title: Fundamental Research Group Associate
description:
“I can succeed as a Fundamental Research Group (FRG) Associate at Capital Group”

As one of our FRG Associates, you will work closely and collaborate with Investment Professionals and peers to deliver valuable insights and conduct bottom-up fundamental research and analysis that will drive investment decisions. You will partner with Investment Professionals on their coverage to help generate investment ideas and monitor holdings by researching and analyzing companies and related industries, financial modeling, drafting reports, facilitating meetings with management teams, sell-side firms and industry experts, and working as a key contributor in the investment process. You will work on projects with growing complexity over time, receiving direction and mentorship from experienced investment professionals.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for”

You are passionate about a career in equity research with a strong interest in long-only investing.
You have 2-5 years of experience in a related field (equity research, investment banking, consulting, accounting or other).
You have a strong desire to continue to develop bottom-up fundamental research skills working in partnership with experienced investment professionals.
You have extensive experience with detailed financial modeling and fundamental analysis, working with sell-side firms and industry consultants, utilizing research tools, trade publications, online sources, regulatory filings, etc., and interpreting this information to generate insightful analysis.
You have a proven ability to develop and maintain comprehensive charts and visualizations to support equity analysis and communicate investment insights effectively.
You thrive in team settings. You ask good questions, bounce ideas off others and proactively share your perspective.
You enjoy learning new things and can flex to varying work styles and expectations.
You have an inquisitive mind, demonstrating intellectual curiosity and analytical skills in areas of high complexity surrounding financial markets and industry trends.
You apply sound judgment in resolving conceptually complex matters.
You apply effective written and oral communication skills. 
You collaborate and develop/maintain relationships both inside and outside the organization.
You are available for occasional travel on research trips to meet with company management teams and investment professionals.
You have a bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, STEM or a relevant field of study.
Familiarity with programming languages (Python, SQL, R), data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI) and data platforms (Amazon S3, Snowflake, Databricks) is a plus, but not necessary.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
“I can succeed as a Machine Learning Engineer at Capital Group”

We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to design, research, implement, deliver and operate predictive capabilities to demonstrably improve our investment process and outcomes. Capital Group will use these predictive capabilities to more efficiently and effectively make investment recommendations and decisions. This role will collaborate directly with senior investment professionals and other technology associates to create, research, implement, and operate state of the art predictive models, systems, and user experiences.

In this role you will work with a high performing team of applied scientists, machine learning engineers, and software development engineers. The ideal candidate for this role will be passionate about our mission and will drive for superior long-term investment results through the application of modern machine learning and software engineering methods.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”  

· You will design, research, build, deliver and operate predictive models, systems and services which demonstrably improve the efficiency and effectiveness of CG’s investment decisions.

· You successfully research, train, evaluate and deploy models from inception to completion, as well as operate them.

· You bring a high level of craftsmanship to your work, ensuring integrity in both form and function.

· You collaborate effectively to support team strategy, contributing to modeling and technology choices.

· You work to identify and resolve the root causes of endemic modeling problems, and collaborate effectively with other teams to implement correct, long-term fixes.

· You work with a sense of urgency, and design and build simple and pragmatic solutions which solve complex problems.

Required Experience:

· 7+ years’ experience with at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, C++ or C#. Strong OO or Functional design skills with understanding of common design patterns.

· Outstanding communication skills, ability to establish and maintain a close working relationship with distributed team members and business partners.

· Demonstrated track record in one or more machine learning subfield, such as forecasting, recommender systems, ranking and relevance, optimization, etc.

· Experience solving “full stack” machine learning problems, from data collection to model training to deployment. Must have experience using machine learning or NLP to solve real business problems.

· Strong computer science fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis.

· Knowledge of software engineering best practices (e.g. Agile software development, test-driven development, unit testing, code reviews, design documentation, etc)

· Track record of successfully delivering enterprise-grade models into production

‎

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
Capital Group has grown rapidly in the past five years and is set for further expansion. Strategic marketing is seen as an important element of this growth and, within it, Product Marketing plays a key role in the articulation of the current and future investment services across a wide range of marketing materials.

This offers an exciting opportunity for an Associate to work within a highly collaborative environment, with significant potential to make an individual contribution to a growing business that is launching new strategies and articulating Capital Group’s distinctive investment process to new audiences while supporting existing investment strategies.

"I can succeed as a Product Marketing Specialist at Capital Group."

As a Product Marketing Specialist, you'll be responsible for defining, planning and creating product and thematic/investment materials to promote our investment offering across our target markets. The role is also responsible for delivering high-quality marketing materials and turnkey, fully integrated campaigns that align with investment themes and business priorities.

Collaborating with key stakeholders including the Investment Product and Research team, Investment Directors, Sales, Compliance and other colleagues within Marketing as appropriate with the objective of delivering effective and high-quality marketing content that helps achieve sales goals and business objectives.

Other duties include:

Working across the business - Investment Product Specialists and Investment Directors, Marketing Managers and Sales - to create and review product messaging and materials to support the promotion of CG’s range of investment services.

Creation and ownership of the messaging and content for a range of materials – e.g. marketing materials, sales books and promotional/defense literature, and other tactics to support various marketing initiatives.

To ensure the investment strategy, product positioning, client feedback, investment insights and responses to sales objections are considered in the materials.

 Working closely with team members to ensure that the latest product massaging and insights are consistent across our marketing channels

Responsible for the delivery and prioritization of the marketing toolkit for specific strategies in response to business priorities.

"I am the right person Capital Group is looking for: "

You'll have 5 years’ experience in investment product marketing.  

You'll have deep understanding of investment management products and asset management.

You'll ideally have experience in creating relevant content that supports the marketing and selling of investment products in Canada.

You'll have experience of working with sales teams to support and drive engagement with prospects and clients - ideally across both institutional and financial intermediary channels.

You will understand investment insights from the Investment Group and client insights from the Sales teams, with the motivation to turn them into compelling messaging and content to support product-specific initiatives.

You'll have excellent written and oral communication skills, stakeholder management and an ability to build strong working relationships.

You'll have high levels of energy and commitment and be able to meet tight deadlines and prioritize effectively.

CIAM welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital’s annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.

title: Sales Operations Manager
description:
“I can succeed as a Sales Operations Manager at Capital Group.”

As the Gate Keeper / Investment Resource Team (IRT) Sales Operations Manager in the Strategic Relationship Group (SRG) within North America Client Group (NACG), you will be a strategic business partner to sales and channel leadership, orchestrating and influencing the development and execution of objectives, strategies and the annual business plan. You will successfully link sales opportunities, priorities and challenges to broader NACG outcomes. You will contribute meaningfully to developing and integrating best practices across Sales Operations, and to the goals of the Strategic Relationship Group.  

You have experience managing long term projects and are adept at driving prioritization and engagement. You have a keen knack for aligning different perspectives with a combination of diplomacy and influence. Your strengths include strong communication skills, demonstrating initiative and ownership, and managing ambiguity while navigating evolving circumstances. You have experience managing teams and are a talent developer; you are passionate about challenging them with new experiences which results in them growing professionally and maximizing their contributions to the team.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.” 

You are known as a resourceful, strategic planner with the ability to pivot.

You can drive and participate in the business planning process, ensuring projects and initiatives align with and achieve business goals, while taking the lead on agenda setting, meeting coordination, and follow-ups across the operation.

You possess strong facilitation and relationship building skills with the ability to work comfortably and confidently alongside senior leadership.

You are comfortable in situations where there isn’t a playbook with a clear-cut answer. You are not easily surprised, and you handle constantly changing circumstances with composure and confidence.

You have a strong foundation in financial principles and an understanding of investment strategies at Capital Group, including our insurance offerings.

You are familiar with our different client types Broker Dealers, Wire Houses, RIA industries, TAMPs and the broader financial services industry sales cycle and sales interactions.

You are capable developing and leading a team (direct or indirect). You are passionate about team engagement, coaching and people development.

You collaborate with key partners across Sales Leadership, Marketing, Product, Insights and Analytics, and other key business stakeholders to synthesize information and enable effective decision-making, productivity, and engagement.

You create, maintain, and improve industry-level sales reporting and data

You facilitate and manage the development of firm initiatives and partner with field sales ops to execute.

You bring a continuous improvement mindset to enhance operational effectiveness and efficiency.

You will have knowledge of sales tools and resources, including Salesforce.com, Seismic, etc.

title: Director, Global Business Services Technology
description:
“I can succeed as the Director, Global Business Services Technology at Capital Group.”

The Director, Global Business Services Technology is responsible for directing application delivery services for Capital Group’s Global Finance, Legal, Risk Management, and Office Services business functions.  The Director is responsible for developing the Technology strategy and providing solutions that enable our business to achieve our long-term strategy, growth, and key business outcomes.  This role requires transformational leadership, demonstrating clarity and authenticity by seeing the vision and possibilities, making a personal commitment, and engaging and inspiring the organization to achieve meaningful results.

Key Responsibilities: 

Shapes Strategy

Direct, manage, and deliver large, complex, mission-critical application development projects.

Identify the drivers, strategies, and needs of clients' technology operations and lead internal changes to support those operations.

Know the application portfolio, its overall technical and functional health, how it will support business needs, and its impact on the overall environment from a support and technology perspective.

Provide technology leadership within the business unit, developing and implementing 5+ year technology roadmaps.

Manage relationships with clients, interface, and maintain communication with Technology and business management.  Monitor business and technology developments and provide on-time response and support.

Ensure that Global Technology-Business engagement is a priority.  Support Technology shared strategic goals and educate business partners and management teams on their importance.

Deliver Results 

Develop a sustainable development and support model to meet key project commitments while gaining efficiency and effectiveness.

Effectively integrate across all functions to support the successful execution of the Service Delivery Model.

Facilitate smooth workflow within the department, ensuring high standards and quality of technical work.  Direct reviews of tools and technologies for improving performance and reducing costs.

Understand the risk profile of the area and ensure that significant risks are mitigated.

Define vision for development strategies and a clear view of how Capital’s development strategies fit together and create business value.

Define and implement clear deliverables and processes.

Build Talent & Teams

Build and support strong teams.

Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously enhance technology capabilities (i.e., Gen AI, etc.).

Stay informed about development trends, directions, and uses across Capital.  Utilize knowledge to apply the most current and appropriate technologies to support the business and anticipate and seize new opportunities.

Stay current with industry technology changes and become an expert in external solutions on the market for functional areas.

Build engagement and a sense of belonging within and outside the immediate team, enabling the broader function to operate as one team in supporting the firm’s overall mission.

Set and define a clear strategy and help teams to understand best practices.

Be interested and open-minded as it pertains to new ideas, open to constructive challenges and course correction when required.

Inspire & Influence 

Provide a global strategic context for associates when sharing information and making decisions.

“One team, one dream” mindset, think and plan strategically, and drive team execution.

Participate in broad organization change efforts, including planning and communication.

Represent the company as a key internal or external contact regarding significant matters.

Communicate with other members of management to resolve complex business issues or set future planning direction/strategy.

Champion and promote new business initiatives and influence acceptance of change.

Influence the acceptance of new technologies that drive consistency, efficiency, and agility to the organization.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.” 

You have a Bachelor’s degree and ideally a Master’s degree.

You have 12+ years of progressive experience in IT leadership, including managing teams and leaders.

You have strong strategic thinking and stakeholder communication skills.

You have proven experience in software, solutions, or data engineering.

You have a deep understanding of modern engineering practices (Agile, CI/CD, DevOps).

You have experience with cloud and data platforms (AWS, Azure, Python, Airflow, Databricks, APIs).

You have strong project management, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

You have strong business acumen and the ability to communicate effectively across all levels.

You have a global mindset with the ability to support a diverse, international operating model.

You have knowledge of emerging technologies and trends (e.g., Gen AI, Quant).

title: Content Research Analyst
description:
“I can succeed as a Content Research Analyst at Capital Group.”

As a Content Research Analyst, you’ll be an integral part of Capital Group’s content team. You will be supporting the creation of innovative investment thought leadership content for an audience of financial advisors and institutional clients. If you enjoy researching and providing content for key programs, including economic and market outlooks, e-book guides, weekly web articles, and a monthly webinar series, then this role is for you.  You’ll play a critical role creating charts and other data visualizations. You’ll add value by collaborating with a creative team to brainstorm ideas for thought leadership-driven marketing campaigns, webinars, and other publications.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”

You have a bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on economics, finance, statistics, applied mathematics or a related field.

You have a minimum of 3-5 years’ professional experience in data research and analysis with investment data, including equities and fixed income.

You’ll use your deep investment industry knowledge and data skills to help craft compelling visual narratives.  

You’re an expert user of Excel to store, present, process and analyze data.

You have plenty of examples of times when you’ve gathered information from a variety of sources, synthesized it, and presented it in a distilled manner.

By asking great questions and bouncing ideas off others, you proactively share your perspective. You’re a skilled communicator and thrive in team settings by being authentic, respectful and engaging.

You’re used to prioritizing work to tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

You’re comfortable collaborating with creative content teams, including writers, editors and designers.

You will provide your expertise and though leadership, stay abreast of industry and technology trends and influence our business partners.

title: Quantitative Analyst – Applied Quantitative Solutions (ML-AI)
description:
“I can succeed as a Quantitative Analyst at Capital Group”

As a member of the Quantitative Research and Analytics group (QRA) at Capital Group (CG), you conduct rigorous peer-reviewed quantitative research and analysis. You leverage your expertise in financial markets to build models of complex systems that drive insight into the causal relationships underlying markets’ behavior.  You apply your scientific process to building relevant models, often partnering with others to do so.  You identify investment relevant questions, translate these questions into testable models, and deliver the impact of models to inform investment decision making.  You are unendingly curious about the dynamics of markets and you enjoy a balance of collaborative problem-solving, individual exploration, and continuous learning. You act as a leader within the QRA team and share in the responsibility for developing the QRA organization and guiding others within the team.

You effectively communicate investment-relevant concepts and conclusions from the AQS work to investors and colleagues. 

You act as a leader within the QRA team and share in the responsibility for developing the QRA organization and guiding others within the team. 

In this role you will:

Partner with QRA leadership to identify quantitative research and analytical priorities.

Use the latest advances in quantitative research, including AI/ML, to uncover valuable insight about complex investment questions.

Develop and maintain classical and new approaches to address previously unaddressed research questions.

Translate priorities into coherent approaches to resolve problems and manage problem statements from inception to completion.

Engage consistently with our technology partners and help develop computing environments to support research and research-driven processes in a collaborative research environment.

Work collaboratively with members of the Quantitative Research and Analytics Group in a rigorous peer-reviewed approach to quantitative research.

Communicate results and recommendations in a form that meets the needs of the listener.

”I am the person Capital Group is looking for”

You have excellent quantitative research skills, as evidenced by an advanced degree (MFE, MSc, PhD) in a mathematically robust discipline (e.g., econometrics, mathematical finance, statistics, or physics) or equivalent experience.

You have demonstrable expertise in the application of AI/ML to financial markets, with a minimum of 7‐10 years of relevant experience; experience with LLMs is a plus.

You have excellent systems and computer skills, including demonstrable expertise in quantitative programming languages (e.g., Python, Julia, or R).

You have shown evidence of strong consulting and relationship building skill set; the ability to engage with engineers, investment professionals, and other partners; communicate in multiple formats/forums, and deliver solutions that address business needs.

You stay abreast of ongoing innovation in the scientific research/modeling areas (inclusive of AI/ML).

You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. You enjoy solving challenging open-ended problems and have demonstrated excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. You incorporate the perspective of others when problem solving.

You have excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to effectively interact with a diverse group of associates including Investment Group, Results Analysis and IT.

You must be able to meet regular deadlines, demonstrate excellent attention to detail, and work well under tight time constraints, while balancing multiple priorities.

You can work independently, as well as part of a team in a highly collaborative environment.

You are self-motivated, take initiative, and demonstrate commitment to continuously improve skills and self.

You will take time to invest in our culture and core values.  

Base salary range: $206,400-$303,600.

title: Retirement Plan Services Representative - Ops
description:
“I can succeed as a Retirement Plan Services Representative - Ops at Capital Group.” 

  

As a Retirement Plan Services Representative in Operations, you’ll respond to inquiries from retirement plan participants, sponsors, financial professionals, and third-party administrators (TPAs). You’ll research and process retirement plan transactions by leveraging varied resources, including making phone calls to clarify questions/requirements to resolve requests. You’ll play a critical role in educating clients on plan- specific inquiries and general retirement industry concepts and regulations. 

  

  

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”  

  

You have at least 2+ years of customer service experience in a phone and processing environment.
You have proven experience completing client requests (i.e., financial and account maintenance). 
You are highly resourceful and a critical thinker. You think outside the box and present alternative solutions. 
You are action oriented with excellent problem-solving skills to tackle complex inquiries/requests. 
You have a working knowledge of the retirement industry and the ability to apply it to work assignments. 
Your detail orientation and accuracy are consistent and dependable. 
You have high learning agility and enjoy staying informed of the company's products and services, policies and procedures and applicable regulations and legal requirements. 
You are a skilled communicator, your verbal and written communication is effective and appropriate  
You are comfortable with a shift ranging from 8-5pm CST & overtime, as business needs allow.

A Global Client Service & Operations Specialist would demonstrate a deep knowledge and is an experienced contributor and leader within the Global Client Service & Operations area. title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
“I can succeed as a Talent Acquisition Manager at Capital Group.” 

Our Human Resources organization drives the people dimension of our business strategy. We have a diverse and global team of associates around the world, and we work collectively to evolve our culture, strengthen our organization, engage our associates, and drive superior service. Our Talent Acquisition team supports Capital Group’s global recruiting needs. We are seeking a Talent Acquisition Manager in New York to oversee university recruiting. This body of work is inclusive of our undergraduate and graduate programs across all functions, including the investment group. 

As a Talent Acquisition Manager, you will partner with the business leaders and colleagues in HR to develop strategies to effectively identify, attract, engage, and hire world-class early career talent. You will have the opportunity to leverage your creative thinking, innovative problem solving to consult with business groups on talent needs and assessment. This role will oversee the day-to-day management and operations of our in-house university recruitment function. Capital Group has a long-term orientation toward our investments and our associates, so this role will cultivate long-term relationships with candidates, business leaders within our firm, and third-party organizations.

Responsibilities: 

Demonstrated experience in attracting world class early career global talent and a keen understanding of the competitive landscape, vision to evolve a best-in-class recruitment organization

Manage and develop recruiter(s) in the team, acting as a player coach who executes searches, setting a high bar for recruitment excellence and partnering with other members of the talent acquisition leadership team to manage the daily operations of the talent acquisition function

Perform reporting and analysis on the body of university recruitment work, monitoring KPIs to drive the business and evolve processes

Create, implement and evolve recruiting strategies, methods and systems to generate a proactive and efficient approach to sourcing, assessing and on-boarding talent for both summer associate and full-time positions

Leverage and manage external vendor and third-party relationships (recruitment agencies, RPOs, sourcing partners) to ensure the smooth execution of recruitment strategies

Partner with business leaders and HR partners to follow through on our commitments to diversity, ensuring that sourcing strategies attract as diverse a range of candidates as possible

Continue to develop and evolve the university recruitment team, providing the team with ongoing feedback, support and career development opportunities

Be a strong culture contributor, setting a positive tone for the team and managing effectively in a hybrid environment

Manage key internal stakeholder relationships and consult with clients to provide updates on key bodies of work, manage communication and feedback loop and ensure that recruiters are set up for success

Represent Capital Group as appropriate at on campus, as well as at conferences, networking and industry events

Partner with the global finance team and business managers to support the allocation of appropriate resources to execute against annual hiring plans and monitor progress against forecasted goals

Participate in key Talent Acquisition and HR projects and programs as needed, to evolve the function and continue to develop as a leader in Talent Acquisition

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”

You have in-depth knowledge of global early career financial services and investment (undergraduate and MBA) recruitment, including innovative sourcing approaches, employment branding, market data, employment laws and assessment methods

You have people leadership experience and have mentored, developed and managed a team of recruiters

You have experience working with sophisticated stakeholder relationships, including business leaders and HR partners

You demonstrate experience building and maintaining global and regional networks

You demonstrate excellent communication skills, interpersonal savvy, intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

You have exceptional assessment skills including an understanding of competencies and deep understanding of behavioral and competency-based interviewing

Bachelor’s degree

title: Sales Support Coordinator
description:

As one of our Retirement Plan (RP) Sales Support Coordinators, you’ll play a critical role on our Site Sales team. This Sales Support Coordinator role will specifically support Retirement Plan Counselors in the Retirement Plan (RP) channel within NACG. You will partner with our external Sales Force Members located in field sales territories, as well as internal sales representatives working within a sales division. A typical day  includes making a high volume of outbound calls to our advisors to schedule meetings with our Sales Force Members. You know that scheduling critical meetings with external stakeholders requires persistence, thoughtful backup plans, and nuanced alternative options. You thrive in team settings and enjoy collaborating with others. You ask great questions, bounce ideas off others, and confidently share your perspective.

You have a solid background in sales/marketing, including cold calling. 
You’ve had previous experience coordinating large complex meetings and events involving participants in multiple locations, compiling meeting agendas, reserving meeting spaces, and arranging all details. 
You have a conscious process that you rely upon to ensure nothing slips through the cracks. 
You are highly observant and have a great amount of anticipation. This helps you prepare materials in a comprehensive manner, ensuring nothing is missed.  
You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where critical thinking and proactive teamwork are essential for success. 
You leverage Excel to manipulate data, answer questions and solve problems. 
You have a bachelor’s degree is preferred.

title: Data Engineer III
description:
“I can succeed as a Data Engineer III at Capital Group.”

As a Data Engineer III with an agile mindset, you will contribute to the design, implementation, and delivery of large-scale, critical, and complex data architecture, storage, and pipelines.  You will build enterprise distributed data processing systems and data lakes, optimizing compute and storage on cloud platforms.

You will live by the motto: “you ship it, you own it,” by providing and receiving constructive code reviews and taking ownership of outcomes.  Your data insights will drive business decisions that improve the lives of millions of people, every single day.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”

You have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering or a related technical field.
You have 5+ years of experience with agile software development while ensuring disciplined engineering practices are followed with a focus on quality, test driven development, controlled and automated build and releases, code management etc.
You have experience working on a cloud platform like Microsoft Azure Cloud or AWS or GCS (AWS Preferred).
You are comfortable being hands-on and building & maintaining scalable data integration (ETL) pipelines using SQL, DBT, EMR (or Databricks), Python and Spark. You consistently automate testing for these pipelines.
You understand the big data ecosystem, Distributed data processing (Hadoop, Spark, Hive), data formats like parquet/delta/iceberg, orchestration tools like airflow.  You can navigate open-source frameworks in search of innovating solutions.
You can write complex, SQL queries across large data sets and have experience working with columnar databases (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
You have experience with data modeling and can tailor models to business problems.
You have strong tech translation and enablement skills. You articulate clear connections between the customer and action.

title: Client Experience & Journey Lead, Japan Marketing
description:
“ I can succeed as an Audience Journey and Delivery Lead Director / Japan Marketing.”

Audience Journey and Delivery Lead Director, Japan is responsible for developing client-centric and target audience specific strategies and executions of work that strengthens CG's reputation and builds brand awareness. The role includes collaborating with other teams on their work to ensure our brand is represented consistently across all Japan marketing efforts.

Audience Journey and Delivery Lead Director, Japan is also accountable for defining, developing and implementing brand building audience journeys and content ecosystems for specific target audience segments by working closely with partners in market research, digital, mobile, other client marketing associates and agencies.

The Japan business segments consist of fund distributors’ gate keepers and advisors, end-investors on on-line banking and broker platforms, DB pension funds (public and private), DC segments including plan sponsors, and financial institutions. 

Develops the optimum audience journey experience, including channel plan with knowledge of key investor and/or intermediary audience segments and the KPIs that will be most critical to achieve business and brand objectives.
Works closely with the Country Marketing, Publishing and Writer teams in Product and Content Marketing associates to develop appropriate and suitable content and messaging to achieve joint goals and inform a learning agenda for input into subsequent journeys.
Drives the development of best in class go-to-market strategies ensuring that journey plans are fit for audience purpose (digital first where possible)
Is the go-to person in the team for expertise on digital marketing best practice based on testing, optimization, and analytics to evolve the client experience.
Thinks ‘out of the box’ and stays current with digital innovation and platforms to deliver innovative and high quality client journey experiences
Improves on existing processes to enhance CG’s competencies. Drives the end-to-end audience journey across brand building initiatives for all audience segments (campaigns, channels, events, etc.).
Continuously evolves and enhances customer journey plans via a PDCA cycle approach – driving daily use of KPIs and in-market feedback to identify challenges and continuously seek for solutions.
Leads the development and execution of effective and break-through audience-specific and/or brand building communications.
Drives channel best practice execution, optimization and partnership with functional leadership across EACG marketing.
Ensures consistency and quality of user experience for given client segment.
Defines, manages and allocates budgets to achieve audience journey objectives
Serves as the point of contact for external service providers and agencies to ensure targeted strategies and business goals are met.
Coordinates with marketing associates on the management of agency roster, budgets and quality of agency deliverables for individual campaigns and projects.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”

Substantial years of asset management marketing experience primarily in Japan.
In-depth knowledge of the Japan financial intermediaries (retail fund industry), institutional, asset management industries.
Able and willing to work on strategic initiatives as well as on executions.
Strong stakeholder management in English as well as in Japanese. i.e. persuasion and influencing skills and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, innovative and creative – able to suggest new marketing ideas to drive sales & increase client engagement.
Fluent English a distinctive advantage

title: Senior Accountant AP/AR Billing
description:
“I can succeed as a Global Finance Senior Accountant at Capital Group.”

As a Global Finance Senior Accountant, you’ll be a key member of our billing and accounts receivable team. You’ll review fee schedules, generate invoices, and process transactions to ensure completeness, accuracy, and guideline adherence. You’ll focus on critical details that ensure timely and accurate revenue recording and financial reporting. To thrive in this role, you’ve worked in billing or accounting within a large organization, with a complex financial structure.

“I am the person Capital Group is looking for."

You have 2-3 years’ experience supporting monthly close activities, preparing account reconciliations and applying variance analysis to calculations and journal entries.
You plan ahead and always leave time for self-review all while juggling multiple, sometimes competing, deadlines.
Exceptional attention to detail has always been your thing. You’re highly observant and can spot missing information to avoid costly mistakes.
You have advanced Excel experience. Big data doesn’t intimidate you, and you can swiftly navigate spreadsheets and creatively design formulas to facilitate complex analysis and insights.
You leverage past experiences to navigate and adapt to new scenarios, always bringing horsepower and grit to find resolution.
You’re a skilled communicator and thrive in team settings by being authentic, inquisitive, respectful and engaging. Because of your great questions, you’re skilled at successful follow-up conversations.
You’re devoted to continuous learning, development, and you find new ways of pushing yourself.
You are a progressive thinker with a passion for streamlining processes and leveraging relationships to navigate changes.

title: Associate, Quantitative Research Analyst
description:
EMPLOYER:         Neuberger Berman Group LLC

TITLE:                    Associate, Quantitative Research Analyst

LOCATION:          New York, NY (A telecommuting/hybrid work schedule may be permitted within a commutable distance from the worksite, in accordance with company policies.)

DUTIES:                Utilize mathematical and statistical models to solve important problems in private market investing, including identifying return drivers and attributes of private market portfolios. Analyze manager performance and dissect market-driven factors from actual manager skill. Develop economic forecasts and industry views. Help to evaluate both private wealth and institutional clients’ private market portfolios, identifying opportunities for active management in order to achieve portfolio objectives. Liaise with other groups around the firm on topics of private market cash flow forecasting and portfolio construction. Lead data-driven research initiatives to support marketing efforts, and the investment decision-making process, including the valuation of private market funds. Contribute to the design, development, and evaluation of proprietary software tools used in the assessment of private market investment opportunities. Design presentations for internal investment groups, external investors, and conferences.

REQTS:                  Must have a Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Financial Engineering, Economics, or a related field plus two (2) years of experience in the financial services field in the position offered, or as a Quantitative Analyst, or a related position. Must have two (2) years of experience in the financial services field with all of the following: Conducting research and deriving insights from private market datasets including Burgiss, Cambridge, Preqin or Pitchbook as well as from asset manager data derived from private market investments; Communicating complex research findings to asset manager's investors and clients; Applying a selection of statistical tools including Python, R, Stata or Matlab for data analysis; Modeling private market cash flows, including using a Takahashi model, in a stochastic framework; Modeling private equity co-investment portfolios, considering asset-level diversification and the interplay between returns and cash flows; Performing asset allocation in an optimization framework that allows for public and private assets to be modeled together, on a like-for-like basis; Performing valuation for private equity assets using statistical models; and Acquiring, cleaning, and analyzing financial and economic data and deriving actionable insights.

HOURS:                Full-Time; Mon-Fri (40 hrs/week)

SALARY:                $175,000 - $185,000 per year

TO APPLY:            Applicants should click Apply here or email resume to Neuberger Berman Recruiting team at nbcareers@nb.com and reference Job # R0010881 in the subject line. EOE/M/F/D/V.

#LI-DNI

Compensation Details

The salary range for this role is $175,000-$185,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in the job posting location.  An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, business sector, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, market benchmarking data, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus, which, along with base salary and retirement contributions, is part of our total comprehensive package. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance and other benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. title: Marketing Analyst
description:
About Neuberger Berman:

Neuberger Berman is an employee-owned, private, independent investment manager founded in 1939 with over 2,800 employees in 26 countries. The firm manages US$515 billions of equities, fixed income, private equity, real estate and hedge funds portfolios for global institutions, advisors and individual investors. Neuberger Berman’s investment philosophy is founded on active management, fundamental research and engaged ownership. Neuberger Berman has been named by Pensions & Investments as #1 or #2 Best Places to Work in Money Management for each of the last eleven years (firms with more than 1,000 employees. For more information, please visit our website at www.nb.com.Data as of 31 March 2025.

Role Overview:

Supporting the Regional Marketing team to execute marketing initiatives for our intermediary and institutional business in Asia ex Japan ex Korea.

Support a range of global and local marketing campaigns; local events; product/fund manager roadshows/webinars; and distributor campaigns in the region.

Collaborate with the Digital Marketing team in conducting regular checks and maintaining our content management system.

Be responsible for management and production of marketing literature and premiums for Asia clients (including content, compliance, consistency and quality).

Manage and/or support local digital /social media initiatives.

Manage vendors and service providers such printers, advertising and PR companies; perform regular service reviews of service providers.

Co-ordination with other regions including cross leveraging marketing activities with the Marketing, Product and Design teams in the UK and the US.

Conduct market research and utilize market intelligence to enable the business to develop a competitive advantage and identify new business opportunities.

Coordinate and manage the Chinese translation of marketing related content.

Undertake ad hoc projects as required.

Qualifications & Experience: 

Degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. business, marketing, communication, design).

Minimum 3 years of work experience in the finance industry, preferably in asset management or banking marketing.

Excellent communication skills, including written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin will be a plus).

Strong Microsoft Office skills required.

Knowledge of the investment management process, investment management products and their relevant sales/distribution channels will be an advantage.

Personal Attributes:

High level of accuracy and attention to detail.

Excellent time-management, planning and organizational skills.

Be a proactive, dynamic, and highly client-focused self-starter.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Neuberger Berman is an equal opportunity employer. title: Marketing - Assistant Vice President (Designer)
description:
About Neuberger Berman:

Neuberger Berman is an employee-owned, private, independent investment manager founded in 1939 with over 2,800 employees in 26 countries. The firm manages US$515 billion of equities, fixed income, private equity, real estate and hedge funds portfolios for global institutions, advisors and individual investors. Neuberger Berman’s investment philosophy is founded on active management, fundamental research and engaged ownership. Neuberger Berman has been named by Pensions & Investments as #1 or #2 Best Places to Work in Money Management for each of the last eleven years ( firms with more than 1,000 employees. For more information, please visit our website at www.nb.com.Data as of 31 March 2025.

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled multimedia designer to join the APAC Marketing team, based in Hong Kong. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in developing engaging and visually striking design that communicates the brand's message and intellectual capital across multiple platforms. The role will be responsible for the delivery of visual assets for the APAC region.

The responsibilities:

Creative Content Execution: Develop multimedia content for marketing campaigns, including digital experience/web layout, thought leadership collateral, social media posts, display advertising, event branding, video and audio.

The role requires a blend of creativity, technical skills, and a general understanding of the financial industry to effectively communicate complex concepts in a visually compelling manner.

Optimised, Integrated Design: Optimise a design standard end-to-end on marketing campaigns to ensure consistency and fluency across platforms and channels.

Interactive Design: Design interactive elements such as animations, motion graphics, and interactive PDFs to enhance thought leadership materials and presentation decks.

Brand Safeguarding: Ensure all multimedia materials adhere to Neuberger Berman’s brand and digital guidelines, maintaining a cohesive visual identity across all channels.

Work in close partnership with and as an extension of our global design and digital teams to ensure best practice standards are met and brand and digital stability is preserved. Meet regularly with these groups on pipeline visibility and to work on shared initiatives.

Oversee the production process for diverse marketing materials

Qualification & Experience

What you will bring

Experience: minimum 7 years of experience in multimedia design, graphic design, or digital media production, preferably within financial services, asset management, or related industries.

Education: Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Multimedia Design, Marketing, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

Technical Design skills: Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro, etc.), as well as other design tools (Ceros, Figma, Sketch, etc.). Audio experience in Adobe Audition would be desirable although not essential. Proficient in PowerPoint.

Web Design & Animation Skills: Knowledge of web design principles, UI/UX design, and web animation tools (e.g., HTML5, CSS3, After Effects, Animate, or similar).

Video Production Skills: Experience with basic video production and editing

Creative Vision: A portfolio demonstrating creativity, innovation, and versatility in design across various digital formats.

Fluency in English and Chinese

Personal Attributes

Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present ideas clearly and effectively.

Attention to detail, and a collaborative team player.

Time Management: Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Creative Thinker, able to think outside the box and bring fresh ideas to the table, all whilst preserving the consistency of the brand and adhering to brand guidelines.

Stays updated with design trends and emerging technologies to keep their content innovative and competitive.

title: Business Associate
description:
Neuberger Berman’s Private Wealth Operating Platform seeks a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate to support initiatives focused on process improvement, operational excellence, and business innovation. This individual will play a key role in enhancing the efficiency, scalability, and effectiveness of the Private Wealth business by bridging the gap between client-facing teams, technology, operations, legal and compliance. The role requires strong analytical and presentation skills, critical thinking, and the ability to connect dots across workflows and systems.

The Associate will work closely with 45 teams across Portfolio Management, Wealth Advisory, and the Trust Company, contributing to the continuous improvement of systems, processes, and business objectives implementation.

Key Responsibilities:

This high-impact role requires a candidate to function as a solutions-driven problem solver, a change agent, and a collaborative partner, with a keen focus on driving innovation and efficiency within Private Wealth.

Own the Process, Enhance Efficiency and Drive Innovation:

Identify and address deficiencies and re-engineering opportunities in business processes.

Gather, analyze and document current and future state business process flows, contribute to the analysis of requirements.

Propose innovative ideas for process improvement and business enhancement.

Master technology platforms and collaborate with business users to prioritize enhancements.

Participate/Lead user acceptance and pilot testing of new applications and systems.

Be a Change Agent:

Assist in designing and developing change management and training programs.

Conduct training sessions for system implementations, enhancements, and project initiatives.

Develop stakeholder engagement, communication, and training strategies for successful adoption of systems and processes.

Problem-Solve with Precision and Deliver Insights: 

Analyze data exceptions and identify root causes to recommend system enhancements. 

Engage in operational activities involving implementing controls, approvals, enhanced reporting and ad-hoc projects.

Collaborate Across Teams:

Act as a business liaison between client-facing PW Teams, Technology, Operations, and Legal & Compliance.

Build strong understanding of functions, systems, and processes across the PW business. 

Qualifications / Skills:

Proven academic and professional success.

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Operations Management, or a related field.  Advanced degree or certifications such as Lean Six Sigma, PMP, or similar a plus.

2-5 years of financial services experience, preferably in Private Wealth, investment advisory, or asset management settings.

Self-motivated and curious, with the ability to adapt to ambiguity and change.

Confidence in collaborating with teams across the PW business.

Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, organizational skills, and stakeholder engagement.

Capability to manage projects independently and collaboratively.

Innovative approach to presentations, communications, and business initiatives.

Experience documenting process flows, business requirements, and implementing programs.

Advanced proficiency in Tableau, PowerPoint, and Excel (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables).

Ability to work with large datasets to identify patterns, correlations, and create visuals.

Impeccable integrity and high ethical standards.

Familiarity with Aladdin Wealth, Charles River, client reporting, and portfolio accounting systems is a plus.

Series 7 and 66 licenses are a plus (or willingness to obtain).

title: Client Associate
description:
Reporting to the Sales Manager and serving as a member of the North American Intermediary sales team, the primary responsibility of the Client Associate (CA) is to partner with the Client Advisor (external wholesaler) to promote and sell Neuberger Berman investment products through RIAs within a specific geographic region.

Responsibilities:

Partner with Client Advisor to promote and sell Neuberger Berman equity, fixed-income, alternative, and private equity products to advisors across RIAs

Make outbound calls as needed focusing on prospecting, uncovering, and closing sales opportunities, providing product updates, setting up sales appointments, and following up on client service

Act as a resource to advisors by developing and maintaining strong knowledge of Neuberger Berman products, the industry, the competition, our clients, and their firms

Develop a strategy with external wholesalers to maximize territory coverage; develop and maintain relationships with key advisors

Assist with territory and firm-wide marketing and sales campaigns

Assist in analyzing territory sales, marketing, and product data to determine opportunities

Respond to inbound sales inquiries, literature requests, and service issues

Act as a liaison between the sales force and the operations department to resolve client issues and problems

Maintain the contact relationship management database (Salesforce) to effectively manage the territory

Prior experience in sales within financial services industry is preferred

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

Strong analytical and organizational skills and attention to detail; ability to prioritize projects and create and utilize a strong client management process

Must be a "self-starter" that can meet activity/production quotas

Series 7 & 63/65 or 66 licenses required (or obtained within 6 months of hire)

title: Advisor Consultant
description:
The Advisor Consultant is responsible for creating new relationships and managing existing ones with Financial Advisors at Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, UBS, Wells Fargo, Raymond James, LPL, and Ameriprise. The goal of the Advisor Consultant is to increase sales and revenue of Neuberger Berman mutual funds, SMAs, ETFs, and alternative investment strategies within the prescribed territory of Los Angeles. This is accomplished through relationship building via individual and group financial advisor meetings, client events, and conferences.

Responsibilities

Lead and develop the Los Angeles territory targeting wirehouses and broker dealers by actively developing relationships with advisors to promote business building ideas and services; maintain and grow assets in territory across mutual funds, SMAs, alternative investment products, and ETFs.

Develop and implement business plan for the territory using activity-oriented goal objectives to guide day-to-day priorities and track progress against goals; make prospecting calls, create qualifying lists, and provide on-going service to existing and new clients.

Maintain a high level of expertise related to capital markets, the broader investment management industry, and marketplace developments.

Coordinate all prospect meetings, final presentations, RFP activities and any other sales support activities related to the sales opportunity pipeline in concert with Client Advisory Specialists.

Exhibit a strong business acumen and executive sales presence to influence decision-makers.

Maintain all activity information in Neuberger Berman CRM database.

Work with internal partners, including Client Advisory Specialists, Alternative Specialists, ETF Strategists, and other members of distribution, legal, compliance, and investments.

Maintain knowledge of Neuberger Berman products offered through partner firms.

Qualifications

A minimum of 7 years’ experience within the investment management industry; 5+ years of intermediary distribution experience preferred.

Experience working with wirehouse, regional, and independent financial advisors.

Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding predetermined key objectives.

Strong executive presence, active listening, client preparedness, and presentation skills.

Professional characteristics reflecting curiosity, empathy, and enthusiasm, coupled with a solution-based drive to meet and achieve expectations.

Ability to develop, prioritize, and implement best practices; ability to manage a territory.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Undergraduate degree required, graduate degree a plus.

CIMA, CAIA, or CFA designations a plus.

SIE, Series 7, 66, 31 or SIE, 7, 63, 65, 31 licenses.

#LI-Hybrid

The salary range for this role in California is $85,000-$100,000 and the salary range for the role in California is $85,000-$100,000. title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Summary: 

The Administrative Coordinator will provide administrative support to key business leaders and provide indirect coverage for other members on the team. This role requires a proactive, detail-oriented individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to contribute to the success of the team. 

Primary Responsibilities: 

Primary administrative coverage for a key business leader

Manage calendars, including meeting coordination, resolving conflicts and changing schedules, and preparing for meetings by ensuring all materials and logistics (catering, visitor registration, AV support, etc.) are in place in advance

Provide phone coverage for members of the team. Answer, screen, and route a high volume of time sensitive phone calls; accurately communicate detailed and timely messages

Coordinate domestic / international travel arrangements, including flights, hotels, and ground transportation in compliance with the firm expense T&E policies 

Process travel & entertainment reports and reimbursements efficiently and accurately

Support the CEO’s executive administrator with distinct tasks and projects

Adhoc projects as assigned

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Concur

Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively

Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in all tasks

A proactive and adaptable mindset with a “no job too big or small” mentality, eager to take on diverse responsibilities

Professional demeanor and strict discretion when handling sensitive or confidential information

Strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently

title: Brand Associate
description:
About Neuberger Berman:
Neuberger Berman, founded in 1939, is a private, independent, employee-owned investment manager with c. $508 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2024. The firm manages a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity, real estate and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally. With offices in 26 countries, Neuberger Berman's diverse team has 2,885 professionals. For 11 consecutive years, the company has been named first or second in Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management survey (among those with 1,000 employees or more).

About the Role:

We are seeking a motivated and creative Brand Associate to help support and grow our brand presence across global markets. Reporting to Vice President, Brand Marketing, this role will lead brand project management and assist in executing brand strategies, coordinating campaigns, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure a cohesive brand experience. The ideal candidate is a collaborative team player with a passion for marketing, strong organizational skills, and a desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment. This is an excellent opportunity to gain experience in brand marketing while working alongside experienced professionals.

Key Responsibilities: 
Lead brand programming and campaign management to ensure cohesive execution and alignment with brand objectives.
Support cross-functional teams, including advertising, channel marketing, content, digital marketing, product, and communications, to ensure brand consistency.
Help coordinate with the NB Events team to enhance brand experiences for client and prospect events.
Collaborate with the team to develop and execute marketing campaigns, including advertising, digital, social, and offline channels.
Work closely with the digital marketing team to align brand campaigns with broader marketing strategies.
Assist in creating content that reflects the brand’s identity and engages target audiences.
Provide support in managing external agency partners, including processing invoices, tracking project plans, and ensuring smooth communication.
Partner with the advertising, social media and digital marketing team to help execute social media strategies that amplify brand messaging.
Contribute to content planning and ensure assets align with brand goals.
Assist in gathering data and analytics to measure the success of branding initiatives.
Work closely with digital marketing, product, and regional teams to ensure alignment on brand storytelling and audience engagement, analyzing campaign results and identify areas for optimization.
Stay up to date on industry trends and competitor activity to provide fresh ideas for the brand team.

Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Communications, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in marketing, branding, or a related field. Experience in Financial Services a plus.
Excellent communication and organizational skills, with a keen interest in brand marketing and digital collaboration.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
Analytical mindset with an eagerness to learn from data and campaign results.
Strong strategic and commercial writing skills a must.

description:
About Neuberger Berman:

Neuberger Berman, founded in 1939, is a private, independent, employee-owned investment manager with $508 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2024. The firm manages a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity, real estate and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally. title: Client Associate
description:
NB Private Wealth is Neuberger Berman’s direct-to-client wealth and investment management business. Managing $70b+ in client assets across 40+ seasoned wealth and investment teams, with access to a deep breadth of customized investment solutions, the platform is truly unique in the industry.

The Client Associate will deliver comprehensive operational support and serve as a trusted resource for clients and an experienced Wealth Advisor Team. The Client Associate enhances the client experience by assisting with the service, maintenance, and growth of the team’s high-net-worth client base. We are seeking a seasoned professional with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills who possesses a deep understanding of operational processes and workflows. This role offers an opportunity to significantly contribute to the team’s success and client satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

Client Service: Provide ongoing operational support for the team’s client base by managing daily transactions and inquiries accurately and within established deadlines, ensuring compliance with firm policies and federal regulations.

Liaison: Serve as a liaison between Wealth Advisors, Portfolio Managers, Operations, and clients.

Client Support: Offer daily support for the team’s client base, including opening client accounts, assisting with required documentation, and performing comprehensive account maintenance tasks.

Account Maintenance: Perform tasks such as funds disbursements, name/address changes, charitable gifting, ACATS and DTC transfers, cost updates, billing/fees, and client-directed trade orders.

Client Interaction: Maintain regular and proactive contact with clients regarding new account documents, LOAs, account updates, checks and wires, account performance, trade activity, transfers, statement inquiries, research, fees, objective changes, portfolio market values, stock quotes, online access, etc.

Account Monitoring: Oversee account activities including trades, cash flows, debits, margin, tech shorts, performance, transfers, allocations, fees, etc., using various in-house portfolio systems.

Client Reporting: Provide customized reporting and analysis to clients or the Wealth Advisor team on a regular or ad hoc basis.

Data Management: Maintain accurate and detailed client files, account information, and new business pipeline in the Salesforce database.

Professional Development: Enhance job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.

Qualifications:

2+ years of proven client service/support or related experience in the financial services industry.

An undergraduate degree and Series 7 and 66 licenses (required within the first 180 days).

Additional certifications such as MBA, CFA, CFP, or CIMA are beneficial but not required.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office and prior CRM experience preferred, particularly with Salesforce.

Broad knowledge of Wealth Management, financial products, and services.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with strong interpersonal and client servicing abilities.

Ability to organize, prioritize, manage multiple tasks, and keep the team informed on open items.

Detail-oriented, well-organized, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.

Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing and fast-paced business environment.

Capable of operating effectively and working under pressure with tight deadlines.

A proactive attitude and ability to work collaboratively

title: NB Alternatives Operational Due Diligence Analyst
description:
About Neuberger Berman Group LLC:

Founded in 1939, Neuberger Berman is a private, independent, employee-owned investment manager. From offices in 39 cities worldwide, the firm manages $515 billion in client assets (as of March 31, 2025) across a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally.

Position Overview:

NB Alternatives manages approximately $168 billion for institutional and high net worth clients across a range of commingled fund of funds and customized portfolios.

This Operational Due Diligence team member will play an integral role in overseeing and maintaining the Alternatives Operational Due Diligence program and directly impacting overall investment decisions. In addition, this role will provide a high level of direct interaction with senior personnel on both the investment and non-investment teams of the firm. The role’s primary responsibility is to conduct operational due diligence reviews on both existing and prospective investments maintained with third party alternative fund managers (i.e. hedge, private equity, venture capital) and specialty lenders. The right candidate will be able to identify operational risks based on key investment characteristics (e.g. strategy, firm/team, product offering), and assess the operating infrastructure in place to mitigate these risks. Reviews conducted will be focused on firm/fund structuring, trading, valuation, portfolio accounting and fund administration, counterparty risk, technology, and compliance. The candidate should be comfortable participating in meetings with C-level executives and be able to succinctly document the findings of their review. In addition, the candidate must be able to maintain ownership of the broader ODD review process of a roster of over 300 alternative fund managers and specialty lenders across various strategies (i.e. hedge funds, private equity, venture capital, specialty finance), and ensure that all investments are reviewed in a timely and ongoing manner, as necessary.

Primary Responsibilities:

Maintain ownership of the full ODD review lifecycle for both existing and prospective investments

Gather and analyze information from fund managers and specialty lenders during the investment decision-making process via meetings held with senior members of the firm’s non-investment team (e.g. COO, CFO, GC/CCO, CTO)

Identify key areas of operational risk and ensure that the appropriate mitigating controls have been implemented

Communicate due diligence findings to the Investment Team and other decision makers at the firm as necessary

Document and track the operational due diligence review process via the maintenance of a proprietary ODD memo

Build out and manage proprietary data set used in ODD analysis and monitoring process

Conduct ongoing service provider due diligence

Stay abreast of industry best practices and key events across several areas (e.g. regulatory, technology/systems, trading) while maintaining ownership of projects focused on the analysis of key risks within the portfolios

Communicate with clients on an as-needed basis

Engage in ad hoc operational projects to support the broader Alternatives platform

Experience & Skills Qualifications:

Minimum 1-2 years of experience required; traditional audit/tax, advisory, or operational due diligence experience strongly preferred but comparable fund accounting, trading, fund administration, or hedge/PE fund operations experience will be considered

Familiarity with private equity, venture capital, private credit, and various hedge fund strategies (e.g. distressed credit, global macro, systematic)

Superior oral communication skills; Candidates must be comfortable participating in meetings with C-level professionals and engaging with investors. In addition, written skills are essential to maintaining internal documentation which may be made available for client consumption

Strong attention to detail; Must be able to consume and triangulate information and data from multiple sources and ultimately reconcile any conflicts

Must be able to independently formulate, and confidently support, opinions

Ability to support ongoing reviews and take the lead on ad hoc projects while maintaining accountability and ensuring that internal deadlines are met; Must be able to multi-task and prioritize multiple projects in an efficient manner

Proficient in Microsoft Office

Experience with Tableau and / or PowerBI a plus

CPA, CAIA or CFA a plus

Compensation Details

The salary range for this role is $85,000-$95,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in the job posting location.  An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, business sector, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, market benchmarking data, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus, which, along with base salary and retirement contributions, is part of our total comprehensive package. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance and other benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, production, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

title: Bank Loan Settlement Specialist
description:
Job Description:

The Bank Loan Team within Neuberger Berman Middle Office provides support to the Non-Investment Grade Credit Investment team which manages over 25 billion AUM of broadly syndicated bank loans. It is the team's responsibility to handle all cash reconciliation, trade routing, trade settlements, and account onboarding. This individual should be highly detail oriented, work in a fast-paced environment with daily deadlines, and has a proven ability to work with external service providers.

Neuberger Berman is an independent, employee-owned, global asset management firm, serving the financial needs of institutional and individual investors worldwide. Our broad capabilities include traditional and alternative equity and fixed income strategies, private equity and commodities, in addition to portfolio advice and wealth planning services. We offer a broad platform to accommodate the evolving needs of our clients.

Responsibilities:

Manage daily settlements of trades with vendor while ensuring accurate posting of trades on internal systems

Daily cash management for CLO’s and Hybrid accounts including the transfer of funds to meet foreign currency requirements

Manage complicated bankruptcy restructures and private debt settlements

Perform end of day checks to ensure accuracy of daily work, reducing exceptions on next day reporting

Assist Portfolio Management teams with questions involving cash balances and trade settlement status 

Implement controls and processes to reduce average settlement time of Primary loan trades

Assist in new account set up as well as KYC

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or other business-related field preferred

2 to 4 years of industry experience preferred (1 year of loan settlements required)

Strong knowledge and understanding bank loans processing required

Strong knowledge of ClearPar, LSTA, and LMA documents required

Strong knowledge of Distressed trade settlements required

Strong organizational and communication skills, detailed oriented

Proven ability to work with external service providers

Ability to implement tasks and projects with minimal supervision in a fast paced environment

Proficiency in MS Office applications with advanced knowledge of Excel a strong plus

Experience with Wall Street Office, Aladdin, ClearPar, and Bloomberg a plus

#LI-DD2

#LI-Hybrid

Compensation Details

The salary range for this role is $75,000-$90,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in the job posting location. title: Developer II - Private Markets Research Technology
description:
Neuberger Berman's technology team is looking for a Developer support our Private Markets research function focused on enhancing our research applications to streamline workflows for our Investment Teams. You will work with business and technology stakeholders on critical private markets research applications.

Responsibilities

Drive the adoption and seamless integration of the Everest platform for new and existing business teams, ensuring smooth onboarding and operational continuity

Design and optimize SQL solutions to streamline data flows, improve query performance, and enhance reporting capabilities for investment professionals

Collaborate with investment teams to understand business workflows, identify pain points, and develop technology solutions that enhance decision-making, as well as other cross functional teams including Data Scientists, Operations, and other Technology teams

1-2 years of hand on experience developing data solutions

Experience in financial services or investment research is highly desirable; familiarity with private markets workflows or research processes is a strong plus.

Strongly proficient in with SQL and Python or .NET

Understanding of ETL processes, building and/or maintaining ETL pipelines

Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus

Experience in an Agile/Scrum environment is a plus

Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools like Git, Jenkins, or similar is a plus

Excellent communication skills

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
