Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

Accountabilities/Responsibilities

The Role: We are looking to expand our team through M&G Global Services to continue to provide the highest levels of service to our end users. The Platform Operations team works to high standards within our growing business by managing critical platforms running our Azure estate and supporting our engineering teams to drive business value in technology.

The team support our UK business with extended support for Asia Pacific regions. This means working flexible hours to meet our business needs. Currently split across three geographies and supported by a technology partner we stand by having a one team feel and regularly collaborate and work together to meet the common goals. The Platform Operations team is the centre of all things in cloud. The team is responsible for ensuring the continuous operation and upkeep of our cloud infrastructure and platforms, while being empowered to enhance, automate, and shape the future development of this digital estate.

Knowledge, Skills, Experience & Educational Qualification

We always support colleagues to develop their skills but to be successful in this role the following will be required:

Minimum of 3+ years of experience in working in the IT industry
You will have in-depth experience as a hands-on IT Engineer, with strong knowledge on different cloud technologies and platforms, experience with Azure is essential.
You will understand cloud governance, best practices, and policies within Azure.
You must have a problem-solving mindset and the ability to troubleshoot unknown technical issues.
Proven track record in providing support and troubleshooting for cloud infrastructure, including incident management and root cause analysis.
Experience in identifying inefficiencies and implementing automated solutions to overcome these.
As a Jr engineer you will be expected to help build out our presence in M&G Global Services and as such experience of building / mentoring and guiding teams and individuals is essential
Strong interpersonal skills for working with cross-functional teams to support cloud solutions effectively.
An understanding of inventory management and software assurance, alongside CMDB and /or other asset management tooling
Familiarity with Agile and DevOps methodologies and technologies – Git, Azure DevOps (or equivalent) and CI / CD Pipelines is desirable. 
Relevant cloud and/or technology discipline certification especially – AZ-104
Scripting in your relevant discipline and/or within Cloud Automation
Experience in implementing and maintaining robust disaster recovery strategies and ensuring business continuity.
An understanding of applying patches and updates to infrastructure to ensure security and functionality, utilising tools such as Ivanti or similar patch management systems.

You need to be this kind of person

Passionate about providing unparalleled levels of service and automation to the cloud products that enable our business
Able to work and learn quickly in a fast pace, fun and dynamic environment
Care about doing a great job and exceeding expectations with the quality of what you do
Curious to learn and develop your own technical skills
Able to both collaborate and move as a team but also be self-motivated and deliver results independently when required.
Able to take ownership of issues, tasks and solutions managing them from inception to conclusion. Whilst working within the audit and governance frameworks.
Ability to challenge and speak up in discussions with colleagues of all levels

Experience

Minimum 3+ years of relevant experience as an Application / Platform / Cloud support engineer

Educational Qualification:

Graduate/Masters in any discipline
Cloud certifications would be an added advantage

M&G Behaviours relevant to all roles:

Tell it like it is: Respectfully speaking up to create better ways forward – both direct and empathetic

Own it now: Putting your name on things with confidence to drive progress and results quickly

Move it forward together: Forming cross functional teams to seize the right opportunities and solve real problems

.........................................…………With CARE and INTEGRITY………………………………………………………...

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G Global Services, regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or long term condition, we are looking to attract, promote and retain exceptional people. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

title: Advice Quality Consultant
description:
At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns.

Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

We will consider flexible working arrangements for any of our roles and also offer work place accommodations to ensure you have what you need to effectively deliver in your role.

The Team:

 

The Advice Quality team undertake quality assurance activities for pre-sale and post-sale advice and forms part of the Risk Control & Compliance function within M&G Wealth Advice. We focus on the following advised sales: Retirement Planning, Estate Planning, Pension Switches, Investment Replacement, Regulated Mortgages, Protection and Equity Release.

 

Within the Advice Quality team sits the pre-sale and post-sale Advice Quality Consultants, the pre-sale team will assess the suitability of the advice prior to this being presented to the client, with the post-sale team completing the final assessment post-sale.

 

We are one team, aligned to one purpose. Client and customers are at the heart of everything we do, ensuring the correct client outcomes are achieved. We act with care and integrity, each taking accountability, ownership and responsibility for doing the right thing.

The Role: 

 

Reporting to the Advice Quality Manager you will undertake quality checking of advised sales and have sufficient product and technical knowledge to make judgements on the suitability of advice outcomes and documentation standards in line with the regulatory requirements.  

 

You will have analytical skills to assess quality outcomes and draw conclusions, with an ability to provide effective feedback. This requires effective communication skills and an ability to report on quality activities.

 

The role would be a great opportunity for those looking to progress their career within an Advice Quality function, and further their knowledge with specialised advised sales areas such as Equity Release and Long-Term Care.  

Key Responsibilities for this role

To operate quality checking of advised sales enabling effective judgements on the suitability of client outcomes and supporting documentary evidence, in line with regulatory and internal standards
To advise on quality outcomes, providing clear professional feedback to advisers with adequate rationale
To advise concise feedback on outcomes achieved and where quality can be improved to develop advisers to achieve better client outcomes and file quality documentation
To operate collaboratively with colleagues to improve overall quality outcomes and provide consistent feedback
Build a rapport with the advisers within the firm and other Compliance Departments to ensure that good relationships are maintained
Contribute into the design and implementation of quality standards, identifying any trends and proposing resolutions to achieve the required standards
Achievement of individual productivity targets and objectives
To prepare reporting on quality assurance activities

 

Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Relevant professional qualification (CII Diploma in Regulated Financial Planning or suitable alternative at Level 4 or above) is essential for the role or could be achieved within 6 months
Detailed knowledge of assessing suitability of advice outcomes , ideally from working in a compliance function
Detailed knowledge of Pension and Investment products is essential to the role
Working knowledge of Risk, Compliance and Advice in UK financial services.
Some experience of Financial Services regulation, in particular in the context of suitability would be an advantage
Experience with Mortgage, Protection and Later Life products would be an advantage

Work Level: Experienced Colleague

Recruiter: Amy Curtis

Location: Huddersfield or Edinburgh

Closing Date: 06/06/2025

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G plc, underpinned by our policies and our employee-led networks who provide networking opportunities, advice and support for the diverse communities our colleagues represent. Regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or long term condition, we are looking to attract, promote and retain exceptional people. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

M&G is also proud to be a Disability Confident Leader, and we welcome applications from candidates with long-term health conditions, disabilities, or neuro-divergent conditions.  Being a Disability Confident Leader means that candidates who meet the minimum criteria of a job, will be offered an interview if they 'opt in' to the scheme when applying.

As a UI Designer within our experience design team, you’ll have an opportunity to work across all aspects of user interaction and experience design.  We’re looking for a talented and enthusiastic designer, either a recent graduate or someone looking for a career move who has a couple of years experience under their belt.   This role offers an exciting opportunity to help build and shape our design system, collaborate with cross-functional teams and make a meaningful contribution to creating user-friendly and visually appealing digital experiences.

Create intuitive and engaging user interfaces for web interface, across mobile and desktop

Excellent communicator

title: Training & Competence Supervisor
description:
At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns.

Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

We will consider flexible working arrangements for any of our roles and also offer work place accommodations to ensure you have what you need to effectively deliver in your role.

Training & Competence Supervisor

This role is based within our Training and Competence (T&C) team at Sandringham Financial Partners, part of M&G. Sandringham is one of the market leading independent national advice firms offering a fresh and innovative approach to financial advice. M&G as the parent company are one of the largest financial services companies in the world and FTSE100 mainstay, whose aim is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work.

The Role

A key team within the business is our T&C team who help support 170 advising Partners within the Sandringham network.

A Sandringham T&C Supervisor’s role is never the same from one day to the next, and with a wide range of skills and responsibilities within the team it ensures we can employ variety in our role. The successful candidate will make important contributions to our regulatory alignment with SM&CR and the AR regimes, coaching & development of advisers and maintaining company standards for advice.

We are looking for a driven and resilient individual as we push forward with changes and growth ambitions, which in itself will lead to great development opportunities for the right person. Whilst direct supervision is the main focus for Supervisors within Sandringham, the varied and unique nature of the role will allow an individual to develop their interests in any of the business areas they are interested in, such as AML, technical advice matters, later life, pensions, investments, and business development to name a few.

Key Responsibilities: 

Being responsible for a Span of Control of between 30 – 40 financial IFA’s, regular assessments of their KPI’s, Fit and Proper assessments, analysis of business structures and internal records to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and regimes such as SM&CR, AR regime, APER amongst others
Assessing various areas of the business for areas of risk or trends
Developing strategies within the T&C team and wider Sandringham / M&G Advice workforce to mitigate risks within the business
Completing quarterly 121s with our advising partners, providing direct support and feedback to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and to ensure smooth transition through SM&CR and AR regime assessments
Deliver training on our monthly Induction course, and on ad-hoc sessions when there is demand
Design and delivery of new Internal content on our Sandringham Academy system
Designing, presentation and delivery of key messages at training events around the UK or online via webinar
Providing ongoing support to advisers as and when necessary, via telephone / email / Teams
Answering regulatory queries to the Supervisors or to our internal Helpdesk function on areas such as financial planning, technical, product and T&C related queries
Liaising with stakeholders within the business including senior management
Support new to industry advisers with their route to competent adviser status, including role plays, client observations and their implementation of company standards
Opportunities and business requirements may mean supporting different parts of the business in project work, or other workflows including but not limited to AR reviews, AML queries, learning management system updates, vulnerable clients.

Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience: 

Existing experience in supervisory duties within financial services
Level 4 Diploma in Financial Planning
(Desirable) CF6, CF8, ER1, J07, Advanced Diploma in Financial Planning
Knowledge of SM&CR, PROD, MiFID, AR Regime
Confident in using your own initiative as well as working from the instruction of others
The ability to be flexible in responding to the needs of the business
Experience within Later Life products would be an advantage
Some travel within the UK will be required at times
Excellent communication skills to a range of stakeholders, including senior management
Resilience and fortitude when facing challenging and busy periods

Work level: Experienced Colleague

Location: Huddersfield or Edinburgh

Recruiter: Amy Curtis

Closing Date: 05/06/2025

description:
We are M&G Global Services Private Limited (formerly known as 10FA India Private Limited, and prior to that Prudential Global Services Private Limited). We are a fully owned subsidiary of the M&G plc group of companies, operating as a Global Capability Centre providing a range of value adding services to the Group since 2003. At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns. 

 

M&G Global Services has rapidly transformed itself into a powerhouse of capability that is playing an important role in M&G plc’s ambition to be the best loved and most successful savings and investments company in the world.

 

Our diversified service offerings extending from Digital Services (Digital Engineering, AI, Advanced Analytics, RPA, and BI & Insights), Business Transformation, Management Consulting & Strategy, Finance, Actuarial, Quants, Research, Information Technology, Customer Service, Risk & Compliance and Audit provide our people with exciting career growth opportunities. Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

• Play a pivotal role across broader Private Markets Research team to foster a culture of analytical excellence, encouraging employees to strive for high standards in their work. Promote and nurture knowledge management practices across all employees to ensure the efficient sharing and utilization of information and expertise within the organization.

• Build & manage relationships with a broad range of stakeholders across private markets, fostering trust and open communication to align expectations and drive new business opportunities. Have a big-picture strategic mindset and a focus on upskilling and strengthening team’s capabilities, positioning the team for growth and continued success.

• Predominantly work closely with onshore front office senior credit analysts covering one or more of the different asset classes across private markets including but not limited to private credit, structured ABS like RMBS/Consumer Credits/CLOs/CMBS/Reg-Caps etc.

• Oversee the entire deal lifecycle by actively participating in due diligence calls, conduct thorough credit and cashflow analysis, execute sensitivity runs and deliver internal rating recommendations to stakeholders.

• Review transaction documents to understand key attributes related to payment waterfall, reserve accounts, asset disposition, key parties & their responsibilities etc. Also understand the underwriting guidelines, deal terms and third-party information.

• Conduct in-depth sector-specific research to identify emerging trends which may anticipate market shifts.

• Assess deals from an ESG lens by thoroughly analysing underlying assets, transaction structures and counterparties to ensure comprehensive evaluation and decision-making.

• Have a strong logical mindset, proactively seek opportunities to optimise existing processes through automation and lead such initiatives to improve efficiency and productivity. 

• Train, groom, and ramp-up junior team members by providing continuous coaching, mentorship, and professional development opportunities.

Support direct reports to make effective decisions, collaborate across silos, speak up and take personal accountability
Encourage Investment Platform team to solve business problems creatively and collaboratively and question the status quo
Be curious and insightful about customer’s needs and support Investment Platform team to adapt to the changing environment
Simplify complexity and reduce unnecessary bureaucracy

Key accountabilities and responsibilities

Owning the engineering roadmap for their squad, driving continuous improvement - ways of working, leveraging emerging technologies, driving automation, platform health etc
Deliver business prioritised changes
Demonstrate a solid understanding of the technology, and domain knowledge
Acting as techncal lead and overseeing the quality of engineering for their squad.
Ensuring any solutions being designed within the squad meet M&G standards
Fostering strong relationships with the other key stakeholders - outcome delivery managers, engineering lead, enterprise architecture, technology partners, SRE, and other platforms
Playing an active role in engineering community for learning and sharing.
Lead the development of solutions end-to-end and see it through until it reaches the end customer.
Develop scalable solutions for investment teams across multiple asset classes in an agile development environment
Lead solution design and presents to design forum for approval,
Leads tech improvements within the squad
Identify and implement best practices within the squad,
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to the squad members
Build and maintain strong relationships with all members of the team
Contribute actively in the Lead Engineering Team and lead initiatives within the squad
Partnering with and assisting the Investment Plaform’s change and run teams to deliver their objectives
Work across multiple disciplines across the Investment Platform and opportunities to connect and improve working practices
Consistently identify improvement opportunities within the team and implements processes, ways of working or facilitate training to address improvement opportunities

Internal

M&G Investments

External

N/A

Advanced  software engineering skills paired with expertise in some of the following programming languages: C#, Java, Python, Javascript, HTML/CSS or equivalent    
A good understanding of DevOps principles and experience in building CI/CD pipelines
Strong experience working with data on Azure including Azure Data Lake, ADLA, Cosmos DB, SQL, and Datafactory

Has good Azure experience on PaaS services such as App Service, Function App, Logic App, Data Factory, Service Bus and Key Vault
Understands Azure AD, Service Principals and Managed Identities to configure role based access for web applications
Is able to investigate application issues by using telemetry and Application Insights information
Has experience with REST APIs and Microservices and API management on Apigee
Follows best coding practices using SOLID principles, design patterns and other industry standards
Proactive self-starter who can manage their own workload and can juggle multiple priorities at the same time
Experience working in an agile environment and good understanding of integrating testing withing the SDLC
Applying a “solutions” mentality for any outcome that you are assigned to and ensure proper solutions design is considered 
Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both written and orally, within a project team
Ability to identify problems and have the drive to follow them through to resolution
Excellent attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and work efficiently to project deadlines

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS (DESIRABLE):

Relevant experience developing back or frontend solutions (e.g. On Azure Cloud, Angular, React, Node.js software frameworks)
Exposure to financial markets & asset management processes and understand analysis into a wide variety of asset classes and associated analytics (e.g. Equity, Fixed Income, Private Assets etc)
Exposure to data visualisation tools - Power BI or equivalent

EXPERIENCE:

14 + years of total experience in software engineering
4 + years of experience in a core engineering role in the cloud

EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS NECESSARY:

Graduate in any discipline

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G Global Services, regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or long term condition, we are looking to attract, promote and retain exceptional people. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

title: Lead Data Support Engineer – Investment Data Platform
description:
We are M&G Global Services Private Limited (formerly known as 10FA India Private Limited, and prior to that Prudential Global Services Private Limited). We are a fully owned subsidiary of the M&G plc group of companies, operating as a Global Capability Centre providing a range of value adding services to the Group since 2003. At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns. 

 

M&G Global Services has rapidly transformed itself into a powerhouse of capability that is playing an important role in M&G plc’s ambition to be the best loved and most successful savings and investments company in the world.

 

Our diversified service offerings extending from Digital Services (Digital Engineering, AI, Advanced Analytics, RPA, and BI & Insights), Business Transformation, Management Consulting & Strategy, Finance, Actuarial, Quants, Research, Information Technology, Customer Service, Risk & Compliance and Audit provide our people with exciting career growth opportunities. Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

                                                                                               

Job Description

Job Title

Lead Data Support Engineer – Investment Data Platform

Grade

2B

Level

Experienced Colleague

Job Function

Asset Management Tech & Change

Job Sub Function

Investments Data Platform

Reports to

Sr. Lead/Sr. Manager – Investments Data Platform (India)

Location

Pune

Business Area

M&G Global Services

Overall Job Purpose

Working with M&G Plc. means becoming part of a brand with a global reputation and our purpose is to help people manage and grow their savings and investments, responsibly.

M&G plc is a firm built on a rich and long history and with a commitment to an innovative future centred on the needs of customers and clients. There is a genuine opportunity to drive competitive advantage with value creation through the formation of this new organisation.

This role is for an Lead Data Engineer - Investment Data Platform (Support).

The role involves maintaining, supporting, enhancing high-quality, scalable software aligned with business outcomes. In a collaborative, agile environment, you will work within a cross-functional team to refine user stories and implement necessary fixes, functionalities. Responsibilities include unit testing and controlled release of support requests, small changes, enhancements, etc. You will use critical thinking to solve business and technical problems. The ideal candidate will possess a blend of software/data engineering skills, data exploration, and domain knowledge to provide wholistic solutions for our stakeholders and expand our data services.

Accountabilities/Responsibilities

Key accountabilities and responsibilities

Provide Technical Support on Critical Production issues with Asset/Investment Data Platform.
Provide L2 Technical Support on various Technical Data Platform Debt delivery, e.g., SQL databases, Deprecation, Modernisation, DevOps Pipeline fixes, Function App upgrade, etc.
Support data platform teams with small changes, including, but not limited to, data modelling, data integration, software engineering, testing, and releases.
Contribute to supporting/delivering software that meets business outcomes and team standards, following the SDLC for the Data Platform.
Support scalable solutions for the data platform team in an agile environment and if required, assist in getting design approvals in relevant forums.
Provide a quality service and product to customers and stakeholders, further developing skills built through significant practical experience or training.  
Work within established frameworks, with the freedom to interpret them to solve various issues.
Understand and follow data engineering best practices, also being part of the community of practice.
Suggest and implement data platform improvements based on experience, and contribute to improvement discussions.
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across the business and Asset Management Technology & Change teams.

Key Stakeholder Management

Internal

All M&G Plc  Business Areas

M&G Plc Support Groups

External

Partner(s)/Vendor(s)

Knowledge, Skills, Experience & Educational Qualification

Knowledge & Skills (Key):

As this role is dedicated into Support, should be comfortable working in support model, separate from Change.
Experienced in analysing large data sets. Possess data exploration and analytical skills to solve issues and understand software.
Investigate data platform issues by using relevant insights/information.
Demonstrate software engineering skills with experience in SQL, C# and the .Net Framework. Knowledge of software patterns and principles.
Experience working with data on Azure including Azure Data Lake, ADLA, Cosmos DB, SQL and NoSQL dbs, and Datafactory pipelines.
A good understanding of DevOps principles and experience in building CI/CD pipelines.
Has some Azure experience on PaaS services such as App Service, Function App, Logic App, Service Bus and Key Vault.
Understands Azure AD, Service Principals and Managed Identities to configure role based access for Data solutions.
Excellent attention to detail, with the ability to identify problems, prioritize tasks, and work efficiently to meet timelines/deadlines.
Strong interpersonal skills with clear and effective communication, both written and oral, within a project team.
Some knowledge of REST APIs and Microservices and API management on Apigee..

Knowledge & Skills (Desirable):

Experience/Knowledge in using Databricks for data ingestion or transformation.
Experience/Knowledge in Snowflake.
Foundational understanding of the components of Investment Data (Transactions, Positions, Instrument T&Cs, etc)
Experience  to financial markets & asset management processes and understand analysis into a wide variety of asset classes and associated analytics (e.g. Equity, Fixed Income, Private Assets etc.)

Experience:

8+ years of total experience in software engineering.
4+ years of latest/recent experience in a data engineering support/role.

Educational Qualification:

Graduate in any discipline.

M&G Behaviours relevant to all roles:

Note: *We are in Hybrid working with min. three days’ work from office (subject to policy change)

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G Global Services, regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or long term condition, we are looking to attract, promote and retain exceptional people. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

title: Project Manager - Digital Marketing and Client Analytics
description:
At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns.

Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

We will consider flexible working arrangements for any of our roles and also offer work place accommodations to ensure you have what you need to effectively deliver in your role.

The Role:

The Client & Distribution Portfolio is at the heart of our client experience strategy, as we continue to simplify and digitise our client interactions to transform how we market, acquire, service, and report to our UK & international clients.

As Project Manager, you will be partnering with the Distribution business to deliver initiatives that support this strategy with a key focus on two key areas;

1. The integration and governance of digital media source data from various channels to support real-time marketing optimisation.
2. The delivery and operationalisation of client analytics capabilities that inform segmentation, journey analysis, retention strategies, and personalised engagement.

You’ll work across multidisciplinary teams—marketing, technology, data science, compliance, and external partners—to ensure that data infrastructure, project delivery, and business value remain aligned. The ideal candidate combines strong project management expertise with a deep understanding of data in the digital marketing and customer insight space.

The Technology and Business Change function supports the asset management business of M&G comprising Equities, Multi-asset & Sustainability, Fixed Income, Private Markets, Research, Risk and Performance, Compliance, Global Distribution and Operations.
 

Key Responsibilities for this role:

Lead on client transformation initiatives working with the business to define clear and compelling goals, business outcomes and plans to execute their delivery.
Lead and own the delivery roadmap for your respective initiatives.
Lead and drive your initiatives in line with priorities set out by MGG ExCom and Distribution Heads of Business.
Provide leadership for your initiatives including responsibility when applicable for ongoing development of M&G client-facing systems and data, simplifying the service model, improvement of processes aligned to a wider vision of the experience value chain (marketing, sales and distribution, client service, client reporting).
Creating Project and Project structures that support business and technology teams deliver effect.
Lead and mentor project teams ensuring best practices are embedded within the portfolio.
Ensure technology and business change controls are observed and when delivering initiatives.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders and meet their delivery requirements, coordinating, consolidating, and prioritising demand and managing dependencies.
Accelerate feasibility, design, and delivery in support of business outcomes to support improvement of the overall control environment and ensure great client outcomes.
Have ownership and accountability to deliver complex initiatives on behalf of the Sales, Servicing and Marketing Teams

Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Expert knowledge of distribution and client servicing systems, data, processes, and emerging trends.
Experience in project portfolio management, including project delivery within asset management.
A proven ability to influence and persuade stakeholders up to C-suite, coordinating and meeting demands from multiple stakeholders.
An experienced change leader, capable of creating and delivering strategic plans, with accountability for several million £ budgets.
Experienced leading teams of direct staff, matrix staff, and strategic partners.
Experience of project management methodologies and Agile methods preferred alongside client and ABOR data and client analytics.
Knowledge of Salesforce, Adobe Experience Manager, and Client Reporting solutions.
Define project scope, objectives, risks, and delivery timelines; manage cross-functional teams in an Agile or hybrid delivery environment.
Maintain clear documentation including data flow diagrams, data dictionaries, project plans, and reporting frameworks.
Coordinate with compliance, legal, and information security to align solutions with regulatory and ethical requirements.
Present progress, findings, and recommendations to leadership, and manage stakeholder expectations across the organisation.

Personal Attributes:

Demonstrable knowledge of digital media platforms, analytics tools and client data systems.
An open, collaborative, and adaptive leadership style capable of building strong partnerships across the organisation and with external 3rd parties.
A clear communicator that can engage a team around a common purpose and vision and can inspire a diverse and geographically disparate organisation.
A highly analytical thinker that makes objective decisions based on data but is equally comfortable leveraging professional experience and instinct in the absence of good or complete data.
A driven individual with a relentless focus on delivering business outcomes by setting the bar high and building a high-performance one-team culture.
A thoughtful but confident team player able to inspire confidence in senior stakeholders regarding judgment and measured risk-taking.

Work Level: Manager or Expert

Recruiter: Sarah Hawkins

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G plc, underpinned by our policies and our employee-led networks who provide networking opportunities, advice and support for the diverse communities our colleagues represent. Regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or long term condition, we are looking to attract, promote and retain exceptional people. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

M&G is also proud to be a Disability Confident Leader, and we welcome applications from candidates with long-term health conditions, disabilities, or neuro-divergent conditions.  Being a Disability Confident Leader means that candidates who meet the minimum criteria of a job, will be offered an interview if they 'opt in' to the scheme when applying. 

If you need assistance or an alternative means of applying for a role due to a disability or additional need, please let us know by contacting us at: careers@mandg.com

title: Advice Quality Consultant
description:
At M&G our purpose is to give everyone real confidence to put their money to work. As an international savings and investments business with roots stretching back more than 170 years, we offer a range of financial products and services through Asset Management, Life and Wealth. All three operating segments work together to deliver attractive financial outcomes for our clients, and superior shareholder returns.

Through our behaviours of telling it like it is, owning it now, and moving it forward together with care and integrity; we are creating an exceptional place to work for exceptional talent.

We will consider flexible working arrangements for any of our roles and also offer work place accommodations to ensure you have what you need to effectively deliver in your role.

The Role

The Advice Quality (AQ) team forms part of the Risk Control & Compliance function within Wealth Advice. The Advice Quality team undertake quality assurance activities for pre-sale and post-sale advice.

Reporting to the Advice Quality Manager you will undertake quality checking of advised sales and have sufficient product and technical knowledge to make judgements on the suitability of advice outcomes and documentation standards in line with the regulatory requirements.  

You will have analytical skills to assess quality outcomes and draw conclusions, with an ability to provide effective feedback. This requires effective communication skills and an ability to report on quality activities.

This Advice Quality team focus on the following advised sales: Retirement Planning, Estate Planning, Pension Switches, Investment Replacement, Regulated Mortgages, Protection and Equity Release.

The Team

Within the Advice Quality team sits the pre-sale and post-sale Advice Quality Consultants, the pre-sale team will assess the suitability of the advice prior to this being presented to the client, with the post-sale team completing the final assessment post-sale.

M&G Culture & Core Values

The Advice Quality culture, focuses on the core values of M&G. We are one team, aligned to one purpose. Client and customers are at the heart of everything we do, ensuring the correct client outcomes are achieved. We act with care and integrity, each taking accountability, ownership and responsibility for doing the right thing.

Opportunity

The role would be a great opportunity for those looking to progress their career within an Advice Quality function, and further their knowledge with specialised advised sales areas such as Estate Planning, Equity Release and Long-Term Care.  

Key Responsibilities for this role

To operate quality checking of advised sales enabling effective judgements on the suitability of client outcomes and supporting documentary evidence, in line with regulatory and internal standards.
To advise on quality outcomes, providing clear professional feedback to advisers with adequate rationale.
To advise concise feedback on outcomes achieved and where quality can be improved to develop advisers to achieve better client outcomes and file quality documentation.
To operate collaboratively with colleagues to improve overall quality outcomes and provide consistent feedback.
Build a rapport with the advisers within the firm and other Departments to ensure that good relationships are maintained.
Contribute into the design and implementation of quality standards, identifying any trends and proposing resolutions to achieve the required standards.
Achievement of individual productivity targets and objectives.
To prepare reporting on quality assurance activities.

Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Relevant professional qualification (CII Diploma in Regulated Financial Planning or suitable alternative at Level 4 or above) is essential for the role or could be achieved within 6 months.
Detailed knowledge of assessing suitability of advice outcomes , ideally from working in a compliance function.
Detailed knowledge of Pension and Investment products is essential to the role.
Working knowledge of Risk, Compliance and Advice in UK financial services.
Some experience of Financial Services regulation, in particular in the context of suitability would be an advantage
Experience with Mortgage, Protection and Later Life products would be an advantage.

Job Level: Experienced Colleague

Recruiter: Phoebe Ewers

We have a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture at M&G plc, underpinned by our policies and our employee-led networks who provide networking opportunities, advice and support for the diverse communities our colleagues represent. We also welcome those who take part in military service and those returning from career breaks.

title: Governance and Controls Analyst
description:
Governance and Controls Consultant - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract 

This is a great job for someone who has a good understanding of Collective Investment Schemes and Tax Transparent Funds in terms of products and operating models.

A bit about the job:

The Strategy, Integration & Governance teams’ primary responsibility is to oversee all aspects of breach management and corporate governance for the relevant management companies/subsidiaries. You will work closely with the 1st and 2nd line teams across GFS and the wider Aviva Investors to facilitate accurate and efficient breach reporting for internal oversight and governance, whilst at the same time working with the depositary and external suppliers to produce effective management and regulatory MI that will create the best customer outcomes. The team also conducts several investment assurance activities such as new and eligible market oversight, controls testing, iCare test plan production, data deletion and business monitoring. In the role you will coordinate the receipt and sign-off of breaches and errors from all of GFS’ contracted parties, and maintain daily, weekly and monthly operational statistics relating to breach management which will include monthly Depositary reporting, production of the monthly GFS breach statistics pack and reporting within the various committees. You will also effectively manage the Class Action process from end to end, maintaining an effective relationship with all third parties to ensure the timely submission of documents should AIUKFSL wish to take part in an action.  Furthermore, a strong admin process needs to be maintained to ensure all current and past actions are monitored and tracked effectively.

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Working knowledge of iCare and the current risk management framework within Aviva, plus the application of robust and efficient controls.

Experience of working with the Aviva Risk Event Database (RED).

An effective knowledge of prevailing regulation within the UK and EU (e.g. COBS, COLL, CASS, MIFID, UCITS, DP).

Well organised with good time management skills and an excellent eye for detail, taking pride in what you produce whilst prioritising key task.

You will have experience of attending/managing meetings with an understanding of what best practice looks like for effective governance.

What you’ll get for this role:

Generous pension scheme - Aviva will contribute up to 14%, depending on what you put in

Eligibility for annual performance bonus

Family friendly parental and carer’s leave

Generous holiday entitlement plus bank holidays with the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

Up to 40% discount for Aviva products

Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars

Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme

21 volunteering hours per year

Aviva is for everyone:

We’re inclusive and welcome everyone – we want applications from all backgrounds and experiences. Excited but not sure you tick every box? Even if you don’t, we would still encourage you to apply. We also consider all forms of flexible working, including part time and job shares.

We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you. Most of our people are smart working –spending around 50% of their time in our offices every week - combining the benefits of flexibility, with time together with colleagues.

To find out more about working at Aviva take a look here

We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you’ve applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll interview you.

We’d love it if you could submit your application online.  If you require an alternative method of applying, send an email to GlobalRecruitment@avivainvestors.com

title: Performance Oversight Analyst
description:
Please note this position is based in London and this will be the contractual location of the successful candidate, other locations cannot be considered.

Performance Oversight Analyst - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract 

This is a great job for someone who has good understanding of the investment management business, fund structures and processes and a working knowledge of Investment Performance calculations and techniques

A bit about the job:

We are seeking a Performance Oversight Analyst to serve as a key point of contact during escalations between our outsourced performance services team at BNY and internal stakeholders at AI, including Portfolio Managers and Investment Specialists. This role encompasses oversight of performance services across multi-asset, equity, fixed income, and illiquid portfolios, as well as the maintenance and reporting of GIPS composites. Responsibilities include tracking new and closed portfolios with BNY and aligning them with appropriate strategies and composites, leading the semi-annual or ad hoc GIPS forum, initiating and managing the annual GIPS verification process, and maintaining AI’s GIPS policy documentation.

Aladdin experience

Performance Measurement experience related to Asset Management across both Public and Private asset classes

Enthusiasm for, and comfort with, working in a dynamic environment whilst maintaining the quality and integrity of the investment data and working to tight deadlines.

title: Head of Institutional Americas
description:
Head of Institutional Americas

Are you a seasoned institutional sales professional with a robust background in asset management and a proven track record of driving growth and delivering results? If so, this role is perfect for you.

A bit about the job:

As the Head of Institutional- Americas, you will spearhead a bold sales strategy to ignite new business growth across the Americas region. This high-impact role is ideal for a sales driver ready to shape the future of distribution at Aviva Investors. As a key player on the regional leadership team, you will lead from the front—pursuing opportunities, exceeding sales targets, and aligning with our global ambitions.

You will inspire a high-performing team, champion a collaborative, solutions-first culture, and build trusted relationships with pension funds, endowments, foundations, corporates, and insurers. From industry events to boardroom meetings, you will be the face of Aviva Investors—bringing insight, energy, and credibility. Partnering across distribution, investment, and support teams, you will ensure a seamless, strategic approach to business development. Staying sharp on market shifts, competitor moves, and regulatory changes, you will feed insights back into strategy and innovation. 

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Established Network: Strong, trusted relationships across institutional clients in the Americas.

Proven Leadership: A hands-on, lead-from-the-front approach that inspires high performance.

Investment Expertise: Deep knowledge across public and private markets, backed by a strong sales track record aligned with Aviva Investors’ capabilities.

Market Insight: Ability to use data and trends to shape smart, strategic decisions.

Executive Accountability: Driving a high-performance culture while ensuring operational and investment excellence.

What you’ll get for this role:

title: Senior Counsel
description:
Please note this position is based in London and this will be the contractual location of the successful candidate, other locations cannot be considered.

Senior Counsel

This is a great job for someone who has good technical knowledge in areas of law relevant to regulated fund structures and/or the distribution of funds.

A bit about the job:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Legal Counsel to join our team at Aviva Investors. In this role, you will provide expert legal support and advice across our range of UK authorised funds, including UCITS, NURS, and LTAFs, ensuring robust support for product development and management. You will also advise on our global distribution business, with a focus on the UK, Europe, and the Americas, covering the distribution of Luxembourg SICAVs, Irish Liquidity Funds, UK OEICs, and UK ACS. From an AIFM perspective, you will support unauthorised UK AIFs, particularly from a risk management standpoint. The role involves offering oversight on key legislative and regulatory developments impacting UK funds and global distribution, acting as the primary liaison with internal and external legal counsel, regulators, service providers, and other stakeholders. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior members of the UK Management Company & Distribution legal team and serve as the lead legal advisor on major strategic and regulatory projects related to UK funds and the UK management company. You will be responsible for advising on and taking decisions regarding the management of legal risk. This will include legal risk in fund documentation, agreements with third parties and compliance with laws and regulations. 

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

English law qualified solicitor with relevant post qualification experience either within a financial services or funds team of an external law firm, or an in-house legal function of an investment management business.

Good technical knowledge in areas of law relevant to regulated fund structures and/or the distribution of funds.

Ability to successfully contribute to major projects, negotiations, and relationships with third parties and external advisers

Demonstrate a consistently positive attitude, effectively resolve challenges through collaboration, and maintain a solutions-oriented mindset to achieve the best outcomes for clients and the business

Good understanding of operational controls framework.

title: Strategic Partners Director
description:
Strategic Partners Director

This is a great job for someone who wants to work in the Wholesale Distribution team to drive Strategic Partnerships with IFAs, Discretionary Fund Managers, and Wealth Management firms in the UK.

A bit about the job:

In this role you will be required to develop strategic partnership channels and business development opportunities with key IFA consolidators, large national networks, and emerging advisory businesses as well as utilizing strong consultative selling skills to build solutions for Strategic Partners and provide them with a range of Aviva Investors’ capabilities.

You will be excited about creating and executing account strategies for key Strategic Partners, working collaboratively with the Sales & Marketing team.

We want you to Seek out and engage new business opportunities with firms unknown to Aviva Investors and create sales opportunities for the regional distribution teams through conferences, presentations, and webinars.

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Experience in developing relationships with key consolidators and national, network IFA firms.
Experience selling to the financial planning market and an understanding of the key strategic partner firms, including consultative selling.
Strong solutions mindset to understand developing propositions and service models to support sales initiative.
Competent and confident presenter, comfortable travelling nationwide to deliver training sessions to advisers
A commercial mindset and sales focused attitude – keen to think outside of the box when it comes to strategic account planning.

What you’ll get for this role:

Generous pension scheme - Aviva will contribute up to 14%, depending on what you put in
Eligibility for annual performance bonus
Family friendly parental and carer’s leave
Generous holiday entitlement plus bank holidays with the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for Aviva products
Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars
Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme
21 volunteering hours per year

In this role you’ll be ‘Certified’ under the Financial Conduct Authority / Prudential Regulation Authority’s Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR). This means that we’ll need to complete some regulatory background checks on you before you take up your role and we’ll need to ask you some questions on an annual basis to make sure you remain ‘fit and proper’ and competent to carry out your role. We’ll provide training on what holding a SMCR role means when you join us and annually thereafter.

Aviva is for everyone:

We are inclusive and welcome everyone – we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Excited but not sure you tick every box? Research tells us that women, particularly, feel this way.  So, regardless of gender, why not apply. And if you’re in a job share just apply as a pair.

title: Senior UK Equity Analyst – London
description:
Senior UK Equity Analyst - - London

This is a great job for an experienced UK Equities Analyst to join the research function of one of the leading equities franchises.

A bit about the job:

We are seeking a highly experienced equity analyst to join our UK Equity analyst team in London as a Senior Analyst. This pivotal role requires the successful candidate to work closely with fund managers on our UK equities and sustainable mandates, while also playing a crucial part in elevating the standards within the team and serving as a role model for others.

As a Senior Analyst, you will be an integral member of the Global Equity team at Aviva Investors, where we prioritize ESG. Our global sustainable equity capability is driven by rigorous bottom-up fundamental analysis that incorporates ESG considerations. You will contribute to generating innovative investment ideas within a collaborative team environment, utilizing a unified investment research language across our equity platform.

You will be expected to lead by example, setting high standards for equity research and analysis, mentor and develop the skillsets of existing analysts within the team.  Collaborate closely with fund managers on UK equities and sustainable mandates.  Generate investment ideas through thorough fundamental analysis and ESG integration.

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Passion for equity investment
Previous depth of experience required in equity research
Previous coverage of Energy, Utilities and Real Estate preferred.
Strong analytical skills and abilities in financial modelling and company valuation
Previous coverage of UK Equities and track record of stock picking success
Strong written and verbal communication skills

What you’ll get for this role:

Generous pension scheme - Aviva will contribute up to 14%, depending on what you contribute
Eligibility for annual performance bonus
Family friendly parental and carer’s leave
Generous holiday entitlement plus bank holidays with the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for Aviva products
Brilliant flexible benefits including electric vehicles
Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn schemes
21 volunteering hours per year

In this role you’ll be ‘Certified’ under the Financial Conduct Authority / Prudential Regulation Authority’s Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR). This means that we’ll need to complete some regulatory background checks on you before you take up your role and we’ll need to ask you some questions on an annual basis to make sure you remain ‘fit and proper’ and competent to carry out your role. We’ll provide training on what holding a SMCR role means when you join us and annually thereafter.

Aviva is for everyone:

We are inclusive and welcome everyone – we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

description:

Compliance Monitoring Specialist - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract

This is a great job for someone who understands the investment management business model & process.

A bit about the job:

We are seeking a dedicated Compliance Monitoring Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting independent second line risk-based monitoring, themed reviews, and ad hoc reviews of procedures, business, and compliance processes. Your goal will be to identify and escalate potential gaps in adherence to applicable laws, regulations, regulatory guidance, and Aviva Investors or Aviva Group policy.

 You will play a crucial role in producing well-written, coherent, and succinct reports on your reviews, which will be circulated to senior stakeholders. Additionally, you will oversee risk-based surveillance tasks to ensure that first line controls related to order/best execution processes, market abuse prevention, and conflicts of interest are functioning effectively.

 Building and maintaining constructive relationships within relevant business areas is essential, as is fostering strong relationships with and providing support to other members of the Compliance team.

description:

In this role, you will be responsible for the execution of the daily oversight and monitoring plan for CASS compliance, with a particular focus on overseeing third-party administrator activities. You will conduct regular reviews of systems and controls to ensure they meet regulatory requirements. This is a great job for a lawyer with previous Private Markets experience to join one of Europe’s leading Private Markets platforms.

A bit about the job:

Acting as a senior legal adviser within the Aviva Investors legal team, providing a first class legal service to the Aviva Investors Private Markets business in relation to all Private Markets funds (real estate, infrastructure, debt) and corporate real estate transactions and joint ventures, the person in this role will support a key strategic business function and act as a support and control to that business, enabling progress towards its strategic objectives.  The role will support around a variety of tasks that include fund creation and structuring, strategic fund outsourcing projects and joint ventures.

Technical expert in areas of law relevant to unauthorised fund structures and the operator of those funds, including AIFMD.

title: Capital Analyst
description:
Please note this position is based in London and this will be the contractual location of the successful candidate, other locations cannot be considered.

Capital Analyst

This is a great job for someone who has strong capital management, along with experience of Asset Management or the Financial Services Sector.

A bit about the job:

The Aviva Investors Finance team holds a leading role in building and running a financial framework that links Aviva Investors strategy, operations, resource allocation and performance management.  The role will support the Capital Reporting Manager and Senior Finance Manager in delivering high quality capital and liquidity reporting to internal and external stakeholders. The internal MI will enable management to make informed decisions around capital and liquidity. The role also contributes to the management of the global capital and liquidity position of Aviva Investors to ensure that no regulatory breaches occur.  The successful candidate will support the Capital Team with new capital transactions, including capital injections, loans, capital reductions, and dividends. Additionally, they will prepare quarterly capital metrics such as Return on Capital, Operating Capital Generation, and Solvency Ratios, and conduct financial risk assessments to support the Internal Capital and Risk Assessment (ICARA) process.

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

Part -Qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA or equivalent)

Understanding of FCA and PRA regulatory reporting requirements and an understanding of EU wide and global regulatory capital directives and requirements.

Strong business acumen, coupled with excellent project management / facilitation skills

Good understanding of the risk and control environment, and the ‘Senior Managers and Certification Regime’ (SM&CR) given the regulated nature of the CFO role

Ability to make decisions, use independent judgment, establish priorities, and work effectively on multiple initiatives

What you’ll get for this role:

Generous pension scheme - Aviva will contribute up to 14%, depending on what you put in

Eligibility for annual performance bonus

Family friendly parental and carer’s leave

Generous holiday entitlement plus bank holidays with the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

description:
Please note this position is based in London and this will be the contractual location of the successful candidate, other locations cannot be considered.

Front Office Analyst Programmer

This is a great job for someone who has demonstrable experience as an analyst/programmer within the asset management (buy-side) industry.

A bit about the job:

This role is for a front office-facing analyst/full-stack analyst-programmer. Candidates must be self-reliant, resourceful, and possess initiative and drive. They should be able to work well within a close team but also operate independently when required. The ideal candidate should be ready to openly share and discuss ideas and fresh perspectives. title: Controls Assurance Analyst / Investment Management (with VBA / SQL / Phyton skills)
description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, Invesco is dedicated to helping investors worldwide achieve their financial objectives. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world.

If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, come explore your potential at Invesco. Make a difference every day! 

Job Description

Your team

The EMEA Controls Assurance team is responsible for oversight of Front Office Control Management and Risk mitigation processes within Invesco’s EMEA based investment centres. We provide Investment Teams with insightful analysis on their business risk profile and control effectiveness to support their decision-making capabilities.  We are a key partner to the Investment Teams to enable them to adhere to their regulatory and organisational requirements.

Your role

We’re searching for an Analyst for our team in Dublin. You will be involved in delivering Controls Assurance process to all EMEA Investment Teams.  You will be responsible for ensuring risk exposure is accurately assessed and the controls to mitigate these risks are effectively designed and operating efficiently.  This is a key requirement to ensure the Front Office business has implemented effective risk management processes and is adhering to all necessary regulatory and organisational obligations.

You will also be involved in:

Working within the Controls Assurance Team to understand and assess the inherent risks faced as a business and the control processes in place to manage these risks. 

Undertake detailed analysis of business processes and interrogation of the underlying trading and investment data to understand the control operation and efficiency.

Provide data for reporting into the Investment Business detailing any observations made through the review of control processes. Utilise data analysis to assess the efficiency and effectiveness of controls.

Provide information into the Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) process by informing management of the completeness of the control environment.  Assist with the update and maintenance of the RCSAs.

Sounds interesting?

We are looking for individuals with an excellent digital literacy, including coding skills (e.g. VBA, Python, SQL), and a good understanding of the investment environment, ability to understand process and manipulate data is key.    

You will be able to demonstrate how you optimally operate in a team-oriented and collaborative environment, how you can empower yourself, manage your time effectively and work under pressure. You will need to be proficient in English, both written and spoken.

Full Time / Part Time

Full time

Worker Type

Employee

Job Exempt (Yes / No)

Yes

Workplace Model


At Invesco, our workplace model supports our culture and meets the needs of our clients while providing flexibility our employees value. As a full-time employee, compliance with the workplace policy means working with your direct manager to create a schedule where you will work in your designated office at least three days a week, with two days working outside an Invesco office. 

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! We want all of our candidates to shine during the application and selection process, so if you need any adjustments to be made, please send an e-mail to emea-talentacquisition@invesco.com. Please include your name, the job you are interested in, and the type of adjustment you need (for example; breaks during your interview, remote interviews, additional time for assessments or other required adjustments)

We promote a working environment that welcomes everyone and creates inclusive teams, celebrates difference and encourages everyone to be themselves at work.

Our commitment to the community and environmental, social and governance investing:
We partner with charitable organisations globally to make an impact in the communities where we live and work. Our people are encouraged to support the charities they feel most passionate about.  We are also committed to environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing. We serve our clients in this space as a trusted partner both on specific responsible investment product strategies as well as part of our commitment to deliver a superior investment experience. 

Recruitment Agencies: 
Invesco has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly. Invesco will not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact hiring managers directly.

Regulatory:
This position may fall in-scope of one or multiple regimes/directives.

title: Assistant Controller
description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, Invesco is dedicated to helping investors worldwide achieve their financial objectives. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world.

If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, come explore your potential at Invesco. Make a difference every day! 

Job Description

The Department

 

The Invesco Private Markets (IPM) accounting team is responsible for investor, fund and account level financial reporting, management of the fund treasury process, coordination of annual audits, and coordination and review of investor and fund level tax filing requirements for real estate, debt, and private equity funds. The IPM accounting team is also involved acquisitions and dispositions and coordination with joint venture partners, third party service provides and property management companies.

 

Your Role

 

The Assistant Controller is responsible for the financial reporting and oversight of the valuation process and controls for the private credit funds.  Additional responsibilities include oversight of the private funds accounting, financial reporting, and fund operations.  The Assistant Controller reports to the fund Controller and works with the portfolio management, operations, and fund accounting teams.  The Assistant Controller also works closely with the Invesco corporate accounting team

 

You will be responsible for:

 

The Assistant Controller is the primary contact for the Invesco, Ltd. corporate accounting team for matters related to the consolidation of the private credit funds and CLO equity funds.
Responsible for overseeing third party service providers that provide data and analysis for the consolidation of the Invesco private credit funds.
Responsible for coordinating responses to auditor requests related to the private credit funds, including the related disclosures.
Responsible to oversee or otherwise complete the data analysis for disclosures related to the private credit funds consolidated by Invesco Ltd.
Assist the fund accounting team with the coordination, preparation, and timely completion of all audit reports for the funds.
Assist the Invesco, Ltd. corporate accounting team in reviewing the consolidation files, support therefor, and other analysis required by the corporate accounting team for the consolidated financial statements and disclosures included in the 10Qs and 10K.

 

The experience you bring:

Bachelors or Masters degree in accounting/finance
CPA preferred
Six or more years of related work experience, and at least three years of experience with valuations of private credit and private equity investments
Background in public accounting or private investment fund administration sought for position, in particular Microsoft Excel.
Interpersonal skills necessary to communicate effectively with a variety of individuals including both internal and external contacts
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; self-motivated, organized and flexible

Full Time / Part Time

Full time

Worker Type

Employee

Job Exempt (Yes / No)

Yes

Workplace Model

At Invesco, our workplace model supports our culture and meets the needs of our clients while providing flexibility our employees value. As a full-time employee, compliance with the workplace policy means working with your direct manager to create a schedule where you will work in your designated office at least three days a week, with two days working outside an Invesco office. 

What’s in it for you?

 

Our people are at the very core of our success. Invesco employees get more out of life through our comprehensive compensation and benefit offerings including: 

Flexible paid time off

Hybrid work schedule 

401(K) matching of 100% up to the first 6% with a discretionary supplemental contribution

title: Senior Manager, Broad-based Compensation
description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, Invesco is dedicated to helping investors worldwide achieve their financial objectives. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world.

If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, come explore your potential at Invesco. Make a difference every day! 

Job Description

Your Role: 

In this role, you will be responsible for developing, designing, maintaining, and implementing Invesco’s broad-based compensation programs.

As a key member of the Total Rewards team, the Head of Broad-based Compensation will work with key stakeholders across the company’s regions and functions. The Head of Broad-based Compensation will bring significant expertise in the development and execution of compensation programs that attract and retain talent across multiple functional areas and disciplines in a competitive landscape. Lead the strategic review, design, implementation, and communication of the Invesco broad-based compensation programs.

You will be Responsible for: 

Ensuring that compensation programs support corporate strategic objectives including competitive pay, global internal consistency and good corporate governance.

Overseeing all compensation planning and review processes from start (budget and timeline drafting) to finish (employee communication).

Researching and using data to provide strategic input for compensation structures for new geographies/new job profiles

Leading with an eye for process optimization and proper documentation

Partnering with Market data providers and Talent Management to stay in front of compensation trends

Providing direction, coaching and development opportunities for compensation team members

Evolving and managing quarterly incentive accrual processes, working closely with the Finance and Investment Performance Oversight functions.

Leading survey participation strategy and managing submissions of data to a variety of surveys on compensation elements.

Continuing to align compensation within a larger global rewards framework, with a keen eye to the market and with a focus on diversity and inclusion.

Managing the maintenance of the Invesco Job Architecture and ensure global alignment in leveling with respect to compensation programs and eligibility, as well as for purposes of career advancement, promotional practices and global consistency.

The experience you bring:    

Significant leadership experience in compensation at a company of scale and complexity similar to Invesco

Demonstrated understanding of the strategic, operational and financial components of a global investment management or financial services organization 

Oversight and deep technical acumen in each area of compensation and strong familiarity with relevant vendors, recordkeeping systems, and emerging best practices in each area for the attraction and retention of the workforce of the future.

Track record of designing and implementing strategies and policies that advance the talent management goals of the organization.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an in-depth financial analysis background

Ability to influence peers, managers, and employees through relationships rather than authority., and to build trusted relationships across the organization and throughout the system.

Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate throughout all levels of the organization and build consensus and influence positive business outcomes.

title: Division Associate
description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, Invesco is dedicated to helping investors worldwide achieve their financial objectives. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, we provide a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world.

If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, come explore your potential at Invesco. Make a difference every day! 

Job Description

The Department:

The Internal Sales Department engages with financial professionals to deliver a Total Client Experience in becoming an indispensable partner. To accomplish this, we leverage a differentiated consultative experience with our clients through Business Consulting, Portfolio Consulting, and Client Engagement. We Learn, Grow and Succeed together.

Your Role:

As a Division Associate, will be an integral part of building and maintaining long-standing trusted partnerships with clients that improve long-term holdings of Invesco products and services. Your efforts will help foster the client journey and enable team members to attain both revenue and profitability goals. This is an ideal role for a recent college grad, or junior sales professional seeking to move to the asset management industry. We have a welcoming environment, strong culture, industry-leading training program, and consistent track record of promoting from within

You will be responsible for:

Partner with internal and external partners in multiple regions across the country to help develop and prospect new relationships with advisors
Conduct consultative, relationship-building sales calls via the telephone with financial advisors and other licensed professionals
Develop and implement sales plan strategies with the primary focus of prospecting new business
Articulate fund objectives, discuss financial markets (domestic and international) and portfolio strategies
Identify sales opportunities and advisor needs, cross-sell ideas and introduce new concepts
Analyze regional/product sales trends within participating broker/dealer firms and among individual financial advisors
Work with various departments/individuals within the organization to provide ‘Best in Class’ service to financial advisors
Handle daily administrative tasks to ensure maximum business efficiency (i.e., update and maintain contact management system)

The experience you bring:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
FINRA Series 7 and 63 licensing a plus (must acquire within firm-defined time period)
Curiosity about sales, prior sales experience a plus
A strong desire to learn about Capital Markets, mutual funds, ETFs, other investment solutions, and impact of economic factors
Consultative, client first approach
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
A digital and data-driven approach
Strong work ethic, high integrity, and strong values
Motivated to achieve success and grow personally and with the firm
