title: Aladdin Client Transformations, Project Manager, Associate
description:
About this role

Aladdin by BlackRock is a cutting-edge finance technology that unifies the entire investment process, providing real-time insights and enabling seamless communication and decision-making across portfolios.

The Aladdin Business is growing rapidly, with the volume and complexity of new client deals and strategic partnerships growing each year. We are at the next phase of our growth and are evolving into a platform focused business with multiple new product launches and external partnerships. Successful candidates will join in our efforts to help sophisticated investors onboard the world’s leading end-to-end operating system for investment portfolios, understand risk exposures, and act decisively with precision.

 We are looking for a Project Manager to join our Aladdin Client Transformations team.

Your team:

Aladdin Client Transformations is responsible for the installation and deployment of Aladdin, eFront and related products and services, globally. Aladdin transformations are high profile initiatives where major clients are undergoing Operating Model changes and as such, these Implementation Projects have senior level exposure and play an active role in the redefinition of investment organizations. A typical transformation project is at least as much about people, processes and implementing change as it is about investments & technology.

We help clients achieve ambitious strategic objectives, which range from streamlining investment operations to integrating teams, unifying their investment analytics & risk reporting framework, to modernizing their overall investment process. Aladdin’s transformation offering means that we take full responsibility for the client going live on our solution. It also means that we develop true partnerships with our clients at the most senior levels, which continue to grow post go live.

If you are ready to be part of a fast-growing team within the Aladdin Business and drive the expansion of our project management team, this opportunity is for you! This position is based in Tokyo.

You will be responsible for leading a team of consultants, architects, analysts, and business users to safely deliver large and medium-sized projects, delivering solutions to meet client requirements on time, to budget and to the required quality.

Your responsibilities:

Active management of project plans, scope, resourcing, budgets, risks, issues, actions, and decisions using standard tools supported by the partner teams.

Responsible for managing client-side project delivery risk – ensuring that client activities on which Aladdin tasks are dependent are completed to meet baseline milestones as captured in a joint project plan. 

Responsible for the planning and coordination of all project activities to adhere to the critical path as defined in the baselined project plan.

Responsible for the successful delivery of Aladdin products by delivery team members:  to quality / on time / on budget

Handle the management of Project Change Control

Management of Risks and Issues – both internal and external

Take an ownership for daily/weekly project reporting

Chairing project working groups / attending Steering Committees

Active project resource tracking and booking

Project budget / finance tracking (e.g., protection of margin / travel budget & expenses tracking)

Your experience:

3-5 years of relevant work experience in leading projects within financial industry, technology, or in consulting

Strong passion to learn new technology and be a student of market

Excellent organizational and communication Skills

Fluency in Japanese and business proficiency in English

Ability to manage several competing priorities with a hands-on approach.

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team.

Superior communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly to internal team members or clients.

Logical, structured thought processes and good problem-solving skills

Experience of working with global teams and stakeholders and sensitivity to cultural differences and time zones

Prior experience as a Project Manager advantageous, and having Project Management Certification is a plus

Experience of Project Management toolsets and processes advantageous

Ability to create and maintain strong relationships with internal and external project stakeholders at all levels and can build consensus and positively influence outcomes.

Excellent Project Delivery methodology knowledge / practical application of formal methodologies

Excellent Risk, Issue, Action, Decision and Assumption Management

Excellent budgeting, forecasting, maintenance, reporting and management skills.

title: Vice President - Voting and Engagement Analyst - Japan
description:
About this role

Team Overview  

BlackRock Active Investment Stewardship (BAIS) is a specialist team which manages BlackRock’s stewardship engagement and voting on behalf of clients invested in active strategies globally. The team sits within BlackRock’s Portfolio Management Group (PMG) which encompasses Fixed Income, Fundamental Equities, Private Credit, Systematic Investments, Multi-Asset Strategies and Solutions and Private Investors Businesses. Our activities are informed by our Global Engagement and Voting Guidelines and insights from active investment analysts and portfolio managers, with whom we work closely in engaging companies. This is an exciting opportunity to join a new function, and we are looking to build a team of high performing governance specialists globally.  

About the position: 

The BAIS Analyst will be responsible for voting and engagement in relation to a universe of companies, in Japan and other Asian markets as required, in collaboration with active investors. They will provide support on portfolio company analysis, engagement preparation and follow up, and reviewing and assessing corporate governance in advance of voting.  

The intention is for the person in this role to specialize in a subset of the companies in BAIS’ engagement universe, along with various aspects of relevant policy, to support the delivery of our annual and long-term objectives. They will report to the Deputy Head of BAIS based in London. The role is at Vice President level and is based in Tokyo.  

Key responsibilities include:

Demonstrating expertise in analysis of company performance, corporate governance and material sustainability-related practices.
Preparing for, participating in, and leading, as appropriate engagement meetings with portfolio companies, often alongside active investors.
Drafting records of engagement meetings and using them as the basis for preparing case studies on specific companies and themes.
Developing fluency in and applying BAIS engagement priorities, and proxy voting policies.
Monitoring, and participating in when appropriate, key industry initiatives that have impact on BAIS policies and practices.
Contributing to data gathering, benchmarking and reporting to support voting decisions and policy positions.
Preparing position papers to facilitate discussion with broader BlackRock audiences on governance and stewardship topics and developments.
Collaborating across the team to identify ways to improve policy and business processes.
Building strong relationships and collaborating with relevant counterparts within the active investment business and selectively contributing to cross-platform initiatives.

Key tasks involved in fulfilling these responsibilities include:

Preparing for engagement with senior representatives of portfolio companies, including drafting memos in preparation for meetings highlighting key stewardship questions to address, informed by our own and third party research and analysis.
Coordinating with active investors in fundamental equity and fixed income on engagement meeting agendas, questions and objectives.
Participating in industry research groups and thematic initiatives with the active investment teams as appropriate.
Attending, documenting and leading (as needed) engagement efforts, including recording research notes to be stored and shared with select audiences within BlackRock’s active investment business.
Monitoring policy developments to improve the relevance of BAIS’ guidelines.
Participating in peer benchmarking analysis and modeling to contribute to leading engagement and voting practices.
Monitoring proxy voting workflow to ensure all accounts are voted as intended and are in accordance with the appropriate guidelines.
Contributing to, and at times leading on, the development of BAIS position papers and reporting.
Analyzing companies’ shareholder meeting agendas and related materials in order to vote in the manner most consistent with BAIS’ corporate governance policies and fiduciary responsibilities.
Collaborating with client-facing and communications colleagues to ensure client reporting and client presentations meet expectations, and that client queries on corporate governance are responded to promptly and to the client’s satisfaction.
Reviewing the BAIS team’s output and working practices to ensure risks are minimized and performance optimized.

Desired qualifications include:

An undergraduate degree in finance, economics, accounting, political science, history, sustainability or other, relevant field.
A minimum of 8 years of experience in investment management, investment banking, corporate finance, investor relations, consulting and/or legal roles. Experience in company-investor engagement and/or voting at shareholder meetings an advantage.  
A demonstrated strong understanding of financial statements and corporate finance.
Fluency in both Japanese and English.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to synthesize complex information and convey it in a clear and concise manner to senior-level audiences.
A diligent, focused, and persistent work ethic to implement while leading multiple tasks and changing priorities.
The ability to prioritize, analyze, and resolve complex issues under time pressure while maintaining consistent attention to detail.
An organized, self-reliant, and self-motivated approach to responsibilities.
A keen interest in corporate governance and material sustainable business practices.
Collaborative working style, and strong interpersonal skills demonstrating the ability to build and maintain successful relationships with colleagues across the firm and with external parties.
Proficiency using Excel, PowerPoint and other Microsoft products.

Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

BlackRock’s hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person – aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.

At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being.  Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.

title: Quantitative Systems Researcher, Associate / VP
description:
About this role

BlackRock is one of the world’s preeminent asset management firms and a premier provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary, and individual investors around the world. BlackRock offers a range of solutions — from meticulous fundamental and quantitative active management approaches aimed at maximizing outperformance to highly efficient indexing strategies designed to gain broad exposure to the world’s capital markets. Our clients can access our investment solutions through a variety of product structures, including individual and institutional separate accounts, mutual funds and other pooled investment vehicles, and the industry-leading iShares® ETFs.

Elevate your career by joining the world's largest asset manager! Thrive in an environment that cultivates positive relationships and recognizes outstanding performance! We know you want to feel valued every single day and be recognized for your contribution. At BlackRock, we strive to empower our employees and actively engage your involvement in our success.

Systematic Active Equity (SAE) is the quantitative equity group within BlackRock’s Systematic investment group.  We invest our client assets using a systematic investment approach.  SAE is a pioneer and thought leader in the industry and has consistently achieved client investment goals across global equity markets for over 30 years.  We believe research and innovation are critical to continuing our success and believe in a multi-disciplinary approach that intersects traditional finance and economics with data and computer science.  

We are seeking a Systems Researcher who will primarily focus on computer science, data management, mathematical models, and computer simulations. The main skills for this role are outstanding execution of algorithmic development and software engineering. The Systems Researcher will be part of our investment and quantitative research teams. 

We have: 

$200bn + billion USD under management. 

A team of world-class quantitative finance researchers and portfolio managers. 

Through BlackRock, access to some of the best investors and thought leaders, as well as to leading experts in statistics, machine learning, and optimization. 

A 40-year plus track record of performance and innovation. 

You have: 

The desire to work in a team environment with computer scientists, data scientists, and quantitative investors of many different backgrounds. 

A passion for algorithmic development and implementation, and a keen attention to detail. 

A fascination for some aspects of computer science: distributed computing, cryptography, and machine learning. 

Working knowledge of serverless architecture, ideally having developed or contributed to projects in that space. 

A Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in computer science with 2+ years of applied experience. 

A proven track record of delivering awesome software. 

Excellent knowledge of Python / Pandas, as well as Java or C/C++. 

Well-rounded proficiency with Linux and UNIX systems. 

Experience in distributed computing and the use of GPUs.


For San Francisco, CA Only the salary range for this position is USD$145,000.00 - USD$215,000.00 . Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, and benefits including heath care, leave benefits, and retirement benefits. BlackRock operates a pay-for-performance compensation philosophy and your total compensation may vary based on role, location, and firm, department and individual performance.


Our benefits

title: Associate Core PM
description:
About this role

Associate, Fundamental Equity Core Portfolio Manager 

Mexico City, Mexico 

Your Team: 

Fundamental Equities (FE) sits within BlackRock’s Portfolio Management Group (PMG), which encompasses Fundamental and Systematic investing across Fixed Income, Equities and Multi-Asset Strategies. 

The FE business is a key division at BlackRock with over $260bn of assets under management, across 90+ strategies and over 200+ investment professionals. FE teams use traditional analytics to pick stocks and assemble coherent, deliberate and diversified portfolios. Through cutting edge technology, sophisticated models and embedded research, our investment management approach provides outstanding performance for our clients and is an important part of the BlackRock brand! 

Your Role & Impact: 

BlackRock has an opportunity for a Core PM to join the firm’s FE business in Mexico City. We are responsible for a wide array of tasks within the FE investment process including equity order implementation, cash management, hedging strategies and compliance monitoring across the FE book. The role will act as support both vertically into investment teams within the US while also servicing the broader platform by administering key end of day tasks and order implementation for investment teams outside of the region. 

Working closely with other members of the investment team, candidates should possess strong analytical and quantitative skills, as well as a proven track record to work in collaboration with a wide range of partner teams. Successful candidates will possess outstanding attention to detail, excellent interpersonal skills, and have a passion for thinking critically.  

Your Responsibilities: 

Implementation of equity, derivative & FX orders across a range of active strategies and partner with trading desks around the globe to target efficient execution of these strategies  
Handle cash flow activity and overall cash allocations through derivative equitization, basket orders, ETF create/redeems and single-stock transactions   
Execute FX hedging strategies to manage foreign currency risk 
Monitor funds to ensure investment strategy is implemented effectively across applicable accounts and in accordance with client guidelines 
Produce daily, periodic and ad hoc reporting and analytics to support the investment teams’ processes using Aladdin tools (Explore, ATX/ATP, etc.) 
Manage enquiries on behalf of the various FE investment teams and resolve issues by escalating matters to relevant parties including operations, compliance and RQA in a timely fashion  
Ad hoc, platform related project tasks to assist business-unit executives (COO/CIO), business managers, heads of research, and other senior-level leaders  
Be a student of the markets and become a crucial part of the investment team and their generation of alpha! 

Your Skills/Experience 

Keen interest in equity instruments and markets, ETF experience a plus, CFA candidate (or willingness to work towards) preferred 
Programming and Database Management: Intermediate proficiency in Python, including experience with version control systems like ADO or GitHub, and a solid understanding of SQL and general database concepts.  
Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools: Advanced skills in Excel and PowerBI (or equivalent tools) for data manipulation, visualization, and reporting.  
Advanced understanding of Aladdin tools & infrastructure.  
Strong analytical, organizational and project management skills along with outstanding communication, sound judgment, integrity and discretion 
Understanding of and dedication to encouraging an inclusive, diverse, and equitable culture 
Flexible, responsive and self-starting personality. Proven experience working both independently and as part of a team in a highly collaborative, global, demanding and dynamic environment 
Thorough with an exceptional attention to detail.  Ability to navigate a demanding and dynamic environment 

Our benefits

title: Issues Governance Data Vice President
description:
Our technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation. We are looking for an experienced Risk Analyst to help maintain and mature our Technology Risk Management Programs. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with IT Risk, project management, and strong analytical skills.

$130,000 - $205,000 Annual

title: Vulnerability Management Risk and Mitigations Analyst, Vice President
description:
Who we are looking for

State Street seeks to recruit an experienced technical analyst as a Risk and Mitigations Analyst within its Global Cybersecurity Vulnerability Management team. This role involves the research and evaluation of vulnerability scenarios to form strong conclusions on risk and response disposition. Analysts will apply technical experience to validate risk and verify the response actions to that risk. This position requires collaboration skills to drive remediation activities across the enterprise, organizational skills, proven analytic skills, attention to detail and vulnerability specific technical expertise.

What you will be responsible for

Maintain situational awareness, collaborate, influence and lead initiatives across the enterprise
Work closely with business units to understand people, process, and technology in order to build effective vulnerability management strategies
Analyze vulnerability assessments and remediation plans
Synchronize with Cyber Defense Center to monitor and research information sources to assess risk to the enterprise
Update and maintain vulnerability management runbooks and playbooks
Maintain operational effectiveness
Update and communicate operational metric
Researching vulnerability risk scenarios, including Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE), tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) and attack chains.

What we value

The ability to quickly but thoroughly evaluate complex scenarios and make strong recommendations.
Knowledge and understanding of vulnerability management and remediation
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skills
Ability to work independently and solve challenging problems
Knowledge and interest in vulnerability related trends
Incredible attention to detail

Education & Preferred Attributes

3+ years of information security experience
Ability to consider short term and long term implications of a recommended solution
Ability to make difficult decisions in unique situations, present recommendations under pressure to senior leadership and to cross-functional teams that my have conflicting positions
Knowledge and understanding of structuring complex data across varied data sources
Expertise in designing solutions, implementing and maintaining new cybersecurity controls and tools

title: Vulnerability Management Data Analyst, Vice President
description:
Who we are looking for

State Street seeks to recruit an experienced data analyst within its Global Cybersecurity Vulnerability Management team. This role involves working with domain experts to develop novel analytics for cybersecurity risk management solutions. Analysts apply skill and experience to datasets using SQL and scripting languages to surface meaningful insights and partner with key stakeholders.

What you will be responsible for

Use your understanding of Security Data Science and Graph Theory to analyse cybersecurity data.
Work hand in hand with product owners and domain experts from across the Global Cybersecurity organization to develop novel analytics for security and risk management solutions.
Analyse datasets using SQL and scripting languages to surface meaningful/actionable insights and opportunities to partner teams and other key stakeholders
Approach problems from first principles, using a variety of statistical and mathematical modeling techniques to research and understand behaviors and interactions
Build, manage, deploy, and monitor end-to-end analytical solutions to
Build and share data visualizations and self-serve dashboards for your product team, and support planning, facilitation, and execution of regular communication and coordination across cross-functional teams
Continually reviewing completeness and accuracy of relevant data platforms
Maintaining situational awareness, collaborate, influence and lead initiatives across the enterprise
Work closely with business units to understand people, process, and technology in order to build effective vulnerability management strategies

What we value

The ability to thoroughly evaluate and understand complex data sets
Knowledge and understanding of vulnerability management and remediation
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skills
Ability to work independently and solve challenging problems
Knowledge and interest in vulnerability related trends
Security certification a plus
Experience within a vulnerability management role
Ability to work in an environment with a geographically dispersed team

Education & Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field with a minimum of 8 years of industry experience or PhD in a quantitative technical field with 4+ years of relevant industry experience.
Direct relevant experience building models and analytics for cybersecurity, insurance, and other data intensive risk management related domains, structuring operational and log data in cloud native analytics environments.
Demonstrated ability to work as an independent contributor driving research and analyses from conception to implementation with minimal guidance.
Experience with scripting and data analysis programming languages, such as Python or R and advanced proficiency with SQL and data visualization tools
Experience with cohort and funnel analyses, population clustering and segmentation techniques, and a deep understanding statistical concepts related to experimental design, selection bias, probability distributions, and Bayesian inference
Experience answering unstructured questions, driving data-driven solutions, and managing projects and tasks to a conclusion
Direct experience in the cybersecurity industry building analytics, models and detections (minimum 1-2 years).
Ability to make difficult decisions in unique situations, present recommendations under pressure to senior leadership and to cross-functional teams that my have conflicting positions
Demonstrated ability to identify core issues and work with leaders and team members to resolution
Strong organizational, task switching, and prioritizing skills
Ability to work independently and solve challenging problems while collaboration with stakeholders
Advanced presentation skills, both orally and written
Ability to work well with others and under pressure
Demonstrated professionalism in approach to communicating ideas and solutions in simple language to team members, senior leaders and business partners

title: PAM Integration Engineer, AVP
description:
This position will be part of the PAM Adoption and Integration Team. Primary responsibilities will be managing critical integrations required for GCS PAM Regulatory and Modernization initiatives. The solutions engineer will design and implement tool integrations between Identity Governance Administration (IGA), Privileged Access Management (PAM) and emerging infrastructure platforms to streamline adoption.

Other responsibility areas are listed below:

Due to the role requirements this job needs to be performed primarily in the office with some flex work opportunities available.

What you will be responsible for

Design specifications for API integration between SailPoint and Enterprise PAM Tools (CyberArk, HashiCorp) and collaborate with IGA/PAM engineering teams to develop and implement requirements.
Work in an agile framework leveraging JIRA, prioritizing remediation work of critical findings, while supporting modernization initiatives for applications/platforms migrating to strategic landing zones.
Writing requirements documents and specifications for systems to enforce automated controls.
Work closely with application and infrastructure teams to understand their operational models and provide guidance for onboarding their privileged access to strategic PAM tools.
Respond to lines of defense queries about controls and privileged access management evidence requests.
Maintain documentation for privileged access policies and procedures.
Attend vendor training and customer support events for Privileged access and other vendor products.
Assist members of the IT community with questions about policy and standards.
Design and implement new processes and procedures as needed to enhance security posture and controls.

What we value

These skills will help you succeed in this role

Candidates with the following knowledge areas, though not required, are preferred:

Operating Systems: Windows, Unix, Linux

Databases: Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server, Databricks

Code and Scripting Languages: SQL, PowerShell, Linux shell scripting, Python and an understanding of operating systems Windows and Linux and accounts management on these systems are preferred.

Cybersecurity Training: Experience with or knowledge of both Identity and Access Management/Privileged Access Management concepts and best practices.
Experience with APIs, SCIM integration preferred.

Education & Preferred Qualifications

Candidates should have a BS/BA degree in a technical discipline.
Candidates must have strong oral and written skills in English and have had exposure to technologies such as Jira, Confluence, Azure, AWS and other Clouds.
Candidates should have strong skills with Microsoft Office tools such as Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint.
Candidates should be initiative-takers, showing initiative without waiting to be asked.
Candidates should be meticulous.
Candidates should have critical thinking skills and be able to solve problems independently.
Candidates should be able to work well within a team.

Additional requirements

Quincy, Massachusetts, USA

title: Key Engineer , Vice President
description:
State Street is seeking a skilled and experienced Security Engineer with expertise in cryptographic key management.  The security engineer will collaborate with lead engineers and architects to develop, implement and maintain key management solutions. The Security Engineer will integrate various key management systems and HSMs within a complex collection of enterprise applications, scaffolding, public and private cloud environments, and DevOPS workflows.  The security engineer will design and implementing cryptographic automation and integrated solutions across the enterprise.

Responsibilities will include:

Leading a team of CMS and KMS professionals to define and deliver on encryption strategies
Developing and evolving a NIST compliant framework for KMS, CMS across the enterprise.
Developing and maintaining system orchestration to automate day to day processes for both certificate and key management.
Developing and maintaining ad-hoc and automated data reporting using vendor tooling or custom processing appropriate to monitor KPI success and overall health.
Evolving the framework for system monitoring as related to critical security alerts and notifications.
Developing automation approaches to solve KMS, CMS lifecycle challenges
Analyzing legacy KMS, CMS solutions for security gaps and developing new capabilities to remediate and mitigate
Providing guidance for scoping complex, cross-organizational projects as needed
Developing standard workflows to enable seamless integration across tech stacks
Partnering with architecture teams to design and evaluate KMS, CMS strategies
Developing and deploying secure solutions to ensure that Digital Credential Services are performing according to specifications, continue to meet defined procedures, and comply with applicable information security policies and requirements. 
Integrate applications and third-party products into internal KMS, CMS services
Creating and maintaining documentation for technical and administrative functions


 

Skills/Knowledge Desired:

Certificate Authority Administration
Certificate Enrollment Web Service & Policy Web Service
Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS) monitoring. 
Familiarity with encryption best practices for data-in-motion  
Familiarity with encryption best practices for data-at-rest  
Expertise in Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) machine identity technologies such as SSH, SSL, TLS.
Experience with workflow and API development
Experience with Restful APIs JSON XML
Ability to perform light programming tasks using common programming and scripting languages
Experience with K8s, CICD, Terraform preferred
 

Experience Desired

5-7 years of experience working with KMS, CMS architecture
5-7 years of System Administration of Windows, Unix/ Linux
5-7 years of experience in infrastructure (security/systems/network) engineering and/or  development
Experience developing executive-level reporting and communications
Experience working in large complex environments (financial services a plus)

Salary Range: 

$130,000 - $205,000 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

title: Global Client Operating Officer (GCOO), GCD Client Grouping, State Street Bank & Trust - SVP/SMD
description:
Location: Boston, Massachusetts

Across the globe, institutional investors rely on State Street to help them manage risk, respond to challenges through solutions, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged professionals are essential to our success.

Our commitment to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us. 

Why this role is important to us

You will be joining the Institutional Services function that allows us to deliver a comprehensive, holistic approach to each client relationship — for asset managers and asset owners, insurance companies, and official institutions globally. It means our client-facing functions work together to bring the very best solutions and services the firm has to offer — across all of our locations, products, and capabilities.

Position Overview

In coordination with the Client Executive, the GCOO role will ensure STT delivers consistent global service excellence and drive transformation changes that aligns with the client’s strategy.  This role will be responsible for providing global client oversight from a service and delivery perspective for some of the largest, and most strategic clients of the bank. 

Primary Responsibilities

Strategic C-Suite Engagement 

In partnership with the Client Executive, drive strategic solutions aligned to One State Street goals and targets

Manage internal and external C-Suite engagement to drive partnerships across product and service teams. 

Commercial Excellence 

In conjunction with the Client Executives, identify new business opportunities and partner to formulate and deliver our value proposition – focus on foundational, higher margin solutions

Measure year over year client p/l’s and identify and facilitate as necessary revenue improvement opportunities and expense improvements 

Measure losses and review opportunities for improvement

Leadership 

Effectively manage staff on both direct and virtual teams by driving GCOO / Client mission; create opportunities for emerging talent to move into stretch assignments; proactive succession and development planning with a focus on service resiliency via training, cross-training

Advance the team’s collective knowledge and effectiveness by bringing insights and solutions to the team and ensuring sustainable best practice

Set an example of team building to the broader State Street organization, particularly with the Global Services and Global Delivery organizations

Deliver Service Excellence 

Create a seamless, integrated operating model across product jurisdictions and operating centres

Represent an internal and external point of escalation, across all business lines that serve the client, for unresolved service items

Act as proactive internal leader on ways to optimize our end-to-end client service delivery to deliver client outcomes

Active Global Governance 

Provide an overarching global governance and framework to enhance locally delivered service solutions through support of Client Account Plans

Oversee regular local and global service reviews with the client

Spearhead monthly internal and external meetings to review KPI’s, key issues, and forthcoming new products/asset classes

Accountability for Client Satisfaction on Service and Delivery 

Focus on specific action items related to global service delivery and resolving service issues

Create a unique operational value that defends and grows the book of business with the client

Build the Future 

Proactively engage with State Street product management to lend a client perspective towards new product development

Engage with the client on needs and capabilities specific to new regulation, product development, and other solutions establishing an early adopter advantage for State Street.

Actively driving and working across all of the service providers within Alpha and State Street to bed down the standard service model and ensure a well understood, documented and repeatable model for the organization to follow.

Job Requirements and Minimum Qualifications

A minimum of 15+ years of services operations and client experience is preferred.

4 year undergrad, MBA preferred

Track record as a COO

Global Experience preferred

Multiple business line experience preferred cross Front, Middle and Back Office

About State Street
What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

title: State Street Global Advisors Sr. Database Engineer Replication Specialist, VP
description:
StateStreet Global Advisors (SSGA) is seeking a Senior Database Engineer to join their technology-focused Database Engineering (DBE) team which is a collaborative group of engineers dedicated to ensuring the performance, security and scalability of the organization’s data infrastructure. DBE team strives to create seamless and efficient data solutions to empower teams across the organization to leverage data for decision making and innovation.

Job Overview:
You will contribute as a seasoned member of a dynamic team to architect, design, develop and implement enterprise solutions for data, cloud, storage, access provisioning, replication and analytics while ensuring the guard rails for security, stability, and scalability are upheld.
You will be responsible for enterprise level development, testing, and maintenance  of various implementations within the architecture team supporting 100+ applications within the IT department servicing front, middle and back office applications 

Must-Have Skills:

Strong database platform knowledge including OLAP (Redshift/Databricks/Snowflake), OLTP (Postgres/Oracle/SQL Server/Sybase) and NoSQL(DynamoDB/MongoDB) data platforms.

Proficient in Data Design and Modelling for OLTP and OLAP applications for optimal performance, minimal redundancy and data integrity.

Development : Python and shell scripting, database development and optimization techniques including indexing, partitioning, materialization, as well as OLAP techniques such as star models, data distribution, sorting, vacuum, materialization, dynamic tables.

Aware of column store, compression methods.

Adhere to coding standards, write CRUD SQL, Bulk Approach for OLAP, MicroBatch workloads, able to understand modern ingestion processes, hot/cold approaches.

Ability to code stored procedures, UDFs multi language and ability to use dynamic and/or structured/semi-structured data types (e.g., XML/JSON). Understand triggers and insight into complex features such as change-data-capture, streaming.

Guide Application teams in writing of database code, validation rules, data quality.

Performance Tuning & Maintenance : Experience with backup and recovery, managing large data sets, and ongoing maintenance of changes (version control), archival and purging strategies. Technical documentation, creating SOPs and migration plans.

Monitoring & Troubleshooting critical processes in Production and knowledge of modern observability techniques such as Open Search, Grafana, Splunk. Ability to understand Disk I/O. CPU, Memory, and other internal resource utilization.

Cloud computing expertise: Familiarity with one or more major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their database services. 

Data Migration & Replication : Architecting and deploying GoldenGate replication on cloud platforms, optimizing performance and scalability for large data volumes.

Building robust data pipelines using GoldenGate to replicate data between different cloud databases (e.g., Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL) across multiple regions.

Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks within GoldenGate replication, including tuning network settings and database configurations.

Passion for learning new technologies, collaborative mindset and a sense of accountability.

Nice-To-Have Skills:

Data modernization techniques : Externalization, follow Medallion Architecture of raw/curated/gold (aka silver/bronze/gold), Lake strategy and usage, Serverless, and Producer-consumer conceptualization.

Workflow Orchestration: Ability to understand end to end data pipelines, use of tools such as Airflow, CICD process and use of Git.

Security Management knowledge including understanding of role-based access, groups and grouping privileges, use of external systems for vaults. Ability to define standards and access controls, user management and various access methods.

Data Security - implement security measures to ensure best practices are followed and protect sensitive data during data pipeline/replication process and access control mechanisms such as Data Encryption, auditing, and logging.

Experience in Enterprise level Data Virtualization/Fabric 

About State Street Global Advisors:

For nearly four decades, State Street Global Advisors has been committed to helping financial professionals and those who rely on them achieve their investment objectives. We partner with institutions and financial professionals to help them reach their goals through a rigorous, research-driven process spanning both active and index disciplines. We take pride in working closely with our clients to develop precise investment strategies, including our pioneering family of SPDR ETFs. With millions* in assets under management, our scale and global footprint provide access to markets and asset classes, and allow us to deliver expert insights and investment solutions.
State Street Global Advisors is the investment management arm of State Street Corporation.
* Assets under management were $2.67 trillion as of September 30,2017. AUM reflects approx. $36 billion (as of September 30, 2017) with respect to which State Street Global Advisors Funds Distributors, LLC (SSGA FD) serves as marketing agent; SSGA FD and State Street Global Advisors are affiliated.

Salary Range: 

$130,000 - $205,000 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job Application Disclosure: 

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
Cloud Solutions Architect - VP
Who we are looking for

We are looking for a seasoned and forward-thinking Cloud Solutions Architect, a strategic thinker with deep technical expertise and a passion for architecting cloud-native enterprise systems. Someone who thrives in fast-paced, collaborative environments and takes pride in delivering high-quality, scalable solutions. The ideal candidate will bring experience designing secure, scalable enterprise systems in cloud environments, particularly focusing on Azure and multi-cloud services, identity platforms, and enterprise integration patterns. This is an opportunity to influence the evolution of our platform while fostering innovation and collaboration across global engineering teams.

What you will be responsible for
Lead end-to-end architecture design of an investment management and trading SaaS platform using Microsoft Azure technologies.
Define and enforce architectural standards, best practices, and reusable design patterns.
Collaborate with engineering, product, and security teams
Own the design of robust authentication and authorization frameworks using OAuth2, SAML, OpenID Connect, and SCIM.
Ensure the platform meets enterprise-grade SLAs for performance, security, availability, and compliance (e.g., SOC2, PCI-DSS)
Provide architectural direction across development teams and lead technical design reviews.
Participate in strategic planning, technical roadmap development, and system architecture reviews.
Drive proof-of-concepts and prototyping of innovative solutions and tools.
Lead the modernization of legacy trading systems, migrating from monolithic architectures to modular, cloud-native services that improve scalability, latency, and fault tolerance. Ensure continuity of business logic while modernizing core infrastructure.
Leverage AI and machine learning tools to drive platform innovation, automate operations, and enhance developer productivity.
Identify opportunities to integrate AI-powered insights across the application lifecycle and customer experience.
Stay current with Azure feature updates and industry best practices; evaluate emerging tools for strategic benefit.
Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, engineering, or a related technical discipline.
10+ years of software engineering experience with at least 5 years in an architecture role.
Technical Expertise
Proven track record designing and architecting cloud native solutions
Strong object-oriented programming skills in Java or C#
Deep understanding of cloud-native design patterns, with the ability to apply patterns to build scalable, maintainable, and secure cloud applications
In-depth knowledge of event-driven architectures and real-time data streaming using tools like Apache Kafka
Experience with Kubernetes with a strong focus on designing scalable, secure, and resilient micro service architectures
Solid understanding of data security principles including encryption, key management, and secure design principles
Deep understanding of identity protocols and cloud authentication flows
Experience designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines that support blue/green deployments, canary releases, and automated rollback strategies.
Strong understanding of application monitoring, observability, and alerting practices to ensure system reliability, performance, and rapid incident response
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work well with peers in a collaborative team environment
Why this role is important to us

The Cloud Solutions Architect is a critical role in our organization, helping transition to a cloud-native SAAS solution operating at the highest standards of quality and performance. Your leadership will drive innovation, ensure compliance with global regulatory standards, and enable seamless collaboration across geographically distributed engineering tams. This is a rare opportunity to shape the future of the State Street Alpha platform.

Alpha unifies portfolio management, trading, compliance, risk analytics, and investment servicing into a single, interoperable ecosystem.

From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading, and investment management to institutional clients.
 
Work, Live, and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance, and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to a flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
 
Inclusion, Diversity, and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are powerful contributors to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. title: Front End Architect
description:
Front End Architect - VP
Who we are looking for

We are seeking a highly experienced and visionary Front End Architect to lead the architectural design and modernization of our web-based SaaS platform. You will play a key role in reimagining a native client application into a modern, scalable, cloud-native web interface, leveraging best-in-class frontend technologies and design patterns. This is an opportunity to influence the evolution of our platform while fostering innovation and collaboration across global engineering teams.

What you will be responsible for
Own the front-end architectural vision and guide implementation of scalable, performant, and maintainable web applications.
Lead the modernization effort of a native desktop client to a cloud-native, browser-based application using modern frontend frameworks.
Define architecture strategies around modular UI composition, including adoption of micro-frontend architectures.
Collaborate closely with product managers, backend architects, UX designers, and cross-functional teams to define and execute technical solutions aligned with business goals.
Ensure best practices in performance optimization, accessibility, testing, and maintainability across frontend codebases.
Drive innovation and productivity through evaluation and integration of AI-driven UI and DevOps tools.
Guide and mentor engineering teams on frontend design patterns, componentization, and reusable architecture principles.
Evaluate and recommend tools, frameworks, and technologies that align with our tech roadmap.
Maintain focus on customer experience, performance, and scalability.
Drive proof-of-concepts and prototyping of innovative solutions and tools.
Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, engineering, or a related technical discipline.
10+ years of experience in software engineering with at least 5+ years in a frontend architecture or technical lead role.
Technical Expertise
Proven experience designing large-scale enterprise web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks, particularly React.
Strong grasp of frontend architecture principles including component-driven development, state management (e.g., Redux, Recoil), and micro-frontend patterns.
Experience transitioning monolithic or native applications to modern SPA (Single Page Application) architectures.
Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3, and modern frontend build tools.
Experience designing and integrating REST and streaming APIs.
Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies for frontend applications, including blue/green deployments.
Familiarity with application monitoring, logging, and performance tooling
Cloud-native development experience, preferably within Azure environments; knowledge of authentication and identity federation models (OAuth, OpenID Connect).
Experience with Kafka or event-driven systems is a plus.
Strong understanding of frontend security considerations (CSP, XSS, CORS, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate architectural decisions and influence stakeholders.
Ability to work well with peers in a collaborative team environment
Why this role is important to us

The Front End Architect is a critical role in our organization, helping transition to a cloud-native web based SAAS solution operating at the highest standards of quality and performance. Your leadership will drive innovation, ensure compliance with global regulatory standards, and enable seamless collaboration across geographically distributed engineering tams. title: Data Architect
description:
Data Architect - VP
Who we are looking for

We are seeking a strategic and technically skilled Data Architect to lead the design and modernization of our enterprise data architecture. This individual will drive the evolution of a monolithic data infrastructure into a distributed, micro-services-based, cloud-native ecosystem. A strong understanding of data modeling, financial systems, and enterprise data management practices is essential. This is an opportunity to influence the evolution of our platform while fostering innovation and collaboration across global engineering teams.

What you will be responsible for
Architect and implement enterprise-scale data platforms to support cloud-native, micro-services application architecture.
Lead the redesign of legacy monolithic database applications into distributed, domain-based data services.
Define and manage data domain models, schemas, and contracts to support modular service-based architectures.
Design and architect enterprise data warehouses, data marts, and data lake structures with attention to scalability, governance, and performance.
Collaborate with application, infrastructure, and business teams to align data strategies with overall platform goals.
Establish data standards, policies, and best practices aligned with financial data conventions and regulatory compliance.
Guide and support development teams in implementing data services and interfacing with cloud storage, analytical tools, and event streams.
Participate in architectural reviews and ensure consistency and scalability of data infrastructure patterns.
Champion innovation in the use of AI/ML tools and analytics to drive value from enterprise data assets.
Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, engineering, or a related technical discipline.
10+ years of experience in enterprise data architecture or database engineering roles, with experience in cloud-native transformations.
Technical Expertise
Proven track record in designing, implementing, and scaling relational and non-relational databases.
Expertise in modern data architecture patterns including data mesh, domain-driven design (DDD), and micro-services.
Deep experience with cloud data platforms (Azure preferred, AWS or GCP acceptable)
Strong background in data warehouse and ETL/ELT architecture
Solid understanding of messaging/event systems such as Kafka for data streaming and event-driven architectures.
Familiarity with financial services data structures, standards (e.g., FpML, FIX), and reporting requirements.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks (e.g., DAMA-DMBOK), data security, and privacy best practices.
Strong hands-on experience with SQL, data modeling tools (e.g., ER/Studio, dbt), and metadata management platforms.
Experience with modern data warehouse platforms such as Snowflake, including performance optimization, data modeling, and integration with cloud-native architectures.
Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence data strategy across engineering and business stakeholders.
Knowledge of graph data models or time-series data engines is a plus
Experience with regulatory data compliance (e.g., SOX, Basel, GDPR) in financial contexts.
Why this role is important to us

The Daa Architect is a critical role in our organization, helping transition to a cloud-native web based SAAS solution operating at the highest standards of quality and performance. Your leadership will drive innovation, ensure compliance with global regulatory standards, and enable seamless collaboration across geographically distributed engineering tams. title: GCF - Head of Client Administration and Loan Operations, MD
description:
Who we are looking for

GCF is seeking a Global Head of Client Administration and Loan Operations for itslending portfolio.  This position reports directly into GCF senior leadership.  This seasoned Operations executive will lead a global team of subject matter experts who manage the set-up, compliance, administration, closing and servicing of GCF’s loans. They will also oversee GCF’s Operational Risk and Compliance Team, Regulatory Reporting Team and lead other key regulatory initiatives. This global team is comprised of 60+ individuals based in the United States, Poland and India and works in close collaboration with both GCF’s Front Office Relationship Managers and numerous global senior stakeholders from around the company.  This individual will oversee back office loan servicing and transaction processing teams, who manage internal and external service providers.  This executive will also lead and drive relationships with external and internal technology/systems owners and is responsible for successful execution of GCF’s middle and back office technology initiatives.  The successful applicant should have significant operations experience with a proven track record of process improvement and driving strategic change.   Client onboarding, credit/banking and client administration experience as well as an understanding of State Street’s role, value proposition, visibility, evolving client needs and industry developments in Credit Lending markets are also critical for this role.

Why this role is important to us

You will be joining the Institutional Services function that allows us to deliver a comprehensive, holistic approach to each client relationship — for asset managers and asset owners, insurance companies, and official institutions globally. It means our client-facing functions work together to bring the very best solutions and services the firm has to offer — across all of our locations, products, and capabilities.

Join us if making your mark on the long-lasting client relationships we build is a challenge you are up for.

What you will be responsible for

Reenginer critical loan servicing functions and process flows to enhance efficiency, reduce risk, and improve client satisfaction
Provide operational expertise to guide the implementation of various workflow tools, loan platform improvements,  and the realignment of Loan Operations team structure
Deepen and drive GCF’s understanding of various loan accounting platforms and applications such as Loan IQ, Wall Street Office, and McCracken Financial Solution Corp’s Strategy
Hire, develop and lead a high performing, global team working with internal clients and stakeholders to deliver a client focused and efficient service experience
Oversee management of Client Administration, including AML/KYC, regulatory compliance and deal execution
Provide input and guidance into the development and assessment of new products and services, which have considerable revenue impact for GCF
Steer relationships with internal and external service providers including management of vendor interactions
Oversee GCF’s Operational Risk and Compliance team
Champion a culture of risk excellence and ensure adherence to State Street’s internal Risk Management and Control frameworks
Manage and coordinate internal reviews, audits and regulatory exams
Direct and influence GCF’s systems architecture, technology improvements and deal workflow
Represent GCF in all applicable committees, boards, advisory forums and regulator meetings

What we value 

These skills will help you succeed in this role

Demonstrated ability to identify and manage operational risks
Builds trust and collaborates with key internal stakeholders through excellent communication and influencing skills
Demonstrated understanding of the importance of pro-active, transparent and constructive relationships
Inspirational leader of people who builds and leverages diverse talent that consistently delivers against team goals
Demonstrated ability to provide fresh insights, resilient and a leader of change

Education & Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in a relevant field or equivalent
Minimum of 20 years of experience in Credit Servicing/Operations, with a proven track record and experience in driving improvements in process and service. 

Are you the right candidate? Yes!

We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don’t necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Salary Range: 

$170,000 - $252,500 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job Application Disclosure: 

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Senior Technical Developer [Oracle EPM – EPCM (Transfer Pricing)] – Assistant Manager
description:
Role Summary & Role Description:

Overall 8-12 years of EPM/PCM experience in areas such as administration, design, analysis, development, and support for various EPM and PCM products.
Must be highly proficient in PCM modules primarily in Transfer Pricing.
Experience in Requirement Gathering & Solution Design for PCM(Transfer pricing model).
Create and maintain EPCM business rules, models and custom MDX allocation scripts for supporting Segment Allocation and Tax transfer pricing processes.
Proficient in building forms and reports.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for Oracle TP applications, working closely with end-users to address their needs and resolve any system-related problems.
Data management skills for creating data load rules, mappings, and data loading processes.
Functional knowledge of the Chart of Accounts and the allocations process.
Must be able to work independently to identify, troubleshoot and resolve issues prior to their occurrence.
Strong skills across MS word, PowerPoint, Excel, MS Office and other collaboration and unified communication tools.
Should be open to adopt new technologies.
Must have excellent experience in Oracle EPM applications. Good to have prior Finance modules experience.
Good knowledge of ITIL concepts (Incident / Problem / Change / Availability Management)
Should possess good interpersonal and communication skills.
Should have a positive attitude.
Should understand business objectives and organization structure.
The candidate must have strong work ethics, trustworthiness, and self-confidence.
The candidate should work accurately with good attention to detail by maintaining confidentiality and integrity.

Core/Must have skills:

Oracle EPCM/PCM/PCMCS
Data Management
EPM Automate
SQL

Good to have skills:

FCCS, EDMCS
Shell Scripting

Why this role is important to us:

Our technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.

We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company. Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.

About State Street:

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

title: Compliance Officer, Assistant Vice President, Hybrid
description:
Who we are looking for

This Compliance Officer AVP role is based in Ireland will provide compliance advisory support as the second line of defence for the Irish entities providing products and services including the Depositary, Custody, Fund Administration, Transfer Agency, Middle Office and Global Delivery functions of State Street.  The individual will be responsible for assisting in the provision of compliance advice to local management, assessment of applicable compliance risks, engaging in monitoring and testing of activities within the business, monitoring the regulatory developments, liaison with local regulators as well as assisting in the provision of an independent viewpoint on Compliance Risk and escalate material matters.

This role is perfect for someone who is a highly organized and an efficient operator focused on producing top-quality, accurate work, and who is an excellent communicator and collaborator and thrives on building a network of colleagues across different teams and jurisdictions.  This person must be driven and innovative by nature, always seeking to improve and streamline existing processes to find better solutions.  Ideally, this person has experience in compliance, legal or audit function within the Financial Services sector and has worked within the Funds Industry. 

Preferred job location is Kilkenny, hybrid model 2-3 days on site.

Main responsibilities:

Assist and support the Ireland Compliance Advisory team in the assessment of Compliance risks and the successful and timely execution of the Compliance Oversight Program

Prepare, coordinate, and monitor communications with the Central Bank of Ireland, developing and maintaining relationships with the business.

Review and analyse regulatory and advisory activities, risk assessments and assist in the design, oversight and execution of testing activities to ensure a robust and comprehensive monitoring and testing plan

Actively engage with the business unit in relation to their regulatory obligations, fostering an open, co-operative relationship, providing advisory support to assist with regulatory queries, and ensuring closure of any Compliance issues within a timely manner

Keep abreast of regulatory and legislative updates or changes. Contribute to analysis and interpretation of the regulation and legislation (new and current as required). Provide feedback to peers and business stakeholders, as required.

Assist with the preparation of written reports for Senior Management on the Compliance Risk Opinion and delivery of the Compliance Programme, indicating progress achieved and any significant matters requiring attention

Support the Compliance Senior Management through the preparation and review of materials for various governance forums and attendance at these meetings

Engage in and participate with clients during their due diligence reviews.

What we value 

These skills will help you succeed in this role

Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with exceptional attention to detail.

Ability to understand, analyse and summarise complex matters including regulations

Excellent project management skills; ability to manage large, complex projects throughout the project life cycle

Ability to meet challenging deadlines in a dynamic environment, adaptable to change and shifting priorities

Ability to self-manage and realign priorities and deliverables to ensure milestones and targets are achieved

Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish strong partnership with Compliance and business partners locally and globally

Proactive attitude, with strong communication skills

Demonstrated interest in working on global and regional projects

Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint

An effective and relatable “culture of compliance” mentality
 

Education & Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline (e.g. Accounting, Finance, Business, Legal) or relevant professional qualification or experience

Professional designation in Compliance or similar compliance, legal or regulatory qualification an advantage

Minimum 5 years experience in financial services industry, specific experience in a the funds industry in a related field an advantage

Strong IT skills (Outlook, Word and Excel)
 

Additional requirements

The role is classified as a CF2 under the Central Bank of Ireland Fitness and Probity regime (CF2), hence candidates must comply with the relevant requirements regarding fitness and probity.

Are you the right candidate? Yes!

We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don’t necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
