title: Associate Level 1- Client Services
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 06 June 2025

 

Title: Associate             

Department:  Client Services                          

Location: Dublin, Ireland/ Kingswood, Surrey

Reports To: Team Lead

Join us as an 'Associate-Client Services' at Fidelity!

If you enjoy phone conversations with customers, working from a premium location based in Dublin, Ireland and seek a dynamic role, look no further.

Discover an exciting opportunity to be a key player in our thriving Customer Services-Call Center team.

What sets you apart:

Are you confident in your customer service skills?

Are you able to reliably commute to the office?

Strong telephone and interpersonal skills, with a willingness to learn new technologies?

Passionate about finding solutions for customers and contributing positively as a proactive team player?

What sets us apart:

Join our rapidly growing team

Benefit from in person and virtual training including classroom and practical experience

Discover exciting career advancement possibilities for a secure future

About Fidelity International

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. From more than 25 locations around the world, we provide investment services and retirement expertise to everyone from central banks to private individuals and have a reputation as one of the world’s most successful investment solution providers. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Client Services team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

Department overview

Customer expectations are ever growing in complexity and the Client Services department is the most important area of our business for delivering outstanding customer experiences every day.

The vision of the department is to deliver a seamless, joined up experience to our customers and advisers when they want it, however they want it. Our role is to provide our customers and advisers with help, expertise and guidance on a range of queries by building strong relationships to develop trust in our business.

What you’ll do

In our busy phone’s teams, you will be offering first-line support to the direct customers or Financial Advisors and will be responsible for delivering the best customer experience possible. You will be provided with a comprehensive training programme that will enable you to do just that.

As you progress you will become an ambassador for the business - learning how to promote our services to support the business. Throughout this time you will be supported to develop your own knowledge and personal skills against a framework of competencies, where success is rewarded by a series of promotions and pay rises.

Responsibilities:

Handle direct customers or Independent Financial Advisor (IFA’s) interactions through a range of channels, primarily phone and also email and letter - understanding their needs to provide the right solutions to them.

Take ownership of every customer interaction to ensure issues and enquiries are resolved to the satisfaction of the customer and the business.

Explain UK products & services as well as provide guidance on tools and sources of information to empower customers to self-serve.    

Adhere to the call process ensuring application of best practice in call introduction, query identification, resolution and call closure

Acknowledge and manage customer complaints, striving to achieve early resolution where possible.

Quickly and efficiently escalate risk, potential fraud or vulnerable customer situations, ensuring escalation to the appropriate person.

 

Your skills and experience

Must have prior experience of working in a Customer Service industry preferably within a corporate environment

Strong telephone and verbal communication skills

Active listener

Passionate about delivering positive solutions for customers

Experience in using technology platforms to deliver a service and a willingness to learn new technologies.

Proactive team player with a desire to improve knowledge and contribute to positive team dynamics across the department

​

Feel  rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. We’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com

title: Sales Support Senior Manager / Manager / Assistant Manager
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31 July 2025

                                                                                                                     

Title                 Sales Support Senior Manager / Manager / Assistant Manager

Department      HKWS / China Offshore Sales Support

Location          Hong Kong

Reports To       Head of Hong Kong and China Offshore Intermediary Business

Level                Wholesale Sales Support - 6 / 5 / 4

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Sales Support team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team

Hong Kong and China Offshore Intermediary Business is responsible for business development of retail distribution  channels in both HK and China. Main responsibility is to promote FIL solutions, including active funds, ETFs and other investment products across multiple channels such as retail banks, insurance companies, fund platforms, local securities house and virtual platforms. Being a part of the sales team, Sales Support member is responsible for providing overall sales support for the Intermediary Business in Hong Kong and China offshore clients.

About your role 
This role is a sales support function within the Hong Kong Wholesale and China Offshore Business. Reporting to Head of Hong Kong and China Offshore Intermediary Business supporting the day-to-day client enquiries and representing the team in various projects. From career development perspective, our sales support manager may choose to remain their sales support role or may choose to grow and develop his / her career as Sales Manager over time.

About you

Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage the sales material including sales deck, fund perspective, performance update, placemat and competitor analysis, etc.
Manage the client due diligence questionnaire and onboarding questionnaire.
Represent the sales team in various projects including CRM, compliance clearance, corporate action, client communication, and other projects lead by technology team.
Coordinate with internal and external parties to ensure we provide timely and accurate response to client.
Host client meetings on behalf of sales team.

Experience and Qualifications

Experience in asset management industry is a plus.
Solid business communication skills in English and Chinese. Demonstrated ability to communicate and work with all levels of the organization and client organizations.
Proven ability to support team member to meet client expectations.
PC literacy - Excel (Vlookup/Pivot etc), Word, PowerPoint
Relevant knowledge of the rules and regulations governing asset management
The ability to accurately grasp the needs of others and communicate them logically and concisely.
The ability to imagine the purpose beyond the given task and return work with added value.

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: RFP Manager
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 30 June 2025

Title                 RFP Manager

Department    RFP, Asia Pacific ex-Japan

Location          Hong Kong

Reports To      Head of RFP, APAC

Level                5

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team

The Asia Pacific ex- Japan RFP Team is responsible for supporting key sales and marketing efforts across the institutional and wholesale/ intermediary/retail business channels in Australia, Hong Kong, Korea, Taiwan, Australia, China, Singapore, Southeast Asia and Middle East. The team’s main responsibilities include completing detailed Request for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Information (RFIs), Due Diligence Questionnaires (DDQs) and ad-hoc requests. Potential clients request this information in order to evaluate our company, products and services; and ultimately make major investment decisions.It is vital that Fidelity provides our clients with up-to-date, high quality documents which communicate our marketing message clearly and the RFP team members are responsible for project managing and producing these documents.

About your role

The successful candidate will be responsible for providing high quality, tailored responses to information requests which communicate Fidelity’s competitive advantages and product features in a clear and compelling proposal.  This involves crafting new content as well as using existing materials.

The RFP Manager works particularly closely with the Asia Pacific ex-Japan sales teams, client services teams, investment specialists, the RFP content management team and other experts throughout Fidelity. As the role involves sourcing and providing in-depth written answers to questions on a wide variety of topics, this role provides an excellent opportunity to gain an in-depth knowledge of Fidelity’s products and services.  As the role involves sourcing and providing in-depth written answers to questions on a wide variety of topics, this role provides an excellent opportunity to gain an in-depth knowledge of Fidelity’s products and services can be an excellent basis for development towards a future career in sales, client relations, product or investment communications.

Key responsibilities

Collaboratively work with the team and other colleagues within the global organisation
Developing a strong knowledge of the key products and mandates, with a particular focus on private credit and multi asset solutions
Proactively organise workload to meet client and internal deadlines
Confidently liaise with the investment product teams and sales relationship teams to determine client requirements, allocate responsibilities and project manage the entire RFP completion process
Crafting a high-quality document using the RFP database to source standard answers, working on new responses and tailoring all content to the particular proposal requirements
Tracking and monitoring the RFP pipeline of work in progress
Proactively contributing to the ongoing improvement of RFP content team’s processes and systems

About you - Skills and Experience

Minimum of 3 years' experience in writing RFPs or comparable roles (e.g., investment writer, investment marketing) within asset management is essential.
Demonstrated applied knowledge of the investment industry and markets, along with a comprehensive understanding of investment products, portfolios, and the operational dynamics of fund management firms.
Proven ability to work collaboratively as part of a team, sharing responsibilities and providing internal support in alignment with Fidelity’s values.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written, are crucial.
Proficiency in written and spoken English is mandatory.
Highly developed project management and time management skills, coupled with meticulous attention to detail.
A proactive and inquisitive approach to learning is vital for successful development in the role.
Strong sense of accountability and a willingness to take ownership of tasks.
Numerical proficiency, with the ability to interpret and utilise statistical data effectively.
Adaptability to engage with a diverse range of tasks as required.

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: Head of Business Finance, Germany
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 14 June 2025

Job Description

Title                 Head of Business Finance, Germany

Department    Finance

Location          Kronberg

Reports To      CFO, Global Distribution and Client Propositions

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Business Finance team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your role

The purpose of this role is to partner with the Head of the German Business and other senior leaders within the region, to provide high-quality strategic and financial insights, advice and challenge, as well as to assist the CFO, Global Distribution and Client Propositions, in supporting the achievement of the strategy and goals of the business.

Key elements of the role include:

Business partnering with the key senior members of the German Management team.  This will involve the development of a broad understanding of the Fidelity business model and a deep understanding of all aspects of asset management, especially sales, retention, product & propositions development & management, including all financial drivers.
Building credibility through the provision of clearly presented financial information, constructive challenge and valued advice, supporting the goal of delivering real value and influence over decision making within this critical part of the business.
Bringing together the strategic initiatives of the German and Global businesses, ensuring that they are founded in robust financial analysis.
Delivery of business finance services to the business in Germany, including budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, management reporting, business case construction, pricing strategy, governance and support and expense & headcount scrutiny.
Supporting the CFO, Global Distribution and Client Proposition, in building a cohesive, empowered and motivated Business Finance team.

Key Responsibilities

Owning the finance relationship with the Head of Germany including key stakeholders on the Leadership Team and other senior leaders within the organisations.  
Provide financial and strategic insight, guidance and challenge to stakeholders, supporting decision making and the achievement of Germany Distribution objectives and broader strategy.
Act as key point of contact / subject matter expert for strategic priorities and areas of focus
Collaborate closely with Finance colleagues supporting Corporate Enablers, Investment and Operations to ensure decisions are joined up and in the wider interests of the business and FIL. 
Lead the identification of cost savings, efficiencies and productivity enhancing opportunities. 
Assist in the development and maintenance of a sound financial control environment.
Drive continuous improvement of regular MI, automating and standardising with wider group MI where possible. Participate in driving and embedding AI and data-driven solutions where relevant.

About you

Experience of the asset management and platform industry and knowledge of its financial and operational drivers.
Able to command respect from senior stakeholders and peers, comfortable playing a part in senior management discussions.
Ability to lead, influence, challenge, advise and offer alternative perspectives or solutions.
Accomplished communicator, able to present and articulate information concisely and with conviction.
Capable of identifying information requirements and reviewing, designing and improving reporting and other processes.
Strong collaboration and team-working skills, ideally with experience of working in a matrix and international environment.
Ability to develop and enhance the performance of team members, multi-task and prioritise under pressure

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. title: Associate - Pension Operations
description:

Job Type: Permanent

Job Description

                                                                                                

Title                 Associate - Workplace Investing Operation                

Department      Workplace Investing Operations                                                         

Location          Gurgaon

Reports To       Assistant Manager

Level                Grade 1

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Asia Risk team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team

Workplace Investing (WI) Operations supports and maintains pension administration services for a wide range of corporate clients. The nature of the service provided includes full support to pension scheme members at all stages of the administration life cycle through to specialist support to trustees and members for specific task delivery.

DC Implementations team is responsible to process few key critical tasks:

Reconciling and validating data on client files
Raising timely data queries with the clients
Placing blackouts and sending communication to the wider business/admin teams
Placing holds on letters and deletion of CA/Imps group on Pendoc
Releasing Welcome/TVIN packs and reconciliation through Pendoc Log
Form collation for investment choices and reconciling them
Creating member records on our systems
Processing Bulk Sale
IDQ runs
Creating mappings on PV
Placing diviload’s.

The team works on multiple projects simultaneously in a month. Hence, any misses or delay of the above tasks can lead to potential Financial, reputational and regulatory risk.

About your role

Handle additional admin and process related responsibilities efficiently and proactively.

title: Social Marketing- Assistant Manager
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 26 May 2025

Job Description

                                                                                                

Title                 Social Marketing - Assistant Manager

Department      Global Platform Solutions (GPS) Marketing Team

Location          Gurgaon, India

Reports To       Social Media Manager (based in UK) with local support

Level                4

Fidelity are proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. We want people to feel confident and excited about investing with us and our social team plays a critical role in this goal.  If you are you passionate about social media and marketing; you love creating engaging content and campaigns, then we've got an exciting opportunity for you!

About your team

We are an integral part of the digital marketing team who collaborate closely with multiple internal stakeholders and third-party teams. We keep a pulse on social and financial trends and use our creativity and communication skills to engage with prospects and clients wherever they might be.  We are a dynamic and ambitious team who’ll support your development every step of the way.

About your role 
•           We're looking for someone who can help develop engaging and captivating ideas that grab people's attention.The goal is to make investing exciting and the seemingly complex subjects easy to understand.

•           You'll support the creation and delivery of our social media content for our B2C and B2B business units.

•           You'll get to work with platforms like LinkedIn, Meta, YouTube, X and Instagram, and use enterprise-level social media marketing tools (mainly Hootsuite).

•           You'll also be responsible for tracking our social channel performance, reviewing data, creating reports and distributing top-line summaries to key stakeholders.

•           You’ll look to continually improve the performance of social by through test and learn tactics.

•           Effective community management is critical for defending brand reputation and retaining our customers, so you’ll closely monitor and respond to comments or questions coming to us via social.

•           You may also be required to help support our paid media team across paid campaign activity, including ad copy writing and asset creation, proofing campaign set-ups and performance analysis reporting.

•           This is a hybrid role, working 2 days a week in our Gurgaon office (increasing to 3 days a week from September).

About you

•           You’ll be proficient in social media and campaign management from an organic perspective (essential) and a paid perspective (preferred).

•           Experience within the asset management or wider financial services industry (understanding compliance requirements in social media) would naturally be an advantage but not essential.

•           Have familiarity with social media platforms such as LinkedIn, Meta, YouTube, X and Instagram

•           Experience using enterprise-level social media marketing tools for publishing, approval workflows and social listening.

•           Able to manage social media monitoring and community management / crisis management - ensuring best practice and working closely with customer service teams

•           Strong ability to interpret data and use insights to optimise campaigns.

•           Effective relationship management skills with key stakeholders and third-party suppliers.

•           Excellent communication, copywriting, proof-reading, and editing skills, along with the ability to distil information into key messages and prioritise in a fast-paced environment.

•           Experience using design software tools like Canva and/or Photoshop an advantage

•           Video editing also an advantage

•           Knowledge and familiarity of some paid social media activity preferred, including commercial awareness and excellent attention to detail adding any real value.

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. title: Lead - Multi Asset Investment Research
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31 May 2025

Job Description

                                                                                                

Title                 Lead - Multi-Asset Investment Research (SMA)

Department      Global Investment Research - Research Specialist Team

Location          Gurgaon, India

Reports To       Team Lead - Multi-Asset Investment Research

Level                Research Analysis - 5

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Global Investment Research - Research Specialist Team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About the Global team 

Fidelity Solutions & Multi-Asset (SMA) is a global team with assets under management on behalf of retail and institutional clients. The team manages investment strategies across various franchises, including Income, Volatility Managed, Absolute & Total Return, and Risk Rated & Open Architecture, designed to deliver specific outcomes for clients across market cycles. Portfolio Managers at FIL SMA draw on an extensive toolkit for delivering investment objectives, including a large and well-resourced investment research team (comprising Manager Research, Tactical Allocation Research and Quantitative Research), as well as a dedicated Risk & Analytics team and implementation specialists. These resources support investment decision-making across various portfolio construction disciplines, including tactical asset allocation, strategy selection and risk management.

About your team

Multi-Asset Investment Research Specialist team works with the Manager Research Analyst team (mentioned above) in their role of identifying the right strategies that go into the multi asset portfolios to implement the investment views of the SMA team.

This team is a part of the broader Investment Research Specialist team, which provides fundamental research support to all FIL Equity and Credit analysts and select Portfolio Managers.

About your role

The job involves providing comprehensive research support to FIL’s Manager Research Analyst team, including screening funds based on quantitative and qualitive analysis; preparing agendas for fund manager meeting and taking meeting notes; contributing to draft research notes to be published by the Analysts; and streamlining databases which make the research process more efficient and robust.

The role requires a good understanding of passive and active fund management space in at least one asset class, with specific knowledge on Fixed Income being a plus. It also entails expertise in using advanced excel tools in analysing large amounts of data and drawing inferences from the same, in addition to ability and willingness to learn quickly on the job, incorporating any new systems or AI tools that become available. Knowledge of visualization tools and coding skills would be advantageous.

Key Responsibilities

Provide all-round research support to FIL Manager Research Analysts covering a broad universe of funds and fund managers across asset classes - Equities, Fixed Income, Alternative.
Prepare fund screening tools based on performance, risk, style/factor bias, ESG and other fund parameters.
Prepare for and take meeting notes of the Analysts’ meetings with fund managers.
Provide quality data and analysis on Fund’s ESG characteristics.
Provide research inputs and authoring support for the publication of Multi-Asset research notes.
Provide quality data and analysis to make the research process more efficient and robust.
Keep track of emerging risks, and investment opportunities in one or more asset classes assigned.
Keep abreast of significant trends and developments in the global fund management space and current market events.
Build and maintain strong relationships with FIL analysts and within the local team.
Make regular presentations to the team on relevant topics/areas of expertise.

Experience and Qualifications Required

2 to 5 years’ work experience in Fund Research or Manager Research analyst or other similar industry-roles.
Good understanding of passive and active fund management space in at least one asset class, with specific knowledge on Fixed Income being a plus.
Strong systems experience, for e.g. Morningstar, Style Research, FactSet, Bloomberg combined with strong numerical and computer (Excel) skills
Working knowledge of visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc. and coding skills such as Python, will be advantageous.
Analytical / problem solving skills, with a logical thought process - to sort, analyse and creatively interpret large amounts of qualitative and quantitative data. 
High level of attention to detail and accuracy. Strong time management skills and ability to multi task.
Excellent relationship management and strong communication and presentation skills.

Education 

MBA or Master’s in Finance from a prominent institute or CA
CFA charter or progress towards any level of CFA will be preferred

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: Senior Legal Counsel, China AMC
description:
About the Opportunity
Company: FIL Fund Management (China) Company

Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31 October 2025

Job Description

                                                                                                

Title                 Senior Legal Counsel, China AMC 

Department      General Counsel - Legal

Location          Shanghai

About Fidelity International China Business

China is a critical, long-term market for Fidelity International. We have been investing in Mainland Chinese companies for over 20 years and we aim to build a new, modern and digitally-based local asset management firm over the long term.

As a leading global financial institution, Fidelity International is a pioneer in China’s asset management industry. Since 2004, we’ve built up 3 offices in Shanghai, Dalian and Beijing. Currently we are a proud employer of over 1,500 staff in China. In January 2017, Fidelity was the first global asset manager to register with the Asset Management Association of China (AMAC) as a private fund management (PFM) company.

In December 2022, Fidelity International was granted the Permit to Conduct Securities business in China by the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC). With the approval, Fidelity International will be able to commence a wholly-owned mutual fund business in China and serve a wider group of investors in the country with a consistent approach as we operate in every market in the world.

We have been making continuous efforts to introduce our extensive experience in the pension business globally into China. With strategic partnerships with key local players, as well as through our own digital platforms, we strive to conduct effective investor education and share our pension investment expertise to, ultimately, enhance Chinese people’s retirement readiness and financial wellness.

Fidelity International is also keen to play as a critical force driving positive changes for China’s financial industry. We are committed to working closely with the Chinese regulators and partners to foster a robust industry eco-system and supporting China to further grow its influence in the global financial market.

About your role 
This position is designed to provide insight to day-to-day AMC Product, Distribution, Operation and other projects and initiatives, integrating compliance and legal expertise to manage and minimise compliance and legal risks.  You will be a key member of China legal team working closely with your peers to provide excellent legal and compliance support on AMC matters.

You will also participate in advising on China regulatory matters including the CSRC and other relevant regulatory authorities and will support compliance matters where necessary.

You will also work closely with your peers across the AP and global teams. You will work closely with our external legal panel making smart and targeted use of internal and external resources.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a high performing legal team working in a fast-developing Fidelity office guiding our key activities.

About you

Strategic Partner

Leverage legal and compliance expertise to deliver business outcomes and take precautions with the ability to work through influence as well as authority, using a combination of knowledge, reasoning and relationships. Partner and build networks across businesses, levels of management advising the implementation strategy of product related regulatory requirements in China.
Partner with legal peers to handle potential legal disputes.
Follow up on regulatory developments, keep internal stakeholders posted of the latest regulatory changes and provide gap analysis where applicable.
Effectively manage vendor on filings with Administration for Market Regulation etc.
Advise on CSRC, AMAC and other regulations in relation to Fidelity’s activities in China including all products, distribution activities and projects.
Partner with and support compliance team to ensure compliance.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders using a practical and outcome-driven approach to challenges. 
Present complex information in a concise and effective way.
Engage in strategic conversations with consideration for the global and enterprise-wide context of issues and decisions.
Set direction with focus, actively interacting with internal and external stakeholders to understand their needs delivering clear goals and priorities.
Demonstrate a commercial approach and sound legal judgement, analyse and assess situations, identify the inherent legal and compliance risks and ensure the protection of Fidelity and its clients by taking mitigation measures. 

Collaborator

Partner with legal peers to promote a consistent approach and application of standard procedures and practices across legal.
Partner with key internal stakeholders to ensure Fidelity takes an active role in responding to and implementing change in an increasingly complex and demanding regulatory environment.
Partner with general counsel group peers ensure consistent and integrated delivery across general counsel functions for China.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with the external legal panel, industry bodies and associations.

Experience and Qualifications Required

Over 5 years of legal working experience, PRC lawyer qualification is preferred.
Familiar with regulatory requirements in China in relation to mutual fund industry
Great level to details and manage priorities
Strong ownership mindset with business consciousness
Excellent communication and coordination skills
Confident and professional style with clients and regulators
Proficiency in English both in writing and in oral. 
Appreciate cultural difference of working in a multinational firm.

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

About Fidelity International

Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. title: Manager Software Development Data
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31 July 2025

Title                 Manager Software Development Data

Department      Technology German Platform and Advisory

Location          Kronberg Germany

Reports To       Wolfgang Kreß

Level                Manager 5

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Software Development Data Team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team : 

The Team “Software Development Data” develops and supports our data transfers between all of our internal systems as well as interfaces to our clients. We design databases and ETL Jobs, build reports, and maintain a document management solution. We are responsible for the smooth running and system operation and for the 2nd level support.

About your role :


Your objective is organizing our large amount document management (more than 20 million documents p.a.) in a way information can be successfully retrieved for daily requirements integrating business and technical staff.

You will organize service and internal product management and be responsible for a team for the technical implementing, maintaining, operating and monitoring the FFB document management solution.

You play a key role in understanding the needs of our several business stakeholders regarding our document management solution and how to set them up.

You will also manage setting up new document types and destinations as well as implement transfer rules for them. You will manage ad hoc tasks regarding these documents like hiding them or correcting their metadata. You are the contact person of our business for any kind of questions regarding the system and the documents.

We have an in-house built solution for document distribution, which gives you the chance of developing your skills in database development. This solution provides several ways of distribution as well as mapping metadata to the documents, and waits with a lots of tasks for you, like setting up the users, defining their roles and rights, creating several reports for them, and also drive forward the further development of the application.

A technical affinity is required for this. You will work on constant enhancements and improvements of the applications in close cooperation with the business stakeholders, the external software vendors and the hosting service provider.

You will cover the key parts of the software lifecycle, from test preparation, test management and production rollouts to ongoing production support. You will work on projects as well as day-to-day operations.

You will also be responsible for performance testing and application optimization to ensure scalability and resilience to meet FFB's growth ambitions. You manage the underlying hardware, operating system and databases and help keeping them up to date.

About you :

Key Responsibilities :

Technical ownership of document management solution and document distribution solution
Managing the business needs of our stakeholders
Covering the aspects of IT service management (ITSM) and software development lifecycle (SDLC) from testing, software role-out up to ongoing production operation
2nd level support: anaylsis of potential incidents and close collaboration with the external software vendor

Experience and Qualifications Required :

Must have:

At least a bachelor's degree or equivalent in business management or computer science or comparable
At least 6-8 years of experience in software / IT industry or financial industries in development or support functions
Good knowledge of SQL and experience in dealing with relational database systems
Experience in working with operating systems Linux and MS Windows
Motivation to work in agile, cross-functional teams
Ability to communicate effectively in German and English language (both written and oral)
Flexible, open, and innovative
Strong team player
Passion to learn and continuously grow

Preferable Skills are:

Experience with collaboration tools Atlassian JIRA and ServiceNOW

Feel rewarded :

title: Manager IT Governance - Identity and Access Management
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Title                        Manager IT Governance - Identity and Access Management

Department         Technology German Platform and Advisory

Location               Kronberg Germany

Reports To           Teamlead IT Governance

Level                Software Engineer - 5

We share a commitment to making things better for clients and each other. We continually explore new technology and different ways of working to put our clients first. So bring your boldest ideas to our IT Governance Team and feel you’re making progress.

About your team

In this role you will be part of a team looking after all aspects of FFB’s Identity and Access Management. The team helps FFB Business and Technology teams to manage access to applications, they need to fulfill their responsibilities. The team also ensures, that all access provided to individuals is in-line with all regulatory requirements, i.e. strict need-to-know principle, regular access recertification or proper joiner/leaver processes.

The team collaborates with several application teams within FFB as well as with FFB’s software vendors providing applications.

The main day2day aspect of the team is working with the Technical IAM solutions provided by global Fidelity teams, to request, approve and provision access to applications.

The team also works in projects and continuous improvements of the provided IAM solutions (e.g. application onboarding, access provisioning automation). That also includes solutions for privileged access management (PAM).

About your role 

You will work as a team member in the FFB IT Governance Team within the FFB Technology department. Main aspects of your role are:

Help FFB business and Technology teams managing their application access in line with FFB’s regulatory requirements.
Creation and maintenance of authorization concepts for applications including of Segregation of Duties (SoD) requirements
Collaborate with FFBs application teams and external software vendors, providing applications to FFB
Work with the technical IAM and PAM solutions, provided by Fidelity
Implement, run and continuously improve IAM related governance controls

You will report into the IT Governance team lead role.

About you

Eager to grow your knowledge and your career, you’ll fit right in. You’ll succeed because you:

have in depth knowledge of German and international financial service regulation (e.g. MaRisk, BAIT, DORA, …) with a strong focus on Identity Access Management
worked in an oversight role in the financial industry
have robust knowledge about information security best practices including policies, guidelines and standards
have solid knowledge and experience with IT system landscapes (on premise, cloud, networks and APIs) especially regarding security and compliance
have knowledge in MS Office products - especially Access and Excel
have very good analytical and problem resolution skills
are an empathic team player
have strong communication skills across hierarchical levels and teams
are comfortable to communicate effectively in German and English language (both written and oral)

description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 25 July 2025

                                                                                     

Title                     Senior Manager IT Governance - Identity and Access Management

Department         Technology German Platform and Advisory

Location              Kronberg Germany

Reports To          Teamlead IT Governance

Level                Software Engineer - 6

We share a commitment to making things better for clients and each other. We continually explore new technology and different ways of working to put our clients first. So bring your boldest ideas to our IT Governance Team and feel you’re making progress.

About your team

In this role you will lead a team looking after all aspects of FFB’s Identity and Access Management. The team is one part of FFB IT Governance area and helps FFB Business and other Technology teams to manage access to applications, they need to fulfill their responsibilities. The team also ensures, that all access provided to individuals is in-line with all regulatory requirements, i.e. strict need-to-know principle, regular access recertification or proper joiner/leaver processes.

The team collaborates with several application teams within FFB as well as with FFB’s software vendors providing applications.

The main day2day aspect of the team is working with the Technical IAM solutions provided by global Fidelity teams, to request, approve and provision access to applications.

The team also works in projects and continuous improvements of the provided IAM solutions (e.g. application onboarding, access provisioning automation). That also includes solutions for privileged access management (PAM).

About your role 

You will work as a team manager in the FFB IT Governance Team within the FFB Technology department. Main aspects of your role are:

Lead and guide your team in all aspects of the day2day work including hands on work on the team’s responsibilities.
Organize and optimize the operating model and ensure the team’s ability to deliver against the expectations, set by FFBs policies and procedures for the IAM/PAM area
Develop the team and it’s individual members regarding their technical and personal skills
Help FFB business and Technology teams managing their application access in line with FFB’s regulatory requirements.
Creation and maintenance of authorization concepts for applications including of Segregation of Duties (SoD) requirements
Collaborate with FFBs application teams and external software vendors, providing applications to FFB
Participate in projects to ensure proper IAM/PAM coverage for new or changed applications in FFB’s technology stack
Implement, run and continuously improve IAM related governance controls

You will report into the IT Governance team lead role.

About you

Eager to grow your knowledge and your career, you’ll fit right in. You’ll succeed because you:

are passionate in heading up teams and enable them to develop and grow
are an empathic team player
have in depth knowledge of German and international financial service regulation (e.g. MaRisk, BAIT, DORA, …) with a strong focus on IAM and PAM
worked in an oversight role in the financial industry (2nd or 1st Line of Defense)
have robust knowledge about information security best practices including policies, guidelines and standards
have experience with common IAM / PAM solutions (i.e. SailPoint, Savient CyberArk, …)
have solid knowledge and experience with IT system landscapes (on premise, cloud, networks and APIs) especially regarding security and compliance
have very good analytical and problem resolution skills
have strong communication skills across hierarchical levels and teams
have excellent language skills in German and English language (both written and oral)

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: Wholesale Sales Senior Manager
description:

Job Description

                                                                                                

Title                 Wholesale Sales, Senior Manager

Department      Fund Promotion Team, Wholesale Sales

Location          Tokyo

Reports To       Head of Fund Promotion

Level                Level 6

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Fund Promotion team / Wholesale Sales and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team

Wholesale Sales is a core department in the Sales division. The division is responsible for establishing and growing profitable business with third party distributors such as banks, securities companies, and domestic asset management companies. Wholesale Sales department is responsible for the following.

Plan and promote sales activities for the Wholesale clients - banks, brokers and domestic asset management companies. Acquire and support the clients for domestic sales of both Japanese and foreign mutual funds established and managed by Fidelity International Japan (FIJ) and Fidelity’s overseas group companies. Plan and promote sub-advisory business for asset management companies.

About your role 
This is a critical role within the Wholesale Sales Department, managing our core accounts, building relationships with, sales promotion of our funds with both new and existing clients. Sales promotion to clients includes a broad variety of activities ranging from identifying opportunities to delivery of in-depth fund and investment presentations to various divisions of our clients. The role also includes meeting day-to-day servicing and fund promotion activities of these clients.

Key Responsibilities

Conduct sales activities and build deep relationships with branches of mutual fund distributors, especially major securities firms.
Promote and cover exist and new products to our client’s Sales organization and Branches.
Build and keep personal and trusting relationships with our focus clients such as large Broker-dealers, Trust Banks, Mega Banks.
Plan and execute mass marketing plan to non-focus clients such as Regional Banks.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge of products and financial market.
Maintains in-depth knowledge of marketplace and competitive landscape.
Closely work with Marketing, Product Specialists, Client Services, and other internal stakeholders including overseas offices to meet client’s need and help generate business.
Ensures that the Wholesale investment products and services make Fidelity a strong competitive market position and leverage Fidelity’s worldwide resources and experience to build a first-class Wholesale business in Japan.
Co-work with other team members for both relationship management and fund promotion.

About you

Experience

- 10+ years of Sales experience in Asset Management industry or related industry and have strong relationships with distributors.

- 5+ years of experience in a product-related role in the financial service industry is a plus

Technical skills and knowledge

- Expertise in investment strategies and financial instruments including equities, fixed income, and FX

- Extensive knowledge of investment management business in Japan

Competencies

- Self-starter who is result-oriented and self-motivated

- Ability to take a logical approach to problem solving, determine appropriate priorities, and therefore leading to the best solution.

- Enthusiastic and flexible attitude with experience working on a wide range of fields - role

- Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a flexible and proactive approach to resolving conflicts and overcoming problems

- Good working verbal and written communication skills in English preferred

Qualifications

- CFA, CMA, or CAIA preferred

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. title: Cyber Defense Operations - Technical Specialist
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31 October 2025

Job Description

Title                  Technical Specialist

Department      FIL – Cyber Defence Operations

Location           Dalian Office

Reports To       Senior Technical Consultant - CDO

Level                4

We share a commitment to making things better for clients and each other. We continually explore new technology and different ways of working to put our clients first. So, bring your boldest ideas to our Cyber Defense Operations team and feel like you’re making progress.

About your team

Technology function across FIL is responsible for all global aspects of Technology, Digital, Cybersecurity, and Innovation. Fidelity is a value-driven, customer-obsessed organization and in Technology we are fortunate to play a direct role in helping our clients with one of the most important aspects of their lives – their financial well-being.

Within the Technology function is our Global Cyber & Information Security (GCIS) that operates enterprise security services and controls. These are designed to mitigate Cyber and Information Security risks ensuring that Fidelity's business operates securely. The Technical Cybersecurity teams monitor both the internal and external threat environment, responding to security alerts and events in close to real time, as well as providing security assurance and access management services across the enterprise technology and business environment. Our global innovative Cyber Defence Operations team sits within GCIS and provides proactive, cutting-edge solutions to protect clients’ digital assets and infrastructure against evolving cyber threats.

The Technical Specialist (L3) within our SOC team focuses on safeguarding and defending FIL from Cyber threats using a multitude of tools at your disposal. You will be working with a high performing global team in responding to security events and progressing them using internal processes.

About your role 
The L3 SOC Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting the Cyber Defense Operations team by timely response to our security alerts that needs in-depth investigations, supporting junior analysts with their analysis and escalations. You will also be responsible to work within our CIRT team to lead and assist Cyber Incidents, or when CIRT is engaged by Major Incidents team. Your wealth of information and experience using solutions like SIEM, SOAR, IDS/IPS, E/XDR, Email security should enable you to excel in this role during investigations. Your experience in Incident Handling and Process development should help you deliver tasks of Incident handling and stakeholder management, development of new playbooks and processes for detection use-cases and keep them updated to align with the changing cyber landscape. You will be at the forefront of developing new detection use-cases in the SIEM to mature the team’s capability to detect threats. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving excellence and innovation across the team and challenge the current setup and process to enhance our Cyber Defences.

About you

Key Responsibilities

Lead and coordinate the investigation and response to escalated alerts and ensure in-depth technical analysis is conducted. 
Monitor security alerts and logs to identify and counteract potential security threats.
Coordinate and lead high-level security incidents in our CIRT team, ensuring effective communication with all stakeholders.
Utilize tools such as Microsoft Defender, Azure Sentinel, and ServiceNow to monitor, analyse, and manage security events.
Develop new detection use-cases to mature our monitoring and detection landscape, and regular review of production use-cases to curb false positive alerting. 
Contribute to developing and maintaining incident response strategies and update processes, playbooks to align with evolving cybersecurity landscapes.
Mentor and oversee junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.
Conduct post-incident analysis and present detailed reports to executive management, recommending improvements to security policies and procedures.
Participate in a rotational on-call support to support our 24x7x365 operations. 
Participate in the design and implementation of new security tools and technologies.
Generate comprehensive reports on incident findings and response actions for senior management.

Experience and Skills Required

A minimum of 5 years of experience in a SOC environment, preferably in Financial Services, with at least 2 years in an L2/L3 position. 
Proficient in security solutions like SIEM (Sentinel), intrusion detection/prevention systems, EDR/XDR (Defender), SOAR, and ticketing solution like ServiceNow, etc.
Proven track record of managing security incidents and working with technical and non-technical stakeholders, with timely delivery of updates and tasks assigned by Incident Manager.
Experience in network flow and traffic analysis to identify C2 and apply preventative controls to defend.
Ability to investigate and navigate through complex investigations and leveraging solutions like Sandbox, CyberChef, etc. to identify the end payload and mitigating it.
Relevant professional certifications like SC-200, CEH, SCS-C02, GCIH, GCIA, etc. are beneficial.
Experience developing and fine-tuning Detection use-cases using KQL and possess Innovative Mindset to challenge current processes.
Employ excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to articulate security concepts, present findings, and engage with diverse stakeholders, including technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrate adaptability to evolving security landscapes, staying updated on industry trends, and proactively integrating new technologies and methodologies into security tooling strategies.
Programming experience (PowerShell, Bash, Python, JavaScript) to analyse and investigate potentially malicious scripts on both Windows and Linux systems.
Previous experience of Threat Hunting will be beneficial.
Experience in Cloud environments would be desirable.
Understanding of modern security attack techniques and how best to detect them.

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: Business Architect - ISS
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Fixed Term Contractor

Contract duration : 11 months.

Application Deadline: 31 July 2025

                                                                                                                    

Title                 Business Architect - ISS

Department      Technology and Enterprise Services

Location          London

Reports To       Business Architect - ISS

Level                Up to 8

We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Business Architecture team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.

About your team

Investment Services and Solutions is one of the main business pillars and investment areas within Fidelity. It is going through a phase of rapid and substantial transformation of its business model as well as the Technology estate.

The Business Architecture team enable Fidelity’s strategic outcomes by collaborating with stakeholders to drive scalable, impactful transformation. The team works throughout the asset management life-cycle, leading and supporting on a range of initiatives.

The team provide strategic solutions across:

Business Architecture: “the blueprint of our organisation”
Strategy Definition: “what do we want to achieve”
Operating Model Design: “the designs to deliver on the strategy”
Delivery: “translating the ideas into delivery”

About your role 
This role plays a crucial part in the development of and delivery of our strategy. In this role you will:

Understand and be able to describe different Investment Management Operating Models
Assess different operating models and support stakeholders in understanding pros / cons, and drive towards decision making
Provide a view of how functions operate, enabling effective decision-making and strategically align, accelerate and de-risk change to our operating model
Advise on challenges, gaps and areas of opportunity
Develop and maintain a toolkit of methodologies and templates for business architecture and operating model design
Independently own design problems, front to back without support, engaging stakeholders, BAs, Technology Architects to achieve the required outcomes
Develop vision statements and guiding principles to ensure clarity on the end goal
Able to quickly understand and document problem statements
Design organisational structures, roles and responsibilities and ways of working
Define governance structures and frameworks 
Design location strategies, and models such as decentralized vs centralized, in-sourced vs outsourced
Design new and enhance existing business capabilities
Outline how various functions interact and how services are delivered
Collaborate with colleagues in architecture to define the technology architecture and data services
Provide design governance, and oversight of TOM implementation activities
Shape, influence and play a leading role in complex strategic initiatives
Advisory on the Change portfolio, and creation of high-level plans / roadmaps
Strategic design oversight and advisory to the Steering Committee for projects / programmes

About you

You will be able to demonstrate that you have:

Led the development of business architectures and operating models
Extensive experience in the asset management across Investment Management, Operations and Distribution business
Strong communication skills with different types and levels of stakeholders, including C suite,  both internal and external.
Proven ability to develop and execute enterprise-wide change strategies, incorporating business and technology perspectives
Effective leadership skills including negotiation, conflict resolution, influencing, bridge-building and political astuteness as well as the ability to motivate and inspire others
A good understanding of financial markets, products and organisations

Feel rewarded

For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

We help our clients invest for the future and to live the lives they want to lead.   It’s a responsibility we take seriously, and it inspires us to do the right thing, not just for our clients, but for each other and the world around us too. So, join our Investment Management Operations team and feel proud of the work you’re part of.

About your team

Portfolio Services Group, Multi Asset (MA PSG), is a London based team within the Investment Management Operations Department.   The team works closely with other PSG teams and Multi Asset Investment Professionals in London and Hong Kong.

About your role 

The Multi Asset portfolio managers and the global trading capability are supported by teams of MA PSG Analysts in London and Hong Kong. The function improves capacity of the portfolio managers and increases the control, scale, efficiency and consistency of the investment process. The team actively contributes and implements ideas for improving and re-designing the investment process and trade flows, and often represents the Multi Asset Investment Management function to other areas of the business.

Ensuring compliance with all applicable statutory requirements

The successful candidate should have experience of supporting investment professionals.  They should have a broad understanding of Multi Asset products, how portfolios are constructed, and how trade ideas are implemented with relevant Operational and Compliance control. 

Experience within a Multi Asset Portfolio Management support function, back office operations or fund administration

Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation.

title: Treasury Legal Entity Management, Inter-affiliate Funding - Vice President
location_raw:
locations
New York, New York, United States of America
location_parsed: New York, New York, United States of America
description:
We offer:
- Work in the Finance department of one of the world's top tier Financial Institutions and gain first-hand insight of our business
- A desirable compensation and benefits package including eligibility for an annual bonus
- Professional development opportunities including access to Morgan Stanley's world-class internal trainings
- Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement
- A supportive and vibrant diverse environment, we are inclusive of individual backgrounds and leverage them to foster our work environment and culture

You will:
- Lead the management of inter-affiliate funding for Corporate Treasury by managing and optimizing the flow of funds between MS affiliates, supporting treasury functions and transfer pricing arrangements
- Monitor and analyze intercompany balances and transactions
- Govern new funding requests and special funding arrangements
- Oversee processes for reviewing limits covering lending between affiliates
- Centrally manage the process to obtain bespoke funding agreements, as needed
- Lead the Intercompany Funding Working Group.
- Manage intercompany loan agreements and adherence to local regulatory requirements
- Analyze legal entity balance sheets to evaluate need for changes in the funding profile
- Manage Intercompany Funding platform tools by working with Technology
- Own transformation projects related to renovation of platforms used by Interaffiliate Funding by working across functions

Team Profile:
Corporate Treasury provides corporate finance advisory service to senior management and internal business units. It also optimizes the Firm's liquidity and capital base, manages the Firm's foreign exchange and interest rate exposure, and coordinates relationships with regulators, rating agencies, and creditors.

About us:
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow.

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals

You have:
- Bachelor's degree
- Multi-year experience in strategic planning, strategy execution, management consulting, investment banking, sales & trading, corporate treasury or a similar role
- Strong understanding of business strategy, project management, and change management principles
- A foundation in finance, accounting, or capital markets; Experience with balance sheets and financial impact analysis, Derivatives experience is of particular interest
- Excellent analytical capabilities and problem-solving skills, including the ability to summarize complex business problems and detailed analysis with clarity and brevity
- Proven ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders using your strong written and verbal communication skills
- A strong motivation to be accountable for your work and deliver positive results by leveraging your organization and time management skills
- Worked in a high-paced environment and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
- Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products
- Diversity of thought
- Experience in coaching junior talent

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY: 

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 89 years. Our values - putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back - aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day to do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you’ll find an opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest, in an environment where you are supported and empowered. Our teams are relentless collaborators and creative thinkers, fueled by their diverse backgrounds and experiences. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. There’s also ample opportunity to move about the business for those who show passion and grit in their work.

Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $120,000 and $200,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

title: Model Risk Management Analyst, Valuation Models
description:
We’re seeking someone to join our team as a Model Risk Management Analyst, Valuation Models. Are you interested in how mathematical models help the business? What could be the risks when we use these models in the financial industry? You will gain insight into global model risk management.


In the Firm Risk Management division, we advise businesses across the Firm on risk mitigation strategies, develop tools to analyze and monitor risks and lead key regulatory initiatives. The Model Risk Management group is part of the Global Firm Risk Management (FRM) department of Morgan Stanley and it has global responsibility for the independent risk control, review and validation of models used by Morgan Stanley. These include pricing models for derivatives in all asset classes, as well as models used for counterparty credit risk (CVA), market risk, credit risk, operational risk, wealth management products, and capital and liquidity stress tests. In addition to traditional methodologies, MRM also reviews AI and ML models, and GenAI solutions. MRM professionals in New York, London, Budapest, Frankfurt, Mumbai and Tokyo work closely with business capital, risk analytics, risk managers and financial controllers. The Budapest team works closely with other members of the Model Risk Management group on model issues across all asset classes globally.

Since 1935, Morgan Stanley is known as a global leader in financial services, always evolving and innovating to better serve our clients and our communities in more than 40 countries around the world.


What you'll do in the role:

Work as part of a global team of model risk professionals to understand sophisticated mathematical models used by the business for valuation and risk management

Work closely with model developers, market risk managers and valuation controllers, to understand not only the models but also the business context in which they need to perform well

Continuously challenge the models with a forward looking, “what could go wrong” mindset

Review, test, challenge and independently implement valuation models

Conduct on-demand analyses of model performance

Produce and maintain written model review reports


What you'll bring to the role:

Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Mathematics, Mathematical Finance, Physics, Engineering, Finance, Economics or a related quantitative field

0-5 years of experience with quantitative models, preferably in financial derivative pricing models

Genuine and broad interest in financial markets and derivatives; internal drive to effectively challenge and improve models with a quantitative and practical mindset

Clear thinking, good business sense and judgment, proactive and collaborative attitude

Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Interest or experience with programming in a high-level language such as Python is a plus


What you can expect from Morgan Stanely:

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 89 years. Our values - putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back - aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day to do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you’ll find an opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest, in an environment where you are supported and empowered. Our teams are relentless collaborators and creative thinkers, fueled by their diverse backgrounds and experiences. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. There’s also ample opportunity to move about the business for those who show passion and grit in their work.

Budapest Morgan Stanley Budapest is an integral part of the Firm’s global business functions including Technology, Finance, Risk, Institutional Securities and Wealth Management. Morgan Stanley has been rooted in the Budapest community since 2006 and is considered a leading employer among the area’s highly skilled talent. Our innovative team delivers deep technical and mathematical expertise to support the Firm’s capabilities in quantitative analysis, data analysis, and risk management. Learn more about our unmatched culture in Morgan Stanley Budapest.

title: Client Service Associate
description:
Client Service Associates provide exceptional service to our clients and support Financial Advisor(s) (FAs)/ Private Wealth Advisor(s) (PWAs)/ teams on a daily basis. Through regular interactions with clients, individuals in this role build trusted relationships. Leading with a client first mindset, a successful candidate for this role will have strong interpersonal skills and will be able to assist clients with their everyday needs.

DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:

CLIENT SUPPORT

Provide service coverage for a FA/PWA/team including:

Supporting the FA/PWA/team in cultivating and enhancing new and existing client relationships
Executing money movement transactions at the request of the client and/or FA/PWA
Answering general non-investment related questions concerning client accounts, including relaying stock positions and providing account balances (e.g., funds due and margin debit)
Enter profile information or pre-fill account documentation on client accounts and/or documents in a clerical capacity at the direction of the client and/or FA/PWA
Educating or enrolling clients in digital tools (e.g. MSOnline, eSign, eAuthorization)
Supporting the FAs/PWAs/teams’ marketing strategy (e.g., website maintenance)
Assist FAs/PWAs/teams in delivering against their business plan and client service model
Remaining current on all policies, procedures and new platforms
Participating in firm initiatives (e.g., training or education programs) , special projects and/or other duties directed by local management

ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT: 

Answering inbound phone calls or making outbound calls (e.g., scheduling follow-up calls with FAs/PWAs/teams as needed)
Managing the calendar including coordinating meetings or events with logistics such as material prep (e.g., maintaining agendas, sending calendar invites with Zoom credentials)
Maintaining travel itineraries, preparing expense reports and managing the reimbursement process
Assisting with general in-office support functions such as copying, filing and scanning documentation
Preparing and submitting expense reports for processing at the direction of the FA/PWA


EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, and SKILLS:

High School Diploma/Equivalency
College degree preferred
Industry experience is a plus
Willingness to obtain Series 7 (GS), and Series 66 (AG/RA) or Series 63 (AG) and Series 65 (RA)

Knowledge/Skills 

Detail orientated with superior organizational skills and ability to prioritize
Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)
Exceptional writing, interpersonal and client service skills
Strong time management skills
Team player with the ability to collaborate with others
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment
Adaptable and ability to multi-task
Goal oriented, self-motivated and results driven

Reports to: 

Business Service Officer
