Interaction with senior Finance, Risk, and Trading Stakeholders as well as a Regulator focus.  You should be able to clearly communicate highly detailed issues, process, and results to senior stakeholders, business, control partners, regulators and internal/external auditors.  Will be able to develop and guide an independent, but constructive, relationship with business and control partners

You will possess excellent technical knowledge of financial markets and products within multiple markets sectors that should be complemented with deep quantitative experience necessary to critically evaluate the results of control procedures applied

Valuation Specialists possess broad knowledge of financial markets, products, and quantitative theory

What we are looking for:

Previous large, complex financial services organization experiences performing valuation control / risk management / model development with technical Vanilla and Exotics Interest Rates Derivatives expertise

Proven management skills with evidence of supporting and developing quantitative resources.

Positive team leading skills required; ability to drive strategic vision, as well as develop and implement new governance and control frameworks

Professional communication skills with ability to communicate complex issues in a simple manner

Programming skills with ability to design, develop and automate

Prior experience influencing and collaborating with stakeholders across functions/divisions.

Experience of regulatory and senior management interaction

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Job Description:

Job Title: CFO Data Management - Controls Analyst

Corporate Title:  Vice President

Location:  Chester

Company Overview:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth.  This includes our commitment to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, attracting and developing exceptional talent, supporting our teammates’ physical, emotional, and financial wellness, recognizing and rewarding performance, and how we make an impact in the communities we serve.

At Bank of America, you can build a successful career with opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact.  Join us!

Location Overview:

Find us in the city of Chester, a destination renowned for its culture, history, and beauty. Working at Bank of America Chester offers a far-reaching global career for a world-renowned organisation, whilst being ideally situated against the backdrop of the rolling North Wales hills and the banks of the serene River Dee.

The Team:

CFO Data Management (CFO DM) is responsible for ensuring data is timely, accurate and complete with respect to Bank of America’s Treasury Function’s needs and use cases. This role forms part of the Treasury Data Management Controls Team.

The CFO DM Controls Team is a horizontal function with three key areas of focus: execution of daily and monthly data quality controls, manual adjustments to address data issues and month end reconciliations to ensure complete and accurate data to downstream data consumers accountable for the adherence to regulatory mandates. The role will have responsibility for the month end reconciliations for GRIFFIN including expanding coverage to include Merrill Lynch International, presenting month end results to stakeholders in GRR and GFC, driving root cause analysis for breaks and remediation of these.

Role Description:

The role will have responsibility for the month end reconciliations between GRIFFIN (EMEA Regulatory reporting platform) and the general ledger.  The reconciliation will cover the following entities/branches: BofASE, BofAE DAC, BANA London and MLI.  

Responsibilities:

Expanding legal entity coverage to include a month end reconciliation for Merrill Lynch International

Supervising the reconciliation team who are based in India

Presenting month end reconciliation results to stakeholders including EMEA GRR, legal entity CFOs, and other key stakeholders

Driving root cause analysis for month end breaks collaborating with CFO DM Product SMEs, GBAM Finance and business partners on data needs, upstream data sourcing, and remediation

Coordination of escalation to address exceptions, threshold breaches and data quality/data gap remediation.

Work with CFO DM GRIFFIN controls team to improve/remediate manual adjustments for data gaps identified by the reconciliation process

Engage and build relationships with business and technical stakeholders at varied levels to align on key objectives and provide data control oversight and proactively escalate and mitigate risk. Ensure adherence to applicable policies.

Operational Excellence – enhance CFO DM processes through identification and analysis of processes and own the delivery of solution(s).

Develop a strong knowledge of CFO DM Controls processes and how they link to stakeholder (GRR) daily/monthly reporting.

Ensure processes, procedures and routines are well documented and followed consistently.

Support Audit and Regulatory requests.

What we are looking for:

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills

Attention to detail and an ability to “connect the dots”

Advanced Microsoft Office

Capacity to handle multiple tasks and work in a flexible environment

Ability to think and act independently, detailed oriented and organized;

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to build relationships across a matrixed organization.

Time management and ability to meet SLAs and deadlines

Skills that will help:

•              Knowledge and prior experience with Regulatory Reporting

•              SQL experience querying large sets of data

•              Basic knowledge of Tableau and/or Alteryx

•              Product knowledge and experience of end to end trade bookings

•              Data Management experience

Partner with colleagues across the bank to investigate and resolve accounting issues

Validate our reporting to external regulators

Why Join Global Markets Finance in Chester?

Industry Experience – Practically apply accounting skillsets within a dynamic industry and fast paced environment.

Market Insight – Develop an understanding of the structure of global markets and their impact on our daily trading flows.

Data Driven Approach - Learn to develop with Emerging Technology tools that provide cutting edge insight into the data that drives our business.

A genuine interest in our business and intellectual curiosity

Proactive and strong attention to detail, with strong organisational skills to effectively manage competing deadlines and pro-active management escalation

Qualified/part qualified accountant (ACCA, ACA, CIMA or equivalent)

Rich and varied experiences from a range of backgrounds

Advanced Excel skills

title: KYC CDD Operations Analyst – Anti-Money Laundering
description:
Job Description:

Job Title: KYC CDD Operations Analyst – Anti-Money Laundering

Corporate Title: Assistant Vice President 

Location: Dublin

Company Overview: 

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities, and shareholders every day.

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being an inclusive workplace with opportunity for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.

At Bank of America we focus on our teammates career as a priority, with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Location: Dublin

Find us at our Central Park office, Leopardstown, where you will find our state-of-the-art facilities based in Dublin’s premium business park. With an onsite gym, staff restaurant and coffee shop, all your daily needs are conveniently catered for. There are also a range of travel options available to staff, including the LUAS network and the Central Park shuttle service between Dublin City Centre and Central Park, which means getting to work has never been so easy.

Role Description:

The EMEA Anti Money Laundering Know Your Customer/Client Due Diligence (AML KYC/CDD) Operations team is part of the Global Operations organization and is responsible for the end-to-end client AML KYC globally. The team supports the Global Markets (GM) and Global Corporate & Investment Banking (GCIB) businesses in completing KYC/CDD checks as well as maintaining client records. We are looking to build out a wider team with this recruitment drive. We have multiple roles available.

The associate will join a dynamic team and will be responsible for the completion of the AML KYC/CDD operational process on assigned clients and will become a technical expert in KYC/CDD procedures. The environment is constantly changing as new procedures & initiatives are implemented and there will be the opportunity for the associate to contribute towards these exciting changes. As a technical AML KYC / CDD expert, the associate will work complex cases and will also help guide less experienced associates in resolving operational queries.

Responsibilities:

You will conduct client due diligence and enhanced due diligence in accordance with internal policies, procedures and regulatory guidelines aligned to jurisdictions and/or client structures.
You will conduct the KYC / CDD checks on clients that are part of the standard cycles or outside of the standard cycles due to a change in client or jurisdictional requirements.
You will Liaise with sales/ client outreach teams to obtain and validate correct documentation to fulfil requirements.
You will perform client refresh/remediation through the review of client documentation, vendor databases and data entered into proprietary systems to ensure all requirements are met
You will participate in internal/external Audits and Quality checks      

What we are looking for:

You will have Anti Money Laundering, Know Your Customer/Client Due Diligence experience

You will have experience performing in a process-oriented production environment that changes periodically

You will have the ability to organise work, prioritise tasks and handle multiple assignments simultaneously

Additional Skills:

Excellent verbal and written communications skills

Familiar with MS Office Suite (Excel/Word/Outlook/Access)

Thrives in a collaborative team environment

description:
Job Description:

Job Title: EMEA Leasing Operations Consultant 

Corporate Title: Up to VP

Location:  Bromley

Company Overview: 

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities, and shareholders every day. 

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being. 

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization. 

Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Location Overview:

Join our bustling Bromley office, situated in one of London’s greenest boroughs. Here you’ll find plentiful and easy commuting routes, with central London just 15 minutes away by train.

Role Description:

This job is responsible for resolving day-to-day complex problems, researching, and executing on complex transactions for multiple sites or larger business unit(s). Key responsibilities include leading the design, development, and implementation of products, systems, processes, and services using discretion within the project management methodologies, with a focus on continuous improvement.

The Team:

The EMEA Leasing Operations team consists of 16 Leasing professionals supporting Bank of America’s Asset finance business across EMEA. The Leasing business has grown substantially over the last 5 years. The team processes around 700 new deals, around 10,000 billing events and 35,000 cash items a year.

Responsibilities:

The fulfilment team responsibilities commence once a Lease or Loan transaction is approved by Credit. The team has responsibility for:

Leads the design, development, and implementation of complex products, systems, and services in an operations environment using subject matter expertise
Manages projects and direct activities of a team related to special initiatives
Advises as a technical expert in assigned area by providing work direction, guidance, and training to employees and business partners on new complex initiatives
Builds relationships with business partners across various Lines of Business
Manages and defines responsibilities and accountabilities for key program and projects
Supporting our Direct and Indirect vendor sales platforms
Ensuring the deal is correctly documented and is in line with business approvals.

title: VP, Corporate Banker, Germany / Austria
description:
Job Description:

Company Overview:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.

Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

The Team:

You will be joining the Germany & Austria Corporate Banking Team based in Frankfurt which is covering corporate clients headquartered in Germany and Austria focusing on both publicly listed and private large cap and large mid cap companies. We are looking to grow our team in Frankfurt.

Role Description:

Due to expansion in Frankfurt we are looking for a Corporate Banking Vice President to join the team.  In addition to project execution and secondary client relationship coverage, you will be responsible for developing tactical plans to the targeted new client groups. Together with a senior banker handling all aspects of major client relationships including advice, direction, coordination, and execution of various transactions.

Responsibilities:

Primary focus will be to lead new client origination efforts, especially in the large Mid Cap corporate segment in Germany and Austria

Together with a senior banker build and manage these new client relationships on a day-to-day basis and act as the secondary client manager for them

Drive client planning routines (Portfolio Assessment Meetings, Product Partner Meetings, Client Team Meetings) to increase client penetration across the BofA product suite

Deliver presentations and advice to clients

Manage multi-product origination efforts within the integrated coverage model and ensure internal partnerships are seamless and efficient to the client

You will manage and develop direct resources and activities across the global franchise in order to deliver the Bank’s products and services to the client

Lead and coordinate groups of bankers that focus in Corporate Banking across the regions to cater to client’s global subsidiary needs

Demonstrate deep market knowledge of Corporate Banking including the Bank’s full product suite and apply this knowledge by generating beneficial ideas for clients, thinking strategically and forecasting client needs

Demonstrate and maintain appropriate detailed sector, regional and technical knowledge

Responsible for ensuring the Bank’s activities are conducted in a compliant and risk free manner

What we are looking for:

Prior experience and client access in the large Mid Cap corporate segment in Germany and Austria

You will possess excellent client relationships, marketing, presentation and sales skills

Self-motivated, tenacious and able to work with high degree of independence

Ability to effectively interact with and the ability to work and communicate effectively with the immediate team, product partners and ultimately bank clients

Creativity, problem solving skills, flexibility in approach and the ability to work with members of multiple product groups at the same time

Ability to analyse complex client financial objectives, accounting or tax issues and alternative solutions or approaches

You will have the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously & working effectively as an individual & as part of a team

Fluency in German (both written and verbal)

The Team:

FICC Business Finance & Control forms part of the GBAM CFO Group and is a control and business advisory function to the business. The team’s work primarily covers P&L, balance sheet and valuation controls with a dynamic book of work providing opportunities to make improvements to our work through varied project work. This role is supporting the EMEA Credit business, which is primarily market making in Credit Products such as CDS, Bonds and CDS Index within the EMEA and CEEMEA regions. This team works closely with the trading desk, the global valuations group (GVG), market risk, legal entity controllers and many other support functions.

The team is also encouraged to take part in employee engagement and diversity and inclusion initiatives to help continue to make Bank of America a great place to work.

The Role:

A member of the EMEA Credit BFC team within Chester covering Financial control, P&L and balance sheet controls, valuation controls and regulatory and audit interactions

Performing the calculation and analysis of valuation controls including IPV, valuation adjustments and prudent valuation adjustments, as well as ownership for quarterly disclosures.

Working with the GVG group to ensure ongoing review & enhancement of valuation control methodologies and practices. Ensuring procedure documents are accurate and up to date

Assisting in the streamlining and enhancement of all BFC processes and becoming actively involved  with system development ranging from technical enhancements and new product releases to automation of existing processes

Engaging with the Accounting Policy Group to implement appropriate accounting policies and procedures

Contributing to governance process, and support of other internal control process, including SOX

 What we look for?

Preferably Qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA or equivalent) or CFA with good working knowledge of accounting concepts

Experience within a similar role, ideally from financial services / banking

Good working knowledge of accounting concepts

Confident Excel skills

title: Senior Tax Advisor
description:
Job Description:

Job Title: EMEA Corporate Tax - Senior Tax Advisor

Corporate Title:  Director

Location:  Chester

Company Overview:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth.  This includes our commitment to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, attracting and developing exceptional talent, supporting our teammates’ physical, emotional, and financial wellness, recognizing and rewarding performance, and how we make an impact in the communities we serve.

At Bank of America, you can build a successful career with opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact.  Join us!

Location Overview:

Find us in the city of Chester, a destination renowned for its culture, history, and beauty. Working at Bank of America Chester offers a far-reaching global career for a world-renowned organisation, whilst being ideally situated against the backdrop of the rolling North Wales hills and the banks of the serene River Dee.

The Team:

The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Group is responsible for the overall financial management of our company. This includes accounting, financial, and regulatory reporting, balance sheet management, financial planning and analysis, treasury, investor relations, corporate investments and tax.

Global Financial Control (GFC) is responsible for managing and executing consolidated financial and legal entity reporting; interpreting and applying accounting policy and standards; overseeing financial controls and operational risk assessments; managing and maintaining financial data and systems; managing general ledger and sub‐ledger accounting; and supporting tax activities.  In short, our focus in GFC is to get the numbers right and to work in support of the company’s goals, most importantly responsible growth.

EMEA Corporate Tax manages tax risk for the enterprise, determines tax strategy, advises on tax consequences of business transactions and structures, manages external tax audit and controversy processes and manages income tax accounting and compliance activities in EMEA.

Role Description:

The EMEA Corporate Tax Senior Tax Advisor will report to the Head of international Tax and will work closely with a small team of tax professionals based in London and Paris, as well as tax colleagues globally.

Responsibilities:

Provide tax advice to and manage tax risks associated with certain business and operation units in the EMEA Global Banking and Markets lines of business, including the review and approval of new products and changes in the bank’s operating models.

Oversee the EY managed outsourcing arrangement for certain countries within EMEA, including: the review and approval of corporation tax filings, tax provision calculations and tax authority audits and settlements.

Review and evaluate the impact of any new tax legislative proposals or changes, communicate the impacts to internal stakeholders and develop any necessary advocacy or action plans.

Oversee tax governance and risk management consistent with the global framework; determine local tax guidelines; and implement initiatives to improve operational excellence.

Work with colleagues in International and US tax and assist with queries on the local tax implications of global activities.

Develop and approve tax planning initiatives with significant impact.

Represent Bank of America at industry body forums and perform advocacy services as required, including industry submissions and liaising with tax authorities or government representatives.

What we are looking for:

Significant level of in-depth post qualification experience in UK and International tax

Currently working within a financial services corporate tax department or with significant subject matter expertise in banking taxation at an accountancy or law firm.

Effective communication skills. The role involves a high level of interaction with senior stakeholders in management, business and support groups on taxation matters.

Strategic vision.  Anticipate tax consequences arising from business developments or legislative change; develop tax effective solutions.

Ability to influence key stakeholders and champion new ideas; excellent advocacy and negotiation skills; build lasting relationships; resolve conflict; diplomatic.

Ability to balance risk: reward and make appropriate decisions.

Ability to manage multiple issues simultaneously.

Skills that will help:

Proficiency in Excel, Word and PowerPoint

description:

Job Title: Operations Analyst - Sanctions

Corporate Title:  Officer 

Location:  Bromley 

Company Overview:

Join our bustling Bromley office, situated in one of London’s greenest boroughs. Here you’ll find plentiful and easy commuting routes, with central London just 15 minutes away by train.

Role Description:

In this role you will be part of the Center of Excellence for economic sanctions monitoring and therefore part of Global Payment Operations (GPO). GPO is the central hub for Bank of America in playing a monumental and mission critical role in establishing, servicing, supporting and monitoring two of the most widely used electronic payment processing vehicles – Wire and ACH – in the financial services arena worldwide.  GPO is also accountable for the SSCoE (Sanctions Screening Center of Excellence) that reviews all of Bank of America’s customers and transactions to ensure compliance with Bank of America’s Economic Sanctions Program.

In this role you will also Investigate Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) alerts for both domestic and international consumer, commercial and wholesale bank businesses or services functions.

Responsibilities:

You will assist with coordination of implementation for products, services, and operational solutions.
You will support the design, documentation, implementation, and monitoring of new products and services.
You will provide guidance regarding procedural, technical, and operational changes.
You will expand business products knowledge within operations environment.
You will build network by developing relationships with partners and teammates.
You will inspect data to identify issues and trends.
You will collect and interprets data to validate operational processes.

You will have an analytical mindset and be detail oriented.
You will have excellent oral and written communications skills.
You will have excellent computer literacy with experience in Microsoft Office.
You will have the ability to work independently, as well as, within a team.

title: Transaction Reporting Submission Control Professional
description:
Job Description:

Job Title: Transaction Reporting Submission Control Professional 

Corporate Title:  Up to Vice President 

Location:  Chester 

Company Overview: 

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities, and shareholders every day.

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.

Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Role Description: 

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Regulatory Reporting Professional to join the Transaction Reporting Control Group (TRCG).  TRCG is a post-process quality assurance function that validates the completeness, accuracy, and timeliness of G20 transaction reports and related obligations.  The team’s main responsibility is to act as Report Preparers for 41 transaction reports including CFTC and SEC reports in USA, EMIR, SFTR and MiFID reports in UK and Europe, and reports for regulators in Canada, Switzerland, Hong Kong, Singapore, Australia, Japan, and South Korea.  For each of these reports, the processing and submission is a fully automated activity performed in real-time; TRCG operates a risk-based control framework to ensure the integrity of the process and submitted data.

The role is based in the Submission Control function, which is primarily focused on remediating exceptions received from trade repositories that provide the bank’s transaction reports to regulatory bodies globally. 

Key Responsibilities:

You will monitor and resolve pre- and post-submission transaction reporting for the EMIR / UKEMIR jurisdictions.
You will investigate issues and carry out root cause analysis; escalate regulatory breaches to senior management as required.  
You will partner with key stakeholders within TRCG and across the organisation (including Front Office, Technology and Compliance) to resolve issues.
You will define remediation requirements and manage the remediation effort through to resolution.
You will produce and disseminate function-related MI as required and provide insightful commentary and analysis.
You will conduct data analysis to assist in responding to internal, client and regulator enquiries.
You will participate in Change Management and business readiness activities to implement internal and external changes affecting transaction reporting.
You will drive the continuous improvement of processes and controls through Operational Excellence to bring reporting in line with non-financial regulatory reporting (NFRR) global standards.

What we are looking for:

Experience of working in Banking Middle Office, Operations or other relevant functions will be ideal.
You will have an Operational Excellence and process enhancement mindset.
You will have strong communication skills across cross-functional stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.
You will have the ability to conduct and review meaningful analysis on large data sets and providing insightful commentary.
You will have some experience of managing or leading a team.

Skills that will help: 

An understanding of the regulatory trade and transaction reporting landscape will be a plus.
Experience with EMIR / UKEMIR would be an advantage.
Familiarity with key products covered by regulatory reporting obligations (FX, Credit, Rates, Equities, Futures & Options) would be an advantage.
Proficient in MS Office, including Excel (VB advantageous) and PowerPoint will be a plus.

UK

description:
Job Description:

Job Title: Fixed Income Specialist – Market Operations

Corporate Title: Vice President 

Location: Dublin 

Company Overview: 

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection.  Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities, and shareholders every day. 

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Location: Dublin

Find us at our Central Park office, Leopardstown, where you will find our state-of-the-art facilities based in Dublin’s premium business park. With an onsite gym, staff restaurant and coffee shop, all your daily needs are conveniently catered for. There are also a range of travel options available to staff, including the LUAS network and the Central Park shuttle service between Dublin City Centre and Central Park, which means getting to work has never been so easy.

Job Description:

This job is responsible for providing advanced end-to-end operational support for securities, loans, exchange traded derivatives and over the counter derivatives across multiple lines of business, and cross-business functional support through the lifecycle of a trade. Key responsibilities include ensuring trading and operational activities are completed accurately and before deadlines, researching and resolving complex issues, and simplifying client interactions. Job expectations include being customer oriented and data driven, while focusing on continuous improvement.

As a member of the department leadership team, you will be act as an escalation point across EMEA FICC Operations.  Management associates play a fundamental and influential role in driving the execution of strategic change initiatives, providing leadership, point of escalation, and subject matter expertise for our business and operations partners. You will provide support to regional associates, encouraging inclusion and engagement and drive the identification and implementation of continuous process improvement, strategic change, and risk remediation opportunities. Business support and engagement is a critical part of this role, and you will enjoy regular interaction with front office partners, gaining exposure to markets rules, business strategy, and the diverse range of fixed income products
 

Responsibilities:

Provides operational support for one or more activities within the lifecycle of a trade, including trade processing, trade settlement, accounting and reconciliation, lifecycle events, and collateral management
Provides simplified client interactions and deepens client relationships across Global Banking and Markets' clients
Completes accurate, timely clearing and settlement of trades with internal and external counterparties including reconciliation management and governance of trade fails and breaks
Performs tasks accurately during high volume periods in a team environment
Improves and simplifies the client experience, reducing manual touchpoints
Supports the implementation of new processes to improve the overall business operating model
Identifies and flags potential risks in a timely manner
Work closely with trading, sales and clients, technology & settlement teams globally to optimise settlement rates reduce fails/ break
Identification and implementation of process improvements, working independently or partnership with technology for deliver
Input into and support of strategic work, regulatory change and supporting projects that impact the team. Responsible for program requirements, test scripts, UAT, and go live monitoring
Ensure the allocation & settlement of securities for global markets, taking the necessary action to eliminate market risk

What we are looking for:

Global Market Operations desirable
You will have an extensive number of years experience in this area
Demonstration of risk awareness & control mindset
Attention to detail
Demonstration of teamwork ethos, partnership intra- team and across org
Excellent organisational and prioritisation skills
Verbal and written communication skill
Decision Making
Strategic Thinking
Negotiation

Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Location: Dublin

Find us at our Central Park office, Leopardstown, where you will find our state-of-the-art facilities based in Dublin’s premium business park. With an onsite gym, staff restaurant and coffee shop, all your daily needs are conveniently catered for. There are also a range of travel options available to staff, including the LUAS network and the Central Park shuttle service between Dublin City Centre and Central Park, which means getting to work has never been so easy.

Role Description:


The Senior Operations Associate will support the Beneficial Ownership Registry consultation process as a part of the broader AML/KYC program. A beneficial ownership registry is a system or database that records the individuals or entities that ultimately own or control a company or legal entity, even if they are not officially listed on company documents.  The role involves performing BOR consultation for clients post completion of the core AML Refresh activities, which includes analysing and resolving discrepancies, and filing reports with relevant agencies as needed. The environment is dynamic with the potential for additional jurisdictions to be added periodically.   

The candidate will need to be familiar with how to manage the work in a case management environment including liaising with multiple key stakeholders including AML Operations, Global Financial Crimes, Sales, and other support areas. The role requires someone who can work well independently with a risk adverse mindset.  The ideal candidate should have a working knowledge of Anti Money Laundering regulations.   

Responsibilities:

Conducting BOR consultations for impacted clients.
Reviewing discrepancies and identify materiality.
Liaising with sales/ client outreach teams responsible for the collection of customer information used to validate client rationale for discrepancies where applicable.
Reporting discrepancies to relevant agencies where required.
Ensuring adherence to all jurisdictional requirements related to BOR consultation.
Participating in internal/external Audits and Quality validation.    
Tracking cases and ensuring timely completion.
Participate in the implementation of BOR consultation processes for new jurisdictions

What we are looking for:

Experience with Anti-Money Laundering, Know Your Customer/Client Due Diligence preferred.
Familiarity with data capture and workflow applications/tools
Ability to work in a dynamic production environment
Able to work independently across multiple areas of the bank
Able to meet, track and manage competing priorities and deadlines while maintaining and ensuring the accuracy of the data and reporting.   
Verbal and written communications.
MS Office Suite (Excel/Word/Outlook) skills.
Ability to provide executive summaries

Benefits of working at Bank of America
Ireland

Private healthcare for you and your family plus an annual health screen to help you manage your physical wellness with the option to purchase a screen for your partner
Competitive pension plan, life assurance and group income protection cover if you become unable to work because of a disability or health reasons
20 days of back-up childcare including virtual tutoring and 20 days of adult-care per annum
Ability to change your core benefits as well as the option of selecting a variety of flexible benefits to suit your personal circumstances including access to a wellbeing account, travel insurance, specified illness cover etc
Use of a flex fund to use towards benefits
Access to free counselling through an Employee Assistance Programme and virtual GP services
Opportunity to donate to charities of your choice directly through payroll and the bank will match your contribution
Opportunity to join our Arts & Culture corporate membership programme and receive discounted entry to some of the UK and Ireland’s most iconic cultural institutions
Opportunity to give back to your community, develop new skills and work with new groups of people by volunteering in your local area

Bank of America

The GBGM Finance Change Team is part of the COO & Governance Organisation within Bank of America. This team drives and delivers change within the GBGM Finance organisation via Data, Process, and Technology Strategy and Solutions.

The Senior Business Analyst will play a critical role within the Valuation Control program which is focussed on improving the end-to-end Valuation Control process and controls. The program looks to deliver:

Increased efficiencies and reduced operational risk through automation and spreadsheet retirement

Reduction of cycle time for end-to-end process

Practical knowledge of Valuation Control processes, IPV and Brisk reporting

Prior experience working on a project is desirable

team

title: Workplace Operations Manager (12 month FTC)
description:
Job Title

Workplace Operations Manager (12 month FTC)

Department

Facilities Management-BG-UK

Overview of Department

Facilities Management provides a number of support services to Baillie Gifford. These include managing the day-to-day running of our offices and ensuring a comfortable and appropriate working environment for staff, as well as managing existing office leases and considering future requirements. The department is also responsible for the Health and Safety of all employees and visitors within our premises. 

Purpose of Role

To manage a small team within the Workplace Operations team within in our Edinburgh properties. Provide a hands-on approach to the workplace services Baillie Gifford has and to provide a level of customer service to our staff, clients and visitors you would expect to find within a luxury hospitality environment. Managing the day to day operations within the Facilities Management (FM) team to ensure the building on a daily basis is ready for use. Using a keen eye for detail, making sure the softer aspects of FM are attended to before they become an issue for staff or visitors. A proactive approach to potential problems and having a good sense and understanding of the wider building operational dependencies. Creating a welcoming customer-focused experience for all who visit the department.

Responsibilities

Accountable and responsible for the daily management of a small team within the Workplace Operations team. 

Responsibility for dealing with reactive events quickly and discreetly, having the ability to create Preventative Maintenance activity for our properties and to manage shift rotas required to support. 

Regular interaction with our preferred supply chain, conducting regular service meetings and negotiating contracts and service agreements to align with the changing landscape of our business needs. 

Keep up to date with changing regulations and promote new ways of working for all disciplines. 

​

Take full accountability for these items of which are listed below:

Cleaning standards internal and external, including fabrics, floor coverings, wall coverings, special cleans and window cleaning 

Mail room services and postal services 

Management of stationary, internal external planting 

Document handling and archiving management to support our internal audit process 

Managing Utility providers 

Pest Control and Waste Management responsibility

Create and develop a customer service culture that provides end users with a first-in-class service for engagement/helpfulness/fault resolution/interaction, using feedback to improve service 

Help-desk management and customer service meetings 

CAFM system development for preventative maintenance and scheduling 

Security - Management of access control systems, Joiners, Mover & Leavers, contractors, man-guarding, etc 

Fully support and develop internal and external audit processes

Support and play an active part in fire evacuation and other life safety activities. Developing these processes and procedures, where necessary 

H&S responsibilities for the Workplace Ops team

Documentation of service sheets, contract records, and certificates to further support our internal policies

Ability to lead by example and promote a self-starting, let's get it done approach to management  

Your Skills and Experience

Solid operational understanding of general building operations 

Strong understanding of working safely, permit to work systems 

Sound understanding of CAFM systems or Maintenance management systems 

Knowledge of CDM regulations & workplace regulations, as well as the ability to create and develop safe systems of work for related activities

Ability to create trust-based relationships with existing supply chains and willingness to engage with new suppliers, as needed

Experience of managing a front-of-house operational team in a unique operating environment 

Ability to effectively manage a small team, ensuring that all service level agreements are met and ideally exceeded

Willing to take part and support semi-skilled activities such as small porterage requests, etc 

Awareness of IOT and SMART building approach

Excellent management of risk and the cause-and-effect process of operational actions being undertaken with an absolute no-outage approach being withstood 

Operational management of contracts and ensuring contractors are doing what they are contracted to do, being involved in monthly meetings etc 

Qualifications

IOSH Working or Managing safely (preferable) 

Water Hygiene accreditation (Awareness or responsible person) (preferable) 

COSHH training (preferable) 

The Type of Candidate that we're looking for

You build trust-based relationships with ease, utilising your strong communication abilities to develop credibility with your team. Your strong communication abilities also help you to extend influence over external partners and suppliers. Your natural Can-Do attitude brings positivity and helps create a sense of Team, rolling your sleeves up where necessary to get the job done, to a high standard, each and every time. Comfortable in a fast paced and ever changing environment, you add value, sharing diverse ideas and leveraging your creative thinking to propose outside-the-box solutions, whilst remaining calm under pressure.

Critical Skills

Adaptability

Enabling Others

Improve Mindset

Team Working 

Systems Thinking

Closing Date

May 28, 2025

At Baillie Gifford we are committed to fostering an inclusive and respectful culture in which each of our colleagues can thrive and develop. We believe that our clients are best served by a diverse workforce with the experiences, ideas and perspectives that this brings.

If you are currently working at Baillie Gifford as an employee or contractor please apply to this job from the firm's Workday internal career site.

title: Creative
description:
Job Title

Creative

Department

Client & Marketing Services-BG-UK

Overview of Department

Creative Services

Purpose of Role

The role of the Creative within the Creative Services Department is to work in support of the Creative Manager and alongside the wider creative team, liaising directly with clients, colleagues and external agencies as required. They will develop, oversee and manage work in adherence of our brand.

Responsibilities

Consistently deliver high-quality artwork according to brand specifications, demonstrating an understanding of the requirements of the brief and the needs of the client with limited supervision
Manage own allocated workload in an accurate and timely manner
Support other team members by offering assistance during busy periods
Respond to ad-hoc requests from various stakeholders and provide accurate and timely responses as and when required 
Process requests to team workflow
Responsible for peer checking others work; identifying errors, suggesting improvements and ensuring quality
Help maintain and coordinate information and knowledge sharing within the Creative Services team 
Represent the team at meetings and discussions
Engage with senior team members for support and guidance
Build effective relationships with clients and the wider business, taking ownership of specialisms as required as a key contact
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office experience
Be involved and assist in departmental workflow
Take ownership, or be involved in, project work as instructed
Assisting in training, developing and mentoring new and existing team members, providing general guidance and direction
Be aware of the latest creative industry standards, trends and keep up to date with your own personal design skills and knowledge of software packages and technology.
Be involved in image selection, licensing and curation as required
Assist in the production of internally printed material in conjunction with the Print Specialist and the wider creative team

Qualifications:

Qualification at higher/further education level in the Creative Arts (preferred)

Your knowledge and experience:

Highly creative with the ability to generate original designs.
Strong portfolio demonstrating original designs, typography, layout, art direction
Able to demonstrate a history of working with, and adhering to brand, guidelines across a range of design deliverables
Experience of working with (or within) the Financial Services industry (preferred)

The type of candidate that we're looking for:

We're looking for a creative designer with a proven history of developing their own creative ideas and taking these from conception to conclusion. They should have strong communication and presentation skills with a flexible and collaborative approach to working with both the wider department and our internal stakeholders.

Adaptability
Storytelling
Team working

May 26, 2025

title: Transfer Agent Oversight Analyst (TA Oversight) - 6 months Fixed Term Contract
description:
At T. Rowe Price, we identify and actively invest in opportunities to help people thrive in an evolving world. As a premier global asset management organization with more than 85 years of experience, we provide investment solutions and a broad range of equity, fixed income, and multi-asset capabilities to individuals, advisors, institutions, and retirement plan sponsors. We take an active, independent approach to investing, offering our dynamic perspective and meaningful partnership so our clients can feel more confident. 

We believe doing the right thing for our clients and our associates is good business. With a career at the firm, you can expect opportunities to create real impact at work and in your community. You’ll enjoy resources to support your career path, as well as compensation, benefits, and flexibility to enrich your life. Here, you’ll find a collaborative culture that respects and values differences and colleagues who share a spirit of generosity.  

Join us for the opportunity to grow and make a difference in ways that matter to you. 

The Transfer Agency Oversight Specialist is responsible for supporting the overall monitoring and management of the performance of T. Rowe Price’s third-party Transfer Agents and Bank Account Providers across the UK and Luxembourg. The ideal candidate will execute and provide support on internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the overall process and ensure a high-quality client experience.

Principal Responsibilities

Responsible for supporting the overall relationship with TRP’s third party Transfer Agents and related bank account providers, acting as a primary contact for both internal and external stakeholders.
Responsible for the investigation and resolution of day-to-day operational queries, issues, and incidents.
Execute on activities from the designed TA Oversight framework and conduct ongoing monitoring activities to ensure compliance with agreed service criteria. Communicate the monthly/quarterly oversight findings to key stakeholders and management teams.  
Complete daily, weekly, monthly tasks to ensure compliance with Client Money Obligations (Bank Reconciliation Oversight, Timed Transfer Modelling, Resolution Pack Review).
Conduct service review meetings and support due diligence on the service providers in conjunction with T. Rowe Price’s Risk and Compliance functions. Formulate, develop, and negotiate service level documents with the service providers.
Support the Breaches & Complaints processes (including logging breaches, performing root cause analysis, ensuring remedial actions are completed & working with internal stakeholders such as CASS Oversight, Compliance, Legal to ensure remedial actions are appropriate).
Participation in ad-hoc projects requiring TA Oversight support and expertise.
Review and interrogation of Management Information relating to the performance of the service providers.   
Maintain written desktop procedures for key activities completed within the team.
Assist in process reviews & drive efficiencies through continuous improvement. 

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES / SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS

4+ years’ experience working in an Asset Management with fund operations and/or vendor oversight experience.
Solid working knowledge of Transfer Agency practices.
Good understanding of Client Money Regulations.
Good understanding of the UK/Luxembourg fund distribution landscape and regulatory environment.
Problem solving oriented approach with high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with ability to communicate with all levels of a diverse range of staff, including senior management.
Good understanding of UK / Luxembourg fund structures.
Forward thinking mindset with a proactive approach.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

At T. Rowe Price, our associates are our greatest asset. We thrive because our company culture is built on inclusion and because we sustain a work environment where associates can bring their best selves to work every day. The backgrounds, talents, and experiences of our global associates allow us to embrace new ideas and perspectives that move our business priorities forward and enable us to deliver strong client outcomes. Here, you can expect equal opportunity and fair and consistent treatment for all. 

T. Rowe Price is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity of thought, gender, and race. We believe our continued success depends upon the equal treatment of all associates and applicants for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, colour, national origin, sex, gender, age, mental or physical disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military or veteran status, pregnancy, or any other classification protected by country, federal, state, or local law.

We take an active, independent approach to investing, offering our dynamic perspective and meaningful partnership so our clients can feel more confident.

Overview 

In this role, you will design, develop, modify, adapt and implement short- and long-term solutions to information technology needs through new and existing applications, systems, databases and applications infrastructure. You will code, test, debug and implement software solutions. 

Role summary and job responsibilities 

Contributes to all parts of the SDLC, e.g., design, development, and testing 

Develops technical solutions following standard methodologies with some guidance from senior engineers 

Practices automated testing and tests your work in an automated and repeatable way 

Identifies and remediates technical debt 

Works with existing data models and schemas and suggests changes and improvements where necessary 

Demonstrates strong logic and reasoning capabilities 

Delivers on well-specified work items 

Uses questions and proposals to clarify requirements when unclear 

Business knowledge 

Applies understanding of the Financial Services and Asset Management industries 

Connects one's own work with the strategy of their team and/or department. 

Can competently engage in business-led conversations. 

Requirements 

Proficiency in Java 11, Ideally should be using Java 17 in most recent experience. 

Proficiency in other programming languages such as Python and Typescript (or React) 

A good understanding of modern AWS architectures and corresponding technologies, such as SNS, SQS, ECS, Lambdas, Postgres, Micro Services 

Able to operate with openness and efficiency with one or more SDLC methodologies (e.g., Scrum) 

Actively seeks feedback and guidance to improve technical skills (e.g., through submitting work for code review) 

Works with existing data models and schemas and suggests changes and improvements where necessary 

Debugs and fixes your own software with minimal assistance 

Practices automated testing and tests your work in an automated and repeatable way 

An understanding of the asset management business and/or financial markets, preferable

title: Technical Architect - Contract
description:
At T. Rowe Price, we identify and actively invest in opportunities to help people thrive in an evolving world. As a premier global asset management organization with more than 85 years of experience, we provide investment solutions and a broad range of equity, fixed income, and multi-asset capabilities to individuals, advisors, institutions, and retirement plan sponsors. We take an active, independent approach to investing, offering our dynamic perspective and meaningful partnership so our clients can feel more confident. 

We believe doing the right thing for our clients and our associates is good business. With a career at the firm, you can expect opportunities to create real impact at work and in your community. You’ll enjoy resources to support your career path, as well as compensation, benefits, and flexibility to enrich your life. Here, you’ll find a collaborative culture that respects and values differences and colleagues who share a spirit of generosity.  

Join us for the opportunity to grow and make a difference in ways that matter to you. 

Role Summary 

This Technical Architect will support the Client Journey, with an initial focus on Onboarding, consisting of the end-to-end experience for the client. The desired experience of the Client Journey encompasses the processes that are performed, as well as a thorough connection to the systems that support the work. There is a need for a Technical Architect to help develop technology architecture blueprints for the Architecture Review Board (ARB).

This role sits within the Enterprise Architecture function of T Rowe Price but will be 100% aligned and dedicated to the Client Journey deliverable. It is the responsibility of the Technical Architect to support the definition of business requirements defining the target state for the Client Journey and then leading the development of the target state architecture (alongside delivery channel architects and developers) to meet this target state. This will include providing technical leadership, consultancy and facilitation of the design process – and the delivery of the socialized and agreed architecture to the delivery teams, after approval through the ARB.

Responsibilities

The Technical Architect will demonstrate competencies across three key dimensions:

Deliver Future-State Solution Architecture

Reports to the Head of Enterprise Architecture – Applications
Works with all members of the Enterprise Architecture team to ensure that all technical decisions made as part of the definition of the Client Journey future state are aligned to the strategic vision of TRP
Works with members of the Client Journey team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, both target state and journey to that target state (business priorities and drivers)
Works with members of the Client Journey delivery team (architects and developers) to ensure proposed architecture is understood, practical and supported by those who will be responsible for the delivery to production. This includes coaching and mentoring of development teams through the initial design process and into the beginning of the development process
Drives digital innovation by leveraging innovative technologies and approaches to renovate, extend and transform the existing core technology base and IT estate.


Analyzes and Evaluates Technology

Understands the strategic, EA driven technical goals and how to implement them in the client journey program
Guides project deliverables to ensure project meets the architectural and business requirements whilst reducing technical debt and increasing alignment to architectural vision
Acts as a consultant and advisor to the project team, opining on how the project direction can be best aligned to current and trending technology initiatives.
Ensures that the project team is aligned to the EA principles and architectural governance process.

Leads and Collaborates to Deliver Business Outcomes

Understands the business drivers and requirements and ensures the target architecture is aligned to those goals
Consults extensively and frequently with all involved parties to ensure that alignment is maintained throughout the architecture development phase
Works closely with the product managers, product owners and EA peers (e.g., enterprise, business, information, security, and solutions architects) to enable infrastructure agility, scalability, and resilience to support required product needs throughout product life cycles.
Documents necessary for enterprise technology architecture design and analysis work
 

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND 5+ years of total relevant work experience
Minimum 5+ years of design and implementation experience in IT, with a deep knowledge in a minimum of two of the following (or similar) technical disciplines: infrastructure and network design, application development, application programming interfaces (APIs), middleware, servers and storage, database management and operations, clustering technologies, virtualization, cloud technologies and Active Directory and protocols
Exposure to multiple, diverse technical configurations, technologies, and processing environments
Understanding of product management, agile principles and development methodologies and capability to support agile teams by providing advice and guidance on opportunities, impact, and risks, taking account of technical and architectural debt.
Excellent people skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation
Strong leadership skills
Good understanding of design principles and common design patterns
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills in a technical context.
Knowledge of IT standards and controls
Understanding of system development life cycle methodologies (e.g., waterfall, spiral, agile software development, rapid prototyping, incremental, synchronize and stabilize, and DevOps)
Relevant vendor or industry certifications

Preferred:

Organizationally savvy, with understanding of the political climate of a global company and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
Ability to understand the long-term (“big picture”) and short-term perspectives of situations and how they relate to achieving targeted business outcomes.
Ability to apply multiple technical solutions to enable future-state business capabilities that, in turn, drive targeted business outcomes.
Ability to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of existing, new, and emerging technologies that enable and drive new business designs and models.


Work Flexibility
This role is eligible for hybrid work, with up to three days per week from home.

description:
At T. Rowe Price, we identify and actively invest in opportunities to help people thrive in an evolving world. As a premier global asset management organization with more than 85 years of experience, we provide investment solutions and a broad range of equity, fixed income, and multi-asset capabilities to individuals, advisors, institutions, and retirement plan sponsors. Here, you’ll find a collaborative culture that respects and values differences and colleagues who share a spirit of generosity.

Position description

This position will support the Insight & Strategic Product Development team within Global Product and will be an ideal position for somebody who wishes to get broad exposure to Global Product whilst working on very specific projects. The role will include analysis of both T. Rowe Price and industry data to support decision making and will entail working on a wide variety of projects.

Responsibilities

Conducts a wide variety of research including on industry, market, competitor and pricing trends using internal as well as external databases and resources to benchmark and report on product strategy, management, development, and positioning

Compiles analysis for both strategic and ad-hoc industry, competitor and client projects, in close collaboration with more senior members of the team

Contributes to the development of strategic plans, commercial metrics and product health checks across asset classes at product, strategy and vehicle level

Assists in creating high-quality, visually compelling presentations in PowerPoint  

Conducts competitive, market, and/or financial analyses to gain breadth/depth of knowledge in relevant products, markets, regulatory/operational environments, and vehicles

Collaborates with product teams to assess existing firm offerings in the marketplace

Acts as point of contact for internal inquiries

Provides high-level assistance and coverage to senior product managers and serves as their backup as needed.

Supports Global Product processes as required

Qualifications & Skills Required

5+ years of relevant work experience

1+ years of relevant experience in asset management, investment banking, or financial analysis. Prior exposure to product strategy or market research is a plus.  

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience working with databases - ability to aggregate and transform data into clear, actionable insights. Programming languages a plus

Hands-on experience with industry tools such as Broadridge, Morningstar, or eVestment for competitive analysis and market research. Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Powerbi, Tableau) is a plus.

Ability to translate insights into polished PowerPoint presentations  

Analytical with great attention to detail

Ability to multi-task

Experience working under time pressure and with tight turnaround times

Intellectually curious & going the extra mile

Self-motivated and able to work independently in a deadline-driven environment

Demonstrated ability to collaborate in a team environment and build strong relationships

Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think strategically and creatively

Team player, Trustworthy and Integrity

Bachelor's degree (economics, finance, mathematics preferred)

title: Accountant, Corporate Financial Accounting and Reporting
description:
At T. Rowe Price, we identify and actively invest in opportunities to help people thrive in an evolving world. As a premier global asset management organization with more than 85 years of experience, we provide investment solutions and a broad range of equity, fixed income, and multi-asset capabilities to individuals, advisors, institutions, and retirement plan sponsors. We take an active, independent approach to investing, offering our dynamic perspective and meaningful partnership so our clients can feel more confident. 

We believe doing the right thing for our clients and our associates is good business. With a career at the firm, you can expect opportunities to create real impact at work and in your community. You’ll enjoy resources to support your career path, as well as compensation, benefits, and flexibility to enrich your life. Here, you’ll find a collaborative culture that respects and values differences and colleagues who share a spirit of generosity.  

Join us for the opportunity to grow and make a difference in ways that matter to you. 

ABOUT THIS POSITION

The Accountant, Corporate Financial Accounting and Reporting is part of T. Rowe Price’s Controller Group and is primarily responsible for the generation and review of accurate and timely recurring rebate calculations and funding to support the firm’s Sponsored Product clients. Responsibilities also will include fee calculations and analysis of related invoices, providing research and guidance on new products, and providing customer service to our internal and external business partners. This role is also responsible for accurate accounting of revenue recorded to our ledger and recording and application of client receipts as it relates to invoicing.

The T. Rowe Price Controller’s Group is a vital component of the CFO Group, responsible for overseeing rebate fee calculations, invoicing, and payment activities across a diverse range of client fee arrangements. These span the firm’s advisory, institutional, and intermediary services, as well as other revenue reporting functions. Beyond ensuring excellence in calculation, accounting, and reporting across T. Rowe Price Group, its global subsidiaries, and branches, we actively collaborate with business partners to deliver high-quality financial information to our clients, global regulatory bodies, and stakeholders across the firm.

The successful candidate will be innovative, good team player, motivated, and has a keen interest in the asset management industry. The individual should be able to communicate effectively with global team members and stakeholders.

The role will focus on: 

Preparation, calculations, compliance, and oversight of rebate management for the business entities ensuring completeness, accuracy are acceptable at all times.
Maintenance of accounting records, new business mandate and external rebates contracts.
Monitoring of changes in the terms and condition of fees and rebates agreements with clients.
Ensuring rebate accruals, payments, reconciliation, and financial controls are always effective.
Providing customer service to our internal and external business partners.
Data governance.
Provide ad hoc analysis and report for the wider business usage.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Contributes to end-to-end rebate processes and client fee invoicing and completes research required to transform data into information for calculation and reporting purposes. Completes basic to moderately complex activities, including processing revenue calculation events and related transactions, reviewing data, management or regulatory reporting, generating rebate payments, client fee invoices and reconciling fee payment activity.
Assists with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions; providing support for audits; completing assignments to support the maintenance of the control environment; fulfilling ad hoc requests in accordance with global, regional, and country-specific accounting, reporting, and process standards; and completing process improvements. May complete special project activities, as assigned.
With general guidance, gathers, reconciles, and analyzes data to complete fee or rebate calculations, performs reconciliations, prepares daily reports, and supports analyses. Ensures accounting for fee calculations or rebates across the firm’s legal entities and branches is accurate. Provide excellent customer service to our internal and external business partners.
Activities are performed accurately, completely, and in a timely manner. May review reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals. Identifies and escalates issues. Provides insight and potential ways to resolve the issue.
Interprets basic to moderately complex fees schedules and contributes to the preparation of client effective rate and other analyses which provide reporting insights for use in oversight, process improvements or other management reporting or analyses. Collaborates with the other functions within the CFO group on financial reporting and various analyses related to revenues earned by the Group.
Contributes to the implementation of financial system modifications to comply with new products, revised reporting, accounting, and accounting process policies, procedures, and more substantial regulatory changes.
Contributes to the identifying and reporting risks, patterns, or recurring issues and working with all necessary stakeholders and technical teams to reach a resolution.
Participates in assignments across lines of business, legal entities, and geographies that have an impact on new products, internal and external reporting, accounting, and accounting processes as a revenue subject matter expert in order to provide effective financial planning, accounting, and reporting of financial information for the Group, its subsidiaries or branches.

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES / SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS

Ideally experience of asset management industry with involvement or understanding of fees and rebate calculations will be advantageous.
Newly qualified accountant (ACCA, CIMA, or ACA). Finalist or part qualified accountant will also be considered with relevant experience.
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND 5+ years of total relevant work experience.
Experience of working as an accountant in a regulated environment.
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills.
Variance analysis, reconciliation, and management reporting.
Works well independently and in a team environment; comfortable in a matrixed environment; ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines across various stakeholders.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools.
Experience with rebate management systems or ERP software is a plus.
Able to work and deliver solution under pressure.
Excellent communication skills.
Exposure to CASS will be beneficial.

title: UK Institutional Senior Marketing Manager – 12 month FTC
description:
At T. Rowe Price, we identify and actively invest in opportunities to help people thrive in an evolving world. As a premier global asset management organization with more than 85 years of experience, we provide investment solutions and a broad range of equity, fixed income, and multi-asset capabilities to individuals, advisors, institutions, and retirement plan sponsors. We take an active, independent approach to investing, offering our dynamic perspective and meaningful partnership so our clients can feel more confident. 

We believe doing the right thing for our clients and our associates is good business. With a career at the firm, you can expect opportunities to create real impact at work and in your community. You’ll enjoy resources to support your career path, as well as compensation, benefits, and flexibility to enrich your life. Here, you’ll find a collaborative culture that respects and values differences and colleagues who share a spirit of generosity.  

Join us for the opportunity to grow and make a difference in ways that matter to you. 

We are looking for a talented channel marketer to join our UK marketing team, which forms part of our EMEA marketing team. This person will help us build on the asset growth and increased brand awareness T. Rowe Price has experienced in the UK over the past few years. This is a 12 month maternity cover role. 

The team’s remit covers both the institutional and intermediary segments; this role will take the lead on our institutional marketing activities. We are therefore looking for candidates with good knowledge of the UK institutional market and financial markets and strategies generally. Some knowledge of the intermediary market would also be beneficial, but not essential. Given the importance of ESG considerations to both ourselves and our client base, a solid understanding of ESG will also be important in this role. 

We operate in a collaborative, enterprising, thoughtful and supportive environment and are looking for candidates who fit that mould. 

The focus areas for this role are:

1.           Develop and deliver the go-to-market strategy for UK institutional, as well as partnering with and ensuring leverage across our EMEA and global institutional teams.  

2.           Plan, execute and measure effective marketing activity across the full marketing mix, with a digital-first mindset.

3.           Represent the UK business within T. Rowe Price, ensuring our clients’ needs are met and key stakeholders are well informed.

4.           Manage regular updates to core materials and ensure the delivery of a high-quality end-to-end client experience through third party and proprietary virtual, hybrid and in-person events, employing a structured approach with a high degree of accountability.

ROLE SUMMARY

Leads cross-functional teams that develop and execute multi-channel marketing plans that position our strategies and thinking in the UK institutional market. Manages the work of internal and external partners. Stays abreast of the market to help identify changes and opportunities. Creates significant components of the integrated marketing plan for UK institutional. Accountable for the effectiveness of individual marketing programs.

RESPONSIBILITIES

•             Evaluates UK institutional client and prospect populations and competitive markets to develop and execute comprehensive business plans for specific assigned segments in order to drive target audience engagement and business results.

•             Identifies new market opportunities within UK institutional and promotes products and services by strategically leveraging a variety of promotional channels and delivery mechanisms, including email, digital, events, etc.

•             Oversees internal and external business partners in the execution of the segment-specific strategy, ensuring appropriateness, consistency, and timeliness of key messages and data for all audiences.

•             Oversees the project plan(s) and overall execution of the Go-To-Market and marketing plan(s) for UK institutional

•             Analyses and integrates business data with key performance indicators to inform the future development of new promotional programs and propose new campaigns; provides recommendations on EMEA Institutional-wide promotional plans.

•             Acts as the primary point of contact for all deliverables aligned to the institutional segment in the UK. Ensures the ongoing maintenance and optimisation of all ongoing marketing plans.

TYPICAL QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.

5 years+ investment management marketing experience, with a preference for experience in UK institutional

Understanding of the UK professional investor media and event landscape

Team player

Written communication skills

Planning and organisational skills

All-round marketing skills

Ability to think creatively and innovate

PREFERRED (OR ESSENTIAL) QUALIFICATIONS

-              Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, marketing or communications

-              Investment management designation, eg IMC

-              Relevant ESG qualification, Certificate in ESG Investing (CFA)

description:
