Job Summary

Barings is looking for an IT Service Desk Support to provide local support to Australia offices and remote support to other regional locations.  This position will be in our Sydney office, reporting to IT Service Desk Manager.

The IT Service Desk role’s primary function is to ensure a positive user experience for the Barings associates. This person will establish effective relationships with the business partners and act appropriately to ensure consistency in successful support service delivery. 

Primary Responsibilities

Provide a single point of contact Service Desk Service to end users for IT-related incidents and requests.
Provide first-line determination and resolution ("First Line Resolution") to resolve and fulfil end users' incidents and service requests.
Communicate effectively with users throughout the life of their reported issues or requests.
Escalate high-impact incidents promptly to responsible parties and management per agreed guidelines and escalation matrix.
Partner with global team to ensure appropriate knowledge management standards are maintained to support the global service delivery efforts adhere to BAM global policy and standards.
Work with global team effectively on problem troubleshooting
Participate in Local and Global initiatives, supporting the needs of the local business partners as well as the initiatives objectives & outcomes.
Fulfil additional, relevant, tasks appropriate to the role and business requirements on an ad-hoc basis

AU - SYDNEY - 60 CASTLEREAGH ST - BARINGS
description:
At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. Barings is a leading global financial services firm dedicated to meeting the evolving investment and capital needs of our clients and customers. Through active asset management and direct origination, we provide innovative solutions and access to differentiated opportunities across public and private capital markets. A subsidiary of MassMutual, Barings maintains a strong global presence with business and investment professionals located across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.

Job Summary

With dual reporting lines to the Head of Residential and Head of Investments, Barings requires a residential analyst to take ownership of the analytics of its high-value, large scale residential portfolio including Build-to-Rent and Build-to-Sell developments and existing completed projects. 

The role includes the following responsibilities:

Accountable for the integrity and analysis of financial information at both a project and portfolio level.
Delivering financial analysis and strategic insights that support Development Manager(s), Asset Manager(s) and other key stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Regularly engaging with Finance teams to ensure project-level information meets requirements including project cost accounting and reporting.

Primary Responsibilities

Reporting and Analysis

Performing project level budgeting and forecasting including preparing financial models (including Excel, Forbury and Procore) and reviewing forecast assumptions.
Preparing financial performance reports (monthly, quarterly, half yearly) on project and portfolio levels, validate the numbers and write insightful commentary to explain performance.
Maintaining portfolio data and assist the teams with financial analysis and strategic insights.
Conducting ad hoc financial modelling and scenario analysis where required for various projects including new investment opportunities.

Project Cost Accounting

Accountable for managing all aspects of project feasibilities including, project financial performance, and capital partnering arrangements.
Reconciliation of project forecast to general ledger actuals and ensuring completeness of data within project feasibilities.
Maintenance of job cost master data (e.g. cash flow markers and cost codes) and ensure job codes are opened and closed in a timely manner.
Accountable for job cost journal entries, recording direct costs, the allocation of overheads to jobs, and integrity of costs by stage.
Managing treatment of interest based on project structure.
Monthly review of inventory balances, cash flows, interest, common cost allocations to ensure actual results are in line with the feasibility, accounting treatment and financial forecasts.
Ongoing review, maintenance and responsibility for financial and operational data captured in project cost management systems and project reporting.
Contribute to continuous process and reporting improvements within forecasting and business intelligence systems.
Identify opportunities and support the automation of Project Accounting processes.

Business Partnering and Engagement 

Regularly engage with relevant development and asset managers to communicate project performance, seek required inputs and understand project-level risks and opportunities.
Attendance at monthly project review meetings and contributing financial analysis as required.
Regularly engage with divisional/group finance teams to ensure project-level information meets requirements.
Work closely to support the respective development teams working on the project.

Qualifications

Relevant tertiary qualifications eg. Bachelor of Finance, Commerce, Economics or Property, CPA/CA or CFA or equivalent.
Strong financial background and previous 3-4 years’ experience in similar role.
Strong Excel modelling capability and financial analysis.
System experience using Procore would be advantageous.
Solid accounting experience within property/accounting preferred.
Experience with management of residential development feasibilities.
Demonstrated experience in Property.
High level communication (written and verbal) and stakeholder management skills.
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
High level computer literacy with exceptional organisational, project management and reporting skills.
Ability to interact and engage at all levels within the business.
Passion, a can-do attitude, and ability to work to deadlines.
Demonstrate a flexible approach to work.

Title: Residential Asset Based Finance, Origination 

Department: Residential – ABF

Location: Charlotte, NC

Barings is a leading global financial services firm dedicated to meeting the evolving investment and capital needs of our clients and customers. Through active asset management and direct origination, we provide innovative solutions and access to differentiated opportunities across public and private capital markets. A subsidiary of MassMutual, Barings maintains a strong global presence with business and investment professionals located across North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.

Job Summary

Barings Resi – ABF group specializes in residential mortgage related investments. We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Banker to join our Residential Investment Group. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in relationship management, origination of investment opportunities, execution, and negotiation of complex investment structures. This role requires a high level of financial and legal expertise, strategic thinking, strong communication skills, and a collaborative approach to working with internal and external stakeholders, including legal teams. The ideal candidate may come from finance, securitization, or legal background with experience in residential mortgage sector. The position will reside in our Charlotte, NC office.

Primary Responsibilities 

Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including originators, sellers, syndicate partners, and other external parties. Serve as the primary point of contact for counterparties throughout the investment process.
Identify, source, and develop new investment opportunities in the residential mortgage sector. Leverage market insights and a network of industry contacts to create a pipeline of potential deals.
Lead the execution of investment transactions, ensuring alignment with the group’s strategic goals. Negotiate terms, structures, and pricing in collaboration with senior management and other stakeholders.
Collaborate with internal legal teams and external counsels to draft, review, and finalize legal documentation related to investment transactions. Ensure that all documentation complies with regulatory standards and internal policies.
Monitor counterparties and other key stakeholders throughout the investment lifecycle. Evaluate the performance, creditworthiness, and compliance of counterparties, ensuring alignment with the group’s risk management policies and objectives.
Monitor and share market trends, industry developments and regulatory changes to identify potential risks and opportunities. Provide strategic recommendations based on market insights.
Contribute in preparation of detailed reports and presentations for senior leadership, investors, and other stakeholders.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Real Estate, Business, Law, or a related field. MBA or other advanced degrees are a plus.
5+ years of experience in mortgage finance, investment banking, or real estate finance, with a focus on residential mortgages or residential mortgage-backed securities.
Hands on experience and demonstrated strong understanding of residential investment structures, financing, legal documentation, and counterparty management.
Experience in real estate law, asset-backed lending, and securitization legal work is highly desired.
Proven ability to negotiate complex deals and work collaboratively across teams.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to influence and engage both internal and external stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, particularly in assessing counterparty risk and legal structures.
Self-motivated with a results-oriented approach and the ability to work independently.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Job title: Senior Associate – Portfolio Finance

Department: Portfolio Finance

Location: Boston, MA (On-site)

Barings is a $442+ billion global asset management firm that partners with institutional, insurance, and intermediary clients, and supports leading businesses with flexible financing solutions. The firm, a subsidiary of MassMutual, seeks to deliver excess returns by leveraging its global scale and capabilities across public and private markets in fixed income, real assets and capital solutions. Learn more, at www.barings.com.

The Opportunity

The Senior Associate role will support the underwriting, execution, and oversight of investment-grade, senior secured loans to asset managers and the investment vehicles that they manage across a range of asset classes, including private equity, private credit, and real estate debt. The loans, directly originated by the Portfolio Finance team, are highly negotiated and often involve complex structuring across various global jurisdictions. The team has originated over $50 billion in private investments since 2017 and manages $26+ billion of AUM.

The team is small, close-knit, and highly collaborative. The Senior Associate will be a critical full-time member of the team. Team members are motivated by a shared goal to originate attractive investment opportunities for third-party clients as well as MassMutual’s GIA while also addressing the unique financing needs of our customers, who are typically world-class alternative investment managers or specialty finance companies. The Senior Associate will support all aspects of the Portfolio Finance platform, including working closely with Portfolio Managers, Directors, Structuring Leads, other team members across Barings as well as external partners.

The Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from a top university with at least 1 year of relevant experience in: fund finance, structured finance, investment banking, private equity, credit hedge fund, private credit, or other alternative investment experience
Passion and intellectual curiosity for finance / investments, with a strong understanding of accounting principles
Comfort working with and making investment decisions using concepts of leverage in a corporate debt context (e.g., Debt / EBITDA) and in a real estate debt context (e.g., LTV, DSCR, Debt Yield)
Good understanding of the roles, responsibilities and motivations of the primary participants in the investment management ecosystem
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, to succeed in a fast-paced, team environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, well-organized, self-starter, and able to multitask and deliver work products on short timeframes
Ability to work closely with portfolio managers and senior management
Ability and openness to understanding operational, accounting, and legal aspects of investments
Strong computer skills including experience with financial applications including proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Power Point and Word)

The Ideal Qualifications

Professional experience working on complex negotiated transactions
Experience working with at least one alternative asset class and a good understanding of the risks and operations of others across the alternative investment landscape

description:
At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. Title: Senior Associate, Investment Risk Analyst

Business Unit: Enterprise Risk Management

Location: Charlotte, NC

Barings is a leading global financial services firm dedicated to meeting the evolving investment and capital needs of our clients and customers. Through active asset management and direct origination, we provide innovative solutions and access to differentiated opportunities across public and private capital markets. A subsidiary of MassMutual, Barings maintains a strong global presence with business and investment professionals located across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.

Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Second Line Investment Risk Management Analyst to join our team at Barings. This role is pivotal in supporting the company’s investment risk management framework, ensuring effective identification, assessment, monitoring, and mitigation of investment risks across our $400 + Billion of AUM encompassing publicly traded and alternative assets. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of enterprise risk management (ERM) principles specifically related to investment risk management, financial markets, and asset management operations as well as possess the required technical skills to compile and analyze data around these areas.

Primary Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to:

Risk Framework and Governance

Support the design, implementation, and enhancement of the firm’s Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) framework within the context of investment risk management
Assist in partnership with first line functions in developing investment risk policies, procedures, and reporting mechanisms.
Partner with first-line business units to ensure consistent application of investment risk management practices in collaboration with senior members of the investment risk management team

Risk Identification and Assessment

Assist in conducting risk assessments and thematic reviews across investment teams, to identify key risks for discussion with senior leadership and relevant risk committees.
Analyze emerging risks, market trends, and industry developments that could impact client’s portfolios

Risk Monitoring and Reporting

Assist in development and maintenance of investment risk dashboards and metrics (Key Risk Indicators, Key Performance Indicators) for use by the investment risk team, senior management, committees, etc.
Monitor adherence to the firm’s risk appetite and escalate deviations appropriately.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc investment risk reports for stakeholders, ensuring accuracy and clarity.

Collaboration and Advisory

Act as a second line of defense, providing independent oversight and challenge to first-line risk-taking activities.
Collaborate with internal audit, compliance, and other stakeholders to ensure a cohesive risk management approach.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business, risk management, or a related field. Advanced degree (MBA, CFA, CAIA, FRM, or similar certification) preferred.
3–5 years of experience in enterprise risk management in an asset management or financial services environment.
Effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex information to non-technical audiences.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Understanding of enterprise investment risk management frameworks.
Familiarity with financial markets, asset classes including both public and private/alternative assets, and related investment strategies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Proficient in risk management tools, data analysis software, and visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, etc.).
Experience with risk aggregation and modeling systems (e.g., Aladdin, MSCI Risk Metrics, etc.)
Demonstrates integrity, objectivity, and professionalism.
Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships across all levels of the organization.

Head of Asset Based Financing Technology

Company Overview
Barings is a leading global financial services firm dedicated to meeting the evolving investment and capital needs of our clients and customers. A subsidiary of MassMutual, Barings maintains a strong global presence with business and investment professionals located across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. Job Summary
Barings' Global Private Investments Technology team is seeking an experienced professional to lead for the Asset Based Financing (ABF) area. ABF is a rapidly growing sector in the marketplace, and we are looking for a talented individual to spearhead this dynamic space for us. This role involves collaborating with business units such as Investment Teams (Portfolio Managers, Analysts, and Quants), Operations, and Fund Services to support daily operations and build a technology strategy that aligns with business plans.

The role involves managing the book of work, encompassing both Business-As-Usual (BAU) items and strategic buildouts across various ABF verticals. The individual will ensure a proper prioritization process and effective stakeholder engagement and management to drive scale and operational efficiency.

Primary Responsibilities

Technology Strategy: Develop and execute a technology strategy that aligns with the firm's business plans and supports growth and operational efficiency.
Partnership and Collaboration: Build deep relationships with business units to understand their needs and leverage technology effectively. Collaborate with other technology functions to ensure cohesive and integrated solutions.

Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead, build, and mentor high-performing technology teams.
Agile Practices: Strong understanding and implementation of agile development practices.
Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.
Business Acumen: Deep understanding of the firm's overall business and investment capabilities. Ability to articulate and communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
Detail-Oriented: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Innovation: Ability to drive innovation and future design in technology solutions.

Title: Associate Director, CLO Analyst

Location: Charlotte, NC

Barings is a leading global financial services firm dedicated to meeting the evolving investment and capital needs of our clients and customers. Through active asset management and direct origination, we provide innovative solutions and access to differentiated opportunities across public and private capital markets. A subsidiary of MassMutual, Barings maintains a strong global presence with business and investment professionals located across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.

Job Summary

The Structured Credit group within the Global Fixed Income Group is seeking an Investment Analyst.  The team is looking to hire an experienced CLO investment professional responsible for the investment in CLO tranches.  The position will be located in the Charlotte, NC office and report to the Head of the Structured Credit Team. 

Primary Responsibilities 

Full underwrite of CLOs including analysis of collateral manager, collateral, cash-flow modeling and document review
Assist senior members with portfolio management
Perform due diligence of collateral managers including in person meetings and calls on a regular basis

title: Senior Workday IT Analyst
description:
AMBITIOUS?
BRIGHT?
RIGHT?

GAM is one of the world’s leading independent asset managers. We provide differentiated active investment solutions and products for institutions, financial intermediaries and private investors.

Together we share a common set of values rooted in teamwork, integrity, entrepreneurial flair and professional excellence.

Our employees are our most valuable asset. Being able to offer an attractive work environment where talented minds from various backgrounds are keen to work is key to the long-term success of our company. We firmly believe in the importance of maintaining the open culture of a small company, aiming to avoid bureaucracy and encouraging a flexible, accessible and hands-on working style across the Group. In turn, our people reward us with their loyalty.

Function:

Information Technology

Department:

IT - Business Systems

Purpose

GAM are seeking a strong candidate to take a leading role in the Corporate Systems IT team.  This team is responsible for all aspects of change to Workday and supporting HR and Finance systems including the medium to long-term platform strategy.  

The successful candidate will take on technical ownership of the Finance and HR technology platforms, responsible for hands on technical change and administration of the Workday and supporting systems.  They will own the request pipeline for the HR & Finance business teams, developing small, medium and large enhancements, managing day-to-day support, report writing, interface development, management of the bi-annual feature releases, prioritisation and delivery of works driven by user need or vendor led enhancements.

In particular, as a Workday expert technician, the successful candidate will be the mentor for other members of the team, assisting them in developing their Workday skills.

This role will provide the candidate the opportunity to broaden their existing experience, as they will be exposed to all areas of the Workday platform across both HR and Finance, Workday and Adaptive.  They will also learn about the supporting systems of Kyriba and Yooz.

Main Duties & Responsibilities

Configure Workday and other Corporate platform systems to meet requirements; requests are grouped into large (> 5 days), Medium (between 5 days and 4 hours) and day-to-day support (< 4 hrs) and this role will be involved in all areas of request delivery.

Participate in daily stand-ups and weekly progress meetings to ensure day-to-day support and enhancement delivery are controlled; visible progress, clear dependencies, raised obstacles.

Participate in and influence the GAM prioritisation process.

Mentor Corporate IT team members with the development of their Workday skills

Application of disciplined change management adhering to GAM standards and best practise.

Help plan and support the bi-annual Workday feature releases and supporting system releases.

Provide robust, considered advice and guidance to Corporate IT Team colleagues and the business

Support internal and external audit reviews, ensuring quality responses are provided in a timely fashion.

Develop training materials and deliver training; cross skills-training to other team members, training end-users with new functionality

Continuous review of Workday & supporting systems’ roadmaps, identifying opportunities for GAM to leverage new functionality and increase the value of the platform.  Identifying and planning for end-of-life events

Systems Administration and user permissioning. Proactively manage user capabilities to ensure good control environment.

Report writing - configure & maintain the outputs for the standard Finance or HR catalogue of reports.

Continuous development of requisite technology skills (eg investing in training to ensure skills align to Workday developments)

Work closely with the IT team on upstream/downstream system changes and infrastructure developments, ensuring Corporate Systems impacts are understood and mitigated.

Qualifications & Experience

Mandatory: Minimum 2 years’ experience of Workday FINS; specifically configuring BPs, Security model changes, Reporting, EIBs.

Mandatory: Minimum 1 year experience of Workday Adaptive Planning.

Mandatory: Completed at least 2 Workday training courses and direct experience in the following LDPs: 

Financial Management

Adaptive Planning

Experience of a Global Finance Department and its processes; including:

Financial Accounting

Accounts Payable

Accounts Receivable

Group Finance

Statutory & Regulatory reporting / Tax

FP&A

Mandatory: Experience of Business & Functional Analysis and Change Management

Beneficial: Experience of supporting other corporate applications; specifically being business point of contact, gathering requirements, overseeing change delivery, engaging with vendors

Beneficial: Experience of working in an IT / technology delivery team / department using a structured delivery methodology.

Desirable:  Experience of Workday HCM configuration and the HR department / Business function

Desirable:  Financial Services experience is an advantage.

Personal Attributes

Ability to deliver on time and provide timely response to varied stakeholders

Managing complex issues, having a structured approach to problem solving (thinking creatively when required)

Excellent organisation and communication skills

Attention to detail

Working in a collaborative manner

Benefits

GAM offers a comprehensive range of benefits and performance-based compensation, along with a variety of lifestyle and family benefits to promote well-being in and out of the workplace. These benefits vary according to local market conditions. Please contact the local Human Resources team for further details.

Employing Company/ies:

GAM (UK) Limited

Reporting to: 

Head of Corporate & TA Systems

Contract:

Permanent

title: Compliance Officer, Asset Management - 6 month Fixed Term
description:
AMBITIOUS?
BRIGHT?
RIGHT?

GAM is one of the world’s leading independent asset managers. We provide differentiated active investment solutions and products for institutions, financial intermediaries and private investors.

Together we share a common set of values rooted in teamwork, integrity, entrepreneurial flair and professional excellence.

Our employees are our most valuable asset. Being able to offer an attractive work environment where talented minds from various backgrounds are keen to work is key to the long-term success of our company. We firmly believe in the importance of maintaining the open culture of a small company, aiming to avoid bureaucracy and encouraging a flexible, accessible and hands-on working style across the Group. In turn, our people reward us with their loyalty.

Function:

Legal and Compliance

Department:

Compliance - UK

Purpose

This is a key role within Compliance as this role focuses on providing regulatory guidance and support to GAM’s Marketing, Sales & Distribution Teams. The role will also involve developing a global approach for GAM in relation to marketing approvals and compliance participation in marketing / distribution initiatives as well as developing a global approach to regulatory development to support the GAM Group. The role will also be responsible for supporting the wider Compliance team for statutory obligations regarding regulatory filings, SM&CR filings, Operations and HR Regulatory support.

Main Duties & Responsibilities

Act as a centre of excellence and principal Compliance contact to provide advisory and regulatory technical support to Product Development, Sales, Marketing and Distribution

Provide specialist knowledge for MiFID and other global regulatory rules relating to Product Governance and Target Market / Sales considerations

Provide regulatory guidance to those individuals holding Senior Management Functions or acting as Certified Persons within Sales, Marketing and Distribution following the introduction of SM&CR

Contribute to regulatory development both for the UK business and the wider Group, taking the lead in keeping UK Business Heads up to date

Provide compliance support to new product and new market initiatives as required

Focus on providing regulatory guidance and support to the Request For Proposal (RFP) team

Oversee the marketing approvals process where required

Support and implement global Regulatory Policies in accordance with an approved framework, to achieve rapid development and deployment of new and improved policies

Assist in driving forward a global approach in relation to providing compliance support to Product Development, Sales, Marketing and Distribution activities

Support the filings and updates in the FCA, SEC and NFA systems to support GAM regulatory responsibilities

Assist the wider Compliance team in general activities related to Financial Crime, Market Abuse and Conflict of Interest management

Qualifications & Experience

Extensive understanding of asset management; good product knowledge including equities, fixed income and derivatives. Good fund knowledge expected

Sound knowledge of asset management regulation including EU regulations and the UK FCA Handbook, particularly in the areas of Sales, Marketing and Distribution. Good up to date knowledge of MiFID II expectations required in these areas

Proven track record of working collaboratively across multiple business lines with stakeholders and colleagues at all levels and across different jurisdictions

Computer literate, including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Personal Attributes

Strong oral, presentation and written communication skills

Able to set priorities and deliver on them

Team player who gets along with others, shares knowledge and supports collective decision making

Someone who enjoys working in an environment where they can drive change forward

Ability to work independently with minimal direction in a fast-paced environment but also someone who is willing to be part of a Group function and is able to collaborate with Compliance Officers based overseas

Willingness to challenge the status quo, propose enhanced processes and motivate colleagues for progress

Resilience

Benefits

GAM offers a comprehensive range of benefits and performance-based compensation, along with a variety of lifestyle and family benefits to promote well-being in and out of the workplace. These benefits vary according to local market conditions. Please contact the local Human Resources team for further details.

title: Associate Business Development Manager, West Coast
location_raw:
locations
San Francisco, CA, United States
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

The Position

We are seeking a dynamic Associate Business Development Manager to join our Americas Institutional Group (AIG) within the Client Platform Institutional Sales team focusing on the Western US region and markets. The Associate Business Development Manager will be located in our San Francisco office, enabling them to effectively identify opportunities and work across channels within the Western region.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Associate Business Development Manager will conduct thorough market research to identify new business opportunities and understand market trends in the Western US region, developing and maintaining deep relationships with clients, prospects and investment consultants, ensuring the highest levels of service. The ideal candidate will develop and implement business development strategies tailored to their assigned territory’s market, aligning with Wellington's strategies and priority products. The candidate will be highly proactive, creative, entrepreneurial, team oriented, and collaborative. They will work in partnership with the Business Development Managers to generate asset flows in their region. This role will also work in close partnership with internal Relationship Management, Product Management and Investment teams to drive exceptional growth.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

The following skills are required for the role:

Acumen and passion – The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5-10 years of experience within the investment industry and will demonstrate a passion for investments and sales, working across alternatives, equity, and fixed income products. This role requires a strategic thinker with a passion for building and nurturing client relationships, driving business growth, and delivering exceptional service to institutional and wealth investors.


Superior collaboration -This role requires a great deal of teamwork and collaboration across Wellington, especially with the Business Development Managers in the region. The successful candidate will enjoy being an individual contributor within a highly collaborative team and embrace the benefits of overlapping lines of idea generation. The ideal candidate will build strong, trusting relationships with clients and prospects, industry contacts as well as internal colleagues and recognize the benefits of diverse perspectives. 

Growth mindset -The flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing is required.  The successful candidate will have a global perspective and creative approach for thinking about innovation and the future of Western US Region business.

Other Qualifications

A successful candidate will also have the following qualifications:

Deep understanding of financial markets and asset management industry.
Proven aptitude for sales, paired with strong analytical skills and a strategic mindset, enabling effective execution of both analyst and business development manager capacities.
Willingness to travel within the Western US region.
Ability to collaborate with experienced, cross-functional teams.
Strong interpersonal skills and experience in a collaborative, team-based, results-oriented environment.
Independence of thought, intellectual curiosity, and entrepreneurial nature.
Strong work ethic and attention to detail.
Strategic and tactical thinker with solid organizational skills.
Comfortable and articulate speaker and presenter.
Ability to communicate (verbally and in writing) clearly with conviction and contribute to an open dialogue.
Possess maturity, polish, and personal presence.

Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?  That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMWTalentOperations@wellington.com.

At Wellington Management, our approach to compensation is designed to help us attract, inspire and retain the best talent in our industry. We strive to pay employees fairly and competitively across all levels and roles. Our approach to compensation considers all aspects of total compensation; all employees are eligible to receive salary, variable compensation, and benefits. The base salary range for this position is:

USD 80,000 - 180,000

This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; role; skills and experience; certifications; and education. This range is an estimate, and further details on salary and total compensation aspects will be shared with candidates during the recruitment process.   

 

Base salary is only one component of Wellington’s total compensation approach. Other rewards may include a discretionary Corporate Bonus and/ or Incentives, if eligible. In addition, we offer a comprehensive and high value benefit package to meet the unique needs of our employees and their families, and we are committed to fostering a flexible work environment that enables employees to thrive personally and professionally.  Examples of our benefits include retirement plan, health and wellbeing, dental, vision, and pharmacy coverage, health savings account, flexible spending accounts and commuter program, employee assistance program, life and disability insurance, adoption assistance, back-up childcare, tuition/CFA reimbursement and paid time off (leave of absence, paid holidays, volunteer, sick and vacation time)

title: Product Marketing Specialist
location_raw:
locations
Central Hong Kong, Hong Kong
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

Position

The Product Marketing Specialist will combine strong investment knowledge, marketing experience, a client perspective, and a commercial lens to partner with client group, product management and portfolio management. The role will effectively position and communicate our investment capabilities, approaches and funds externally and internally, across both traditional and digital channels. As the part of the APAC Product Marketing team, this individual will also partner closely with our Americas and EMEA Product Marketing teams on cross-regional initiatives.

Specific responsibilities include but not limited to:

Product Positioning and Messaging: Develop clear and compelling product positioning and messaging strategies that highlight the unique value propositions of our investment capabilities and funds

Selling System Development: Design and implement a robust selling system (primarily for wealth and advised retail channel) that equips client-facing teams with effective tools, resources, and training to maximize product adoption and client engagement. Collaborate with internal teams to recommend enhancements that ensure the display of relevant data, ease of client use, appropriate update frequency, efficient distribution, internal sharing, archiving, and maximize opportunity for cross region leverage

Market Update and Intelligence:  Strengthen our competitive analysis and market intelligence capabilities to emphasize product differentiation. Collaborate with investment directors and portfolio management teams to provide client-facing colleagues with timely updates and strategic messaging, enhancing client engagement. Continuously monitor competitor activities and market trends to refine product positioning and strategy.

Marketing Campaigns: Partner with global marketing colleagues to support key campaigns promoting Wellington’s investment capabilities. Collaborate with channel marketing to identify new opportunities for different formats and new content for priority products, setting out the annual agenda for product materials.

Content Creation and Management: Collaborate with client group partners, channel strategists and global content center of excellence, develop regional content strategy and development that balances global and local needs.

Internal Training: Facilitate ongoing training and support to ensure client-facing teams are well-versed in product offerings and competitive positioning

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Coordinate with key stakeholders globally, including marketing, distribution, investment, product management, product development, marketing compliance, fund reporting, and design.

Qualifications

Specific qualifications include:

Over 8 years of experience in marketing, competitor intelligence, or product management

Expertise of product marketing within an asset management firm, with strong understanding in regulatory and legislative landscape, knowledge of UCITS and local fund ranges marketing rules across APAC especially in Singapore and Hong Kong, and understanding of financial promotions rules. Prior exposure to alternative investments a plus

Experience across APAC markets and sales channels (intermediary/institutional)

Solid technical knowledge of products and investments. Client-facing experience is a plus

Skilled in crafting compelling fund narratives that engage diverse audiences

Global perspective with experience working in regional and global teams

Passion for working in a collaborative environment as part of a global team

Strong collaborator and influencer, adept at engaging multiple stakeholders and quickly building relationships.

Excellent communication skills, including interpersonal, verbal, and written

Proficiency in Chinese (verbal and written)

Possesses an entrepreneurial mindset, a can-do attitude, a problem-solving mindset with intellectual curiosity

title: Fund Governance & Oversight Analyst
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

POSITION
This analyst role, working in collaboration with other analysts and managers of the global Fund Risk & Governance Department, will contribute to both ongoing initiatives and new projects focused on Americas fund governance. The role will also work closely with a variety of other internal and external professionals, including those within the Product team, Legal & Compliance, Fund Services, and Tax, in researching internal information and regulatory, fund, & corporate requirements. The range of funds covered include hedge funds as well as funds investing in fixed income and equity instruments. As you gain experience and demonstrate your capabilities, you can progress to managerial roles and further develop cross-functional collaboration.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

1.    Corporate Governance:
•    Assist in drafting and maintaining governance templates, policies, and procedures for 40 Act funds as well as for funds in Cayman and Bermuda.
•    Ensure compliance with the Investment Company Act of 1940 and other relevant regulations.
•    Maintain and update the governance framework to align with regulatory changes and best practices.
•    Prepare and file necessary documents with regulatory bodies such as the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
2.    Company Administration:
•    Keep corporate information and directors’ details up to date on the entity management system and elsewhere.
•    Maintain statutory records.
•    Support the preparation and administration of board and shareholder written resolutions. Act as primary contact for document execution.
3.    Board and committee support:
•    Plan and manage board meetings.
•    Prepare meeting agendas, distribute materials, and record meeting minutes.
•    Ensure effective communication and documentation of decisions made during meetings and draft regular reporting.
•    Coordinate with senior management.
KEY COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:

1.    Relationship Building:
•    Build strong relationships with directors and relevant stakeholders.
•    Communicate effectively and maintain good interpersonal relationships.
2.    Problem-Solving and Decision-Making:
•    Find solutions to challenges that the company faces.
•    Make decisions quickly and effectively using analytical skills and critical thinking.
3.    Technical Skills:
•    Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
•    Coding skills are an asset but not mandatory.
•    Ability to understand, manipulate, and correctly report on various kinds of data.
4.    Qualifications and soft skills:
•    Strong academic track record and a fast learner.
•    Strong organizational and time management abilities.
•    Strategic mindset with the ability to execute from start to finish.
•    Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
•    Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills.
•    A professional and proactive attitude with a willingness to learn and grow.
5.    Experience and preferred knowledge:
•    At least five years’ experience in governance, compliance, legal, or similar regulatory function and prior experience with the governance of 40 Act funds.
•    Knowledge of capital markets.
•    A strong interest in corporate governance, compliance, and regulatory matters.

description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

HEDGE FUND INVESTOR RELATIONS
Hedge Fund Investor Relations at Wellington Management works closely with our hedge fund investment teams, client relationship teams, and business colleagues across the firm to support our clients’ investment needs. Our hedge fund platform spans a wide range of strategies including equity long/short, global macro, credit long/short and multi-strategy. The function has three main objectives:


PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND MARKETING
HF Investor Relations contributes to client growth and retention by acting as a subject matter expert and portfolio manager representative for clients, consultants and colleagues, assessing business opportunities and leading business planning, developing new products and investment solutions, creating the communication strategy for the book of business, including materials that differentiate the product relative to competitors. 

INVESTMENT INTEGRITY AND RISK MANAGEMENT
HF Investor Relations acts as an independent advisor to ensure the integrity of the investment and risk management processes, as well as consistency with client parameters and objectives, conducts regular product risk and performance attributions reviews.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT 
HF Investor Relations contributes to business management, including managing risk, capacity, pricing and guidelines, leads resolution of internal business challenges, and collaborates on product management business to share investment integrity, marketing and product development best practices.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The Investment Analyst will work as part of one or more product coverage teams to contribute to the broad efforts of HF Investor Relations, with a focus on equity long/short strategies. The primary focus of the role is to provide analytical leverage to the team as well as be a point of contact for a variety of internal constituents regarding inquiries about the investment teams and products under coverage. 

Responsibilities include performing analyses related to portfolio positioning, attribution and risk, market trends, competitive positioning, and pricing. Additional responsibilities include creation and maintenance of marketing materials, review and updating of RFPs, responses to investor and prospect questions, monthly and quarterly performance and exposure analysis, and general flow data and analysis.  

The role of an Investment Analyst requires demonstrated skills or knowledge of alternatives products, data analysis, performance and risk analysis; ability to manage and analyze data and create efficient and effective workflows. Excellent excel skills, proficiency at managing large amounts of data, attention to detail, and strong follow up and communication skills required. The individual will interact closely with the investment directors and specialists, contributing to efforts centered on reviewing and evaluating the integrity of our hedge fund data, analytics and materials, and contributing to the success of those products in the marketplace. 


QUALIFICATIONS 
Success in the role requires an interest in hedge funds, attention to detail, and demonstrated proficiency in data procurement and analysis. A positive, collegial attitude and high level of professionalism are essential, as are initiative and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment with tight deadlines. We seek individuals that possess the analytical skills and ability to organize and interpret investment data to reach conclusions as well as effective verbal and written communication skills. 

Further, the ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications: 

1-3 years of directly relevant experience 
 A university degree with strong academic credentials; finance, accounting or business-related majors preferred
Strong technical skills and mastery of MS Excel
 Demonstrated analytical skills including the ability to organize and synthesize data to reach conclusions
Strong communication skills, a high work ethic and willingness to hit the ground running essential
Attention to detail combined with a solutions-oriented mindset
Ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings 
Strong ownership, accountability and follow through
Ability to work both independently and in collaboration with a global team
Thoroughness, and ability to prioritize 
Grace under pressure with an ability to adapt to get things done
 

Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?  That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

title: Director, Global Benefits Operations
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

The Director, Global Benefits Operations is a strategic and hands-on leadership role responsible for the administration of the company’s global benefits programs. This leader will ensure operational excellence across health & welfare, retirement, wellness, and other employee & Partner benefit plans. The role will also collaborate closely with the Head of Total Rewards, HR Business Partners, Finance and senior leadership to ensure benefit programs align with the firm’s talent strategy and support employee well-being, engagement, and retention globally.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead the global benefits operations team in the delivery of high-quality, efficient, and compliant benefits services.

Inspire, develop, and retain a high-performing team, fostering a culture of growth, accountability, and empowerment.

Oversee the administration of benefit plans, including health, dental, vision, life, disability, wellness, pension, and retirement programs across multiple geographies.

Manage vendor relationships, service-level agreements, and contract negotiations to optimize service delivery and cost effectiveness.

Ensure global benefits programs comply with local, national, and international laws and regulations.

Lead the implementation of new programs, tools, and technologies to enhance employee experience and improve operational efficiency.

Identify opportunities to harmonize global benefits offerings while respecting regional nuances.

Collaborate with  HR and internal communications teams to drive benefits awareness and understanding.

Develop and execute employee education campaigns during open enrollment and throughout the year.

Champion a culture of well-being by aligning benefits offerings with broader employee wellness and mental health initiatives.

Leverage data and analytics to measure plan effectiveness, usage trends, and ROI; provide regular reporting and insights to leadership.

Monitor legislative and regulatory changes; develop and update policies and procedures accordingly.

Ensure accurate plan documentation, filings (e.g., Form 5500), and audits.


KEY QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE 

12+ years of progressive experience in benefits operations, with at least 5 years in a supervisory role in a global organization.

Proven track record of leading benefits operations with a focus on scalability, process optimization, and service excellence across global regions.

Expertise in driving operational excellence through continuous improvement, automation, and cross-functional collaboration within a global environment.

Deep knowledge of U.S. benefits regulations (ERISA, ACA, HIPAA, etc.) and experience managing benefits in international markets.

Passion for talent development, employee well-being, and building inclusive workplaces.

Proven ability to lead high-performing teams and manage complex benefits programs.

Preferred expertise in Workday or similar HRIS systems.

CEBS, CBP, or similar benefits certification.

Strategic thinking with operational excellence.

Strong analytical skills and data-driven decision-making.

Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.

High integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.

title: Business Operations and Strategic Delivery Manager - Strategic Relationships
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

Position

The Manager for the Business Operations & Strategic Delivery (BOSD) team will be part of the Client Platform COO Group. The COO team plays a critical role in the execution of the Client Platform strategy, providing leverage for leaders across the platform in the running of their business lines, driving scale and efficiency across the platform, and partnering with infrastructure leaders to ensure critical operations run smoothly. The BOSD team will focus on key processes critical to the running of our business that span multiple teams across the platform, with a focus on platform operations (including L&D and risk/regulatory processes), sales planning, and strategic client relationships. The team also leads cross-platform initiatives focused on creating efficiencies and supporting growth.

The Manager will be largely focused on our strategic client program, working closely with the Client Service Director to partner with regional teams to drive commercially impactful strategic client initiatives and to deliver on priority growth opportunities. In addition to the strategic client program, we expect the Manager to also lead cross-platform strategic projects as capacity and interest allows.

Although the role will be based in Boston, the Manager will have a global remit and will work closely with all teams across the Client Platform.

Specific responsibilities include:

Strategy setting: Builds and implements ongoing strategic client service delivery strategy, in partnership with Client Service Director
Client education and training: Owns the strategy, design, and execution of foundational client training and research sharing programs, partnering closely with Strategic Partner sales teams to understand and align with client objectives/interest areas, and commercial priorities
Scale and govern centralized resources: Provides review and counsel to global business development teams on designing bespoke training programs, to include curating a centralized resource library; leveraging technology to design and implement a centralized tracking system for senior leader mapping and relationship scaffolding; and providing oversight/management of the Global Macro Portal
SRAC oversight and governance: Sets strategy for Strategic Relationship Advisory Council (SRAC) discussions in partnership with SRAC Chair & Vice Chair; serves as SRAC Secretary, establishes KPIs and regular tools for measurement; mobilizes SRAC and other key stakeholders for review and collaboration/execution on big deals
Host select strategic/tier 1 global clients, prospects, and consultants when they visit the firm’s global offices
Partners with Client Service Director on key stakeholder management and regional engagement
Leads cross-platform strategic projects that are critical to evolving the business, working closely with key business partners

Qualifications

Specific qualifications include:

7+ years experience in asset management (direct experience with sales teams an advantage)
Proven project management skills, organizational skills, and ability to manage simultaneous projects across geographies and teams
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Direct experience, or at least knowledge of, the infrastructure required to support the business
Global mindset, and willingness to work flexible hours on occasion to foster close partnerships with global colleagues
An awareness and understanding of the competitive landscape, including key trends across large Asset Owners and Managers, and a creative approach to thinking about how we showcase and commercialize our competitive advantages and key differentiators
Ability to independently drive projects in a highly matrixed and collaborative team environment, exercising sound judgment with regard to use of internal resources
Ability to partner effectively with others across all levels of the organization, seek a wider audience, build consensus, influence, develop recommendations and act decisively
Flexibility and grace under pressure; ability to adapt
Entrepreneurial mindset – enjoy building and having an impact, “rolling up sleeves” and getting things done
Fluency with Microsoft suite (specifically Excel, PowerPoint, CoPilot) and Tableau.

description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

The Executive Assistant supports members of the Private Investments team. Wellington has been investing in private markets for many years, and the Firm launched its first dedicated private capital fund in 2014. The Private Equity platform has over $8 billion in committed capital across a broad range of private equity and private credit strategies including late-stage growth, multi-stage sustainability venture, early-stage venture, and hybrid financials, and is one of the fastest growing investment groups within Wellington. The Private Investments team is responsible for overseeing fund governance, product development, marketing, operations and servicing investors, as well as driving growth in our privates business. The Executive Assistant plays an integral role in supporting the work of this team and collaborates with other assistants in the group and across the firm to meet the needs of the business.

This position works with the Private Investments team on a day-to-day basis but is also part of the Client Platform’s broader administrative team. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Duties will include, but are not limited to:

Logistical coordination of meetings with various constituencies and proactive calendar management

Meeting preparation including gathering, assembling, and distributing materials

Preparing internal and client-facing documents and presentation materials

Comfort with technology and learning new tools

title: Off-Cycle Internship - Sustainability, Luxembourg (6-12 months)
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

RISK MANAGEMENT FUNCTION AND SUSTAINABILITY RISK MONITORING

The Risk Management Function is based in Luxembourg and comprises the Head of the Permanent Risk Management Function, a Risk Manager and a Risk Analyst and it bears responsibility for overseeing all risk identification, measurement, monitoring, management, reporting, and if needed escalation and remediation of breaches.   

As capital markets and client expectations evolve and change, we have seen increased client interest in sustainable investment practices and strategies. In concert with these shifts, Wellington has launched a number of bottom-up initiatives, including starting new investment strategies and working groups focused on climate assessment, environmental, social, and governance integration, and impact investments.  

When launching a sub-fund, the Risk Management Function will review its sustainability risk exposure and document it in the sub-fund’s initial risk profile. We use different metrics to monitor the environmental, social and governance risk of our investments. 

 

THE POSITION 

We are seeking an intern to join the Risk Management & Sustainability Risk team in our Luxembourg office. Duration will be between 6-12 months dependent on the individual and needs of the team. 

This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of ESG strategies, helping Wellington understand and integrate sustainability into investment/business policies and processes. Secondly, the intern will be involved in the implementation of risk management policies and procedures, in automating the tracking of the risk profiles of each fund, and for ensuring compliance with risk limits. 

 

Non-exhaustive responsibilities: 

Inform SI policy/process and lead on process execution across various environmental, social, and governance investment and business topics. 

Undertake research projects on pressing sustainable investment issues, analyze material ESG issues in portfolio companies, gather data for engagements, enhance ESG risk assessment frameworks, and analyze voting and engagement results. 

Daily monitoring of the fund’s risk in line with regulatory and Group internal requirements (UCITS, AIFMD). 

Automating the monitoring of risk parameters (VAR, stress testing, leverage, liquidity, counterparty, sustainability risk, etc.) against established limits, and researching and escalating breaches. 

Automating controls to ensure compliance with UCITS and AIFMD regulatory requirements. 

Maintaining risk related policies, procedures, and documentation. 

Support the Conducting Officer and the other team members as required. 

Providing reporting on risk monitoring results to the EU management committee and boards. 

 

QUALIFICATIONS 

Strong academic track record and fast learner 

Strategic mindset and ability to execute from start to finish 

Ability to work independently and with a team 

Analytical skill and excellent attention to detail 

Curiosity, ingenuity, and research skills 

Desire & excitement to work closely with data & technology 

Effective verbal and written communication skills 

Capital markets knowledge – preferred 

Course work/interest in sustainable investment (impact, climate, SI policies/processes) – preferred 

Experience in data science (data cleaning, validation, analysis, visualization) – preferred 

 

Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?  That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

title: Corporate Access Originator
description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

The Position

The Asia Pacific Corporate Access Originator (based in Hong Kong or Tokyo), with a specialized expertise in the Japan market, will be part of a team responsible for originating and executing corporate access events across APAC i.e. initiation of events which will help investment research or enhance Wellington brand among listed companies, coordination and management of access to corporates, experts and government entities. This will include site visits, conference calls, roadshows, investment conferences and bespoke field trips. This is a role that requires knowledge of the market and investment process, proved ability to build and own corporate relationship, ability to generate content for corporate access events based on investment professional’s needs.  You will engage with investors, proactively suggest agendas, itineraries and respond to company queries and questions where applicable.

Responsibilities

Develop internal relationships with investors to understand their investment philosophy and process in order to originate events

Engage with the Investor Relations community in partnership with corporate access team to strengthen Wellington’s corporate partnerships and brand

Assist to centralize and coordinate all corporate access activity across APAC, with a focus on Japan

Engage with all investment professionals globally to gain understanding of their requirements in APAC

Work closely with global counterparts in other geographical locations to provide corporate access updates and opportunities

Work closely with sell-side counterparts, brokers and third-party vendors to manage corporate access activity

Problem solve and liaise with our research providers to create the best possible conference schedules for our investment professionals

Help develop and utilize technology to enhance management of the corporate access process

Update and analyze current processes and procedures and actively suggest improvements and assist with training

Qualifications

3-5 years of relevant experience within financial services in particular corporate access and investor relations across the APAC region (deep knowledge in the Japan market will be essential)

A strong team player with excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills

A passion for corporate access and its importance in the investment process

Ability to build and maintain strong relationship with companies and capable of initiating and delivering events base on market trend and knowledge

A service attitude and mindset

A self-starter who can think strategically and has a desire to learn

Ability to develop relationships with investment professionals to gain an understanding and empathy with their needs as an investor

Exceptional written and verbal communication

Highly motivated and proactive individual who is capable of working on their own initiative

High attention to details and consistency to follow through; accuracy with all work is essential

Ability to prioritize and multi-task as needed

Diplomacy, yet strength to defend the right decision in a very visible situation and the ability to cope in a very fast-paced, pressurized environment

Fluency in English and Japanese language skills is highly preferred

Proficient in Microsoft Excel and database skills preferred

location_raw:
locations

description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Portfolio Advisor to support the business development and relationship management needs of the distribution business Asia for our Global Wealth Management team. This individual will primarily be focused on supporting the marketing and training efforts with our distribution (sub-advisory and private wealth management) clients and serve as a portfolio manager proxy in our marketing campaigns and roadshows. The Portfolio Advisor will be part of the Global Wealth team and will work closely with the relationship managers and business developers to expand upon our overall efforts with our distribution clients. This individual will also work closely with Product Management on marketing strategy, investment content and messaging, competitive analysis, and client communications. The role will be based in Hong Kong and will require frequent travel.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The ideal candidate would:  

Possess in-depth investment knowledge and be an astute thinker about financial markets, perspectives and views, so as to act as an effective investment representative and portfolio advisor of the firm to prospects & clients 
Play a key role in our marketing efforts and roadshows by articulating our investment approaches, processes and complex portfolios to audiences across a wide range of asset classes, products, and strategies
Demonstrated capability to synthesize complex subject matter and communicate it effectively to diverse audiences with varying levels of sophistication
Develop relationships with the private bankers and regional office heads and develop a deep understanding of their business to help drive flows 
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the distribution (sub-advisory and wealth management) landscape in Asia but in particular Hong Kong and Taiwan so as to contribute to the development of market strategy and enhance connectivity within client ecosystems
Perform market and portfolio analysis so as to differentiate and position our strategies relative to competitors 
Adept at combing market intelligence and CIO/distribution partner feedback to identify and promote relevant product opportunities
Be a keen collaborator with other functional areas to address client issues, concerns, and opportunities in a fast-paced, team-based environment 

QUALIFICATIONS

Candidates should have the following qualifications and experience:

10+ years of relevant experience in the sub-advisory/distribution markets, ideally gained in a portfolio specialist, client portfolio manager or product management role 
Deep investment product experience and knowledge across traditional and alternative asset classes
Experience working in Northern Asia, with deep understanding of regional business practices, market landscape and culture. 
Have high energy, excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills 
Fluency in English, with working proficiency in Cantonese and Mandarin as highly advantageous 
Strong academic credentials, ideally a post-graduate and/or professional qualification (e.g. MBA/CFA or equivalent) 
Willingness to travel frequently to support marketing activities in the region and, occasionally, globally.

About the Role

Wellington Management is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Relationship Analyst (RA) to join our US Wealth team. This individual will play a critical role in supporting the firm’s sales and relationship management efforts with wealth management clients across the United States. The RA will be responsible for coordinating a wide range of client-related activities, partnering closely with relationship managers, business development professionals, and internal functional teams to ensure the seamless execution of each client’s investment, operational, and reporting requirements. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills, along with a commitment to delivering exceptional client service in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide timely, accurate, and high-quality support to the firm’s US Wealth clients, including private banks, wirehouses, independent broker deals, RIAs, and other intermediaries.

Maintain awareness of industry trends, peer group positioning, and competitive intelligence to inform strategic initiatives.

Demonstrate flexibility and a team-oriented mindset by supporting colleagues during peak periods or on cross-functional initiatives.
