title: Fund Accounting Manager, Alternative Investment Funds (HYBRID) NYC/CT
description:
The Investment Manager Services Division (IMS) at SEI is growing rapidly and is seeking new members on our Private Equity & Hedge Fund Accounting Teams. Our primary goal is to provide exceptional customer service, accounting and administration services to our hedge and private equity fund customers. As a Fund Accounting Manager, you will be responsible for the accounting operations and resolution of accounting issues for clients.

What you will do:
As the main contact for clients, we will need you to demonstrate your expertise in the area of offshore and domestic fund accounting and administration for alternative funds.
You will manage the delegation of funds to your team, coordinate/onboard new fund set ups, serve as a liaison between clients and internals teams, and work closely with all parties to provide accurate and thorough accounting packages.
As the record keepers for the fund, you and your team will be involved in the coordination and support of various year-end audit engagements in accordance with GAAP accounting standards.
We will need you to perform due-diligence to ensure clients are in compliance with government laws and regulations.
You will be required to adhere to our Anti-Money Laundering policies and procedures when reviewing all fund transactions.
As a Fund Accounting Manager, you are responsible for ensuring your team is in compliance with our department’s rules and regulations designed to stop the practice of generating income through illegal actions.
You and your team will generate and reconcile all accounting reporting, such as month-end valuation reports.
You will review and approve month-end valuations prior to distribution to client with a goal of 100% accuracy. In addition, you will authorize wire payments from fund’s escrow accounts.
You will correspond with investment managers and regarding day-to-day inquiries, including questions on transactions associated with the fund(s), administration servicing planning and reporting of funds and financial statements. Client engagement and a dedication to quality service is a must for success.
You will connect with investment managers, transfer agents, and sales and service teams to resolve open issues and questions, getting in touch with internal technology support and vendor support when necessary to resolve any production issues or system support queries.
You will conduct performance appraisals, monthly one-on-ones with your supervisors and analysts and provide career pathing and training.
You will also ensure staffing requirements are met by assessing resource requirements, interviewing candidates and hiring employees.
You will provide and champion a team environment to include individual development, promotions and disciplinary action.
You will support the new business development and relationship teams for prospect calls, client visits and presentations.
You will facilitate the on-boarding of new and converted clients by gathering client requirements, submitting any custom requests and communicating key deliverables to your team members.
We want you to succeed and look for future solutions! Through attending and participating in various IMS and corporate professional development sessions, you will acquire the tools to identify processes across the division and organization.
You will have the opportunity to partner with a diverse team and grow your career.
What we need from you:
BA / BS in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics or equivalent professional experience.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the fund services industry, alternatives experience required.
Minimum of 2 years’ supervisory or management experience.
Intermediate skills in Microsoft Excel.
Ability to commute to Stamford or Hartford, CT.
What we would like from you:
The self-motivation, organization and drive to complete multiple client deliverables in a timely manner without sacrificing excellence or quality.
Strong written and verbal communication skills as you will primarily support your clients through email and/or phone calls.
Strong customer service skills as you will be communicating daily with your clients and other service providers.
A drive to broaden one’s knowledge of the financial services industry by learning new concepts and systems and taking the initiative to apply it to daily work assignments.
Attention-to-detail to ensure that all deliverables consistently meet the highest standard of quality and accuracy.
Collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
As the needs of our clients change, we need to be flexible to change with them.
Positivity and collegial approach in assisting both colleagues and clients and the ability to work in team environment.
Curiosity, critical thinking and attention to detail: Whether it’s to identify a solution to a problem or possibly help implement a more efficient process or procedure, your skills have a place in our business.
Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun. Please see our website for more information. https://www.seic.com/

The base salary pay for this role is $100,000 - $160,000 per year. This position will also be eligible to earn a discretionary bonus each year, subject to company approval.

SEI’s competitive advantage:

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive care for your physical and mental well-being, a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, a hybrid working environment for most roles, support for working parents and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

title: HRIS Analyst-Payroll and Support
description:
SEI is seeing to hire a HR Information Systems Analyst – Payroll Specialist who will bridge the work between the payroll (Dayforce) and human capital management (Workday) systems.  This includes monitoring activities across the various global payroll groups, improving processes between each system and providing support to SEI employees.  This role must create new processes between SEI Payroll, Workforce Benefits and Development teams.  By continuing to drive process improvements, SEI employees will gain clarity of all the corporate employee tools used to manage their compensation, benefits, retirement savings, career, continuing education and training.  In addition, this position will work with members of the HRIS team to own and deliver process improvement, system enhancements, dashboards and tools required by SEI leadership. 

What you will do:

This role will provide the governance of data between both the HCM (Workday) and payroll / benefits (Dayforce) systems.  In addition, this role will create, run and continuously automate the support model for Payroll, Workforce Development and Benefits activities.  This role will also drive system improvements across all HRIS systems and lead projects with key vendors.  

This individual serves as a point of contact for HR related technologies, and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing system changes, report writing, data analytics and analyzing data flows for process improvement.

Monitory, support and enhance integrations from Dayforce and Workday.  Will need to lead work across both internal teams and multiple vendors.  Lead HRIS payroll projects Identify, remediate, and deliver lasting solutions to payroll issues
Work with the HRIS team to enhance and develop all reporting needs.
Lead all Dayforce and Workday audits.  Build and execute monitoring schedule in compliance with SOX governance.
Monitor and work daily with payroll vendors to ensure they meet all project deliverables, SLA, and are not negatively impact services during product releases.
Identify, remediate, and deliver lasting solutions to Dayforce issues.  Continually look to optimize Dayforce configurations and workflows.
Continue to build relationships and knowledge of products and services in HRIS technologies.  Identify and help drive business cases for strategic investments to improve services or drive cost reductions.
Develop and enhance the employee support model that covers payroll, benefits, workforce and technical issues.  Continue to develop model to scale support for new products and services.

Monitory, support and enhance integrations from Dayforce and Workday.  Will need to lead work across both internal teams and multiple vendors. Lead HRIS payroll projects Identify, remediate, and deliver lasting solutions to payroll issues.

Manage and lead support team.  Look for staffing opportunities with the programs and resources within the Workforce Development team.

Experience creating support models and driving process improvements

title: Client Money Analyst
description:
You will be working within the CASS  team and be integral in the day to day achievement of objectives, to include day to day preparation of the client money reconciliations, preparing monthly submission of CMAR to FCA and supporting internal and external audits.


What you’ll do:
 

›       Preparation of the daily Internal Client Money Reconciliation (ICMR) in line with FCA requirements and arrange appropriate funding, escalating large items as relevant.

›       Prepare the Client Money and Asset Return (CMAR) in line with the FCA rules

›       Review and produce management information to identify, manage and report CASS and regulatory activities to relevant internal and external parties.

›       Supporting Cass audits  (internal and external) and compliance monitoring reviews

›       Identify changes to current regulatory controls, procedures and reporting that will strengthen internal controls, enhance efficiency, reduce risk and maximize the use of technology.

›        Preparing Client Money Acknowledgement letters and maintain accounts database

›       Support custody related data requests, S793, SRD II and CSDR returns.

›       All SIEL employees are responsible for the identification, assessment and control of risks and risk events. Employees will maintain a good understanding of  applicable policies, procedures, risk appetites and tolerance relevant to their function and or business unit, and are expected to consider current and potential risks when making or informing business decisions. Employees are responsible for the accurate and timely escalation and recording of incidents associated to relevant risks. In addition, employees are responsible for completing all required Risk Management training.


What you’ll bring to the role:

›       Must have a good understanding of the CASS rules (client money, custody and mandates), including but not limited to the, CASS daily client money calculation rules, the CASS reconciliation and other related operational functions 

›       Advanced technical knowledge of Excel/PowerPoint/Word

›       Workiva system knowledge advantageous

Attributes we value:

›       Strong work ethic, methodical, and keen attention to detail

›       Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads

›       Good interpersonal skills, willingness and ability to discuss and collaborate with colleagues and stake holders at various levels

title: Business Development Director
description:
SEI’s Advisor business is growing the Sales & Experience Team to continue to accelerate business growth. To support this expansion, SEI is seeking a qualified Business Development Director to join the team!

In this high-profile business development role, this professional will be the most prominent client- and prospective-client-facing individual—responsible for new producing advisor acquisition, onboarding, and activation, as well as territory management—to drive the continued growth of assets and relationships in the Independent Broker/Dealer (IBD) channel of SEI’s Advisor business.

This is an excellent opportunity for an accomplished sales and client experience specialist who is passionate about leading change, and whose business development and buyer-influencing skills will build long-lasting client partnerships.

This role reports directly to a Managing Director and works with a dedicated Account Executive and cross-functionally across the Sales, Marketing, Solutions and Service organizations of the business. Together, you will be responsible for territory growth goals and overseeing the totality of business development, relationship management, account management, and experience for advisor-client firms in the territory.

This role is territory-based, covering a territory that includes Kansas, Missouri, and Nebraska. 

What you will do:

Lead business development and territory management for firms in the Independent Broker/Dealer channel.

Work in coordination with partner Account Executive to drive territory strategy planning.

Analyze market data, trends, consumer preferences, and competitor behavior to optimize client and territory growth.

Influence the development and acquisition of new advisor-client relationships at all stages in the buying journey.

Shape and implement sophisticated, diverse and collaborative growth agendas, with a focus on motivating prospective-clients to embrace change and convert business.

Generate new interest and prospective-client leads—constantly staying ahead of new opportunities—while also managing the development of inorganic leads through the sales process.

Proactively engage clients and prospective-clients, led by in-person meetings, online-meetings, telephone and email, and both in-person and virtual presentations, to drive sales agendas and support advisor-client’s full engagement health.

Through mastery of SEI’s suite-of-solutions, educate and persuade with a process to support clients in their engagement with SEI, across custody, technology, asset management and business-centric solutions.

What we need from you:

A minimum of 7 years of experience in financial services client sales and service support, with direct experience in IBD channel sales strongly preferred.

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics or in a related field.

Advanced degree or credentials, specifically in the business administration and/or planning areas—MBA and/or CFP®—preferred.

Current NASAA Series 65 or Series 66 license or ability to acquire within 90 days.

Extensive experience in multi-channel communication mediums, including individual face-to-face interactions, in-person one-to-many presentations, virtual one-to-many presentations, live video, recorded video, phone and email.

Ability to influence decision-making at the highest levels of an organization, while performing with a client-first mentality, and an established background in consultative sales.

Consistent record of performance in territory management—both in strategic planning, execution, and travel—with outstanding time-management, organizational and mentor skills, plus the track record of exceeding goals.

Excellent written and verbal communications skills with a track record in client relationship management and buyer satisfaction.

This position includes territory management and up to 80% travel potential.

What we would like from you:

Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun. Please see our website for more information. https://www.seic.com

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive care for your physical and mental well-being, a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, a hybrid working environment for most roles, support for working parents and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
We have a challenging career opportunity for a DevOps/SRE Engineer. You will have the ability to automate tasks that cause friction for both our customers and developers.  You also love everything about the web and understand the pace of technology and embrace it.  You’ll work on cloud based solutions and help product teams meet their goals by creating processes, and writing code to automate those processes.  You know how to work closely with the business to build cutting-edge solutions following the lean/Agile development process.

What you will do:

Create, manage, and maintain cloud infrastructure
Implement monitoring for applications and infrastructure
Automate developer processes
Ensure organization compliance requirements are met
Ensure security of platform
Plan, deploy, and maintain critical business applications in prod/non-prod cloud environments.
Engineer suitable release management procedures and provide production support.
Drive improvements to processes and design enhancements to automation to continuously improve production environments.
Build tools to reduce occurrences of errors and improve development experience
Perform root cause analysis for incidents and outages
Design procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance
Maintain and contribute to our knowledge base and documentation.

What we need from you:

BA/BS, in a related technical field; or the equivalent in education and work experience
Minimum of 5 years prior work experience working with an application development organization Hands on demonstrable experience with AWS based services
Experience with SCM tools such as Git, Bitbucket, or GitHub
Experience with container management using Docker, ECS, or Kubernetes
Experience setting up, administrating, and maintaining log aggregations with tools such as OpenSearch or Elastic
Experience managing CI/CD builds for Java, NodeJS, and Dotnet based web applications with tools such as Jenkins or GitLab
Experience with Infrastructure as Code with Terraform and CloudFormation
Experience scripting in Bash, Python, or Powershell
Experience working on large scale cloud based web applications

What we would like from you:

Ability to clearly communicate both verbally and in writing with client and team members, including experience documenting and presenting findings
Excellent analytical skills, organizational abilities, and problem-solving skills
Self-starter who works efficiently in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a geographically distributed team
Ability to think creatively and seek optimum solutions
Ability to grasp loosely defined concepts and transform them into tangible results and key deliverables
Diagnostic skills with the ability to analyze technical, business and financial issues and options
Ability to infer from previous examples, willingness to understand how an application is put together
Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun.  Please see our website for more information. 

The base salary pay for this role is $135,000 - $145,000 per year.

This position will also be eligible to earn a discretionary bonus each year, subject to company approval.

title: Senior Product Support Engineer
description:
Employer:         SEI Investments Company

Position:           Senior Product Support Engineer

Location:           1 Freedom Valley Drive, Oaks, PA 19456

Job Duties: The Senior Product Support Engineer relies on experience working with an application development organization, as well as in quality assurance of financial software application; enterprise content management performing quality assurance and production support; testing and implementing solutions to support the technical capabilities for financial document management systems and AFP and Xerox-based statement archival and retrieval; developing detail level project documentation, project plans, implementation plans, and project test plans; developing and implementing procedures for ensuring ongoing operations and proactive maintenance of the software or technology for a Financial Technology business; enterprise content management using Rocket Software’s Mobius suite of products, which includes Mobius View (UI and API’s) and Mobius for Windows (including the Archival, indexing, administration, and user entitlement); implementing and performing automated quality assurance plans using Test Complete; MS SQL; and Java, JavaScript, and PowerShell. The Senior Product Support Engineer is responsible for the following: analyzing, coordinating, and implementing automated quality assurance test plans based on business requirements; coordinating User Acceptance Testing with the development and production support teams; documenting and reviewing of business requirements for new development items; working with development staff to ensure they understand the work to be performed; utilizing core applications and/or database systems; providing oral and written technical problem root cause analysis, resolution and application support; serving the role as owner of Release, Upgrade, and Implementation projects and tasks; and participating in cross-functional teams to support business strategies as they change. Remote work is permitted.

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field plus post-baccalaureate experience working with an application development organization. Must also possess seven (7) years of experience in quality assurance of financial software application. Five (5) years of experience with each of the following: Enterprise content management performing quality assurance and production support; Testing and implementing solutions to support the technical capabilities for financial document management systems and AFP and Xerox-based statement archival and retrieval; Developing detail level project documentation, project plans, implementation plans, and project test plans; Developing and implementing procedures for ensuring ongoing operations and proactive maintenance of the software or technology for a Financial Technology business; Enterprise content management using Rocket Software’s Mobius suite of products, must include Mobius View (UI and API’s) and Mobius for Windows (including the Archival, indexing, administration, and user entitlements); Implementing and performing automated quality assurance plans using Test Complete; MS SQL; and Java, JavaScript, and PowerShell.

Please Mail Resumes to: Denise Mapes, Workforce Development, SEI Investments Company at 1 Freedom Valley Drive Oaks, PA 19456. Reference # SPSE0525CK.

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
This Senior Project Manager role would suit someone with significant experience in the Wealth platform arena, with strong implementation experience, the energy and tenacity to collaborate across teams, while working closely with a variety of stakeholders (internally and within our clients) to deliver successful project outcomes.

The Change team is responsible for the implementation of the SEI Wealth Platform (SWP) for new clients, (forward-thinking Independent Wealth Advisors, Private Banks and Private Client Investment Managers (PCIMS)).  They also manage significant business change projects for existing clients as well as manage internal change processes across the business units.

The SWP solution is a comprehensive set of services which includes the SEI Wealth Platform (SWP) – (the client wealth management administration platform delivered with SEI’s operational services in an outsourced environment) and SEI Asset Management Solutions (the investment management services and client advice processes that enable wealth managers to meet client goals). 

What you will do:

To lead a cross functional team to; 

Pre-Sales/Pre-Project

Assist the technical sales in mapping out prospective clients’ business models to align them to SWP and define the implementation project approach 

Represent the Change team in meetings with prospective clients explaining how the team works within the context of SEI and ongoing client relationships 

Estimating costs and effort to deliver projects to ensure commercial viability

Onboard new business

Working with new and/or existing clients to onboard new business effective to the SEI Wealth Platform

Co-ordinate with internal SEI teams to ensure that successful transition of the business onto the platform

Ensuring that new business and committed project activities are in line with standard service offerings

Project Methodology & Controls   

Ensuring project risk, issues, dependencies, deliverables etc are managed effectively to resolution and where necessary escalated for further action

Ensuring appropriate governance and reporting processes in place

Developing and managing key project documentation

Project Execution

Ensure effective testing and validation of new services to clients

Shape and deliver client training and resolve issues to improve their usage of the services/applications

Identifying and present solutions to potential issues that may arise over the project lifecycle

Serve as a client advocate through regular, collaborative interactions with other SEI teams

Working with key subject matter experts across SEI (UK & US)

What we need from you:

Deep knowledge of the Wealth and/or the Investment Management industry and supporting technologies and products

Experience in delivering a number of complex implementation projects to transition financial assets and static data and implementing support services – within a SAS and/ or BPO environment

Experience working across one or more Wealth Management platforms

Adaptable working style, with a willingness to work across a span of activities during the project lifecycle in order to meet key milestones

Demonstrated ability to evolve an implementation approach leveraging best practise thinking and client excellence 

Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team environment

Demonstrated ability to challenge and influence senior stakeholders

Strong familiarity with current UK regulation and evolving themes

Take on a leadership role within the Change team, assisting in the career development and mentoring of team members.

What we would like from you:

Strong and effective communicator (verbal and written)

Self-starter

Have attention to detail and a thoroughness in application across specific activities

Strong and effective communication

Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team environment. 

The ability to build strong relationships with internal teams and senior stakeholders

Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun.  Please see our website for more information.  https://www.seic.com/

title: Senior Manager - Operational Oversight & Outsourcing
description:
SEI Investments is a leading global provider of asset management and investment technology solutions.  The company’s innovative solutions help corporations, financial institutions, financial advisors, and affluent families create and manage wealth. SEI is a people focused organization which encourages and recognizes employee development as being a critical component in the provision of excellent client service. An open, collaborative and detail oriented environment underpins this business objective.

Whilst the parent company has its principal offices in the United States, the SEI Group comprises operating subsidiaries in the EU, UK, Cayman Islands and Canada. The SEI Group’s operations in Ireland are carried out through three entities based in Dublin that conduct the Group’s business of managing proprietary UCITS and AIF funds, as well as providing administration and depositary services to funds established by third party investment managers. 

Position Description:

The Senior Manager, Operational Oversight & Outsourcing is responsible for the oversight of various key deliverables including but not limited to Fund Accounting, Investor Servicing, Anti Money Laundering, Outsource Service Providers (OSPs).  The senior manager will work closely with Operations, Management, legal and Compliance to manage all aspects of the Outsource Program. The individual will work collaboratively across a number of SEI teams and legal entities globally to ensure Central Bank of Ireland (CBI) guidelines and requirements are adhered to and will escalate if issues or concerns arise. The individual is responsible for maintaining proactive and satisfactory relationships with all OSPs.

What you’ll do:

Oversight & Outsourcing:

Together with Senior Management determine oversight and outsource strategy for the relevant operational teams in line with overall company strategy and business plan

Establish objectives and goals to meet agreed strategy

Responsible for the effective oversight and governance around outsourcing including coordination of Outsourcing Committee(s) and meeting all regulatory requirements

Ensure all outsource documentation including Terms of Reference, policies, training, ongoing monitoring, KPIs, register are maintained accurately, timely and to the highest standards

Present regularly to SEI’s internal board of Directors, in addition to Fund’s Boards.

Ensure acceptable client service standards are maintained with ultimate goal of complete client referenceabilty

Process Improvement and Efficiency:

Ensure innovation to improve efficiencies, enhance client service and maintain satisfactory controls within the various oversight teams

People Management:

Manage teams and personnel and maintain a satisfactory level of people management and work environment

Ensure succession planning process in place and operational within department through identification and development of high potential personnel

Champion HR policies and ensure all are applied and maintained

title: Financial Reporting Senior Analyst - 9 Month Maternity Contract
Private Equity Fund Accounting Supervisor - Maternity Cover 6 months Contract
description:
SEI Investments is a leading global provider of asset management and investment technology solutions.  The company’s innovative solutions help corporations, financial institutions, financial advisors, and affluent families create and manage wealth. SEI is a people focused organization which encourages and recognizes employee development as being a critical component in the provision of excellent client service. An open, collaborative and detail oriented environment underpins this business objective.

Whilst the parent company has its principal offices in the United States, the SEI Group comprises operating subsidiaries in the EU, UK, Cayman Islands and Canada. The SEI Group’s operations in Ireland are carried out through three entities based in Dublin that conduct the Group’s business of managing proprietary UCITS and AIF funds, as well as providing administration and depositary services to funds established by third party investment managers. 

Position Description:

The Supervisor will be a core part of a team in a high growth area of SEI. This individual will be responsible maintaining and reviewing the accounting books and records of the Funds in the team, including the calculation of the Net Asset Value, preparation of financial statements and regulatory reporting in addition to forging strong internal relationships within their team and client.

What you’ll do:

Ensure that the review of the Fund’s NAV is accurate and delivered on a timely basis

Responsible for the review of expenses schedules, income calculations, capital activity calculations and fund fee calculations

Ensure the established controls are maintained and followed during the Nav production cycle.

Participate and lead in the preparation and readiness for new Fund launches within your team

Serve as initial point of contact for clients on fund accounting matters pertaining to Nav production

Build a strong relationship within your team and with your client through a conscientious approach to query management and problem resolution

Build a strong relationship with all SEI teams and third-party stakeholders in the Nav Production cycle

Build a strong product knowledge through exposure to complex Fund structures and financial instruments

Supervise, train, coach and mentor analysts on core tasks, systems processing/reporting and procedures

Participate in department initiatives and group projects as appropriate.

Provide input and feedback regarding employees’ ongoing performance / development / performance appraisals

What you bring to the table:

4 years + experience in Fund operations with experience in Alternative Funds. Some experience in private markets is preferable.

Ability to work effectively in a team, build positive working relationships across the board, take responsibility for assigned work and helping your peers and your manager.

ACCA qualified preferable but not essential

Effective and confident communication, both written and oral.

Experience with analysis of the Trial Balance, general ledger entries, and at a minimum, basic management and performance fee calculations.

Experience in working on funds with closed ended structures,

Experience in reviewing Limited Partnership Agreements and OM’s and fee agreements

Third Level qualification in Finance or Business (desirable)

Attributes we value:

Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills and attention to detail

Strong Organisational and administrative skills

Energy, accountability and drive

Strong oral and written communication skills.

Fluency in English Language (both verbal and written) essential.

Team player with positive ‘can do’ attitude with excellent problem-solving skills.

title: Product Owner
description:
SEI delivers technology and investment solutions that connect the financial services industry. With capabilities across investment processing, operations, and asset management, we work with corporations, financial institutions and professionals, and ultra-high-net-worth families to solve problems, manage change, and help protect assets.  Technology and operations: The heartbeat of our business.

We work with our clients to tackle the whole of business transformation. From the front to back office, our technology solutions create connections that empower our clients to take control and reshape their businesses. We offer end-to-end platforms for wealth and investment management, delivered as flexible outsourced infrastructure solutions that include processing, fund administration, information analytics, and cybersecurity services.

As a Product Manager, you will primarily focus on executing on the product roadmap. To be successful you will be (or become) the subject matter expert for the products you support, and have an understanding of the overall platform in which those products operate.  The Product Manager acts as the primary facilitator among the development teams, the other Product Team leaders, Development Teams, and the user community (clients and operations) in support of their products.

What you will do:

Coordinate and execute detailed requirements gathering & documentation for one/more assigned products.
Collaborate with the Director for prioritization based on funding and development capacity.
Continuously review and refine the backlog of requirements using Jira as SDLC tool.
Lead and facilitate all Agile ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
You are the SME in this role, providing knowledge and expertise in this business area/product to business analysts, development team members, and the user community.
Create and deliver communications throughout the development cycle to stakeholders at all levels, including release planning content, feature/story-level acceptance criteria new/modified functionality overviews, user guides, and release notes.
Monitor employee performance and provide continuous feedback for software engineers.

What we need from you:

BA/BS in Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting, Business or applicable experience.
5+ years’ experience with a strong background in Product and Development disciplines
Financial Services experience, preferably FinTech experience in Asset Management or Wealth Management.
Experience with Agile and Iterative development methodologies.
Experience with software development management/tracking tools (i.e. Jira, Microsoft TFS, Rally, etc.).

What we would like from you:

Ability to synthesize information arising from multiple directions, and generalize specific issues or requests into functional requirements for broader application.
Curiosity, critical thinking and attention to detail.  Solutions-oriented with strong problem solving skills.
Project management experience, and the self-motivation, organization and drive to manage and complete multiple projects in a timely manner without sacrificing quality.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.  Ability to clearly articulate performance problems and solutions related to complex financial instruments and transactions.
Demonstrated leadership experience as a team lead or similar role.
Ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders. As the needs of our clients change, we need to be flexible to change with them.
Ability to work on several projects simultaneously and to thrive in a project-based environment within a lean team.
Capacity to work within complex systems and large data sets.
Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun.  Please see our website for more information.  https://www.seic.com/

The base salary pay for this role is $125,000 - $140,000 per year.

This position will also be eligible to earn a discretionary bonus each year, subject to company approval.

SEI’s competitive advantage:

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive care for your physical and mental well-being, a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, a hybrid working environment for most roles, support for working parents and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. 

Benefits include healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription, wellness, EAP, FSA), life and disability insurance (premiums paid for base coverage), 401(k) match, education assistance, commuter benefits, up to 11 paid holidays/year, 21 days PTO/year pro-rated for new hires which increases over time, paid parental leave, back-up childcare arrangements, paid volunteer days, a discounted stock purchase plan, investment options, access to thriving employee networks and more.

We are a technology and asset management company delivering on our promise of building brave futures (SM)—for our clients, our communities, and ourselves.  Come build your brave future at SEI.  


SEI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and so much more…


After over 50 years in business, SEI remains a leading global provider of investment processing, investment management, and investment operations solutions. Reflecting our experience within financial services and financial technology our offices encompass an open floor plan and numerous art installations designed to encourage innovation and creativity in our workforce. We recognize that our people are our most valuable asset and that a healthy, happy, and motivated workforce is key to our continued growth. At SEI, we’re (literally) invested in your success. title: Software Engineer II
description:
We are looking for a passionate Full Stack Software Engineer, who is ready to work on the cutting edge of FinTech software solutions. You will be joining our team of experts to build the next generation of alternative investment platforms. You will engineer solutions to challenging and meaningful problems, with the goal of expanding and enhancing the solutions suite. You should possess solid software development and programming skills, have a sound understanding of engineering best practices and have the drive to deliver the very best.

Additionally, you must have excellent communication skills, since you will be working with sales and support teams as well as 3rd party API development teams.

What you will do:

You will be writing code across all tiers of our application using technologies like Angular, Typescript, Javascript and Java.
You will be writing RESTFul APIs in a microservice architecture using Node.js and AWS Lambda.
You will participate in all the design meetings and stand-ups that you and the team conduct.
You’ll work with embedded product managers and software testers to take a holistic approach to your software development.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field  
A minimum of 3 years of experience working on a multi-tiered cloud-based application.
Demonstrated experience with the following: .Net, Java or Golang, JavaScript/TypeScript, SASS, HTML, Angular, Snaplogic, Kafka and Node.js.
Hands on coding experience with RDBMS or NoSQL databases in a distributed system
Deep understanding of Agile development best practices such as TDD and continuous delivery
Experience or exposure with cybersecurity application development concept.
Strong knowledge of design patterns and software engineering best practices.

Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Love of technology and an eye for applying it to existing and upcoming challenges and opportunities.
Exposure to the capital markets and investing
Someone who will embody our SEI Values of courage, integrity, collaboration, inclusion, connection and fun

This team follows a hybrid schedule and works in the office 2-3 days per week.

title: Finance - Perpetual Finance – SEC Reporting Managing Director - Retail Funds
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. title: Blackstone Credit & Insurance - Asset Management, Senior Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Job Description

Business Unit: Blackstone Credit & Insurance


Blackstone Credit & Insurance (“BXCI”) is one of the world’s leading credit investors. Our investments span the credit markets, including private investment grade, asset-based lending, public investment grade and high yield, sustainable resources, infrastructure debt, collateralized loan obligations, direct lending and opportunistic credit. We seek to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns for institutional and individual investors by offering companies capital needed to strengthen and grow their businesses. BXCI is also a leading provider of investment management services for insurers, helping those companies better deliver for policyholders through our world-class capabilities in investment grade private credit.


Job Title: Senior Associate 


Responsibilities:
Blackstone Credit & Insurance’s Asset Management group mobilizes resources to preserve investor capital and enhance investment returns in challenged situations. Once assets that are or could be challenged are identified, the Asset Management group proactively engages with owners, management, and other stakeholders to preserve value. 


The Senior Associate will work to address distressed positions within the portfolio, restructuring if necessary, and support the maximization of returns post-restructuring by adding value to the management teams as further described below. The team employs a private equity mindset when managing assets by taking an active role in turnarounds, value-creation strategies, and exit planning. 


The main areas of responsibility will include assisting senior team members with:

Preparing investment memoranda, analyses (with significant emphasis on identifying root causes of underperformance), financial forecasts, and other ad-hoc requests to support real-time decision making related to existing investments

Restructuring of capital structures by evaluating financial models, identifying optimal financing solutions, and supporting negotiations to enhance liquidity, reduce debt burdens, and secure long-term financial stability for an organization

Providing comprehensive support to management and the board of directors by preparing detailed analyses, strategic recommendations, and facilitating effective decision-making to drive business performance and achieve corporate objectives. This could include participating in due diligence processes for potential add-on acquisitions & divestitures as part of broader restructuring efforts

If required, coordinating the selection and engagement of third-party consultants and service providers for value creation initiatives

Developing and maintaining a comprehensive understanding of industry trends, competitive landscapes, and regulatory environments to inform strategic decision-making for control / significant minority equity positions

Driving and reporting on the progress of turnaround initiatives, providing regular updates to BXCI senior management on key financial metrics, operational milestones, and risk factors

Qualifications:
Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, have sound judgement and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. In addition to strong analytical skills, the successful candidate should have:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, business administration, economics, or a related field; advanced degrees (e.g., MBA) or professional certifications (e.g., CFA, CPA) are a plus, but not required

Minimum of 3 years of experience in investment banking, restructuring advisory, private equity/private credit, management consulting, or a related field, with a focus on distressed assets or turnaround situations

Demonstrated proficiency in financial modeling, valuation techniques, and scenario analysis, with a strong ability to assess complex financial structures and understand the implications of various restructuring alternatives

Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills, with the ability to synthesize large amounts of data into actionable insights and coherent strategies

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively presenting analysis and recommendations to management teams, boards of directors, and external stakeholders

Proven track record of working collaboratively in a team environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously, and meeting tight deadlines under pressure  

Strong EQ, with an ability to navigate between internal demands and building strong working relationships with management teams

High level of initiative and motivation, with a keen interest in the dynamics of companies and a passion for developing creative solutions to complex problems

Familiarity with industry-specific challenges and opportunities, with the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new sectors


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

$175,000 - $200,000

title: Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA) - Multi Asset Portfolio Strategist, Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Unit:

Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA) manages $88 billion across a diversified set of businesses. We strive to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns across market cycles while mitigating downside risk. Our strategies include Absolute Return, which supports diversification, and Multi-Strategy, which invests opportunistically across asset classes, including direct investments.   

Job Description: 

The Portfolio Strategy Group (PSG) is a part of the Absolute Return investment team within BXMA. PSG is responsible for bringing a technical investment lens to client and prospect interactions. More specifically, PSG liaises with the BXMA sales team and a variety of other teams within BXMA, to ensure that:

Portfolios are positioned to accomplish the long-term objectives of our clients.

Performance outcomes are well understood by our clients in the context of broader market and industry developments.

Clients view BXMA as a long-term partner that can help enhance their organizations beyond simply managing their capital.        

Responsibilities:

Client & Prospect Coverage – The most essential function of PSG generally, and this role specifically, is to work closely with clients and prospects to ensure a strong experience. This includes developing a detailed knowledge of each organization’s unique needs, delivering portfolio reviews to existing clients, and working with the portfolio construction team to position current and prospective mandates for success.

Continued Enhancement of Optimal Positioning – PSG is responsible for the core positioning that we use with all clients and prospects to explain our investment performance, our investment process, and our value-add. The team will continue to refine this positioning over time as our offerings, the markets, and our competitive advantages evolve.

Thought Leadership – Contribute to external white papers, thought pieces, and other content that will help communicate our messaging to clients and potential prospects.

Provide Guidance on Materials – Provide specifications to partner teams on what materials need to be created for a given client or prospect deliverable. Periodically, in time sensitive situations, pitch in on creating materials.

Liaise with Sales Team on Long-Term Business Plans – Work with senior sales teams, for different client types and jurisdictions, to determine what is needed to support growth.

Qualifications: 

3+ years of experience in hedge funds, an allocator role, or multi-asset investment management would be ideal but other areas of financial services may also be considered 

CFA or second degree is a bonus but is not imperative.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Good process and project management skills.

Think quickly and manage a number of deliverables, from a variety of stakeholders, simultaneously.

Interest in financial markets and investing.

Interest in business building and desire to be commercial.

Interest in interaction with prospects and clients.

description:

Blackstone Multi-Asset Investing (BXMA) manages $83 billion across a diversified set of businesses. We strive to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns across market cycles while mitigating downside risk. Our strategies include Absolute Return, which supports diversification, and Multi-Strategy, which invests opportunistically across asset classes, including direct investments.   

Blackstone’s Global Fund Finance is seeking an Assistant Vice President to assist in the production of monthly Net Asset Values and reporting for the Hedge Fund Solutions platform.  Responsibilities include calculations of estimated NAVs, reconciliation of final NAVs, processing of investor payments, oversight of expense budgeting, hedging and cash reconciliations, certain client reporting functions, and fund structuring and restructuring.  

Responsibilities:

Review monthly estimate and final Fund NAV’s
Review and analyze NAV reconciliations with various third party administrators and custodians
Review and reconcile the calculation of pay management and performance fees
Review and reconcile client capital statements generated by third party administrators
Review and reconcile fund foreign currency exposure and coordinate hedging
Assist and coordinate team members in responding to client requests
Review customized client reporting including calculation of time weighted returns and IRRs
Review monthly revenue reporting and assist in review of projections
Assist in the setup and launch of new products and Funds
Review cash flow analysis reporting to support the investment process
Review capital call and distribution calculations and review investor notices
Collaborate with offshore resources with NAV production
Collaborate with Operations teams including Middle Office, Pricing, Financial Reporting, Management Reporting, Legal and Compliance, and Regulatory Reporting
Utilize technology and outsourced solutions to enhance efficiencies and controls
Oversee service providers to achieve superior service
Work with reporting teams to properly present data in audited financial statements and regulatory filings
Review legal documents for fund accounting process considerations

Qualifications:

BS (or above) in Accounting or Finance
6+ years of public or private accounting experience
CPA, and/or CFA preferred
Experience with PE, hedge fund and/or FoHF investing
Strong understanding of accounting ledger data
Accounting systems experience strongly preferred
Strong Excel skills
Excellent analytical and communication skills
Able to multi-task and effectively manage own time
A collaborative team player, always willing to assist colleagues

Private Equity   

With $152 billion of assets under management, Blackstone’s corporate private equity business has been a global leader since 1985. We uncover value by identifying great companies and enhancing their performance by providing strategic capital and outstanding management talent. We aim to grow stronger enterprises, create jobs, and enable our portfolio companies to build lasting value for our investors, their employees and all stakeholders.

Job Description:

The Administrative Assistant role entails providing support to a Managing Director and their team. The responsibilities include:

Managing calendar(s) including scheduling internal and external appointments, confirming meetings, coordinating with other assistants

Answering calls and acting as a gatekeeper

Acting as back-up support for other senior professionals

Booking conference rooms for internal and external meetings; meeting and greeting guests, registering guests in the visitor system

Completion of detailed corporate expenses including tracking receipts and reimbursements

Coordinating travel arrangements including flights, visas/passports, cars, hotels, and other reservations

Maintaining and organizing files

Ad hoc projects

4+ years of administrative assistant experience supporting a team of 3 or more

Strong written and verbal communication skills; high EQ

Highly organized with strong attention to detail

Multi-task and prioritize competing tasks and deadlines

Perform duties with confidentiality and professional integrity

Experience with coordinating travel arrangements

An independent worker with strong follow-through skills

Build effective professional relationships with key players and management

Creative thinker

Familiarity with Concur is preferred

Extensive familiarity with Microsoft suite

title: Real Estate - BREDS (Public Investments), Senior Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Unit: Real Estate

Business Unit Description:

Blackstone is a global leader in real estate investing. Blackstone’s real estate business was founded in 1991 and has US $320 billion of investor capital under management. Blackstone is the largest owner of commercial real estate globally, owning and operating assets across every major geography and sector, including logistics, data centers, residential, office and hospitality. Our opportunistic funds seek to acquire undermanaged, well-located assets across the world. Blackstone’s Core+ business invests in substantially stabilized real estate assets globally, through both institutional strategies and strategies tailored for income-focused individual investors including Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust, Inc. (BREIT). Blackstone Real Estate also operates one of the leading global real estate debt businesses, providing comprehensive financing solutions across the capital structure and risk spectrum, including management of Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE: BXMT).

Job Description: 

The Senior Associate will work directly with the BREDS Public Investments business, which is responsible for sourcing, analyzing and executing all liquid, real estate-related debt investments on behalf of Blackstone Real Estate. The Senior Associate will be responsible for credit underwriting on new corporate credit investments and ongoing monitoring of a portfolio of real estate-related corporate investments. This position offers an excellent opportunity to contribute to a dynamic and collaborative environment while enhancing your skills in credit analysis and real estate-related investments.

The Senior Associate’s work may include:

Conducting financial analysis and fundamental due diligence for both public and private companies.
Performing quarterly financial reviews to monitor credit strength and identify key trends.
Tracking and communicating material company developments to relevant stakeholders.
Interpreting and summarizing credit agreements to ensure compliance and understanding of key terms.
Building and maintaining complex financial models to evaluate investment opportunities and portfolio performance.
Preparing investment packages and presenting findings to senior management.
Collaborating with the team to collect, organize, and process documentation and credit-related information.
Conducting industry-level analysis to assess relative value within the portfolio and identify broader industry headwinds and tailwinds.

Qualifications:

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors.  The successful candidate should have the following qualifications:

Education: Undergraduate degree from a top-tier academic institution.
Experience: 3+ years experience in sales and trading, investment banking, or investment management experience.
Project Management: Experience managing multiple assignments and delivering high-quality results.
Communication Skills: Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Work Ethic: Highly motivated with a strong work ethic and a desire to thrive in a collaborative, small-team environment.
Analytical Thinking: Highly analytical mindset with a talent for identifying, scrutinizing, and improving complex processes.
Team Collaboration: Resourceful team player who excels at building trust and fostering professional relationships with colleagues and clients.
Multitasking: Manage multiple priorities and workstreams effectively.
Technical Tools: Exceptional Microsoft Excel and proficient Microsoft PowerPoint skills.

title: Blackstone Private Wealth Global Transfer Agent Oversight Manager, Principal
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

The Global Transfer Agent Oversight Manager will be responsible for overseeing the operational performance, compliance, and strategic alignment of transfer agent (TA) services across Blackstone’s Private Wealth Perpetual Funds.  This role ensures that TA and Distributor/Custodian processes are executed efficiently, accurately, and in compliance with regulatory requirements while delivering exceptional service to investors and advisors. The individual will act as the Senior liaison between Blackstone Business Units, Private Wealth, Distributors/Custodians and its third-party transfer agents, driving operational excellence, mitigating risks, and ensuring alignment with the firm’s broader objectives.

Job Description
•    Manage a team responsible for the day-to-day oversight of global transfer agent services, ensuring timely and accurate processing of investor transactions, including subscriptions, redemptions, transfers, and distributions.
•    Monitor performance metrics and service level agreements (SLAs) to ensure third-party transfer agents meet Blackstone’s standards for quality and efficiency.
•    Oversee transfer agent operations across multiple jurisdictions, ensuring consistency and adherence to local regulatory requirements.
•    Collaborate with regional teams to address market-specific challenges and opportunities.
•    Provide regular updates to senior leadership on TA performance, risks, and strategic initiatives.
•    Lead vendor selection, onboarding, and performance evaluation processes for new transfer agents globally.
•    Negotiate contracts and SLAs to ensure competitive pricing and high-quality service delivery.
•    Identify and address operational bottlenecks, errors, or inefficiencies in TA, Distributor and Custodian processes.
•    Drive partner engagement and manage relationships with operations and trading teams at distributors, custodians and FinTech platforms.
•    Ensure transfer agent operations comply with applicable regulations, including AML/KYC requirements, FATCA/CRS reporting, and other jurisdiction-specific rules.
•    Conduct regular audits and reviews of transfer agent processes to mitigate risks and ensure adherence to internal policies and external regulatory requirements.
•    Collaborate with legal, compliance, business development, product strategy and marketing teams to address changes impacting TA operations.
•    Coordinate with internal business partners’ cash and share activity and transaction reporting to balance records with fund accounting records.
•    Drive the adoption of technology solutions to streamline TA workflows, reduce manual errors, and improve investor experiences.
•    Collaborate with IT and data teams to ensure seamless integration of transfer agent platforms with Blackstone’s internal systems.
•    Ensure transfer agent operations deliver a seamless and positive experience for investors and advisors.
•    Address escalated investor inquiries and resolve complex issues related to TA processes.

Qualifications:
Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who work well in a team-driven working group, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. 
In addition, the successful candidate must meet the following qualifications:
•    Bachelor’s Degree.
•    8+ years of experience in transfer agent oversight, investor services, operations or related role(s) within asset management, private equity, or financial services.
•    Series 7 License. 
•    Experience managing vendor relationships and driving performance improvements.
•    Strong analytical skills in order to identify trends, risks, and opportunities in TA operations.
•    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, effectively collaborates across teams and regions.
•    Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and compliance.
•    Lead cross-functional initiatives and drive change in a complex, global environment.
•    Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing challenges.
•    Demonstrated experience effectively managing competing priorities and delivering results under tight deadlines.
•    Strong  Excel skills.
•    Enthusiastic, adaptable, and proactive.
•    Client focused.
 


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

Expected annual base salary range:

$200,000 - $250,000

Actual base salary within that range will be determined by several components including but not limited to the individual's experience, skills, qualifications and job location. For roles located outside of the US, please disregard the posted salary bands as these roles will follow a separate compensation process based on local market comparables.

Additional compensation: Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits offered in connection with the advertised role.

title: Real Estate – Capital Markets, Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Real Estate – Capital Markets, Associate

Business Unit:   

Real Estate

Location: New York, NY

Business Unit Overview:               

Blackstone is a global leader in real estate investing. Blackstone’s real estate business was founded in 1991 and has US $315 billion of investor capital under management. Blackstone is the largest owner of commercial real estate globally, owning and operating assets across every major geography and sector, including logistics, data centers, residential, office and hospitality. Our opportunistic funds seek to acquire undermanaged, well-located assets across the world. Blackstone’s Core+ business invests in substantially stabilized real estate assets globally, through both institutional strategies and strategies tailored for income-focused individual investors including Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust, Inc. (BREIT). Blackstone Real Estate also operates one of the leading global real estate debt businesses, providing comprehensive financing solutions across the capital structure and risk spectrum, including management of Blackstone Mortgage Trust (NYSE: BXMT).

Job Title:

Associate                            

Job Description:               

Associates in the Capital Markets group have the opportunity to participate in a wide range of capital markets and real estate transactions including public market debt and equity transactions, securitization, private market secured and unsecured credit deals, and interest rate and currency hedging transactions.

Responsibilities:

Associates will work on a wide range of transactions and responsibilities will typically include:

Providing analysis on financing alternatives for acquisitions and refinancings
Analyzing and tracking existing debt positions to identify accretive refinancing opportunities in conjunction with asset management and acquisition teams
Modeling financial costs, terms and structures in conjunction with deal team analysts
Assisting in the negotiation of financing terms and transactions
Assisting in the execution and closing of transactions
Assisting in the preparation of materials used to solicit bids from lenders on financings

Qualifications:                                  

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, intelligent, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. In addition to strong analytical and quantitative skills, the successful candidate should have:

3+ years of commercial real estate financing experience
High proficiency of Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
Be a collaborative team player
Excellent attention to detail
Highly motivated and diligent
Contribute positively to the collegial atmosphere of the team


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

description:

Business Unit:

Legal & Compliance

Business Description:

This role will work closely with the Global AML team and other members of the UK Financial Crime Team to support the maintenance and development of the Global AML program.

Job Title: Legal & Compliance – AML, Analyst

Job Description:

Support the AML/CFT process for counterparty due diligence, obtain key KYC information and screening for potential reputational and financial crime concerns, including those relating to PEPs, sanctions, and proliferation financing.
Support the distributor on-boarding process and ensure deadlines are met.
Disposition alerts within KYC database.
Liaise with legal counsel, deal teams, and third parties to support Blackstone’s internal processes relating to requests for information from counterparties.
Assist with ad-hoc global projects as required.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and mitigate potential money laundering risks.
Capacity of working autonomously and effectively manage priorities, as well as deadlines.
Work on ad-hoc projects as needed.

Qualifications:

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who works well in a team-driven working group, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors.  

The successful candidate must have:

Ideally between 1 – 3 years of experience
Undergraduate degree or equivalent
General knowledge of AML/CTF legal framework including UK, Luxembourg and EU
General knowledge and experience in adverse news screening
Strong investigative/analytical skills, able to formulate and clearly articulate a supportable rationale behind the decisioning of “alerts” within cases
Strong organisational skills and detailed oriented
Ability to manage multiple and competing priorities
Excellent written and oral communication and research skills
Strong work ethic
Ability to use Microsoft Office applications (pivot tables, charts, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

title: Blackstone Credit & Insurance - Business Management, Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Blackstone Credit & Insurance – Business Management, Associate 

Business Unit: 

Blackstone Credit & Insurance 

Business Unit Description:

Blackstone Credit & Insurance (“BXCI”) is one of the world’s leading credit investors. Our investments span the credit markets, including private investment grade, asset based lending, public investment grade and high yield, sustainable resources, infrastructure debt, collateralized loan obligations, direct lending and opportunistic credit. We seek to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns for institutional and individual investors by offering companies capital needed to strengthen and grow their businesses. BXCI is also a leading provider of investment management services for insurers, helping those companies better deliver for policyholders through our world-class capabilities in investment grade private credit.

Job Title: 

Associate 

Job Description:               

The Liquid Credit Strategies Team (“LCS”) manages $114B in AUM across diversified portfolios of (fixed income) debt investments, primarily consisting of senior secured floating rate bank loans and high yield bonds of non-investment grade companies. The group manages and sub-advises accounts in US and Europe, including Collateralized Loan Obligations, Separately Managed Accounts, Commingled Funds, Exchange Traded Funds and Closed End Funds. LCS also invests in the debt and equity tranches of CLOs.

The Business Management Associate will help prepare recurring business updates to senior leadership relating to items such as performance, AUM, fundraising targets and key success metrics.  The Business Management Associate will also help periodically review the viability of existing business lines and products as well as assist with monitoring of success metrics for third party distribution partners.

This role involves significant coordination across various teams within Blackstone Credit including Portfolio Management, Institutional Client Solutions, Finance and Middle Office.

The Associate will contribute to and work with the broader LCS COO team business to:

Aggregate key wins and LCS strategic updates weekly for senior leadership briefings
Review progress of fundraising targets in various channels against results
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and project manage/drive execution of new initiatives
Prepare presentations and memorandums for management and other key stakeholders
Perform ad hoc analyses and work on special projects as needed

Qualifications:                                  

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who work with in a team-driven environment, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. The successful candidate must have the following qualifications:

Prior Investment Banking (Credit or Asset Management) or Product Development/ Fund management experience preferred
At least 2 years of related experience
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics with a strong academic record
Self-starter, highly organized, and detail-oriented
Collaborative team player
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
Ability to adapt to new challenges in a dynamic environment while handling multiple projects
Possesses a strong work ethic, professional integrity, a positive attitude and genuine passion for excellence
Strong desire to work in an entrepreneurial environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
 


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.
