title: Blackstone Mortgage Trust (BXMT) Financial Analytics, Associate
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Unit Overview:

Blackstone’s real estate business is a global leader in real estate investing, with $320 billion of total capital under management. Blackstone’s real estate segment operates as one globally integrated business with approximately 840 employees and has investments across the globe, including in the Americas, Europe and Asia. Blackstone’s real estate investment teams seek to utilize their global expertise and presence to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns for its investors.  Blackstone Real Estate also operates one of the leading real estate finance platforms, Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies, including management of the publicly traded Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc. (NYSE: BXMT).

Job Overview:

In this role, the Associate will be an integral member of the BXMT Finance team, with a focus on financial analytics for BXMT.  The focus of the team is to develop analytics and produce reporting of BXMT’s financial results for key decision makers and business leaders to support strategic business decisions. Responsibilities will also include addressing a variety of management reporting and analytics, efficiency/technology initiatives, and support for the broader BXMT team.  The Financial Analytics Associate will contribute to and work closely with the broader Blackstone Real Estate Debt Strategies group (BREDS), including the investment team, capital markets, asset management, operations, financial reporting and legal/compliance.

Job Description:

Develop analyses and presentations supporting BXMT’s executive team in various business initiatives and strategic decisions
Coordinate with the Investment, Asset Management, and Operations teams to understand the latest performance and composition of BXMT’s business, capitalization, and loan portfolio
Collaborate with the BXMT Corporate Strategy and Shareholder Relations functions to prepare quarterly board of directors and earnings release materials
Drive analyses and diligence processes and provide support for public and private securities offerings and other financing and capital markets transactions
Assist in preparation of business financial forecasts and weekly reporting for senior management
Liaise with internal and external counsel regarding various business activities, including capital markets and other transactions
Execute ad hoc projects, and generate weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting for investors and management team

Qualifications:

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, intelligent, intellectually curious, have sound judgment, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. The successful candidate must meet the following qualifications:

BS (or above) in Finance, Accounting, or Economics 
A strong academic record
4+ years of finance-related experience is required
Prior work experience with real estate finance, banking/capital markets, and/or corporate finance is preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel; comfort working with large data sets and identifying data inconsistencies and patterns
Produces creative, compelling, detailed materials; strong proficiency in PowerPoint
Effectively multi-tasks and executes a wide range of assignments
Self-starter, detail-oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills
Collaborative team player with a high degree of intellectual curiosity
Possesses a strong work ethic, professional integrity, a positive attitude and genuine passion for excellence

description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Blackstone Private Wealth   

Blackstone Private Wealth was established to answer the growing demand for Blackstone products from high-net worth investors. Partnering with many of the world’s largest private banks and wealth management firms as well as family offices, Blackstone’s Private Wealth team packages and delivers the full breadth of Blackstone’s alternative product capability to these firms and their clients and provides ongoing product and advisor support, as well as education and training around alternatives.  

Job Description:

This role will work on a variety of interesting and cutting-edge legal and general corporate matters, with a focus on the formation and ongoing management of credit and real estate registered funds.

Primary job responsibilities will include:

Participating in the design and launch of new registered funds, broadly offered private funds, collective investment trusts, and other kinds of investment vehicles.

Research new product ideas and issues and work with counsel and stakeholders to propose solutions.

Coordinate and prepare materials to facilitate decisions regarding structuring of new products.

Overseeing the ongoing day-to-day management of new and existing registered funds and other Private Wealth vehicles.

Assisting leaders with project management on fund formation matters and participating in product development of various investment structures across multiple jurisdictions.

Support fund governance matters, liaise with external counsel, create, review and present from time-to-time, board materials and provide guidance to business colleagues and senior management on board proposals.

Managing regulatory filings (e.g., 8-Ks, 10-Q/Ks, Form 10s, N-2s, N-CSRs, and prospectus updates) and assisting with day-to-day oversight of legal matters.

Assisting with the development of a marketing and fundraising plan for registered funds. 

Working with the in-house Legal & Compliance team and external counsel to monitor and implement legal and regulatory developments that impact the registered funds.

Providing regulatory and legal advice to investment professionals and business personnel, including preparation of reports for the investment team and senior management.

Other projects as needed.

Qualifications:

6+ years of experience practicing law as a law firm associate or an in-house counsel, preferably focused on registered funds / investment management law. Capital markets or similar public company background would also be suitable.

Familiarity working on BDCs, interval funds, broadly offered private funds, and/or collective investment trusts is preferred but not required.

Experience with public company filings is required.

Creative problem solver with a can-do attitude.

Significant experience with the Investment Company Act of 1940 and familiarity with the Securities Act of 1933 and Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

Learn quickly and communicate complicated matters with an awareness of business needs.

Interest in a dynamic and high growth environment.

Highly motivated, enthusiastic, proactive, intelligent, and proven excellence in prior endeavors.

Proactive in new situations and to independently manage projects to conclusion.

Strong time and task management.

Ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders while raising issues in a timely and productive fashion.

Possess an interest in financial markets and legal processes with an ability to step in and work directly with stakeholders in the business.

Must be a strong and independent thinker with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Team player and willing to get involved where needed.

Strong organizational and communication skills, as well as a demonstrated ability to communicate effectively.

Desire to work as part of a collaborative team and willingness to embrace a variety of issues and responsibilities.

In addition to the compensation range below, Blackstone offers comprehensive health benefits, including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, and FSA benefits. 


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

Expected annual base salary range:

$150,000 - $250,000

Actual base salary within that range will be determined by several components including but not limited to the individual's experience, skills, qualifications and job location. For roles located outside of the US, please disregard the posted salary bands as these roles will follow a separate compensation process based on local market comparables.

Additional compensation: Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits offered in connection with the advertised role.

title: Human Resources - Operations, VP
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

The Vice President, HR Operations will assist with the oversight and optimization of HR processes related to employee lifecycle events, third-party workforce management, global mobility, and immigration, while ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. Reporting to a Senior Vice President, HR Operations, this role will focus on overseeing and implementing efficient, scalable, and compliant HR operational frameworks that enhance the employee experience and support the organization’s business objectives. 

Key Responsibilities

Employee Lifecycle Management

o        Assist with the oversight and management of lifecycle events, including onboarding, transfers, and offboarding for both Blackstone employee and Third-Party workforce. 

o        Develop and implement standardized processes and policies to ensure consistency, efficiency, and a positive employee experience throughout the employee lifecycle.

o        Partner with HR business partners and other stakeholders to address complex employee lifecycle events and resolve escalations effectively.

o        Continuously evaluate and improve lifecycle processes to align with organizational goals and employee needs.

Third-Party Workforce Management

o        Develop and implement frameworks for managing third-party workers, ensuring alignment with company policies and legal requirements.

o        Collaborate with Procurement, Legal, and business leaders to ensure proper classification, onboarding, and offboarding of third-party workers.

o        Monitor and mitigate risks associated with third-party workforce management, including compliance with labor laws and contractor agreements.

Global Mobility and Immigration

o        Assist with the oversight and management of global mobility and immigration processes, ensuring compliance with international employment laws and visa requirements.

o        In coordination with the Global Mobility lead, develop and implement policies and procedures to support employee relocations, international assignments, and visa sponsorships.

o        Manage complex global mobility cases and ensure seamless employee transitions.

o        Provide strategic guidance to leadership on global mobility trends, challenges, and opportunities to support business growth and talent strategy.

Legal and Compliance Oversight

o        Ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, regulations, and company policies across all jurisdictions where the company operates within North America.

o        Develop and maintain policies, procedures, and documentation to meet legal and regulatory requirements, including audits and reporting.

o        Monitor changes in employment laws and regulations, proactively updating processes and advising leadership on potential impacts.

HR Operational Excellence

o        Drive process improvements and standardization to ensure HR operations are scalable and aligned with the company’s growth.

o        Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of HR operations with other business processes.

o        Act as a trusted advisor on HR data governance and data quality. 

Team Leadership and Development

o        Assist in the leadership of the HR Operations team who are responsible for employee lifecycle management, third-party workforce processes, global mobility, and compliance.

o        Foster a professional culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the HR operations team.

o        Provide coaching and development opportunities to enhance the skills and expertise of team members.

Collaboration and Stakeholder Management

o        Partner with HR Business Partners, Talent Acquisition, and other HR functions to ensure seamless delivery of HR services.

o        Collaborate with Legal, Internal Audit, Procurement, and IT to align HR operations with broader organizational goals and compliance requirements.

o        Build strong professional relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure HR operations meet the needs of employees, third-party workers, and the business.

Partnership with People Analytics 

o        Collaborate with the People Analytics team to leverage data insights and inform strategic decision-making.

o        Use data to evaluate employee lifecycle events, global mobility processes, and third-party workforce management to identify areas for improvement and drive operational efficiency.

o        Provide leadership with actionable insights and recommendations based on data-driven analysis to enhance the employee experience and support organizational goals.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
8+ years of HR experience, with at least 3 years in a mid-level HR operations role
Experience with Workday and HR Service Now required.
Deep knowledge of HR processes and best practices, with a focus on employee lifecycle management, third-party workforce management, global mobility, and immigration.
Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations across multiple jurisdictions, including those related to employee and contingent workforce, global mobility, and visa sponsorships.
Analytical mindset skills with the ability toto leverage data to drive decisions and improve processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills;, with the capability to builds strong professional relationships at all levels of the organization.
Experience managing HR operations in a global or multi-location organization is a plus.
Strategic thinker with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.
Results-oriented and committed to delivering high-quality outcomes.
Adaptable and resilient in the face of change and ambiguity.
Passionate about creating a positive employee experience and fostering a culture of excellence.


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

$160,000 - $190,000

title: Blackstone Operating Team, Talent & Organization – Compensation Vice President
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Description:

Blackstone’s Operating Team partners with companies to create purposeful, valuable, growth-oriented businesses. Blackstone’s portfolio spans 230+ companies with approximately 700k+ employees around the world. This platform provides unique insights, connections, experience, and opportunities across its portfolio companies, creating a powerful flywheel effect. Blackstone backs leading, innovative businesses across sectors and geographies, creating a differentiated, supportive, and valuable ecosystem for leaders across the portfolio. The breadth and quality of the portfolio provides valuable touchpoints, learnings, and business opportunities for its executives as they grow their businesses. Blackstone’s Operating Team — along with an experienced advisor community — is a team of efficient and adaptable operating executives with expertise across all aspects of an enterprise. As partners to Blackstone’s portfolio companies, we provide empathy and experience as we help our companies create and accelerate value.

We believe that great deals begin with great talent and teams. Our Talent and Organizational Performance team serves as the conduit between Blackstone deal team professionals and our portfolio company executive teams advising on the most critical people and organizational issues.

Job Description:        

The Compensation Vice President will support the development and administration of compensation programs across the portfolio, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and market standards. This also involves compiling and analyzing compensation data and providing recommendations to enhance employee engagement and retention while increasing business performance.

Key responsibilities include:

Equity Program Management: Assist in the design, implementation, and administration of equity compensation programs across the portfolio, ensuring alignment with company goals; develop illustrative tools, models, analytics, playbooks, and communication templates; recommend technology solutions for more efficient administration.
Internal Benchmarking: Maintain an internal database of executive compensation practices across portfolio companies including cash compensation and management equity program designs, equity allocations, and performance metrics.
External Benchmarking: Conduct executive compensation benchmarking studies with third-party compensation consultants to ensure that portfolio companies offer competitive pay structures, analyzing market trends and data to inform compensation strategies; adjust strategies based on findings to attract and retain top leadership talent.
Recommendations and Support: Provide various stakeholders with real-time executive compensation benchmarks to support ongoing executive searches and compensation needs; work closely with deal teams during acquisitions to assess compensation structures and needs.
Training and Education: Offer training and resources to internal stakeholders and portfolio companies on best practices in compensation management.

Qualifications:         

While the bar is high to join, the learning and professional development opportunities are boundless.  Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who work well in a team-driven environment, are highly motivated and results driven, work hard and smart, have sound judgment and who have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. 

Critical qualifications and experience for this role will include:

Compensation Experience: 3+ years of hands-on experience building and delivering compensation and incentive strategies across privately owned, progressive global companies or portfolios; experience with transitions to public company compensation plans (i.e., IPOs) is preferred.

Functional Expertise: An understanding of pay practice benchmarking, cash incentive design, long-term incentive design, economic sharing ratios, and their link to the investment thesis.

Market and Best Practice Awareness: Understanding of labor market trends and evolution of compensation structures for both leadership and all employees.

Compensation Consultant Partnerships: Experience working directly with third-party compensation consultants (i.e., comp committee advisors) and survey data.

Champion: Passion and appreciation for the impact that properly designed compensation programs can have on organizations, people, and other stakeholders.

In addition to the above, the successful candidate must meet the following additional qualifications:

Self-starter, results driven, attention to details, business acumen, leadership skills, team player, persuasive, analytical problem solver; client focused, value driven, adaptable, strong judgement, objective collaborator and strong communicator; proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.

A bachelor’s degree in human resource management, business administration or equivalent is required; Advanced degree preferred.


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

Expected annual base salary range:

$175,000 - $200,000

Actual base salary within that range will be determined by several components including but not limited to the individual's experience, skills, qualifications and job location. For roles located outside of the US, please disregard the posted salary bands as these roles will follow a separate compensation process based on local market comparables.

Additional compensation: Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits offered in connection with the advertised role.

title: Blackstone Private Wealth - Internal Sales, Associate (San Francisco)
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Blackstone Private Wealth was established to answer the growing demand for Blackstone products from high-net worth investors. Partnering with many of the world’s largest private banks and wealth management firms as well as family offices, Blackstone’s Private Wealth team packages and delivers the full breadth of Blackstone’s alternative product capability to these firms and their clients and provides ongoing product and advisor support, as well as education and training around alternatives. 
 

The Internal Sales Specialist will partner with External Sales Specialists to cultivate relationships with key financial advisors within a specified channel and territory(s), with the goal of accelerating the adoption of Blackstone investment solutions.  The Internal Sales Specialist will maintain a high level of contact with intermediary clients and prospects and will be the subject matter expert across one of the most diverse sets of alternative investment offerings in the industry.    
                          

Responsibilities:                       

Partner with External Sales Specialists to drive sales within assigned territory(s)
Cultivate relationships with financial advisors through high-quality interactions including proactive and reactive calls, emails and follow-ups as well as limited in-person territory meetings
Maintain a high-level of client service by answering inbound inquiries and working with the operations team to resolve specific account issues
Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate Blackstone’s sophisticated products (fund objectives, terms, exposures, manager strategy, positioning, performance attribution, etc)
Take a consultative approach in profiling financial advisors in order to understand their business, clients and investment challenges to better match Blackstone solutions to their needs
Work with External Sales specialists to establish and execute on territory plan(s) and utilize data to optimize engagement with financial advisors
Utilize the CRM system to log all client/prospect related activity on a daily basis
 

Qualifications:                          

Bachelor’s degree required
FINRA Series 7 & (63/65 or 66) required
5+ years work experience within the financial services industry required (asset management, wealth management or alternatives experience preferred)
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated passion for capital markets and alternative investments
Ability to perform at a high-level within a dynamic environment, and entrepreneurial culture with a focus on excellence
Proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel and Outlook
Experience with web-based CRM technology (eg SalesForce)

title: Alert, Detection, and Response Engineer, VP - Cybersecurity
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Unit Overview:
Blackstone Technology & Innovations (BXTI) is the technology team at the core of each of Blackstone’s businesses and new growth initiatives. Serving both internal and external clients, we work to build the next generation of systems that manage risk, create efficiency and improve transparency within the firm and across our broad community of investors and portfolio companies.

BXTI is nimble and entrepreneurial – our open, iterative design processes and rapid pace of development mean that everyone on the team has the opportunity to make an impact from day one. We are problem solvers who can take projects from idea to implementation. We believe in active mentoring and developing excellence. We collaborate to find the best answers for our customers and for Blackstone. We are critical to the firm maintaining its competitive edge.

The Role:
The Alert, Detection, and Response Engineer in our Cybersecurity Operations team is integral to keeping our team on the forefront of security detection and response maturity efficiency. They are a core member of our SOC strategy with a focus on escalated incident response / investigations, advanced detection engineering, and continuous advancement of our Blue Team capabilities. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with conducting investigations with cybersecurity platforms (e.g. email, endpoint, network, and cloud-based threat detection) and developing custom detections to address emerging and advanced cyber threats. This involves staying abreast of the latest threat landscape and ensuring that detection systems are agile and responsive to evolving security challenges. The candidate will work closely across the cybersecurity organization to develop bespoke detections and playbooks to support more advanced investigations and response requirements.


Responsibilities:

Develop advanced threat detection mechanisms to identify and raise alerts for adversarial or high-risk behaviors within the company's systems.

Act as an experienced  senior incident responder, leading complex investigations and managing incidents from detection through resolution using tools such as security incident and event management (SIEM) and endpoint detection and response (EDR).

Continuously improve and fine-tune detection portfolio to adapt to new and emerging cyber threats.

Represent the Blue Team on Red and Purple Team efforts to design and build detections.

Provide exceptional Tier 1-3 escalation support including for analysis, investigations, and engineering.

Supervise and monitor the quality of security operations investigations.

Provide reporting and analysis on investigations and trends. 

Work with the security engineering team to identify trends in detections and investigations to better inform the engineering process (security by design).

Coach and train junior team members on detection and investigation techniques.


Qualifications:

6+ years in a hands-on technical role in information security.

Experience with cloud-native architectures such as AWS, Azure, Office 365, etc.

Proven experience running investigations and managing incidents through security event detection platforms, SIEM platforms (e.g. Splunk) and EDR (e.g. CrowdStrike).

Hands on experience creating custom detections within event detection and SIEM platforms.

Working knowledge of a wide range of current network security technologies such as firewalls, proxies, network and host-based intrusion prevention, DLP, vulnerability assessment tools, security information/event management, endpoint security, anti-virus/anti-malware, etc.

Digital forensics experience such as network analysis, malware analysis, memory analysis, etc.

Development/scripting experience: Python and/or PowerShell.

Ability to self-Highly organized, prioritize activities independently, create documentation and handle reporting.

Ability to iInteractsface with business and technology stakeholder. 

Strong written and oral communication skills; with the ability to effectively explains technical ideas to non-technical individuals at any level.

B.S. in Computer Science or Engineering or similar technical program.

title: Product Manager - Private Wealth Technology
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

Business Overview:
Blackstone Technology & Innovations (BXTI) is the technology team at the core of each of Blackstone’s businesses and new growth initiatives. Serving both internal and external clients, we work to build the next generation of systems that manage risk, create efficiency, and improve transparency within the firm and across our broad community of investors and portfolio companies.  


BXTI is nimble and entrepreneurial – our open, iterative design processes and rapid pace of development mean that everyone on the team can make an impact from day one. We are problem solvers who can take projects from idea to implementation. We believe in active mentoring and developing excellence. We collaborate to find the best answers for our customers and for Blackstone. We are critical to the firm maintaining its competitive edge.


Job Description:
We are currently seeking a dynamic Product Manager for our Private Wealth Technology team who has a strong passion for building new products and democratizing data for non-technical users. As a member of the Private Wealth Technology team, you’ll be expected to solve real business challenges by bridging strategy and technology execution – owning complex initiatives from inception to delivery. You are equal parts problem solver and operator with an instinct for identifying what matters, an a bias for action- oriented mindset, and the resilience to see things through. 


Responsibilities:

Own Business Problem-Solving: Navigate ambiguity to define, structure, and deliver strategic technology initiatives across Private Wealth. Act as the first responder to business needs—whether it’s a data gap, process friction, or new insight required.

Translate Needs into Execution: Partner with investment professionals, developers, and stakeholders to document and triage requests across CRM, reporting, data, and workflow systems. Define MVPs, prioritize backlogs, and ensure delivery timelines are met.

Drive Product and Data Strategy: Lead intake and refinement of technology and data asks related to sales tracking, client engagement, and business analytics. Proactively identify opportunities for better tooling, automation, or data flows that increase adoption and reduce manual work.

Be the ‘Super Connector’: Coordinate across functional business and technology areas—Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Technology—to ensure we deliver complete solutions, not isolated features. Push for integration, not just implementation.

Enable Better Decision-Making: Maintain critical data tables that power downstream reporting and insights. Support the delivery of clear, accurate analytics to enable senior leadership to make faster, smarter decisions.

Institutionalize Process & Governance: Partner with global and regional teams to document recurring issues and propose solutions. Champion sustainable ways of working—across intake, prioritization, delivery, and documentation.


Qualifications:                        
Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who work well in a team-driven working group, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. The successful candidate should possess the following qualifications:

8+ years of experience in management consulting, financial services, project management, and/or business analytics preferred

User Focused – you dig deep to understand user needs. You have experience conducting thorough research to understand user motivations and workflow and can clearly communicate them using appropriate methods (ex: user flows, personas, etc.)

Data Driven – you use data to help drive decisions in areas like designs and prioritization

Decisive – you can lead and manage projects with minimal oversight and make independent decisions, but know when to reach out when guidance or additional feedback is needed

Detail Oriented – you have experience recording detailed requirements or design documents and are comfortable documenting end-to-end functional, technical, reporting, and data needs

Flexible - You want to work in a fast-paced environment requiring you to flex between analytical, strategic, and operational aspects of the job.  Regardless of the need, you’re happy to roll up your sleeves to get any job done.

Independent - You can work effectively as an individual contributor and possess strong analytical, problem solving, critical thinking, and decision-making skills, multitask and deliver under tight deadlines

Strong Interpersonal and Collaborative Skills – you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You also know how to drive consensus among stakeholders, manage expectations, and keep strong relationships

Experienced with Agile Processes - You have worked in agile environments and know how to break down key features into appropriate user stories.  You have experience working closely with Engineers through the software development lifecycle

BI Tools/Data tools - Experience working with data visualization and BI tools (e.g. Tableau), CRM (e.g. Salesforce), agile methodologies and tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence), data warehouse tools (e.g. Snowflake)

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, or Business Analytics related fields preferred


The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

$125,000 - $225,000

title: HR Business Partner, Blackstone Technology and Innovations, AVP
description:
Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1.1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X, and Instagram.

The Human Resources Business Partner role is multi-dimensional and involves aligning the organization’s Human Resources strategies with its business strategy and successfully implementing critical initiatives in support of business activities. The individual will work both as a hands-on generalist, strategic partner, and a trusted advisor to Blackstone Technology and Innovations (BXTI) constituents at all levels.  Responsibilities will vary but may include the following:

Own key Human Resources activities predominantly for BXTI New York employees; including talent and performance management, training and development, onboarding, compensation planning, performance improvement plans, headcount tracking and reporting, and other cyclical HR processes

Partner with stakeholders to lead and support the planning, development, communication, and implementation of the talent management process and core HR processes

Lead talent discussions with BXTI management and Global HRBP

Act as a trusted advisor to managers and employees at all levels

Provide guidance to business on Employee Relations (ER) matters in partnership with the HR ER team on matters including coaching and development/delivery of performance plans

Partner with employee relations and benefits to address high volume employee requests (i.e., leaves of absence)

Partner with BXTI HRBP team and Talent Development to identify, develop and implement business-specific training solutions and talent development initiatives (e.g., mentoring, bespoke training)

Partner with recruiting leads and hiring managers to support the lateral recruiting process

Interpret Human Resources metrics and support core people and talent processes (e.g., talent reviews, annual promotions, mentorship programs, etc.)

Ensure HR data integrity and accuracy by working closely with HRIS and key systems to streamline reporting processes

Partner with broader HR team to implement and deliver HR programs - Employee Relations, HR Operations, Benefits, Recruiting, Talent Development

Qualifications

The individual we seek is an experienced Human Resources professional with excellent strategic insights, broad HR experience, including organizational development and effectiveness, and a strong generalist skill set. The HRBP, AVP is a confident change agent who is an effective and persuasive communicator at all levels. The HRBP, AVP must have strong interpersonal skills and be a collaborative colleague.  In addition, they should have the following qualifications:

Strong project management and analytical skills with a hands-on approach

No task too small mentality

Dive into a process and make suggestions for automation and improvement  

Effectively and persuasively communicates inside and outside of HR

Strong Microsoft skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)

Human resources experience in client-facing roles such as an HR generalist or HR Business Partner

Bachelor’s degree required

Minimum of 6 years of human resources experience gained, at least in part, at a well-respected professional services, financial services, or technology organization known for disciplined business performance and engaged, consultative human resources

title: Insurance Advisor, Home and Auto - Field Sales
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Insurance Advisor you will provide Home and Auto planning and advice to the personal market.   You are focused on new sales acquisition through client focused insurance advice and solutions based on an insurance needs analysis that satisfies the client’s needs.  You will contribute to team sales success and deepening client relationships through effective opportunity spotting, cross selling and referring to your team and RBC partners. You will be focused on meeting the needs of the personal market through the full suite of RBCI Home and Auto products.

What will you do?

- Proactively engage with potential clients over the phone or in person and establish a trusted advisor relationship

- Provide existing clients with excellent advice and strong client experience necessary to retain their business

- Promote Client First mindset by meeting clients at their convenience, either virtually or in an RBC Insurance store location

- Increase external network to contribute to the community and to capitalize on market opportunities and referrals from centers of influence

- Grow your business through quality sales, maintaining underwriting requirements

- Contribute to team sales success through achievement of individual sales goals and through effective opportunity spotting, cross selling and referring to your team and RBC partners

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

- General Insurance License (OTL)

- Proven professional sales experience with an entrepreneurial mindset

- Results oriented and driven to succeed, passionate and curious to help clients meet their needs

- Interpersonal, communication and problem resolution skills

- Digital literacy using a variety of systems and tools

Nice-to-have

- Bilingualism (French and English)

- Proven success in achieving sales targets

- Experience with business development and relationship management

- An existing network of referrals and centers of influence

What’s in it for you?

- We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

- A comprehensive “Total Rewards” package including health benefits, pension, retirement, and investment plans

- The opportunity to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work through our generous compensation program

- Be part of a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

- Ongoing training and continuous learning

title: Insurance Advisor, Home and Auto - Advice Centre (Bilingual)
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role at RBC Insurance Advice Centre gives you the best of both worlds - the flexibility you need for your life and the fulfillment you seek in your work.

We will provide you with the tools, training and support you need to successfully complete the Damage Insurance Certificate delivered by l’Autorité des marches financiers (AMF) and the Other than Life (OTL) Ontario insurance license and other provinces.

As an RBC Licensed Insurance Advisor for Home & Auto, you’ll be the trusted voice on the other end of the phone providing insurance advice and options to help clients protect what’s important to them. You’re empathetic, helpful friendly and provide clear, upfront insurance advice for clients. With every conversation, you’re curious, caring and detail-oriented, with a focus on problem and delivering an exceptional client experience. You will contribute to individual and team sales goals by proactively recommending personal home and auto insurance solutions to new and existing clients, as well as referring them to your partners within the organization.

What will you do?

Provide insurance advice and solutions to clients based on their needs through inbound calls

Exhibit a consistent, positive client experience with every conversation and resolve client concerns at first point of contact, demonstrating relationship building through meaningful discussions

Complete personalized needs assessments and reviews by leveraging tools, resources, and calculators to demonstrate value and support advice recommendations

Demonstrate a solid understanding of regulatory risk when underwriting and updating home & auto insurance policies

Use procedures effectively and seamlessly during conversations with clients

Cultivate and maintain relationships with partners to work as one RBC team

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Willingness and ability to successfully obtain the Quebec Damage Insurance certificate delivered by l’Autorité des marchés financiers and the General Insurance License for Ontario Other Than Life and other provinces.

Bilingualism (English and French) required, as you will regularly serve our clients with English and French speaking needs.

High level of reading, comprehension and speaking in both languages

Exceptional customer service skills with the ability to build strong relationships and connect with clients

Flexibility to work all shifts within the hours of operation. The Home & Auto Advice Centre is open Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 8:30pm

Digital literacy across a broad range of services (i.e. smartphones, tablets, laptops etc.)

Nice-to-have

Possession of the Quebec Damage Insurance certificate delivered by l’Autorité des marchés financiers

Post-secondary education

Knowledge of insurance products

Customer service and/or sales experience in a contact centre environment.

What’s in it for you?

Whether it’s developing new skills, opportunities to innovate and grow, modern and comprehensive benefits, or the flexibility to enjoy the moments that matter, at RBC you have everything you need at your fingertips to build your career and life.

Working with an award-winning team Awards | RBC Diversity & Inclusion

A comprehensive Total Rewards package that prioritizes your overall wellbeing, including flexible and modern benefits, competitive compensation and stock options

Work where you belong as part of a supportive, inclusive team and company that celebrate your unique perspectives, background and experience and want you to bring your whole self to work, every day.

Leaders who are invested in your success and provide opportunities to learn, to grow and to try new things. Develop new skills, sharpen existing ones and explore paths you never knew existed with a host of learning programs and tools designed to support you in every phase of your career.

Flexible work arrangements and leaders who support your needs—both personal and professional.

An opportunity to have real impact on the lives of our clients and the communities we serve.

RBCI software tools to boost your productivity

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available conditional on employees being able to meet with the technological and confidentiality requirements of the role (i.e., private and quiet space, Internet connectivity, etc.) Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

title: Manager, Decision Rules Development (Java)
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

RBC Portfolio Management and Credit Strategies team is hiring a Manager, Decision Rules Development. You will help all assigned work items through all phases including requirements (business, functional and non-functional) definition, scoping, planning, development of business & technical rules, testing, implementation, and post-implementation review.  You will also assure the quality of deliverables are fit for use, supportable, and maintainable.

What will you do? 

Advance development and design solutions that satisfy the business needs while staying in line with the overall business strategy
Pro-actively communicate and collaborate with business clients to analyze their business requirements and deliver the appropriate artifacts as needed: business requirement documents, functional specifications, data specifications, use cases, developing business & Technical rules, debugging etc.
Ensure design leverages existing reusable components, traces back to business requirements, and that new modules are designed with reusability in mind
Build, execute, improve and maintain test cases through standard methodologies, closely monitor test results for swift feedback
Conduct data analysis and create reports as needed using different analytical languages
Experience in projects utilizing Waterfall and Agile project management methodologies

title: Bilingual Licensed Customer Care Officer, Home & Auto
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Customer Care Officer will respond with professional and accurate service for all client concerns and escalations within the Insurance Advice Centre. You will be responsible for providing effective problem resolution and delivering a superior client experience by demonstrating effective root cause analysis for Home & Auto.

You will strive to constantly improve functions taking a client focused approach to effectively process client requests and provide advice and service solutions where appropriate.

In addition, you will ensure due diligence of procedures, process, regulatory compliance and assessment of risk within set authority limit.

What will you do? 

Provide a superior client experience, listening and connecting with clients, act as a “trusted advisor” in client conversations using effective client discovery to identify client need, provide relevant insurance advice and solutions based on client need.

Handle complex escalations for supported business areas and provides in the moment coaching to mitigate future problems and build employee capabilities.

Identify root causes and actions to prevent similar issues from occurring recommendation of action plans or appropriate solutions to resolve the problem as 20-30% of the role will involve coaching managers to problem resolution principles for future handling of similar complaints at the first point of contact

Partner with leaders to build leader, team and employee capabilities for problem resolution, product and underwriting knowledge

Creates customized skill builds on complaint handling to address top issues and learning gaps for supported business areas

Shares insights and trends observed in business level and channel level top irritant analysis sessions

Leverage tools and resources to support advice driven discussions, maintains data integrity, documenting all relevant client services contacts and results and prepare and submit final decision letters to client as appropriate

Contribute to the achievement of the centre’s overall client survey results focusing on call quality to differentiate the client experience where it matters most to the client

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

Bilingualism (English and French) required, as you will regularly serve our clients and do business with RBC partners and/or employees across Canada with English and French speaking needs.

Proven experience in Home & Auto Insurance (minimum 2 years preferred)

Damage Insurance license and OTL license for Ontario is required, along with the ability to obtain provincial licenses in Eastern provinces.

Proven communication and problem resolution competencies

Flexibility to work Monday – Friday between 8:00AM - 8:00PM

Nice-to-have  

Life, travel, and/or Call Centre experience

Personal lines Damage Insurance Agent's license for Quebec

CIP Designation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

title: Manager, Enterprise Liquidity Risk Measurement
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Associate Director, Liquidity Risk Measurement, you will be a member of the Liquidity Measurement team of RBC. You will be part of the liquidity center of expertise which is responsible for measurement and analysis of consolidated liquidity position of the RBC financial group and is critical component of the overall liquidity risk management capability of RBC. The team provides regular information to the regulators and management, analyzes trends in the balance sheet and liquidity and works with regional centers and business partners in understanding balance sheet and liquidity profile of the organization.

The role includes responsibility for timely and accurate production of liquidity metrics, primarily Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR), Internal Liquidity Metric (ILM) and conducting ongoing analysis and forecasting of changes in liquidity and balance sheet profile. Role also supports developing, maintaining and enhancing liquidity measurement capability.

What will you do?

Prepare monthly Liquidity Metric report, including data checks, corrections, validation and analysis of the results
Analyze short-term changes and long-term trends in balance sheet and liquidity position, update forecasts and projections. Liaise with internal partners to understand and explain dynamics of the liquidity metrics.
Prepare semi-monthly estimates and monthly presentations decks.
Prepare Monthly ILM reports and help to answer inquiries from business partners.
Complete data testing when new data or mapping changes are being implemented.
Prepare analytical reports for management and other internal business partners
Support the Associate Director in special projects, ad-hoc analyses and presentations.
Ensure that the calculation of the metric is compliant with the liquidity risk measurement governance framework. Support necessary liquidity risk measurement governance processes, provide support for management attestations and for the review of the metric by auditors and regulators
Monitor and analyze impacts of any changes in the NSFR calculation prescribed by the regulator. Manage and validate implementation of the changes in the LRM system
Support other team members in liquidity risk measurement team.
Liaise with business partners on explaining period over period drivers of NSFR
Design and improve existing controls as well as improve overall efficiency of existing processes
Act as subject matter expert for the respective liquidity metric to provide support in an ad hoc manner
Manage relationships and provide meaningful information to business partners as required

What do you need to Succeed?
Must Have

Strong understanding of bank balance sheet, products and business operations
Strong knowledge of 3 years+ experience with financial and/or regulatory reporting in financial institutions
Knowledge of risk management tools and techniques desired
Conversant with Basel III and other regulatory developments related to liquidity
Excellent research and problem-solving skills
Collaborative and consultative team player
Self-starter and independent
Demonstrated integrity and independent thinking
Detail-oriented, thorough and conscientious
Programming skills in VBA Excel and/or SQL knowledge
Knowledge of Tableau

Nice to Have

Professional designation: CPA, CGA, or CFA preferred

Job Skills

Analytical Thinking, Commercial Acumen, Decision Making, Financial Regulation, Financial Reporting and Analysis, Financial Services Industry, Liquidity Management, Risk Management, Strategic Thinking, Treasury Management

Additional Job Details

RBC CENTRE, 155 WELLINGTON ST W:TORONTO

TORONTO

Canada

37.5

Full time

title: Banking Advisor
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This unique position calls on your client-focused sales expertise and natural problem-solving skills to maximize each client interaction. Specifically, you help clients with their everyday banking, credit, and investment needs. As an RBC ambassador, you add value in the moments that matter most to clients and collaborate with RBC partners to help clients achieve their goals. Whether you’re demonstrating to a client how to use digital banking, on-boarding a new client, or referring a complex opportunity to a specialist, your expertise will contribute to creating meaningful and memorable client experiences to drive client satisfaction and loyalty.

What will you do?

Proactively engage with clients in all areas of the branch and in the community, uncovering banking needs, providing help and advice, as well as identifying sales and referral opportunities
Focus on client education and demonstration, leveraging technology to deliver a memorable client experience, drive sales, and retain business
Respond to client-initiated contact, assisting them with a full range of financial transactions
Actively listen and engage clients in conversation to further understand their individual needs
Proactively take ownership of resolving and preventing client banking problems
Cultivate and maintain relationships with partners to make the most of business opportunities and referrals

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Mutual Funds accreditation (i.e., Investment Funds in Canada or the Canadian Securities Course)
Demonstrated passion for putting clients first, as well as success in a hands-on, target-driven sales environment
Problem-solving and people skills, with the ability to build strong relationships and proactively connect with clients
Flexibility, eagerness to learn, strong personal ethics, and a hunger for success
Digital literacy across a broad range of devices (i.e., smartphones, tablets, laptops, etc.)
Availability to work all open business hours

           

Nice-to-have

Track record in building rapport and maintaining client relationships within the financial or service industry

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including competitive compensation, bonuses, and flexible benefits
Continued opportunities for career advancement
World-class sales training, coaching, and development opportunities
Support from a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high performing team, as well as world-class tools and training
Opportunity to achieve great success and grow your career with RBC

Job Summary

Coordinates production support activities for all major systems and related subsystems to ensure the integrity of computer generated data. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.

Job Description

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

The Production & Risk Services group is looking for a Client Technology Production and Risk Services analyst to help support and drive the operations of a group of complex Client Technology applications. This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing team supporting a stable but growing business at a major North American Bank.

The overall group is responsible for:

Supporting various applications in the Client Technology portfolio
Build tooling to automate monitoring, deployment and our capability to employ DevOps and CI/CD capabilities.
Offering technical expertise and support across the entire portfolio of applications
Managing requests to implement normal/emergency changes, releases and capacity planning.
Coordinate disaster recovery, planning and execution. Update internal config management and risk systems.


What will you do? 

Provide user facing front office production support for local and remote users leveraging multiple platforms.
Manage releases and coordinate bugs/enhancement with internal development and external vendors.
Work closely and integrate with the CTB (Change the Bank) team to engage in collaborative agile based development.
Engage with various technical partners and stakeholders to achieve stability in the production environment.
Leverage your strong written and verbal presentation skills including creating of documentation in Confluence runbooks.
Responsibilities include rotational weekend release work + checks.
Mission Statement

Delivery Best-in-class service by providing maximum level of system stability of production environments, reduce cost of application support through efficiency and automation, front-to-back problem and capacity management, and mitigation of risk.

Computer Operations, Customer Service, Enterprise Application Delivery, Group Problem Solving, Information Technology (IT) Infrastructure, Interpersonal Relationships, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), System and Console Operations, System Applications, Systems Software

title: Inside Sales Wholesaler, Life and Living Benefits Insurance
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As an Inside Sales Consultant, Life and Living Benefits Insurance, you will be responsible to cultivate and maintain quality relationships with existing RBC Insurance Brokers while developing new relationships in specific territories and increasing sales of RBC Insurance product. You will work closely with Sales Consultants to achieve plans for all lines and develop producer acquisition strategies, provide quotes, solutions, advice to assigned brokers, and develop relationships in order to optimize business opportunities and referrals.

What will you do?

·         Collaborate with Sales Consultants to establish a strategic business plan for the territory with defined sales targets

·         Recommend RBC Life and Living Benefits Insurance products & solutions to producers (Existing and prospects by doing proactive calling & webinars

·         Support producers by providing insight and sales ideas related to the insurance industry, product knowledge & system training

·         Assists in new producer/MGA (managements general agent) set-up including proactive calling and follow-up material

·         Establish relationships with marketing staff of key producers/MGA

·         Contribute in the sales process with new prospects by booking presentations and meetings for the Sales Consultant

·         Identify opportunities for cross sell/referral on other lines of business – Life, Living Benefits, Wealth & Group

·         Maintain contact management system for Sales Consultant and facilitate regularly scheduled mailings

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

·        Life Insurance License (Insurance of persons) or willing to obtain the license within 6 months of the hire date

·        Bilingualism (English and French) required, as you will regularly serve our clients and do business with RBC partners and/or employees across Canada with English and French speaking needs.

·        High level of written skills in both French and English

·        Proven professional sales experience

·        Ability to train and influence others

·        Must be willing to travel occasionally

Nice-to-have

·        Proven success meeting and exceeding sales targets

·        Post-secondary education or the equivalent.

·        Knowledge on all lines of business (Life, Living Benefits, Wealth) an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.  

·         Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

·         A comprehensive Total Rewards package including flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions and stock.

·         Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.

·         Management that supports your work and progression.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available conditional on employees being able to meet with the technological and confidentiality requirements of the role (i.e., private and quiet space, Internet connectivity, etc.) Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

title: Director Digital Technical Product Owner - Communications & Digital Engagement
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Director of Technical Digital Product - Communications & Digital Engagement, is purposed to help transform RBC Insurance digital technologies from the outside in.  Utilizing a deep understanding of financial market technology, and a keen sense of future state technical architecture, the ideal candidate will be able to not only understand existing RBC Insurance Infrastructure, but also be able to advocate for target state systems and architecture across our digital product suite.  

Today, messaging to clients and advisors—whether compliance notifications, marketing campaigns, document transmissions, or system alerts—is siloed across teams and technologies. There’s no centralized ownership, unified governance, or prioritization framework. This results in inconsistent experiences, duplicated effort, audit vulnerabilities, and a lack of scalability.

This role will be responsible for closing that gap, and owning communication and document infrastructure as an integrated digital product. This leader will drive vision and strategy, establish governance, coordinate platforms, streamline delivery logic, integrate with enterprise identity and consent frameworks, and enable future-ready, privacy-compliant communications at scale.

The candidate will be a key conduit between technology teams, digital product teams, and business leads.   They will be as astute at putting together a business case, as they are surfacing technological risks – and they will use this know how to help drive RBCI forward on a path to digital transformation.  This role requires working internally as well as with various vendors / suppliers.

What will you do?

1. Own Communications as a Product:

Establish a single, unified product strategy for all outbound communications and document workflows across client and advisor channels.

Champion a holistic view of communication moments across the advisor and client journeys.

2. Build & Operationalize a Communication Orchestration Engine:

Lead the creation of a centralized orchestration layer for message triggering, deduplication, prioritization, throttling, and escalation.

Incorporate signals from various internal platforms

Enable cross-channel coordination across email, secure message centre, in-app notifications, SMS, and physical mail.

3. Overhaul Document Management & Delivery Infrastructure:

Build a centralized, metadata-rich inventory of all documents (statements, letters, regulatory notices, onboarding kits, etc.).

Standardize assembly templates, version control, delivery routing, and archival practices.

Ensure linkage of documents to roles and permissions within identity platforms and document systems.

4. Integrate Consent, Preferences & Suppression Logic:

Govern the ingestion and enforcement of client and advisor communication preferences across all systems.

Integrate with privacy teams and CDP to enable suppression, opt-in/opt-out tracking, and data residency compliance.

5. Implement Scalable Access & Permissions Governance:

Build role-based access models tied to enterprise identity systems, ensuring proper access to compose, approve, or publish communications.

Establish platform-specific permission schemas (e.g., SFMC user roles, Salesforce record types etc.).

6. Create a Unified Intake, Triage & SLA Model:

Develop clear intake and prioritization workflows for communication and document requests from business units.

Set up KPIs, turnaround times, and operational playbooks to manage demand.

7. Operationalize Communication Monitoring & Incident Response:

Establish real-time monitoring of outbound communications with failure detection, audit logging, and alerting.

Design an incident response framework for high-risk or incorrect communications.

8. Build Analytics & Optimization Capabilities:

Partner with analytics teams to develop dashboards and performance scorecards across communication channels.

Implement A/B testing capabilities and data-driven optimization loops.

9. Ensure End-to-End Documentation & Knowledge Sharing:

Develop and maintain documentation of communication logic, ownership, templates, and data flows.

Build onboarding guides and training for internal users and support teams.

10. Align Strategic Communication Roadmap with Enterprise Transformation:

Synchronize communication strategy with all digital experience priorities.

Participate in enterprise governance and communications councils.

10. Additional Responsibilities:

Discussing and determining product backlogs for each sprint, and reviewing the outputs of all sprints, to make sure they are in alignment with the product requirements.

Defining and conveying the vision of what is to be built for the scrum team, to address client requirements and ensure successful product for business objectives.

Working closely with the scrum master and development team, to ensure the right things to be focused on and completed during the development process.

Following principles to write, discuss and add user stories to product backlogs; prioritizing product backlogs by business values during the sprint planning meeting.

Contributes to the product vision, strategy and overall roadmap of the products being developed.

Responsible for a suite of projects and has product accountability.

Be open-minded and look beyond your stack to solve complex problems

Be open-minded and look beyond existing technology to solve complex problems

Capable for the vetting of product and service architecture and distribution through the digital channels strategy/roadmap, for multiple lines of businesses / channels, while also identifying emerging opportunities and target state technology.

Build the state of the art, highly scalable digital solutions as a strong visionary, business technical lead and contributor across the digital and data team

Develop software components as a hands-on contributor when necessary

Build digital assets and drive scalable vendor solutions and enhancements

Detail potential competitive threats from digital enterprises that are generally considered outside of the traditional realm of competition

Identify, analyze, and scope digital acquisition targets with an understanding of integration requirements

Collaborate with stakeholders involved in digital strategy and digital innovation to develop an IT investment roadmap

Coordinate a strategic plan for leveraging integrated business architecture as part of future state vision

Provide guidance leadership across Insurance technical community in identifying and capitalizing on transformation opportunities

What do you need to succeed?

Must have 

10+ years of experience oscillating between business and technology in modern development stacks including common cloud platforms.  Can get to details of the technical issues faced by developers and find ways to de-bottleneck development by creating spike solutions, proof of concept development while articulating the ins and outs of the solutions in business language

Understands regulated communication frameworks in insurance or financial services.

Is a strategic communicator and can recognized patterns across large portfolios

Has deep familiarity with platforms such as Salesforce, SFMC, SMTP configurations, CDPs, document management systems, identity platforms, and consent architecture.

Is fluent in concepts like event-based architecture, omnichannel orchestration, audience segmentation, and message throttling.

Possesses strong stakeholder engagement and operational design experience across matrixed organizations.

Understanding of IT and Architecture Standards, Methodologies

Strong engineering experience, and able to ensure the speed and quality of deliverables by the team.

Strong Agile experience and able to guide the team in delivery process.

Familiar with business casing, business process modelling and API orchestration. familiar with Dev Ops, CI/CD, Cloud deployment, and basic infrastructural knowledge to be able to demonstrate and build paths forwards with technology partners.

Product Management experience including managing a roadmap, building and launching capabilities on web and mobile platforms and applying analytical rigor to support investment decisions

Experience guiding an agile team and leveraging knowledge of User experience (UX)/ technical / functional domain experts

Experience in Kanban and Sprint methodologies

Ability to convey business needs in technology, and technology needs to the business

Strategic mindset to managing technology and product

Understanding of data and funnel performance

Previous experience leading and building digital tools and architecting solutions

Strong execution experience leading large and complex initiatives

Technical curiosity and a passion to build digitally enabled End to End solutions for clients and staff

Ability to break complex ideas into their component features

Defining the risk associated with the future vision and finding the appropriate balance towards our strategy

Experience with agile methodology including setting product vision, building and maintaining backlogs, constructing release plans, and defining product performance metrics

Passionate for leveraging data to enable the best product

Experience with designing creative, scalable consumer products that delight clients in partnership with technology and design counterparts

Lead through ambiguity

Nice to Have technology experience

Snowflake

Adobe Analytics

Google BigQuery,

Google Developer Console,

Launch

Darkly

Docker

Kubernetes

Java, React, Spring Boot, Go/Rust/Python/Phoenix/BEAM (Elixir, Erlang) experience

Familiarity with cloud platforms – Azure, AWS, GCP, etc

Experience in designing and building microservice architecture based applications

Experience writing apps built around event-based architecture

Certifications - Salesforce Certified Administrator, Salesforce Platform App Builder and one of Salesforce Sales Cloud or Salesforce Service Cloud

Financial Services Cloud experience is an asset

Experience using Flow builder

Education & Experience:

Including or similar to: MBA / BCOM & BSc / BEng

Working Conditions

This position will work in a hybrid office setting with a minimum of 3 days in the office

The environment may be very fast paced, requiring focused, adaptable, results oriented individuals with attention to detail.

#LI-POST

#TechPJ

Agile Methodology, Business Oriented, Communication, Decision Making, Digital Architecture, Digital Business, Digital Data, Digital Products, Digital Solutions, Digital Strategy, Digital Technology, Digital Transformation, Process Management, Product Applications, Product Vision, Scrum, Software Platforms, Software Product Management, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Services
