title: 6 month Fixed Term Contractor - Associate Director - AML, RBC Capital Markets (Frankfurt or Paris or London based)
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fixed-term Contractor (FTC) AML Manager for 6 months to be based in either our Frankfurt, Paris or London office.

You will assist the RBC EG MLRO, senior management and businesses in embedding AML Compliance and AML compliance management in the culture of relevant RBC businesses and operations.

You will align AML regulatory priorities with the Business and RBC, create and maintain an effective relationship with regulators and external auditors to enable reputation and regulatory issues to be appropriately managed, establish and maintain a strong, effective control environment and identify and communicate financial crime risks inherent in the business to senior management and the business.

What will you do?

Assisting the appointed Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) for RBC Capital Markets (Europe) GmbH in the oversight of the AML framework for all branches of RBC EG

Testing the AML Transaction Monitoring alerts

Timely investigation of client and payment sanctions screening alert escalations / name and country screening alerts

Under the direction of the Head of AML Germany - drafting and submission of Suspicious Transaction and Order Reports (STORs) to relevant authorities, where required

Under the direction of the Head of AML Germany - drafting and submission of Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) to relevant authorities, where required

Implementation and regular review of AML, CTF, Sanctions and ABAC related policies ensuring compliance with the German Anti-Financial Crimes requirements

Assisting in the completion of the annual risk analysis which comprises all risks related to money laundering, terrorist financing and other criminal actions

In conjunction with the business groups establish and maintain a framework to ensure that all new products and services are subjected to an initial AML, ATF, Sanctions and ABAC risk assessment prior to implementation

Assist in the completion and submission of MLRO monthly report and other regulatory reporting on AML, CTF and ABAC within the appropriate business groups identifying and escalating gaps and weaknesses within the control framework and development of action plans to remediate, where appropriate

Create slides /deliver AML training to the business; identify and remedy training gaps, where appropriate

Completion of the annual statutory external AML audit and other AML audits, including subsequent remediation of the identified audit findings

Management of AML regulatory, Internal Audit and AML Compliance Testing issues

Conduct additional local testing activities

Act as primary liaison and coordination with key RBC stakeholders and escalate to senior management issues of Legal, Regulatory or Reputational Significance

Oversight of the financial crime compliance framework in place for the relevant legal entities, including oversight of high-risk clients

Engage with Global Economic Sanctions (GES) and ABAC on concerns relating to sanctions or bribery & corruption, where applicable.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

AML Compliance experience within a financial institution or equivalent institution, or with a regulator and/or comparable environment is preferable

Comfortable in multilingual and multicultural environment (preferable excellent German and English oral and written communication skills)

Wholesale/capital markets businesses knowledge in order to provide AML compliance support to the RBC EG and Branches operations

Strong grasp of banking and AML laws, regulations, directives and expectations, preferable with detailed understanding of the application and impact of the Wertpapierhandelsgesetz (WpHG), Wertpapierinstitutsgesetz (WpIG), Geldwäschegesetz (GWG), BaFin’s AML Guidance (BaFin AuA AT), relevant EBA Guidelines such as EBA on the role of AML/CFT compliance officers (EBA/ GL/ 2022/ 05)

Ensure adherence to local and enterprise Outsourcing (Third Party and Intra-group) standards, policies, and procedures to comply with local regulatory expectations for Outsourcing services, described in AT 9 of the MaRisk, EBA-Guidelines on Outsourcing, GwG, Sec. 40 WpIG, WpHG and BAIT

Willingness to accept accountability and demonstrate initiative. Ability to conduct duties expediently, aptitude for accuracy, attention to detail, and hands-on approach. Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information

Good computer literacy, knowledge of Word, Excel, Access and Outlook essential.

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program and competitive compensation

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Opportunities to work with the best in the field

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

A world-class training program in financial services

Flexible working options fully supported.

Agency Notice

RBC Group does not accept agency resumés.  Please do not forward resumés to our employees, nor any other company location.  RBC Group only pay fees to agencies where they have entered into a prior agreement to do so and in any event do not pay fees related to unsolicited resumés. Please contact the Recruitment function for additional details.

Job Skills

Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Business Perspective, Client Counseling, Communication, Decision Making, Financial Regulation, Fraud Risk Management, Group Problem Solving, Internal Controls, Operational Integrity

title: Administrator, Regional Account Support
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

The Regional Account Support Team specializes in assisting Estate & Trust Services Relationship Managers by providing efficient, accurate and quality client service. Key client service elements include, preparing estate asset summary documents, tax preparation, account distribution and asset administration. The Administrator will assist and support Officers to ensure that the administrative tasks are properly completed. Attention to detail and quality are paramount as well as ensuring key milestones are met. Teamwork, collaboration and developing inter-personal relationships are important skills for success.

What will you do? 

This is a great opportunity to network with RBC partners and other financial institutions as you gather information relating to client holdings in an estate environment.
Your organization skills and proactivity will successfully support a book of accounts and demonstrate the high level of quality service that our team focuses on. This will include timely written, verbal and electronic communication with other support groups internally and with external contacts.
As you work towards gathering information about Estate assets you will build an Estate Summary of Assets.
Asset collection from internal and external sources forms part of your role as well and represents an important part of consolidating the client’s assets in a timely manner.  Your networking skills will be useful here.
You are a keen trouble shooter and can effectively resolve inquiries on your own and willing to seek out support from your team leader, as required.
Well versed in our policies and procedures you will ensure that your administration is carried out within company goals and objectives.
You will actively participate in sharing best practices, innovations and work effectively in a team oriented environment.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have  

Post-secondary education or equivalent (Estate & Trust Administration courses preferred)
3 years’ plus administration experience
General working knowledge of the Securities and Financial Services Industry
Excellent written/verbal/electronic communication skills. 
Ability to work effectively with others and perceived as a professional business partner with co-workers and external contacts.
Ability to resolve issues and aspects of administration independently
Technological literacy, especially with Excel and Word, and experience with Mail Merge

Nice to Have  

Previous Estate administration experience

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager role forms a key part of the Wealth Management Europe ('WME') Financial Control ('FC') team and is responsible for ensuring that the end-to-end financial control framework that supports the production of an IFRS compliant Balance Sheets and Income Statements.

The role will be responsible for managing any assigned direct reports (1 to 2 people), supporting FC and change management activities for all WME business, whilst also ensuring a robust control environment.

The role will require partnering with the business and functions for where issues have been identified, to ensure appropriate actions plans are implemented and managed effectively.

What will you do?

Financial Control activities

Head Office reporting

Financial Statements preparation

Manage direct reports (1 to 2 people).

Must-have

Qualified ACCA/ACA/CIMA (or by experience) with undergraduate degree in quantitative fields and suitable financial services work experience or similar/equivalent

The incumbent should have solid knowledge of the accounting treatment of banking products and IFRS 9

Solid understand of the control framework

Strong IT skills, and in particular advanced Excel is essential

Demonstrate leadership abilities.

Experience working with Oracle PeopleSoft, TM1, Murex, Murex, RIBS, or RIMMS.

title: Trust Officer
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Trust Officer, you will create an exceptional client experience by providing superior service and a complete range of estate and trust solutions that meet client needs. You will achieve business results in partnership with the team by identifying, growing, and retaining a long-term profitable high-net-worth (HNW) portfolio of clients. By leveraging cross-selling opportunities, you will manage and develop strong relationships with existing and prospective clients and centres of influence. By joining RBC Royal Trust, you will have direct impact on improving the lives of clients by helping settle their estates, protecting their legacies, and improving the communities in which they live. We are a team committed to helping clients achieve peace of mind now and for the future.

What will you do?

Handle estate, trust, and protection mandate accounts
Create an exceptional client experience by providing superior service and comprehensive fiduciary solutions that meet the needs and goals of clients
Develop proactive client contact strategies to ensure the broadening of the client relationship to the next generation and with RBC Wealth Management
Ensure client strategic objectives are known and reviewed, and a documented client action plan is set up customized to the client’s unique situation
Identify any referral opportunities to appropriate professionals across the RBC network
Ensure the process for obtaining new business is efficient and seamless for the client and their professional advisors
Demonstrate a commitment to taking ownership and accountability for efficient client problem resolution
Responsible for overall client relationship management and acting as the representative of the client portfolio
Assist and mentor team members in achieving their potential through effective coaching, mentoring, communication, and training and development activities

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Specialized knowledge of the provisions of the Civil Code of Québec related to estates and trusts
Demonstrated ability in managing complex family dynamics, the grieving process, and dealing with conflict
Ability to communicate with clients about general investment, estate, financial, trust, and taxation issues, including economic conditions
Bilingualism (English and French) required, as you will regularly serve our clients and do business with RBC partners and/or employees across Canada with English and French speaking needs
Possess or working towards Trust and Estate Practitioner (TEP) designation

Nice-to-have

Canadian Securities Course (CSC)
General knowledge of RBC products and services
Solid foundation in values-based selling

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program, including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

title: Customer Service Representative - Futures Clearing
location_raw:
locations

location_parsed: Chicago, Illinois, United States of America
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the Opportunity 

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

What will you do ?

Perform the Customer Service function including reconciling client trades, positions, money balances, and other customer inquiries and service enhancements.

Confirm daily margin settlements for both cash and non-cash collateral and assist in resolving any client queries and service enhancements.

Act as a liaison between new customer accounts and the RBC operations group and Front Office.

Process various transactions within the back office system as well as help maintain/enhance the system.

Communicate Regulatory changes and possible impacts to client base.

Coordinate Customer Service functions with other RBC Operations groups globally.

Coordinate and communicate physical deliveries with clients and Clearinghouses

What do you need to succeed ?

Working knowledge of CFTC and exchange rules and regulations for trade clearance, trade input, position balancing, margin and settlements.

Operational knowledge of cleared OTC products and Exchanges.

Minimum of 3 years of experience working as a Customer Service representative within a Client Service team for an FCM.

Familiarity with Exchange clearing systems.

Excellent written and oral communication skills required.

Works well with teams.

What's in in for you ?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program include competitive compensation and flexible benefits, such as 401(k) program with company-matching contributions, health, dental, vision, life, disability insurance, and paid-time off.

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.

Opportunities to do challenging work.

Opportunities to build close relationships with clients.

The expected salary range for this particular position is $75,000 - $105,000, depending on your experience, skills, and registration status, market conditions and business needs.

You have the potential to earn more through RBC’s discretionary variable compensation program which gives you an opportunity to increase your total compensation, provided the business meets its performance targets and you meet your individual goals.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

Drives RBC’s high-performance culture

Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

title: Quantitative Researcher
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity ?

The Electronic Market Making group, a high-frequency trading team at RBC Capital markets, is seeking Quantitative Researchers and Traders to join our desk.

The nature of finance is changing, and RBC Capital Markets is looking to recruit the next generation of Quantitative Researcher to drive innovation in equity trading.  Leveraging sophisticated statistical techniques and machine learning, in combination with software engineering and trading, Quantitative Researchers are responsible for conceptualizing and building sophisticated trading signals and strategies.  If solving complex problems in a fast-paced and exciting environment with a group of passionate and like-minded individuals appeals to you, the Electronic Market Making group is looking for you.

What will you do?

Research, backtest, and implement quantitative signals and trading strategies

Drive innovation through original ideas

Apply critical thinking and problem solving skills to expand existing algorithms

Automation, optimization and re-engineering of desk processes and tools to increase efficiency

Analyze market data and trends to investigate previously unexplored structural research areas

Think critically and creatively within a collaborative and close-knit team working on Canada's largest trading floor

What you need to succeed?

Passion for quantitative research, software engineering and mathematics

Extensive object oriented programming experience (Java/Python/C++)

Strong background in mathematics, statistics and machine learning

Excellent communication and teamwork skills

Bachelor/Master/PhD degree in Engineering/Computer Science/Mathematics/Statistics or related field

2 - 5 years of relevant experience within Capital Markets domain

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Opportunities to do challenging work

Flexible work/life balance options

#LI-KA2

Job Skills

Communication, Critical Thinking, Detail-Oriented, Equity Trading Systems, Market Making, Market Risk, Problem Solving, Systems Applications, Teamwork

title: Marketing Operations Manager
description:
Who You'll Work With: 

We are seeking a proactive and analytically minded Marketing Operations Analyst to support a wide range of strategic and operational initiatives within the Marketing Operations team. This role blends data-driven decision-making, process improvement, and cross-functional collaboration to drive scalable, efficient marketing operations — requiring strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.

The ideal candidate is an efficiency-minded and technically conversant Marketing Operations professional with 3-5 years of experience in a Marketing Operations role (or similar). This individual is eager to take ownership of projects that improve workflows, uncover actionable insights, and align stakeholders. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to building/scaling capabilities and driving marketing efficiency in a complex, global, cross-functional environment.

What You'll Do:

Strategic Execution

Break down complex or ambiguous problems into structured plans and execute with minimal oversight.

Apply a systems-thinking approach to continuously improve how work gets done

Enable Operational Insight  

Leverage data to drive decision-making across marketing operations, identifying trends, performance gaps, and opportunities for optimization.

Collaborate with data and analytics teams to design user-friendly dashboards and reporting tools/processes that enable cross-functional teams to drive operational excellence.

Interpret data in context of team activities and marketing initiatives to connect operational performance with business impact.

Process Optimization

Document and analyze existing marketing workflows to identify inefficiencies or opportunities for improvement.

Recommend and implement scalable solutions that enhance team productivity, efficiency and consistency.

Stakeholder Engagement

Collaborate with cross-functional partners across marketing, MarTech, engineering, and global teams.

Build trust and alignment to support project and operational initiative success through effective change management.

Program & Project Support

Contribute to the successful delivery of marketing programs and operational initiatives.

Manage project timelines and dependencies, coordinating across teams to keep efforts on track.

What We're Looking For: 

Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field with 3-5 years of experience in marketing operations, business operations, or related fields.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to synthesize data into actionable insights.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively and influence without authority.

Detail oriented with ability to set realistic goals, timelines, and demonstrate successful follow-through.

Technically proficient with a strong aptitude to learn new technologies

Comfortable working in and driving action and accountability in a large, distributed organization.

Familiarity with marketing technologies, campaign workflows, and project management tools (e.g., Workfront), preferred.

Proficiency in Excel

Familiarity with reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI). SQL, Python, or other technical data viz proficiencies are not required.

Demonstrate a bias toward operational excellence and continuous improvement.

Who We Are: 

At AB, we are a leading global investment management firm dedicated to high-quality research and diversified investment services. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations in 26 countries, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. Our people are our competitive advantage, and we strive to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work and fosters intellectual curiosity and collaboration. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, or infusing new technologies into our business, we are fully invested in your success. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us!

Nashville, Tennessee

title: Investment Strategist
description:
Who You’ll Work With:

AllianceBernstein’s Insurance team is seeking an Investment Strategist, reporting to the Head of Allocation and Strategy. This person will support the Portfolio Managers in the Allocation and Strategy team on holistic portfolio strategy, cutting-edge investment solutions, and capital-adjusted relative value frameworks tailored for AllianceBernstein’s global insurance clients.

The candidate will also work closely with  members of the Insurance Portfolio Management team, and Insurance Client Advisors  to best achieve client objectives. Additionally, the candidate will partner with investment professionals dedicated to both public and private asset classes in designing tailored insurance solutions for our clients. This role enables an individual to experience all aspects of the asset management business. The candidate must work well in a team-based environment and will be part of the broader AB Insurance team.

What You’ll Do:

The Allocation and Strategy team serves as the key investment point of contact for AB Insurance clients and advisors, owns tactical asset allocation and thematic positioning for all insurance portfolios, and is responsible for overall portfolio performance versus client objectives and risk levels as well creating bespoke investment solutions. A successful candidate will:

Aid in enhancing and streamlining the cross-sector optimization process.

Take ownership of the relative value framework, which includes the maintenance and innovation of relative value tools, as well as leading meetings where the portfolio management team discusses and debates cross-sector relative value.

Develop and maintain tools to track and analyze insurance client portfolio strategies.

Assist in conducting analysis for thought leadership pieces.

Support in developing and analyzing liability-driven investment solutions for insurance clients. Provide detailed analysis and recommendations to meet client objectives.

Support portfolio managers in ad hoc client requests, including commentaries on markets, portfolio strategies, and risk exposures.

What We’re Looking For:

Experience in insurance asset allocation, investment analysis, or a related field within an asset management firm, insurance company, investment bank, or consulting firm.

Basic understanding of US and global capital markets, public and private fixed income instruments, insurance regulations, and investment accounting.

Strong passion for capital markets and solving complex problems

High level of technical skills; (Python, R, Excel, Power BI)

Understanding of insurance company regulations across various regimes; statutory and GAAP insurance investment accounting, and risk management framework

Client focused with history of developing relationships with new and existing clients 

Ability and willingness to design, implement, and utilize systematic quantitative tools

Strong oral and written communication skills

Excellent time and project management skills

Detail-oriented, service-oriented and self-directed

Team-orientation is vital.  AB emphasizes it’s striving, yet collegial culture as a cornerstone to its successful track record

Bachelor’s degree. MBA and/or CFA/FSA a plus

Who We Are:

We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. We realize that it's our people who give us a competitive advantage and drive success in the market, and our goal is to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work. 

Our culture of intellectual curiosity and collaboration creates an environment where you can thrive and do your best work. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, infusing new technologies into our business or providing thoughtful advice to our clients, we are fully invested in you. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us! 

In accordance with applicable law, the minimum and maximum base annual salary for this role is as follows:

Base Salary Range: $125,000 to $150,000

Actual base salaries may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base salary is just one component of total compensation at AB, which may include, depending on eligibility, commissions, year-end incentive compensation, short- and long-term incentives and Department-specific awards. In addition, AB provides a variety of benefits to eligible employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, sick and vacation time off

People of color, women, and those who identify as LGBTQ people are encouraged to apply. AB does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status or any other basis that is prohibited by applicable law.  AB’s policies, as well as practices, seek to ensure that employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants, based solely on job-related criteria well as practices, seek to ensure that employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants, based solely on job-related criteria

New York, New York

title: AVP/Research Analyst
description:
Research defines the culture of AB Equities and is the cornerstone of our collaborative investment decision-making process.  Our analysts engage in creative, rigorous and long-term strategic research that is the basis for all portfolio decisions.  We seek to own good businesses at attractive valuations and apply a long-term approach as owners of businesses.  We serve clients globally, with research coverage across developed and emerging markets, and our analysts are based in offices in New York, London, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Singapore, Taipei, Sydney and Melbourne.

We have one role open for a research associate to join our Emerging Markets Equities team, part of our global Emerging Markets Equity Platform. Location: Singapore or Pune. 

The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Conduct research into publicly listed companies and associated entities in order to understand the business and industry, create detailed financial projections and provide insights into valuation.
Make strategy-appropriate investment recommendations based on a thorough understanding of key company, industry and market issues, and in the best interests of AB’s clients.
Engage in team-based problem solving, information sharing, and research discussions.
Collaborate with AB’s Responsible Investing team to actively consider and evaluate the environmental, social, and governance aspects of the companies we invest in.
Meet with company management teams, research providers, data vendors, industry leaders, etc. 
Travel as necessary to AB offices, industry conferences, and to visit companies under research.
Collaborate with production of marketing and client communication materials.
Uphold AB’s fiduciary obligations, adhere to our Code of Conduct and uphold AB’s reputation as a representative with clients and in the broader industry.
Promote an appropriate diversity and inclusion culture in the firm. AB values diversity of backgrounds, diversity of experience and diversity of thought.

Job Qualifications: 

Be highly motivated and driven to achieve, with a record of outstanding academic and professional success in their chosen fields.
Have a bachelors or comparable degree, and 2+ years of business experience in finance, strategy or related areas.
Preferably have research experience in the financial services sector through equities research, management consulting, or direct industry experience.
Be able to demonstrate strong problem solving and quantitative skills, including experience modelling in Excel and in interpreting financial statements.
Have clear and concise written and verbal communication skills.
Preferably have experience living and working in an emerging market and interest in foreign economies, businesses and cultures, plus some fluency in a relevant foreign language.
Have the ability to work independently but also as a member of a team in a dynamic, informal and fast-changing environment. We encourage vigorous and open debate among members of our team in an atmosphere of mutual respect.
Demonstrate a passion for ongoing learning and development.
Fluency in Hindi is preferred.
Singapore

title: Fixed Income Product Analyst
description:
Client Group Overview

This role is organized under AllianceBernstein’s Fixed Income Business Development unit within the Global Client Group. The Client Group has a presence in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Australia, and is composed of five main areas:

Sales & Client Services works with financial intermediaries and institutions to offer diversified investment solutions that help clients build and preserve their wealth
Business Development is a conduit to the firm’s investment teams and supports our clients and internal business partners through investment-platform and product content, messaging, competitive analysis and education
Product Strategy & Development designs, develops and manages the firm’s global lineup of investment services and considers clients’ evolving needs to identify new opportunities
Marketing promotes the firm and its services by creating, packaging and distributing content and messaging to engage diverse audiences through digital platforms and initiatives, strategic campaigns, and events
Business Transformation looks to evolve and scale our business, leveraging digital and data, to drive top-line growth and improve profitability

Job Summary 

AB’s Global Fixed Income Business Development team includes approximately 40 professionals including product management and investment strategists. The Product Analyst partners with both investments and distribution to promote and drive the growth of the business for AB. The Product Analyst will serve as product champion for specific Fixed Income products, as well as focuses on various channels and/or regions. The individual will be responsible for articulating AB’s fixed income market views and portfolio strategies with AB’s salesforce.


Job Description

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Fixed Income Product Analyst to support fixed income senior investment strategists, portfolio managers, and act as a key liaison for AB’s Asia sales teams. This role is central to driving product positioning, marketing, and client engagement across AB’s globally-integrated fixed income platform.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as the first point of contact for Asia sales teams on assigned AB’s fixed income strategies and funds
Support client-facing senior investment strategists with pitchbook updates, product positioning, portfolio data analysis
Partner with investment teams and marketing to develop and maintain core product materials
Build expertise in AB’s investment process and market outlook to represent fixed income capabilities credibly
Analyze and explain portfolio performance and positioning using attribution and risk tools
Generate new sales ideas and advocate for AB’s strategies across channels
Align with regional and channel priorities to inform internal communication and strategy
Collaborate with fixed income senior investment strategists on business development, training, and focus areas
Conduct competitor analysis to support product positioning
Assist with RFPs / Due Diligence Questionnaires and respond to advisor and relationship manager inquiries
Identify and contribute to thought leadership initiatives

Job Qualifications & Key Attributes

3–5 years of experience working with fixed income instruments and/or in product management roles within the investment management industry
Strong interest in capital markets and creativity to engage effectively with AB’s sales teams, prospects, and clients.
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines while maintaining strong internal relationships
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Strong marketing and messaging capabilities, with the vision to craft and sustain a compelling narrative for the firm’s fixed income platform and products
A collaborative team player with well-developed interpersonal skills, including negotiation, consensus-building, and relationship management
A proactive mindset with a desire for educating internal stakeholders and supporting AB sales initiatives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Proficiency in an Asian language is a plus
An advanced degree in Economics, Finance, or a related field is preferred. CFA designation or active progress toward certification is advantageous
Hong Kong

title: Business Analyst
description:
Company Description:

As a leading global investment management firm, AB fosters diverse perspectives and embraces innovation to help our clients navigate the uncertainty of capital markets. Through high-quality research and diversified investment services, we serve institutions, individuals, and private wealth clients in major markets worldwide. Our ambition is simple: to be our clients’ most valued asset-`

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Investments Business Operations Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in supporting the business aspects of our investment activities with a dynamic set of responsibilities aimed at driving efficiency across the investment teams.

Responsibilities:

Support Investment Business Heads: Assist the Investment Business Heads for Equities, Fixed Income, and Multi-Asset Hedge Fund Solutions in creating quarterly Town Hall materials, maintaining scorecards, and creating other strategic business material that covers performance, AUM, expenses, and strategic priorities.  The goal is to standardize key materials used by the Investment Heads and automate data updates.

Market Data Management:  Conduct ongoing reviews of the Investment teams market data costs to rationalize demand and reduce the spending.  Analyze synergies of services across teams, explore more cost-effective alternatives, and work closely with the AB market data team to manage new service requests and contract renewals.  Assess AI tools to create an inventory for key contract terms across vendors and manage renewal cycles.  Provide quarterly KPI reporting to investment teams to validate services and costs.

 Expense Tracking:  Leverage various reporting tools to create analytics that monitor the travel and expense cost trends for each business unit, ensuring they remain within budget and identify opportunities for cost savings.  Provide monthly KPI reporting to Business heads. 

Vendor Management: Manage the Investment teams list of critical vendors and execute on the annual Vendor risk review process.  Collaborate with the AB Vendor Risk Management team on the process and systems utilized. 

Indirect Cost Allocation Tracking:   Review the allocated costs across Technology and Operations to each Investment Business unit to identify changes and opportunities to reduce overall costs across Investments. 

Project Management:  Participate in and manage various projects related to initiatives aimed at improving business operations.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field.

2-4 years of experience in investment operations, financial services, or a related field.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to manage deliverables for senior investment professionals.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.

Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Power BI tools and use of AI.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Pune, IndiaNashville, Tennessee

title: Senior Associate, Investment Operations (Energy Transition)
description:
Senior Associate, Investment Operations (Energy Transition)

AB CarVal is an established global alternative investment manager and part of AllianceBernstein’s Private Alternatives business. Since 1987, AB CarVal’s team has navigated through ever-changing credit market cycles, opportunistically investing $151 billion in 5,800 transactions across 82 countries. Today, AB CarVal has approximately $19 billion* in assets under management in corporate securities, loan portfolios, structured credit and hard assets.

AB CarVal is dedicated to attracting and retaining the industry’s best people across asset classes and geographies. AB CarVal is committed to diversity and inclusion, valuing the full range of life experiences, skills and qualities of our employees.  We believe peak effectiveness comes from an engaged, talented, and diverse workforce. 

AB CarVal’s Energy Transition business invests via debt and equity across power and utility projects, resilient energy networks, clean transportation, and resource waste management transactions. This is a great opportunity for a qualified candidate looking for a dynamic role spanning hedge fund and private equity type transactions in the clean energy sector. The Senior Associate will partner with the front office commercial team and support the full lifecycle of clean energy transactions. They will be exposed to all features of AB CarVal’s Clean Energy business, will be responsible for several aspects of new and existing transactions, and will work closely with a wide variety of parties both within AB CarVal and externally.

Principal Accountabilities:

Operational Management – 60%

Provide day-to-day operational input on clean energy investment transactions

Quickly evaluate complex situations that arise and use good judgement to propose solutions

Engage with and interpret detailed clean energy investment transaction legal documents

Monthly updating of models; production and booking of discounted cashflow valuations and IRRs

Effectively manage be-spoke complex financing agreements, including oversight of monthly construction draws

Independently review and book fundings and distributions on clean energy investments

Set up new deal structures, manage existing deal structures

Complete due diligence and audit requests by working with appropriate partners

Coordinate and manage all aspects of tracking clean energy transactions in AB CarVal’s systems

Respond to internal and external queries regarding clean energy investment transactions throughout their life-cycle

Business Partnering – 40%

Collaborate with the AB CarVal clean energy commercial team and external clean energy projects’ partners

Provide input on clean energy investment transaction documentation alongside AB CarVal clean energy commercial team

Make judgement based decisions related to the operations function and assume responsibility for the impact to the business

Understand key areas of the clean energy investment transactions/business and anticipate potential issues; proactively communicate solutions to others within the team or management

Assist with collateral management and project by project review/analysis/milestoning within energy transition investment transactions

Qualifications:

Required

Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, finance, or related industry

3+ years accounting/finance experience

Advanced Excel skills including data modelling and analysis

Demonstrates knowledge and mechanics of lending instruments, legal documents and structures

Strong work ethic and commitment to a high standard of excellence

Proven ability to balance multiple assignments and manage quality, accuracy, and consistency of each work product

A self-starter with the ability to follow through and complete tasks

High level verbal and written communication skills

Strong drive for results with both detailed and practical focus

Strong analytical/problem solving skills

Enjoys working in a collaborative team environment, partnering with commercial team

Ability to travel on business

Preferred

Certified Public Accountant

Experience with renewable energy investments, transactions, asset management terms and concepts

Experience working in an alternative investment fund manager or similar industry

Public accounting or Financial Services experience

Demonstrated initiative in communicating issues and concepts to multiple groups at multiple levels

Knowledge and/or experience with conducting audits and due diligence of external companies

In accordance with applicable law, the minimum and maximum base annual salary for this role is as follows:

Base Salary Range: $85,000 to $125,000

Actual base salaries may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base salary is just one component of total compensation at AB, which may include, depending on eligibility, commissions, year-end incentive compensation, short- and long-term incentives and Department-specific awards. In addition AB provides a variety of benefits to eligible employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, sick and vacation time off

Minneapolis, Minnesota

title: Compliance Analyst
description:
Who You’ll Work With:

We are seeking a San Antonio based Private Wealth Compliance Analyst to join our San Antonio based Compliance Department.

 

The purpose of this job is to mitigate regulatory and reputational risk to the firm. The role will require an analytical approach, the ability to evaluate critical data elements, review complex client documents, research, evaluate and document findings, while ensuring adherence to firm and regulatory requirements. The Compliance Team is essential to Private Wealth business to ensure compliance with applicable Anti-Money Laundering laws and protecting the firm from regulatory and operational risks. In addition, the Compliance Teams enforcement and procedurally focused reviews help to maintain the compliance with internal account type and product requirements, detect and mitigate risk, while maintaining the high standard for integrity.

 

Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:

ACE – Cash Flow System         

SNAP – Record Keeping System

Office Team – Record and Maintenance System

BTS – Brokerage – Custody view system.

 

What You'll Do:

·         Perform the legal and compliance work related to the new account opening process for Bernstein Private Wealth Management clients including reviewing and analyzing all new private client discretionary and alternative investment accounts

·         Utilize your critical thinking skills as you read and analyze complex client documents, including trusts and pension plans, and respond back to questions about these documents accordingly

·         Protect the firm’s reputational risk by ensuring compliance with all regulatory and firm requirements, including conducting AML due diligence for non-US clients

·         Uphold the firm’s fiduciary responsibility by verifying product and client suitability and providing guidance to financial advisors and associates

·         Reinforce the firm’s reputation for exceptional client service by preparing customized offering materials

·         Employ your written communication skills by drafting client communications

·         Contribute to the talent development of the firm by coordinating with business liaisons to create training courses and FAQs for our salesforce

·         Showcase your relentless ingenuity by updating and implementing new processes both in legal and sales

·         Contribute towards the team orientation of the department by being willing to assist with other projects and tasks, as needed

 

What We're Looking For:

·         1 to 2 years mutual fund operations or financial services experience

·         Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) with 2+ years of related experience or experience in a legal or compliance department generally

·         Strong knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry and products and services provided

·         Comfortable implementing processes, controls, and/or compliance activities for new/changing business models, services/products, and/or technologies

·         Knowledge of private client business preferred 

·         Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

·         Strong problem-solving or analytical/critical thinking skills

·         Attention to detail and ability to multi-task/reprioritize

·         Ability to follow documented procedures and apply sound professional judgment

About AB 

We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. San Antonio, Texas

title: PCI Financial Reporting Assistant Vice President (AVP)
description:
Who You'll Work With:

AB is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. 

AB Private Credit Investors (“AB-PCI”) is the private corporate credit investing platform of AB primarily offering direct lending capabilities to middle-market companies across various industry sectors. AB-PCI focuses on directly sourced and privately negotiated investments in the primary issue market, while selectively pursuing opportunities in the distributed and secondary loan markets on a relative value basis. AB-PCI pursues a flexible mandate designed to deliver attractive risk-adjusted returns by investing in unitranche, first lien and second lien debt as well as selectively structured preferred stock and private equity co-investments. Target companies typically have robust business models, strong competitive positions, sustainable enterprise value and predictable cash flow profiles. The group maintains a strong credit culture and pursues a highly selective investment process based on fundamental due diligence and a focus on transaction terms and documentation.

AB-PCI is led by relatively tightly knit group of seasoned senior investment professionals with strong industry background and credit investing track-record. The group maintains a cohesive culture and values teamwork, collaboration and contribution of individual team members.

AB-PCI is looking for a professional to join AB-PCI’s Financial Reporting Team which focuses on Performance, Fund Accounting and Investor/Fund Reporting, working in partnership with AB-PCI’s COO, portfolio management / valuation and middle office teams as well as AB’s Financial Control Team (“FC”), business development and product development teams.  This new role will support the growing business and team. AB-PCI has grown significantly over recent years and high caliber talent is needed to help support continued business growth, improve processes and scale operations. The role will provide exposure to all aspects of performance, Fund accounting, and reporting while providing opportunity for growth as the team continues to grow and take on more responsibilities.  Responsibilities of the team include, but are not limited to, the following:

What You'll Do:

Review and approval of monthly Fund financials and reporting from TPAs, in partnership with FC including income, fee and expense calculations, investor distributions, and expense payments

Assisting AB’s FC with quarterly / annual financial reporting and audits

Monitor key performance indicators such as IRR, cash flow metrics, yield, and NAV movements 

Near-term revenue and return forecasts for management and investors, including commentary and drivers as well as actual revenue and returns analysis for management and investors, including any explanation of deviation from forecasts / estimates

Assisting AB’s Business Development team with Fund and investor reporting 

Drive projects for automation and process improvements as relates to Fund investor reporting, PnL explain and forecasting, performance reporting, amongst others

What We're Looking For:

Finance or Accounting experience is required

Proven experience with PowerBI, sigma or other data visualization and reporting tool

Experience with SQL or Python for data analysis and automation is a plus

Experience in the middle market loan / private alternatives industry preferable

Microsoft Office application proficiency (advanced Excel skills a plus)

Ability to effectively prioritize to work and adapt in a fast and challenging environment where priorities can change daily

Team oriented – works collaboratively with teammates and other AB teams, exhibiting a one firm mindset

Excellent organizational, analytical and communication skills

High attention to detail and a high standard for accuracy and responsiveness

Who We Are:

We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. We realize that it's our people who give us a competitive advantage and drive success in the market, and our goal is to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work. 

Our culture of intellectual curiosity and collaboration creates an environment where you can thrive and do your best work. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, infusing new technologies into our business or providing thoughtful advice to our clients, we are fully invested in you. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us! 

Austin, Texas

title: Private Wealth Associate
description:
Position Overview

Bernstein Private Wealth Management is a premier investment management firm advising high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth clients. As an industry leader, we put people first and pride ourselves on selecting and developing high caliber talent. 

Bernstein Private Wealth Associates are client service professionals who exhibit drive, ambition, and exceptional communication and relationship-building skills, and who, in collaboration with Financial Advisors, help propel the growth of our Private Wealth Management Platform. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to partner with Advisors to provide asset allocation recommendations, capital markets positioning, portfolio analytics, and wealth and legacy planning for high-net-worth individuals and families.

 

An Associate will: 

Collaborate and network with senior professionals throughout the firm to fuel career success

Partner with Financial Advisors to build their business and provide service and support functions such as portfolio analysis, account creation and maintenance, and client/prospect meeting preparation

Build relationships with clients and prospective clients to understand and support all aspects of their servicing needs

Strive to provide a world-class level of customer service and support

Our Comprehensive Development Program

Associates will participate in a robust and comprehensive training program – The Associate Development Program (ADP). After years of heavy financial investment and input from industry leaders, ADP is a one-of-a-kind opportunity. The Program is designed to build a foundation of investment knowledge and develop the quantitative and qualitative skills needed to achieve long-term stability and success, regardless of your incoming background.

Components of the Associate Development Program (ADP) Include:

In-depth industry training on proprietary investments, services, policies and procedures

Advanced training on trusts & estates, wealth planning, investment management philosophies, and financial management strategies

A focus on client service excellence, partnership and sales training in order to provide an exceptional client experience

Behavioral training geared toward the development of communication, leadership, and other professional skills

Career management, one-on-one coaching, and specialized skills training to achieve success beyond the Associate role
 

Associates have a myriad of opportunities to continue their career with us as a client service professional or in areas including Leadership, Wealth Strategies, Investment Strategies, and building their own business as an Advisor. We take all of our Associates' development seriously, and we focus on understanding each individual’s strengths and aspirations, personalizing a roadmap with the success of each team member in mind. As Associates progress in the role, and as milestones are achieved and core competencies are exhibited (typically over the course of ~3 years), we celebrate the opportunity to advance team members on to other exciting opportunities at Bernstein Private Wealth Management.

Job Qualifications

We Are Seeking:

People who possess strong analytical and communication skills (both written and verbal) and an ability to build relationships

Accomplished team players who thrive in a rigorous and challenging environment

Individuals who are client-focused and detail-oriented with a strong ability to multi-task and work under pressure in a fast-paced atmosphere

Individuals who have a bachelor's degree with excellence in academics and strong leadership experience

Proficiency in Word and Excel are required

Desired Qualifications

1-2 years client service experience, financial services industry experience a plus

The Firm will sponsor required series exams, including SIE, Series 7, and Series 63, but candidates with licenses are a plus

Company Overview

Bernstein Private Wealth Management advises high-net-worth clients on planning for—and living with—the complexities that come with wealth. We specialize in addressing challenges that extend well beyond wealth management by offering a vast network of resources customized to clients’ values and needs.

Bernstein is distinguished among major wealth managers by its holistic approach, flexible process, innovative research, sophisticated modeling, and cutting-edge investment solutions. Our people are our advantage. Our collaborative culture means each client is supported by a team of specialists aligned with a shared sense of purpose.

Bernstein is a business unit of AllianceBernstein, which ranks among the largest investment managers in the world, with 4,400 employees across 51 locations in 25 countries and over $700 billion in assets under management.

Join us in pursuing insights that unlock opportunities. Learn more at http://www.Bernstein.com

To learn more about Our Purpose and What We Stand for, visit us at http://www.bernstein.com/our-story/overview.html

#BernsteinPWM

Washington DC

title: Investment Product Analyst
description:
The Investment Product Analyst is responsible for serving as a product specialist, including domain knowledge of investment strategies and portfolio holdings. The role is mainly responsible for developing product presentation and updating quarterly review decks of client portfolios. This person will support both servicing for existing clients and proposal for prospecting clients by having client exposures and by handling performance and portfolio data to meet client requests. The role also partners with investment teams and regional sales teams to support local equity business development activities by collaborating and sharing regional knowledge with global colleagues based on AB global product management platform.

Success in the role will be tied to:

Equity business development with client facing and investment idea generation.
Equity product servicing for existing clients and proposal for prospecting clients.
Mainly focused on both Retail and Institutional Clients by providing investment servicing, but additional limited engagement with other works in Investment & Product Strategy such as investment fund execution, etc.
Collaboration with global investment teams and global product managers

Job Qualifications

Collaborative team player with client focus
Self-starter and proactive thinker with analytical skills
Basic knowledge of capital markets, investment products and asset management industry
Knowledge of equity investment and risk analysis is preferable
Comfortable in handling and preparing presentation decks, guideline documents, RFP/RFIs etc.
Communication and coordination skills
PC skills - MS Word, Excel, Power Point
English – Business ~ Fluent level
Equity investment experience / Overseas working experience a plus

Tokyo, Japan

title: Advisor Enablement Strategist
description:
We are seeking a proactive individual to join our team as an Advisor Enablement Strategist, reporting to the National Director of Digital Strategy & Client Reporting. In this role, you will partner with Advisors to optimize their practice management through relevant technology tools. Your efforts will directly impact revenue production by empowering Advisors to enhance their productivity and efficiency. Collaborating with sales leadership, the training team, and the advisor enablement team, you will develop and implement strategies that support our business goals.
 

What You'll Do:

Provide personalized, high-touch service in one-on-one meetings with Advisors, Managing Directors, and other Private Wealth resources. Understand their practice management and pain points, offering tailored recommendations to reduce friction, scale their practice, and share best practices.
Support the rollout of new sales technologies, ensuring smooth implementation and minimal disruption.
Monitor technology usage and adoption rates, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Conduct impactful virtual and in-person training sessions and presentations for regional offices and Private Wealth National.
Analyze and improve strategies and materials that promote the adoption and effective use of sales technologies including existing training guides, delivery methods, and training programs.
Onboard and support users with essential tools, staying abreast of developments in corporate technology.
Travel is required, estimated at approximately 25%.
 

What We're Looking For:

A minimum of 4 years of experience in the financial services industry; marketing and/or communications experience is a plus.
A proactive mindset with strong attention to detail.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively with a broad range of personalities.
Professional maturity, decisiveness, and strong business judgment.
Proficiency with Salesforce, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Creativity, vision, and a passion for continuous improvement.
Sales orientation with the ability to think from the perspective of financial advisors.
 

This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our firm by integrating technology solutions that meet the unique needs of each advisor, transforming their practice and driving our success. If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for technology, training, and sales-oriented engagement, we encourage you to apply.

About AB 

We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. We realize that it's our people who give us a competitive advantage and drive success in the market, and our goal is to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work. 

Our culture of intellectual curiosity and collaboration creates an environment where you can thrive and do your best work. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, infusing new technologies into our business or providing thoughtful advice to our clients, we are fully invested in you. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us! 

In accordance with applicable law, the minimum and maximum base annual salary for this role is as follows:

Base Salary Range: $95,000 to $105,000

Actual base salaries may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base salary is just one component of total compensation at AB, which may include, depending on eligibility, commissions, year-end incentive compensation, short- and long-term incentives and Department-specific awards. In addition AB provides a variety of benefits to eligible employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, sick and vacation time off

People of color, women, and those who identify as LGBTQ people are encouraged to apply. AB does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status or any other basis that is prohibited by applicable law.  AB’s policies, as well as practices, seek to ensure that employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants, based solely on job-related criteria

Tampa, Florida

title: Software Engineer
description:
Who you'll work with:
The Private Wealth Technology supports the Private Wealth Sales, Institutional Sales, Wealth Management, Marketing and Operations departments.  This role is within the Equity Investment Management Technology (EIMT) group which is responsible for the Private Client Portfolio Management system known as SPSR.  SPSR is used by the Private Client Portfolio Management team to manage and invest over 47,000 private client accounts with roughly $100 billion in assets under management.  The SPSR system is comprised of numerous automated processes that continuously analyze and rebalance AB’s Private Client portfolios using highly quantitative tools and portfolio optimizations that leverage AB’s proprietary research models and algorithms.  In addition to the automated rebalancing and trading processes, the SPSR system provides interactive tools that the Associate Portfolio Managers use on a daily basis for handling account-specific activities such as individual account optimizations, asset mix changes and new account investments.

What you'll do:

This position will be responsible for analyzing, designing, developing, deploying, and supporting the SPSR system described above.  The candidate will work on strategic and tactical projects to enhance system capabilities while continuing to support existing processes. In addition to designing and implementing software, this candidate will be expected to partner closely with business users to gather requirements and support time-sensitive requests for information.  The ideal candidate must have at least 3 to 5 years of C++, or C# experience as well as significant SQL development experience.  

Work closely with Portfolio Managers to understand their needs and formulate solutions.

Translate raw data into useful information to fulfill time-sensitive business needs.

Design, implement, and maintain software using SQL, C/C++, and C#.

Coordinate and oversee the quality assurance and user acceptance testing phases.

Ultimately responsible for the success of the projects and tasks assigned.

Support the operation of the portfolio management system to ensure that trades are executed correctly and on-time.

What we're looking for:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics.

3 to 5 years of experience in C/C++.

3 to 5 years of experience in C# including .NET, Winforms, and ASP.NET.

1-2 years SQL including stored procedures and table design.

Experience using Visual Studio, git, Azure Devops, VScode, Azure Data Studio, SQL Server Management Studio is a plus.

Solid analytical and trouble-shooting skills

Graphical user interface design and development

Strong objected oriented analysis and design

Very strong written and oral communication skills (absolute necessity)

Wealth/Investment Management process and data domain knowledge is a plus

Nashville, Tennessee

title: Vice President/Investment Risk Manager
description:
Who You'll Work With:

A successful candidate will collaborate with key investment and operations stakeholders to support AB’s initiatives by providing unique insights and recommendations while ensuring risks are well understood and controlled.

What You'll Do:

The Investment Risk Manager will play a critical role in identifying, assessing, and managing risks associated with the firm’s investment services and processes to ensure they are managed in line with firm's risk frameworks, client guidelines, and regulatory requirements.

Deliver independent portfolio oversight, risk measurement, monitoring, analytics and advice.

Leverage various risk models and analysis platform to perform in-depth analysis of portfolios or strategies, and support, assist and challenge portfolio management.

Use a variety of analytical resources to develop new and enhance existing risk-return analysis, including risk monitoring, interpreting performance attribution, multi-factor risk models, benchmarking and scenario analysis.

Ability to think critically about broad range of potential investment risks, gathers relevant data and information systematically, can translate complexities and perceives relationships amongst data and trends.

Keeps abreast of current financial markets, securities and investment themes to bring an informed perspective to the risk management processes.

Develop a deep understanding of AB’s investment management services and functional areas to keep abreast of current issues in business operations and incorporate changing business needs into risk analysis.

Develop strong relationships with AB investment teams. Excellent communication and presentation skills, and comfort in challenging status quo.

Collaborate with broader Risk team and other departments including Legal & Compliance, Operations and Technology to deliver a holistic risk management framework.

Represent the independent risk function with key stakeholders including senior leadership, mutual fund boards, clients, prospects and consultants.

What We're Looking For:

AB is seeking a Vice President, Investment Risk Manager within the independent, second line of defense Risk Management business unit to support and implement the firm’s independent risk management framework

CFA, FRM, and/or Master’s Degree highly desirable.

5+ years relevant work experience in investment management and risk management, preferably on the buy-side.

Deep knowledge of financial markets and market structure, including Equity, Fixed Income, Multi-Asset, Derivatives, and Private Markets.

Experience with risk systems such as Bloomberg PORT, Aladdin and/or MSCI/Barra.

Familiarity with US and European regulatory framework for registered funds.

Proficiency in SQL and Python preferred, basic knowledge of database structure and querying, demonstrated ability to mine large datasets for analytical insights.

Excellent attention to detail and organization skills.

Proactive self-starter with a collaborative approach to problem solving.

Strong ability to multi-task and to work under pressure with tight timelines.

Proven leadership experience, with ability to drive outcomes.

Nashville, Tennessee

title: Assistant Portfolio Manager
description:
We are looking for an Assistant Portfolio Manager to join our Taipei office to support the fixed income related portfolio management in Taiwan. The principal function of the Assistant Portfolio Manager is to support the senior portfolio management team, ensuring that investment strategies are accurately implemented in the portfolios and support the investment documentation to meet regulatory requirements:  


Describe the role: 
The principal function of the Assistant Portfolio Manager is to support the senior portfolio management team, ensuring that investment strategies are accurately implemented in the portfolios and support the investment documentation to meet regulatory requirements:   


The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 


The Associate Portfolio Manager works as part of a team supporting senior portfolio managers. Specific responsibilities may include: 

Monitor portfolios’ position weights and risk analytics compared to benchmarks and targets.
Highlight deviations and enter orders to rebalance portfolios.
Construct trade orders for execution.
Monitor portfolio positions and trade orders for compliance with client guidelines.
Capital flow and currencies hedge managements against the subscriptions/redemptions of each share classes of various fixed income related portfolios.
Manage portfolio cash balances and ensure cash balances are consistent with product guidelines and current investment strategy.
Review proposed guideline amendments, custodial changes, and other activities that may impact accounts
Review and resolve any potential post trade compliance breaches.
Liaise with other departments internally, including Legal/Compliance, Sales/Marketing, Investment Operations, and other Investment Teams.
Understand investment decisions derived from Credit strategy meetings with respect to implementation activities
Support and maintain the investment related documentation to compliant with the requirements of Taiwan regulations/regulators.

What is the professional development value of this role, i.e. what learning and professional growth does the role offer the candidate?  
The candidate will be learning from/coached by AB senior Fixed Income experts on every aspect of expertise including portfolio construction, investment research, risk management, etc.  
Job Qualifications (The ideal candidate should have the following): 
Qualifications, Experience, Education: 

Ability to demonstrate general knowledge and curiosity about fixed income markets
Graduate with strong academics, at least two years relevant industry-related experience and familiarity with the investment process.
The ideal candidate must have strong communication, analytical, and computer skills (Bloomberg, Excel and comfort with quantitative tools), and be very detail-oriented.
Candidate must also be able to prioritize, work well under pressure, work well independently, and be a team player.
SITE/SICE qualification or, if not, willingness to acquire this qualification at the earliest convenience.

Attributes:

Strong work ethic - willing to put in the necessary hours to accomplish tasks.
Pro-active personality with a strong desire to continually improve and accept challenges to institute change.
Team oriented/collaborative – must want to work towards and support a common goal and actively seek ways to contribute. Must be able to work with people of diverse
Competitive Drive – must relish the day-to-day fight to think/act ahead of the market and have a high desire to achieve good execution for our clients.
Confident in representing AllianceBernstein in the marketplace.
Works well under pressure – must be able to remain calm and focused while multi-tasking in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Strong attention to detail with low tolerance for errors.
Familiar with investment related regulations in Taiwan

Skills:

The ideal candidate must have strong communication, analytical, and computer skills(Bloomberg, Excel and comfort with quantitative tools), and be very detail-oriented.
