Job Description:

At Dimensional, we want to change the way the world thinks about investing. As a leading global investment firm, we offer systematic, value-added investment solutions based on robust science and thoughtful implementation. Our global team includes hundreds of passionate people with diverse experiences, education, strengths, and talents. Every employee plays a role in delivering these experiences, and we know we can achieve the most when we work as a team to endeavor to help improve investors’ lives.

 

Dimensional's Human Resources department drives organizational success by recruiting and cultivating a high-performing, highly engaged workforce. HR serves as a strategic commercial partner across all departments to drive business results. The Global Recruiting team focuses on building pipelines of talent and casting a wide net to attract a diverse array of candidates. The team manages the full lifecycle of recruitment, from prospecting to hiring for students, graduates, and postgraduate entry level through executive level talent, with a keen focus on an efficient and effective process that provides a positive experience for the hiring manager and candidate alike.

 

The Recruiting Coordinator will support the Global Recruiting team and play an important role in the hiring process by interacting with candidates, recruiters and hiring managers in a thoughtful and engaging manner to ensure an exceptional candidate experience.

 

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Coordinate logistics across various time zones for all candidate interviews (in person and virtual) including extensive calendar management for interview team members and arranging candidate travel details.

Provide coordination support for global recruiters on an as-needed basis.

Serve as concierge throughout the onsite interview process by greeting and escorting candidates to interview rooms while ensuring that each candidate has a hallmark interview experience.

Perform ad hoc reporting, analysis and data management utilizing applicant tracking systems (Workday Recruiting).

Manage candidate travel and expense reimbursement process utilizing Expensify and Concur.

Evaluate and recommend process improvement opportunities to streamline and enhance our candidate experience and scheduling efficiency.

Support special projects and initiatives for Human Resources on an ad hoc basis.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education or training in Human Resource Management is preferred.

Proven experience as an HR or recruiting coordinator or relevant HR/administrative position.

Knowledge of human resources processes and best practices.

Strong ability in using MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular).

Experience with HR databases and HRIS systems, Workday preferred.

Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to handle data with confidentiality.

Detail-oriented with a technical, problem-solving mindset.

Good organizational and time management skills.

Proficiency with Workday and Microsoft Office applications.

Ability to handle sensitive and confidential data.

title: Operational Resilience Manager
description:
Department

The Digital Policy, Control & Resilience (DPC&R) department operates within the COO domain, which encompasses both Operations and Technology departments. DPC&R is tasked with managing security oversight and operations, business continuity management, security monitoring and testing, identity and access management, cybersecurity and analytics, as well as policy making. The department includes various roles such as information security officers, policy and control officers, and cybersecurity analysts. The head of the department serves as Robeco’s Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). 

Position & Requirements

We are seeking an Operational Resilience Manager responsible for developing and implementing strategies to ensure Robeco's preparedness for major business continuity and cyber security incidents. This individual will manage effective responses to contingencies and coordinate a comprehensive testing and exercise program. Key responsibilities include managing business continuity exercises, disaster recovery tests, threat-led penetration testing, and crisis simulations. The role requires engagement with relevant stakeholders and communities, operating on both tactical and strategic levels, and possessing strong reporting skills for senior management.

Key Responsibilities

Enhance and implement operational resilience strategies and a resilience testing program.
Coordinate, manage and enhance the organization's response to major incidents and crises.
Lead the planning, execution, and evaluation of cyber security exercises, crisis simulations, and disaster recovery tests.
Develop and maintain incident response plans and business continuity plans.
Collaborate with various first, second and third line departments to ensure comprehensive preparedness and response plans.
Provide training and awareness programs for staff on operational resilience and crisis management.
Monitor and report on the effectiveness of resilience strategies and programs.
Continuously improve resilience capabilities through lessons learned and best practices.

Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree in crisis/security management, IT, risk management, or related field.
5-7 years in operational resilience, disaster recovery, or business continuity.
Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and industry standards (e.g., DORA).
Excellent project management, communication, and leadership skills.
Ability to handle pressure and juggle multiple priorities.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CBCP, MBCI, CISSP) are a plus.
Proficiency in Dutch and English (written and spoken).
Availability of at least 4 days/32 hours per week.
Hybrid work setup with at least 3 days in Rotterdam.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

At 30/09/2024, Robeco had €203.7 billion under management, including €199.6 billion under ESG integration. Robeco cultivates a pioneering spirit, always on the lookout for innovation. Highly adaptable to a technical environment

title: Active Ownership Analyst
description:
Robeco is recruiting for a full-time Active Ownership Analyst within their Active Ownership Department at Robeco’s headquarters in Rotterdam. Robeco is an active sustainable investor and a committed signatory to the United Nations Principles for Responsible Investment since 2006. Robeco has a long-standing history in sustainable investing and is committed to drive positive change through being at the forefront in stewardship and its focus on ESG integration.

Department

The Active Ownership team is responsible for voting at annual meetings and actively engages in dialogues about environmental, social, and corporate governance topics with listed companies. The Active Ownership team fulfills a fundamental role in Robeco’s sustainability proposition and uses its resources to contribute to both investment results and to create societal impact; the Active Ownership team has a role to boost Robeco’s strategy on sustainable investing throughout the firm and associate Robeco with this externally. The team is also involved in Robeco’s exclusion policy. The team reports on all these activities internally and externally.

Position & Requirements

The Active Ownership Analyst works closely together with the team’s other Analysts, Engagement Specialists, and Investment teams in active dialogue cases.

The Active Ownership Analyst will be jointly responsible for the proxy voting process. Annually Robeco votes its shares at approximately 7,000 company meetings. Voting recommendations are insourced and customized to Robeco’s own voting policy. The analyst will be responsible for implementing Robeco’s voting policy, analyzing and deciding on how to vote on priority shareholder meetings. The proxy voting process is complex, requires systematic and accurate administrative execution and involves internal consultation within the team and with portfolio managers and analysts within Robeco. Due to the increasing number of shareholder meetings, increased client request for customization, process management skills are important. The workload increases during the voting season, which runs from March to June.

Outside the voting season, proxy voting takes less time, and the Active Ownership Analyst will join the Engagement Specialists in conducting the active dialogue with international companies. Robeco conducts active dialogues, often theme based, with international companies typically lasting for two to three years. The aim of these dialogues is to improve the long-term risk return profile and the sustainable behavior of these companies, in which Robeco’s clients hold investments. Also, the Active Ownership Analyst will be involved in projects for the team, often in close collaboration with one of the Engagement Specialists. Reporting on voting and on engagement is part of the function. Additionally, the Active Ownership Analyst is expected to play a key role in improving the proxy voting process in terms of efficiency and policy implementation. The Active Ownership Analyst will support the team in its working process and will be involved in various audits on those processes.

The candidate has interest in corporate governance and sustainability issues. The candidate combines strong analytical skills and precision with sensitivity for relations and is a real team player. The candidate is self-motivated, diligent, and results driven. Accuracy and organizing, also under pressure, are necessary skills.

The candidate has a master degree (or equivalent) and must be fluent in English. Writing skills and communication skills are well developed. Demonstrable affinity, knowledge of or experience with corporate governance is a must. A financial background is a pre. The candidate should have well developed Excel skills. As the team depends on the use of various ICT tools, the analyst must develop a basic understanding of - and ability to maintain in-house built software.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

Robeco Recruiting Team

title: IT Specialist - Scrum Master – Robeco - Marketing & Distribution Services
description:
The challenges for companies in the financial sector are greater than ever. Under increasingly strict supervision, legislation, and at a time of growing demand for digitization and transparency, we work with users on innovative automation and processes to provide the very best experience for our business customers throughout the entire client lifecycle.

Department

At Robeco, you will work as a Scrum Master within the Technology – Marketing & Distribution Services (MDS) department. The MDS team consists of 18 IT professionals divided into three Scrum teams (Dynamics team, Web team, and Marketing team). The team has successfully delivered high-value solutions over the past few years and has embraced Agile/DevOps. We design and deliver solutions based on a microservices architecture and utilize the latest technologies such as Azure cloud services. Our ambition is to further build and expand our capabilities in the domains of marketing, sales, and customer service, ensuring the team remains the reliable partner for delivering high-value solutions. 

Position & Requirements

 As a IT Specialist - Scrum Master* at the Marketing & Distribution Services department, you are responsible for supporting the Web and Marketing teams within the department. Your tasks include assisting and supporting the teams, the Product Owner, and the organization. 

Supporting the Teams You coordinate sprint planning sessions, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and sprint retrospectives for both teams. You ensure that each team remains focused on their objectives and deliverables, helping them work efficiently, adapt to changing requirements, and continuously improve their processes. You are responsible for setting up Scrum as described in the Scrum Guide and helping everyone understand Scrum theory and practice. Additionally, you coach team members in self-management and cross-functionality, and you remove impediments to the Scrum Team's progress. 

Supporting the Product Owner You form a strong duo with the Product Owner, who serves both teams. You assist the Product Owner in finding techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management, and help the Scrum Team understand the need for clear and concise Product Backlog items. You facilitate collaboration with stakeholders when requested or needed. 

Supporting the Organization You actively contribute to the rollout of the “RAW” initiative (Robeco Agile Way of Working). You are an advocate of the program and ensure that the teams are aligned with the way of working. You lead, train, and coach the organization in its Scrum adoption, plan and advise on Scrum implementations, and help employees and stakeholders understand and follow an empirical approach to complex work. You actively remove obstacles between stakeholders and Scrum Teams. 

Summary of Tasks: 

Facilitate Agile Practices: Lead and facilitate Scrum events for both the Web team and the Marketing team. 

Servant Leadership: Act as a servant leader for both teams, removing impediments and barriers to progress. 

Coach and Mentor: Coach and guide team members in self-management and cross-functionality. 

Promote Collaboration: Foster a collaborative environment within and between the teams, facilitating communication and cooperation. 

Support the Product Owner: Assist in finding techniques for effective Product Goal definition and Product Backlog management. 

Conflict Resolution: Proactively identify and address conflicts within the teams or with stakeholders. 

Metrics and Reporting: Monitor project progress using agile metrics. 

Continuous Improvement: Lead efforts to identify process improvements and implement best practices. 

Support the Organization: Actively contribute to the rollout of the “RAW” initiative, lead, train, and coach the organization in its Scrum adoption. 

What do you bring? You have a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT, or a related field. You are a Certified Scrum Master (CSM/PSM) or have an equivalent certification with at least 5 years of work experience, including at least 4 years as a Scrum Master. You have a strong understanding of agile methodologies and principles. You are hands-on, proactive, results-oriented, and a strong team player. 

Additionally, you possess: 

Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. 

Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills. 

Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 

Knowledge of website development, sales enablement and customer data platform tooling, marketing, and distribution processes and technologies is a plus. 

Interest in learning new tools and techniques. 

Good command of the Dutch and/or English language, both written and spoken. 

Availability for 40, 36, or 32 hours per week. 

* At Robeco, we operate with Job Profiles and Roles, providing flexibility in work responsibilities, hence the opportunity to develop knowledge, experiences & skills, clarity regarding possible career paths and increased adaptability and collaboration. Changes in Roles are determined collaboratively and consultatively in order to balance employee and company interest.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

title: Senior ServiceNow Developer
description:
Department

Within Information Corporate & Cloud Technology (ICCT), IT4IT Service Management is responsible for managing the Service Management process within Robeco through the ServiceNow platform. This platform supports various processes widely used across Robeco, such as ITSM and Config processes.

Your primary responsibilities will include configuring ServiceNow to meet stakeholders' requirements, building custom applications, performing operational maintenance, and ensuring seamless integration with other IT service management platforms.

Position & Requirements

We are looking for a candidate for the position of "Senior ServiceNow Developer".

Your primary responsibilities starts by defining ServiceNow solutions and tailoring them to meet client requirements. Additionally, the role involves configuring the ServiceNow Platform based on leading practices to provide solutions that achieve customer outcomes. You will be part of a DevOps team that is also responsible for Operational Maintenance. This role requires a deep understanding of ServiceNow platform capabilities, ITSM processes, CSDM principles, Integrations, IT service management best practices and Agile/ Scrum.

The Senior Developer should be able to act as a sparring partner for IT counterparts and stakeholders. Additionally, you are expected to have or develop a broad knowledge of ServiceNow, collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure that Robeco and IT4IT Objectives are followed and achieved, and oversee and mitigate risks where necessary.

You should be capable of implementing changes and working with ServiceNow and the processes secured within the platform. You can establish yourself as a trusted partner for your team and stakeholders. You can deliver results and achieve objectives both autonomously and as part of a team. You are a strong team player.

We expect a proactive attitude and quick participation in the Robeco Change process. Social and communication skills and the ability to work under pressure are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities:

Platform Expertise: Maintain a deep understanding of the ServiceNow platform, including its architecture, data model, and scripting capabilities
Application Development: Design, develop, and implement custom applications on the ServiceNow platform to meet specific business needs.
Automation: Develop and implement automation scripts, workflows, and orchestration to streamline processes and improve efficiency.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of ServiceNow instances, ensuring high availability and scalability.
Integration: Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate ServiceNow with various IT service management frameworks and tools, ensuring data consistency and process alignment.
Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation within the ServiceNow platform, leveraging best practices and industry standards.
Maintenance: Provide ongoing support and maintenance for the ServiceNow platform, including troubleshooting issues, performing upgrades, and implementing enhancements.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all development and administration activities, ensuring knowledge transfer and continuity.
Training and Documentation: Conduct training sessions for end-users and administrators, and develop comprehensive documentation for implemented solutions and processes.

Generic requirements:

Profile HBO and/or WO
Minimal 5 years working experience with ServiceNow as a developer
Proficient in the Dutch as well as English language (written and spoken)
Fulltime position (40 hours per week)

Technical Skills:

ServiceNow Expertise: Minimal 5 years working experience in ServiceNow development, including custom application development, integrations, ITSM and configuration management.
Programming Languages:
ServiceNow back-end development: Proficiency in JavaScript.
Portal development: UX experience, HTML, CSS and AngularJS.
API Integration: Experience with REST APIs for integrating ServiceNow with external systems.
 

Soft Skills:

Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze complex requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
Problem-solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues efficiently.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Team Collaboration: Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build positive relationships with colleagues and stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Certifications:
Required
CSA – Certified System Administrator
CIS  – IT Service Management
Scripting in ServiceNow Fundamentals
Desired:
CAD – Certified Application Developer
CAS – Performance Analytics
Service Portal Fundamentals
ITIL Foundation Certification
PSM1 - Scrum
Experience: 5+ years hands-on experience in implementing and advising Service Management processes in ServiceNow.
Agile - Scrum: Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies, including practical experience in implementing these frameworks in IT projects

title: SI Specialist
description:
Department

To further strengthen our capacities in serving clients with world-leading sustainable investment expertise, we are looking for a Sustainable Investing Specialist based at our office in Rotterdam. 

You will become part of the Sustainable Investing (SI) Thought Leadership team within Robeco’s SI Center of Expertise. Part of the Investment domain, the SI Center of Expertise consists of 50 sustainability professionals based in Rotterdam, Zurich, Hong Kong and Singapore. Besides the SI Thought Leadership team, the Center comprises several other teams: SI Research, Active Ownership, and SI Client Portfolio Management. 

The SI Thought Leadership team is responsible for developing, maintaining and monetizing sustainable investment frameworks, like Sustainable Development Goal corporate and country scores, forward-looking climate and biodiversity metrics and the country sustainability framework. The team is also responsible for overseeing ESG integration and consistent use of the SI frameworks in products and solutions across the organisation. Furthermore the team contributes to Robeco’s leadership in the field of SI by publishing (academic) articles, opinion papers and whitepapers. 

In this role, you will support the further development and implementation of Robeco's SI intellectual property and ensure that it contributes to Robeco’s commercial goals and SI leadership. Next to further developing our SI frameworks from a content perspective, you’ll also be working closely with colleagues across the organization to make sure the frameworks are implemented and used by our investment teams, client solutions, product development, data systems, SI research and active ownership. 

Position & Requirements

What will you do:

Further development of our sustainable investing frameworks across all topics, including country research, controversy screening, social framework, SDGs, climate and biodiversity.

Further embedding of our sustainable investing frameworks across the firm, including integration in products and client solutions and integration in data systems.

Contribute to monetization of our sustainable investing frameworks via client meetings and collaboration with sales, investment teams, and product management.

Contribute to Robeco’s sustainable investing thought leadership through (academic) publications, presentations and collaboration in external networks.

What we are looking for in a candidate:

More than 5 years of professional experience working in, or with, the financial or corporate sector in developing and/or implementing sustainability strategies

Master’s University degree in business, finance, (environmental) economics or equivalent

Content knowledge on sustainability, policy and regulations, and implications for investors

Good stakeholder and project management skills to bring together different perspectives and requirements and translate these into results

A team player with strong attention to detail, accuracy and timeliness of delivery and an agile approach

“Can-do” attitude with ability to lead projects and workstreams and at the same time flexibility to support on urgent tasks in a high pace environment

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Excellent oral and written language skills in English

The successful candidate is a self-motivated, creative analyst with deep knowledge of sustainable business / investing. Strong in research skills, you are able to share your knowledge in a structured way. Academic affinity is a plus. Your are used to working independently in an international environment and to clearly represent your views internally and externally. Your further strengths include level-appropriate communication, quality awareness, an open mind, strong interpersonal skills and respect for different opinions and cultures.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

Robeco Recruiting Team

title: Engineer*
description:
Department

At Robeco, we operate with Job Profiles and Roles, providing flexibility in work responsibilities, hence the opportunity to develop knowledge, experiences & skills, clarity regarding possible career paths and increased adaptability and collaboration. Changes in Roles are determined collaboratively and consultatively in order to balance employee and company interests.

Position & Requirements

The Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) plays a critical role in ensuring the reliability, availability, and performance of IT services within our financial services environment. Operating at the intersection of development and operations, the SRE leverages observability tools such as Dynatrace, ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, and other supporting applications and platforms to proactively monitor, automate, optimize system performance, application and infrastructure resilience and incident response in our hybrid Azure Cloud and Datacenter environment.

The ideal candidate is passionate about automation, observability, and continuous improvement in a DevSecOps transitioning organization. 

This role includes on-call duties outside of regular business hours, following industry best practices to ensure a balanced work-life integration

Your success in this role will hinge on your ability to communicate effectively, educate development teams, and ensure that SRE recommendations and best practices are consistently followed across the organization.

   

Key Responsibilities: 

 Observability and Monitoring: 

Implement, maintain, and optimize observability tools, including Dynatrace, ServiceNow, and Azure monitoring solutions. 
Develop automated alerting, dashboarding, and reporting solutions tailored to diverse stakeholders. 
Align observability efforts with business capability monitoring strategies. 
Integrate AI-driven insights for predictive monitoring and proactive issue detection. 
Define, measure, and monitor Service Level Indicators (SLIs) to ensure service reliability and performance. 
Establish and track Service Level Objectives (SLOs) to align reliability goals with business expectations. 

  

Incident Management and Response: 

Utilize AI-powered monitoring tools to detect, diagnose, and resolve incidents proactively. 
Automate incident creation, escalation, and resolution workflows. 
Lead incident post-mortems, ensuring thorough root cause analysis and implementation of preventive actions. 
This position includes on-call responsibilities outside of regular work hours, adhering to best practices for managing on-call duties. 
The SRE will collaborate within an on-call framework alongside the SMPO team, which coordinates incident resolution, and the IT Delivery teams if necessary. Robeco is introducing these roles for the first time to improve operational efficiency and incident management throughout the organization. 

  

Automation and Reliability Engineering: 

Develop automation scripts and frameworks to enhance system reliability, scalability, and resilience. 
Implement self-healing capabilities and continuous deployment pipelines. 
Collaborate with development teams to embed reliability best practices into CI/CD workflows. 

  

Performance Optimization and Cost Management: 

Continuously analyze system performance and suggest optimizations for cloud cost savings. 
Utilize observability data to guide infrastructure scaling decisions and ensure optimal resource utilization. 
Monitor sustainability KPIs and align observability insights with ESG goals. 

  

Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing: 

Work closely with cross-functional teams (DevOps, Security, Compliance) to align observability practices with business objectives. 
Provide training and mentorship on observability best practices to engineers and operational teams. 
Document processes, workflows, and guidelines for broader organizational adoption. 

  

Core Competencies 

 Technical Skills: 

Expertise in observability tools: Dynatrace, ServiceNow, QlikSense. 
Experience with scripting and automation (Python, PowerShell, Azure DevOps). 
Deep understanding of the Azure cloud environment and hybrid infrastructure. 
Strong knowledge of observability concepts (metrics, logs, traces) for performance and reliability tuning. 
 

 Problem-Solving Abilities: 

Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot complex distributed systems. 
Ability to correlate multiple data sources to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks. 
 

 Collaboration and Communication: 

Ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences. 
Experience working within Agile/Scrum teams. 
 

 Security and Compliance Awareness: 

Familiarity with IT governance frameworks, security compliance (ISO, GDPR), and audit requirements. 

  

Soft Skills 

Proactive and self-driven with a continuous improvement mindset. 
Strong organizational and time management skills. 
A secure base for the team, balancing technical depth with a collaborative and mentoring approach. 
Experience in communicating and collaborating with both operational and development teams. 
A strong communicator with the ability to persuade and influence stakeholders at all levels. 

  

Qualifications and Experience 

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, or related field. 
3-5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably within financial services or large enterprise environments. 
Certifications in Dynatrace and Azure are a plus. 

 

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

title: Marketing Internship
description:
Department

The marketing department consists of three sub departments: Content Management Organization (CMO), Strategic Marketing and Global Branding. Together these teams develop marketing campaigns, client communication, RFP’s, management of all Robeco’s websites and the production of wide variety of content. The Global Branding team’s primary responsibilities are brand development and maintaining brand consistency. On the brand development side we aim to grow the brand in terms of name and proposition (investment capabilities) awareness. This is done by developing and coordinating a wide range of marketing communication: advertising campaigns using all available online and offline channels, event management (both online and in-person) and video productions. Maintaining brand consistency is a shared responsibility for all in the team and includes safeguarding our corporate identity (colors, designs, logo’s, etc.). The team works in close cooperation with all other marketing teams, sales, local offices, corporate communications and investments and uses a network of creative agencies and communication suppliers. Global Branding consists of 9 people. Three Brand specialists, three event specialist and two designers in the Studio. The Head Global Branding is the team lead.

Admin assistance, easy organizational tasks in webinar set up; schedule webinars, set up registration page, emails, audience console.
Webinar preparation (coordination & briefing  suppliers, presenters and internal support teams, arrange internal logistics).
Assist in webinar execution (coordination of recording day with presenters, internal and external suppliers, quality assurance set, technique, light, video, sound and platform settings, onsite director during recordings.
Post-production in the platform (semi-live/ on demand local versions, edit captioning, activating translations, create chapters, downloads.

Assisting Brand Specialists:

Control work for various forms of advertising: Checking creative assets, correct copy, language and disclaimer, correct version (different markets have different topics); Testing if animated display ads work correctly.
Building EDMs and testing mockups of EDMs/native ads/advertorials coming back from the media.
Image searching for native ads, linked in posts.

Assist in video productions.

title: ServiceNow Solution Architect
description:
Department

Within Information Corporate & Cloud Technology (ICCT), IT4IT Service Management is responsible for managing the Service Management process within Robeco through the ServiceNow platform. This platform supports various processes widely used across Robeco, such as ITSM.

Your primary responsibilities will include configuring ServiceNow to meet stakeholders' requirements, building custom applications, performing operational maintenance, and ensuring seamless integration with other IT service management platforms.

Position & Requirements

We are looking for a candidate for the position of "Senior Solution Architect."

In this role, you will be responsible for discussing new requirements with various stakeholders within Robeco. Together with technical consultants within the team, you will translate these requirements into technical solutions. You will convert solutions into smaller MVPs to realize value in the short term and create a plan with dependencies for major topics.

You will support the Product Owner and stakeholders by emphasizing the business value of each solution and determine if the requirements and solutions fit within the vision as determined by the Product Owner. Additionally, you will assess whether the requirements and solutions are feasible based on existing licenses and architectural best practices.

Together with the Product Owner, you will determine the roadmap and vision. You will highlight technical debt and share it with the architecture board. Organizational standards, such as security, will be translated into adjustments and solutions on the platform. You will proactively advise stakeholders on new or expanding features of the platform.

You will create and present presentations and workshops about products of the ServiceNow platform, such as ITSM, CSDM, and interfaces. As part of a DevOps team, you will also develop user stories, peer review code, resolve operational incidents, and participate in Agile/Scrum meetings.

· Proficient in both Dutch and English (written and spoken).

· 5+ years of ServiceNow experience across various projects.

· 32 hours per week

· Start date: 1-04-2025

Qualifications:

· CTA (Certified Technical Architect)

· CSA (Certified System Administrator)

· CIS (IT Service Management)

· Scripting in ServiceNow Fundamentals

· A good understanding of the following ServiceNow products: ITSM, CMDB, CSDM, Portal, Scoped applications, Interfaces.

· Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies, including practical experience in implementing these frameworks in IT projects.

· DevOps mindset and skills.

· Team player.

· Strong consultancy skills.

title: Sales Manager
description:
Department

Robeco France is proud to be recognized as one of the most influential foreign asset managers in the French market, consistently ranked among the top 50 asset management companies that matter. Our Sales Team covers the French and Monegasque markets, serving institutional and wholesale clients with a commitment to excellence and sustainable growth. As a vital part of Robeco’s global network, we leverage our expertise in sustainable investing to provide impactful, ESG-driven investment solutions tailored to the unique needs of our clients in France and Monaco. As we continue to expand our presence in these key regions, we are eager to welcome professionals who share our passion for sustainable finance and are dedicated to driving Robeco’s success forward.

Position & Requirements

Missions: 

Responsable de la distribution clientèle intermédiée Française et Monégasque (banques / privées, assurances, multi-gérants, sélectionneurs de fonds, family offices, plateformes),
Transversal coverage for both France & Monaco of French & Global institutions in collaboration with the international teams Couverture France et Monaco des institutions françaises et globales et ce en coordination avec les équipes internationales,
Assurer et atteindre des objectifs quantitatifs commerciaux annuels au niveau individuel et au niveau de l’équipe (Wholesale France et EMEA),
Entreprendre des démarches de prospection et le développement de la clientèle wholesale en France et Monaco,
Participer à l’élaboration des plans stratégiques commerciaux et marketing et réflexions sur le positionnement tactique des produits sur la France et la zone EMEA,
Être à l’écoute de l’actualité, du marché, des clients et des instances de place afin d’avoir une bonne connaissance des directives réglementaires de marché et ainsi d’en assurer leurs implémentations et leurs exécutions,
Développer et approfondir le leadership de Robeco en terme d’investissement durable et être moteur pour implémenter les différentes directives locales sur ce sujet,
Développer une bonne analyse et une excellente veille concurrentielle du marché sur nos expertises d’investissement et être force de proposition afin d’agir proactivement auprès des clients et de leurs besoins
S’assurer de la bonne conformité des relations existantes mais également nouvelles (Know Your Customer / Know Your Distributor),
S’assurer du suivi et de la qualité des données dans l’outil CRM pour un monitoring exact de l’activité,
Gestion de projets transversaux en interne et externe.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for the distribution to French and Monegasque intermediary clients (banks / private, insurance, multi-managers, fund selectors, family offices, platforms),
Transversal coverage for both France & Monaco of French & Global institutions in collaboration with the international teams Coverage of French and global institutions in France and Monaco in coordination with the international teams,
Ensuring and achieving annual quantitative sales targets at individual and team level (Wholesale France and EMEA),
Undertake prospecting and development of wholesale clients in France and Monaco,
Participate in the development of strategic sales and marketing plans and reflections on the tactical positioning of products in France and the EMEA zone,
Be aware of current events, the market, clients and market authorities in order to have a good knowledge of the regulatory directives of the market and thus ensure their implementation and execution,
Develop and deepen Robeco's leadership in sustainable investing and drive the implementation of local sustainability guidelines,
Develop a good analysis and competitive intelligence of the market on our investment expertise and be proactive in addressing clients and their needs,
Ensure the compliance of existing and new relationships (Know Your Customer / Know Your Distributor),
Ensure the follow-up and quality of data in the CRM tool for accurate monitoring of the activity,
Management of internal and external cross-functional projects.

Profil:

Vous avez plus de 7-8 ans d'expérience dans le secteur, avec une expérience confirmée dans un rôle commercial similaire,
Très bonne connaissance du secteur français de la gestion d'actifs, de la clientèle (y compris les structures des grands groupes) et des aspects réglementaires du marché,
Une très bonne connaissance du secteur de la gestion d'actifs en France, de la clientèle (y compris les structures des grands groupes) et des aspects réglementaires du marché,
Vous parlez couramment l'anglais (oral et écrit)

Senior professional individual with more than 7-8 years of industry experience, with a proven tracking in a similar sales role,
Very good knowledge of the French asset management industry, the clients (including larger groups structures) and the regulatory market aspects,
Strong appetite for / good understanding of sustainability driven strategies,
Fluent in English (speaking & writing).

Compétences générales :

Une approche pointue du développement des ventes, à la fois axée sur les résultats et les solutions, avec une orientation client claire,
Penseur stratégique créatif, capable d'organiser son propre travail et celui des autres,
Forte personnalité de leader qui aime travailler en équipe dans un cadre international,
Capacité à travailler avec des équipes interfonctionnelles aux niveaux local et mondial,
Un communicateur ouvert avec un état d'esprit constructif et la capacité de donner et de recevoir du feedback,
Collaborateur engagé, doté d'un esprit d'entreprise et capable d'établir des relations.

Competencies:

Sharp sales development approach, both result driven & solution orientated, with a clear customer focus,
Creative strategic thinker with an ability to organize its own work and the work of others,
Strong leadership personality that enjoys working in a team within an international setting,
Capacity to work with cross-functional teams both at local & global levels ,

description:
Department

We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Marketing Manager to lead and execute our marketing initiatives across the Americas region, driving brand awareness, client engagement, and business growth. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and executing impactful marketing strategies, with a deep understanding of the Institutional channel in North America and good knowledge of the Wholesale channel in US Offshore and Latin America .

Position & Requirements

Key responsibilities:

•    Develop and implement an effective marketing strategy aligned with Robeco’s business priorities in the Americas.
•    Execute comprehensive marketing campaigns and key initiatives to enhance brand recognition and grow familiarity with our investment strategies across the region.
•    Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including broader Marketing, Sales, Investments, and PR teams, to drive and execute a cohesive marketing approach.
•    Plan and manage an effective event program, including conferences, sponsorships, roadshows, in alignment with business objectives.
•    Manage production, approval and maintenance of thought leadership content and marketing collaterals.
•    Work in close collaboration with the PR team and external agencies to ensure alignment and consistency of all external communication.
•    Collaborate with the Social Media manager to tailor content to the regional needs and develop a social ambassador program.
•    Oversee and manage the regional budget, ensuring resources are allocated effectively and efficiently to drive ROI.
•    Monitor and report effectiveness of marketing activities, providing actionable insights for continuous improvement.
•    Stay abreast of regional regulatory requirements and work closely with the Compliance team to ensure adherence to marketing standards.

Required experience and skillset :

•    8+ years of experience in channel marketing in the Americas region, with a proven ability to execute across the full marketing mix.
•    Proven ability to lead, influence and align cross-functional teams effectively.
•    Strong analytical and strategic planning skills.
•    Experience working independently while managing regional responsibilities withing a global team structure.
•    Knowledge of regulatory and compliance framework.
•    Commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment.

•    Strong verbal and writing communication skills.
•    Ability to thrive in a collaborative small-team environment.
•    Strong attention to detail.
•    Ability to work to deadlines and manage competing priorities effectively.
 

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

title: UK Sales Manager ETFs
description:
Department

Robeco has a long heritage of research-driven investments and is recognized as a leader in Sustainable Investing. ETFs present a major opportunity to package our strategies, complementing existing capabilities offered through mutual funds and mandates. Launching our ETF capability in 2024 is a strategic priority for Robeco and we are establishing a specialist team to allow us to realise this ambition.

Position & Requirements

The UK Sales Manager will be responsible for promoting our ETF products to UK clients, creating awareness of this new capability and driving sales.

Responsibilities:

In collaboration with UK Wholesale Sales team and UK Marketing Manager, develop an appropriate sales and marketing strategy to build awareness of Robeco ETFs.

Leverage knowledge of ETF client base to identify and prioritise target clients in order to achieve both activity-based and revenue-based targets.

Conduct client meetings, sales presentations and educational seminars to inform clients and build awareness of Robeco ETFs.

Provide market intelligence and training on our ETF products and capability to sales teams, empowering them to support the growth of this business line.

Support ETF sales activities in other markets as needed.

Stay updated on market trends, competitor products/positioning and regulatory developments relevant to ETFs. Ensure that Robeco ETFs continue to be positioned favourably.

Work with internal stakeholders to ensure that appropriate materials are available to support ETF sales.

Provide feedback to the product development team based on client needs and market demand.

Keep CRM systems up to date and ensure that appropriate information is available to support sales reporting and forecasts.

Requirements

Extensive experience in an ETF Sales role, with a focus on the UK market.

Detailed knowledge of ETF client base in the UK, and ideally across other European markets.

Strong client relationships and a proven track record of achieving sales targets and new business development.

Detailed understanding of ETF products and market landscape.

Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate across a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.

High levels of motivation and resilience. Ability to bring an entrepreneurial mindset to developing this new capability with an established and successful asset manager.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.
